A lot of people had recommended Guacho to me  and it was definitely worth the hype  My girlfriend and split the parilladas mixta  an order of papas al horno and a small provoletta  It was a lot of food  and a very reasonable price for a nice date night dinner  I ll definitely be visiting again

Really bad experience  I got to the restaurant an hour before closing and the door was already locked  So if you are planning to go and have dinner make sure you arrive a few hours before  They should post it on their web  closing time is not accurate

Maybe the best food in Pittsburgh   So much flavor   You re paying for quality at this place  and you get it  every time     The salsas  probably not called that  are all amazing   If it wasn t socially inappropriate  I would put a straw in those pitchers and use that as a drink with my meal

You will be in HEAVEN after having a meal at Gaucho  There is always a wait out the door but the food is so worth it  The menu has so much to offer  at all reasonable prices  but you can never go wrong with anything you order  I ve been twice and both times enjoyed the steak sandwich  The meat is so flavorful it tastes great in any dish  They also offer a variety of sauces that are good to try  Try to come early to beat the crowds

The girlfriend and I have been wanting to go to Gaucho as soon as we found out about it from Yelp  We actually did try to go one time but as we pulled up the line was out the door and around the corner  We stood in line with some friends for about    minutes before we realized the line wasn t budging  Granted  we didn t stay in line that long  but we were very hungry and restaurant week was currently happening so we decided to go elsewhere  We recently went back and figure out why there is so much hype about Gaucho   The first tip I would give to you would be to be prepared to wait in line depending on the day time you go and the second tip would be to bring alcohol because it is BYOB  The second time we went we waited for about    minutes before being seated  The staff was very helpful and made sure everyone knew the wait times  they even told us that they were stopping taking orders since there were no tables to seat customers at the time  The way the restaurant works is very interesting  you decide what you want on the way to the cashier  gives you something to do while your waiting as well  and then you order and get shown to your seat by a host    We ended up ordering the some empanadas  cheesy bread  a chicken sandwich  and pulled pork sandwich  The food came out super quickly which was great because we were very hungry  They also offer a number of sauces which we tried in line and fell in love with the red pepper sauce  The empanadas were wonderful and tasted authentic and fresh as well as the cheesy bread which was surprisingly better than it sounded on the menu board  The sandwiches were huge and we ended up having to take them home but they were also amazing and stuffed with meats    I am looking forward to going back here and trying out the other wonderful things the menu had to offer

First of all  our taxi driver wasn t sure where this place was when we first gave him the address  And then when we finally got there  he looked at us and said   Well  there s people inside   We got out  looked around with some trepidation  as we re not city dwellers   shrugged our shoulders and decided to go for it  and I m so glad we did   The place just smelled amazing  and we were really hungry  I finally settled on a salad with rib eye steak  I would have liked less fat on the steak  but it was super flavorful and a perfect compliment to the salad  which had yummy roasted grilled veggies   We didn t realize that it was close to closing time  so they were running out of things like bread and sweet potatoes  which was bad for anyone who wanted a sandwich  I was impressed with how friendly the cashier guy was  even at the end of the day  He calmly and patiently explained the menu to newcomers  like us    There s hardly any seating  so we were lucky to grab some seats as people left   The kitchen is open  and they keep the wood piled up in the front area  so you can see them cooking making your food  I was thrilled to watch my salad being made oh so carefully by a very cute guy   We were the last patrons as they closed up for the day  They were kind enough to call a taxi for us  and when we left  the chef and his staff said thanks and goodbye as they stood outside smoking their cigarettes

Be prepared to wait   There are no reservations and the line is out the door on a Saturday night    We waited about two hours    I loved the food and there is a choice of small and big portions  so nice to not have too much food    I had a veggie sandwich and my hubby had a yummy steak    The potatoes and chimi sauce was great    Bring your own bottle and everyone does  You order in line and food is brought to you    Even seated  service is a little slow   But food was great and I would return   A fun place and very friendly staff

The food at gaucho was awesome     I had the Rosemary braised beef sandwich  which comes with caramelized onions and horseradish sauce  The meat was tender and flavorful  the onions were soft and sweet  the sauce added nice tang  and the bread was chewy on the outside and soft on the inside  I also split the grilled vegetables and the corn pudding as side dishes  The corn pudding was delicious  It was creamy  had great texture and spice  and was slightly smokey from the charred corn  The vegetables were my favorite part  hard to believe even for me  The platter came with red peppers  caramelized onions  zucchini  asparagus  and mushrooms  Each vegetable was grilled perfectly  seasoned extremely well  and had a delicious sauce  The peppers were also charred and had a wonderful smokey flavor  The sauces to choose from too also added unique flavor to everything we tried  The staff was friendly and accommodating in the great atmosphere the restaurant had to offer  However  the line was insanely long and it took almost    minutes to order  so I would either go early  go when you have a wide open schedule  or order ahead  Either way  it was well worth the wait  Definitely a place to try in the strip district of Pittsburgh
Mucho bueno   Great place for groups   Will be back many times again
One of my favorite spots in town  Gaucho never disappoints  The food is amazing and reasonably priced  well worth the wait in line  Bring a couple friends and order the Asado platter

Went here on a first date and couldn t have asked for a better experience  from food to servers to the wait line that wrapped around the building   this place left such warm memories  The food was fantastic  of course  The environment was lively and servers so personable  Thank you for a wonderful time

Hits and misses for sure at Gaucho Parrilla   We went for the Parrillada Mixta since we wanted to try a lot of things   Came with NY Strip steak  grilled chicken  and chorizo  as well as   pieces of toast   The steak was great  cooked perfectly   When you pair it with the chimmichurri  it s just perfect   There s actually   sauces  but in the end we both thought the chimmichurri was the best   The chorizo was also very good  but the chicken was a huge let down down   very dry and not much flavor    We also got an Argentino salad to share   The salad was great   Loved the grilled flavor on the veggies   The large on its own is definitely a filler  especially if you add protein to it   For some reason we didn t care for the empanadas   Both the chicken and the beef were just alright     Saw a bunch of people ordering sandwiches and it looked amazing   The toast we had was great so I can only assume the bread on the sandwiches are just as good   In hindsight  probably should ve went with that or just the steak haha   Be prepared to wait in line   Apparently we were lucky and only waited for       minutes

The place smells great but the prices are a bit steep and they arnt very helpful with the menu  All in all a pricey place woth good smells  I wouldnt recommend this establishment unless you already have an understanding of Argentinean cuisine

Just amazing food  It s delicious  the portions are huge  and the prices worth it  It s very small and cozy  the staff very Friendly and welcoming  with a hipster vibe  Definitely worth stopping by  Try anything on the menu  I d recommend one of the small streaked with a pequeno on the side  the Jamon Serrano was amazing
One of only a handful of  must try  restaurants in the Pitt   This place is tits

First time in Pittsburgh and this place was all everyone recommended  The food was excellent  service was excellent  prices were reasonable   It s a quick meal though  Dont go if your looking for a nice sit down dinner  Your in and out quite quickly

Yup I went there but it didn t fully live up to the hype  Food WAS good  line was out the door and around the block  always a good decision   atmosphere was a bit plain but ok  heads up it s a BYOB so be prepared and bing a cocktail   The empanadas where Soooo Good the best being the veggie one   as a devote meat guy you bring me a veggie anything that blows my mind it s worth talking about      I love the little guy niche  ABC    Anything But Chain  restaurants  Why   not    Lunch for   people with a desert but NO alcohol and one of us drank tap water was      A bit steep seem like steak house prices

For our last meal in Pittsburgh  we wanted to find somewhere good  After searching the Internet for quite some time  we came across gaucho and decided to give it a try  One of the best decisions food wise we made during the trip  although all food experience during this trip was top notch   We got the biggest meat plate with five different cuts and some sides like potatoes  asparagus  and squash  It was definitely a lot for two people but we still managed to finish most of it because it was so freaking delicious  Could not think of a better meal to end our trip  Additionally  look at the picture   The way they plate their food is so simple yet beautiful

Amazing food  One of the best restaurants I ve ever been to and well worth the wait in line  Get there early  It s byob  We ordered all the side vegetables and they did not disappoint  My favorite with the broccolini   Wow I can t wait to go back
Not real Argentinian steak  in Argentina steak is always cooked well done  but still very tasty  Usually crowded but lines move fast  Great service  Not much more to say

The food was amazing  Spent the four days in Pittsburgh for my birthday and this was the best spot by far  Meat cooked to perfection  It seemed like every ingredient was of the best quality  Definitely worth the price

Great place   Authentic food   Great menu   Right on the   th street bridge   NO PARKING so you have to hike a few blocks and prepare for parking meter hell coutesy of Pittsurgh parking authority   Go later in the evening and forget paying since there is no enforcement   Locals just wait until enforcement goes home for the evening   Food is the actual deal   For me  however  it is far too much per serving   Good see see a new business in that spot   Roy

Showed up at      and waited    minutes without the line moving  They advertise they take phone orders   when you call no one answers  Good food  Horrible service  They needs to learn how to get people their food faster  I don t recommend

I dont know how I didn t rate this place before  This is one of my top   restaurants of all times  I m so happy we got to go  The line was about    deep outside the restaurant  We attempted to go one day but we didn t want to wait in the long line so we came earlier    and I m sooooo happy we did  The meat    the meat     omg    I cant even tell yall how perfectly cooked it was  Juicy  Seasoned so well  The wood burning grill makes the steaks sooooooooooooo good   Ive looked everywhere in DC  Maryland  TX    and pretty much all the places I visit to see if there is anything like this place and I can t find anywhere    I  think I even looked up Los Ang   and was  unable to find anywhere    I need to make this place apart of my regular eats    somehow    OWNERS   COME BUILD ONE in TX     Also  despite the    deep that I saw on my way out    I d wait in a line for this place

If you are ordering lunch get it Togo if possible  I didn t know either that while ordering a Togo order you do not have to stand in the long line that will be wrapped around the block  but it is sooo worth it  I recommend the ribeye  corn  shrimp and grilled veggies  Food is pricy but you get what you pay for  The steaks are always tender and packed with flavor  Spices are heavy and the chimichurri is delicious  I would recommend taking one of each sauces and using them all for dipping  You won t be disappointed

We traveled all the way from Houston and wanted to eat here for dinner  Despite our best efforts  we showed up right at  pm and the white haired older guy grumbled about letting me in  Then while I was ordering he came behind the counter and grumbled to the guy who was in the middle of taking my order   damn  it looks like we re going to have to stay until    again    Ok      I really like the concept of this place   We ordered the Parrillada Mixta  New York steak  chicken breast  spicy chorizo   This was the most lacking of all of the dishes  The meats were all cold and the chicken was dry but the flavors were good  Perhaps this is due to us showing up late   We also had the large grilled vegetables which were EXCELLENT and the Caldo Del Mar which was also EXCELLENT  It was steaming hot and definitely hit the spot   All the serve yourself accompanying sauces were pretty great too    I would have given this place   stars if the  older guy  didn t leave such a bad taste in my mouth  Everyone else was very friendly but it just takes one bad apple in a restaurant service   Later we heard him grumble that they only made      today to another worker  Don t know what that means exactly except that he s a big grumble pot
The filet mignon carne con pan is one of the best sandwiches I ve had anywhere   Also the braised beef  and caldo del mar are delicious as well

We waited forever  and I expected to be underwhelmed  I was not  this place is worth the wait  the meat well cooked  the veggies seasoned perfectly  and on top of that it is just a fun scene to sit with friends and enjoy a meal

Surprisingly met Expectations on both visits  Beef is cooked near perfectly  Wish the steaks could be ordered in larger than  oz and   oz but no big deal   Facts   Four types of chimichurries  Steaks and steak sandwiches At least one type of fish on menu     sides ranging from beans and greens to potatoes to eggplant to mushrooms Homemade empanadas  slightly overrated    Drinks are BYOB  wish they served glasses of house wine  Lines anywhere from   mins    hrs  Staff is nice and pretty attentive    Recommendations  make it easier to get back in line for ordering dessert drink etc and serve house wine by glass  BYOB is much appreciated but not everyone plans ahead  plus you would make a lot more money
I ve lived in Argentina  Netherlands and Argentine Queens  NYC   NOTHING comes close to the authenticity  especially in Pittsburgh

There is nothing bad to say about this place  I try to stop in for lunch whenever  I am in the area  The dinner line scares me but not enough to rule this place out  Try all the sauces  BYOB  Order extra bread
Incredible steak cuts   Sauces are even better   Get there early or stand in line outside

Love these guys  Anthony knows what he s doing  Steak Burger is best burger in town and I stand by that  Killer Americana twist on classic Argentina Specialties  Only one problem  I can t get enough  Awesome awesome food

Now  everyone talks about this place  Your mom  your cousin  daddy  step father  sister  cousin   everyone  I certainly didn t want to try it out because of all of the hype  Well  the hype is warranted  This place is everything  I mean everything  Like the moon and the stars type of everything   I arrived around       am on a Friday  It was a good thing that I did because the lunch crowd appeared at about        Once you arrive  you stand in line  and on the wall is a large chalkboard menu  You order at the front  pay and then you are seated  Someone then  brings your order to the seating area  and yells your name  They then bring your dish to your table    I got the Carne sandwich with rib eye and a side house salad  The sandwich was so big and scrumptious  I literally  drooled on the table when I opened it up  the sandwiches come in that sandwich paper   I should have known it would be good  the paper it was wrapped in was so greasy  The meat was so tender  and the onions  the caramelized onions leave nothing to be desired  The house salad was a perfect size  and I believe they make their own dressing  It was peppery and tangy    I loved my experience here  The service was quick  the place was clean  and the staff was polite  It was a great place to celebrate the end of the work week

Outstanding every time  My husband is from Argentina  and he swears by Gaucho  The empanadas are just like you eat in Argentina  and the provoleta is amazing  Be sure to leave room for dessert as the alfajores are awesome    We started going shortly after they opened when it was counter service only  They expanded to the next building  and the new look is beautiful

I can t say enough about this place  I spent my birthday dinner here and it exceeded my already high expectations  First  byob is a huge plus  Second  every single thing I tried was just so good  The grilled vegetable platter was my favorite and I m a huge fan of all of their dipping sauces at your disposal    The service and staff were all friendly and the casual dining atmosphere was great  I can t wait to go back    Make sure you get there early

If you re one of those people that enjoys finding unsuspecting  delicious  hole in the wall places    you will LOVE Gaucho  Settled in an unsuspecting part of the Strip District  it is a restaurant full of vibrant food  and people to match   Don t expect to sit inside  there are only about   or   seats to choose from  I got the El  Pavo sandwich with grilled corn and it cost me about      Not bad   The staff seemed excited to see us and were genuinely happy to be there  They checked up on us outside to make sure we were happy with everything    I didn t get to take a picture   I was too busy enjoying the meal     TL DR    Great food  Great staff  Food with integrity  A must go to in Pittsburgh
Good good and great service  Busy place so you may have to wait for a short time  The food is worth the wait

Gaucho is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh  Every dish that I ve tried there has been incredible  The employees are so nice and are happy to answer any questions about the menu  Note that Gaucho is BYOB and you ll most likely have a LONG wait outside of the restaurant

You order at the counter and pay first  but it s nicer than it sounds  This place a cool vibe and good service  But the food is why this place has a line out the door    The empanadas are not the traditional ones I m used to   I ve been to Argentina several times  but they are good  We liked the pork one the best  The rosemary and garlic red skin potatoes were awesome   Much more flavor than normal boring potatoes  The steak was  dry good  and the bread was outstanding  The sauces were tasty and plentiful too    I highly recommend this restaurant when in Pittsburgh

In town for the weekend and heard great things about this place  Called ahead on a Saturday around  pm to see how long the line was to get in and it was about   hours  This place does not take reservations and you have to wait in line for seating  Called back later on and line died down  Got there and was seated within   min deff worth the wait  Great steaks and Argentinean flavor  It is BYOB and liquor stores close early around here so come prepared  I really enjoyed their set up  how you order and pay first at the counter then get seated  very different
Perfect in every way  Simple plates  amazingly prepared  If you don t try this place  you all sorts of crazy

I m sorry  I can t write a review about this place  Why   Because there is only one word  AMAZING      I mean so amazing that I m speechless   I m only in Pittsburgh to visit but I don t think I ll ever find steak like this again  The wood burning grill  the service  and the FOOD    Check it out   Owner said they are expanding soon

Everything is good here  The steaks were tender  perfectly cooked and seasoned  and melts in your mouth  The chicken appetizer  grits  and potatoes were all amazing  I d make sure to also try all the sauces  The beef empanadas were just okay but I d skip them if you want more potatoes or grits    They don t have parking and it can be a pain in the ass to find street parking  There are some parking lots nearby but they accept cash only  The line for the restaurant can also get really long so I d try to time it by coming in off peak hours if you don t have too much time  Despite those things  I will definitely try to come back if in Pittsburgh

Gaucho is probably the most highly rated place to eat in the burgh   And that s because they god damn deserve it    I first experienced Gaucho at Pittsburgh Winery for a Yelp event  I tried their braised roast beef with horseradish sauce and was in love  The sauce complemented the beef so well and it was so unique  I also tried their chanchito  pork tenderloin with arugula  pickled red onion and mushrooms  Incredible  By far my favorite  The last item I had that night was their grilled shrimp with rice  I honestly don t know if I have ever had shrimp that juicy before and the flavors were out of this world good    Tonight I had the opportunity to go to Gaucho for the first time  Located at the beginning of the strip  close to downtown   it s not very large at all  There were enough seats for about   people  bar style  It was around     when we arrived and we didn t have to wait too long for some seats to open up  I ordered a steak plate    oz hanger steak with a small salad and toasted bread  I also ordered some grilled maiz  corn   The boyfriend ordered the braised roast beef sandwich and my friend Nick ordered the carne sandwich  flank steak with red peppers on ciabatta    I had the chance to try everything    Wow  The braised roast beef sandwich was incredible  my boyfriend was obsessed with the sauce and had to ask for extra  Nick let me try his sandwich and the flank steak was awesome  So juicy and went so well with the peppers    My steak plate was crazy good   Charred and smoky with tons of spices and super juicy  The grilled corn was amazing too  My mouth is watering just thinking about it    This place is worth the hype  It s insanely delicious  Go there  Now

My girlfriend and I stopped by Gaucho on a Friday night  and surprisingly it wasn t too busy  There was a bit of a wait however because of a private party being held  Even so  the wait wasn t terrible  The waitstaff was friendly and they seem to be organized   I ordered the Arrachera  flank steak  and my girlfriend ordered the Bife de Gaucho  ribeye   Both of the steaks were well cooked and flavorful  While they were not nearly the best steaks I ve had  the quality for the price is great   I d definitely recommend Gaucho to any meat lover  but be prepared for a bit of a wait

The beef is more tight than the normal American style steak  I guess the meat has less marble  However  it is a pleasant experience to have the meat with several sauce together  I like the Argentina pesto the most

The hype is real    Ordered   Bife de Chorizo   NY Strip  rare Los Sprahts   Brussel Sprouts  sweet peppered bacon  and cider reduction Caldo del Mar   Mussels  clams  squid  fried capers  lemon  garlic  tomato  and a secret ingredient   My favorite part is that it s not ridiculously expensive  I recommend the steaks  and the brussels were really good  I was disappointed by the seafood  next time I ll just stick to the land meat    I ve looked through the many pictures  and I d want to come back and try the sandwiches too   The only downside or unimpressive part of Gaucho is that the eating area could be improved   it feels like a McD s dining room  Wobbly chairs and tables

We went to the Strip just to try Gaucho because there has been so much hype about the restaurant  I ordered the burger and it definitely did not disappoint  I really like how you wait in line to order before being seated  That really sped up the process  We got our food pretty quickly and it wasn t too crowded until noon  By the time we left  the line wrapped around the side of the building

YAAAY   This was the  nd time my  honey and I went here and OMG AMAZING    My honey had the New York strip steak sandwich with that yummy corn that makes your mouth shout SECONDS PLEASE      I had a steak empanada with the roasted potatoes  I looooooove sauces so I went to the sauce bar and packed   little cups with different sauces to dip my potatoes in and they were yummazing     Yaay   I ll truly miss this gem in Pittsburgh  but back to New Orleans I go
Unique restaurant  Had flank  the meat was fresh and cooked to perfection  Call in for a table as at times it is busy and has long Q  BYOB  so be prepared if you plan to

This restaurant is really hot right now  It is a different set up from the traditional restaurant where there is a dedicated waitress or waiter  You walk in and order from the front counter  leave your name and they bring your food to your table  It s byob and they don t charge a corking fee   All food is ala carte and you can order any combination you want  Reasonably priced and good quality  I recommend trying different sauces and enjoying the flavours

Went here with some friends on a Saturday  Waited in line for about     hours  It s byob so we had some drinks and it was fun  The people were nice and the food was outstanding  Worth the wait  Love it

Hands down my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh  If you love steak you must eat here  The meat is divine   tender  juicy and made to perfection just the way you like it  You can get your favorite cut of steak in small or large size  Also comes with salad  toast  and chimmichurri  And don t forget to try their   different sauces    You order at the counter and then your food is delivered in a pretty quick fashion  The food is served on these cute wooden platters and the whole restaurant has a rustic hip kind of vibe    If you want an app  get the roasted carrots which are amazing   marinated with smoked honey and goat cheese  so yum  Heard the sammies are delicious as well so will have to try them the next time I m in Pittsburgh    On top of that it is BYOB so how can this place get any better   Note  they do not accept reservations so come early

This place has   stars for a reason  The chorizo sandwich was excellent and cooked to perfection  The fire roasted red pepper on it was not burnt and the ciabatta that it came on was very soft and fresh  The dipping sauces are very bold in flavor and you can get a side of tasty seasoned potatoes for only     Service is very friendly and the outdoor seating is clean and comfortable  I recommend this place to anyone in the Strip District who is looking for a quick bite to eat  The quality of the food can be compared to that of an upscale bistro

After much hype and reading the reviews  I decided to go here with my friends for  A nice Friday evening out  To be honest  it was disappointing  We were there early  and I always wondered why there was a line out the door  The reason being that you order and pay up front and hope they have a table  The menu is a giant chalkboard that is kind of hard to read  We luckily were one of a few groups there so we didn t have any trouble    We got   entrees for   people  The Large Shrimp  Pork Chop  and the Lamb Shank  We did not get any drinks  sides  or apps  Our total bill before tip         Now after paying that much  sitting at the table  and getting the sauces  Our food came  The pork chop was a nice portion size that came with a little salad  The lamb shank was a small size that came with some orzo  and the shrimp     little shrimp  Was the food tasty   yes  Was it worth the money  That s another story   Now listen  I cook a variety of dishes regularly  I  m a novice baker  I m a foodie and appreciate great tasting food  I understand that portion sizes may be smaller at some places  I have paid for small portions and felt that it was worth the money  But for     and to get    shrimp that is supposed to be an entree  aka main course   no matter how good is disheartening  Everyone of us was not satisfied  We all left hungry    In short  expect a wait  expect to drop a pretty penny  and don t order the shrimp

So I have walked by this place numerous times and the line is insane  Today I finally got lucky  Walked in no lime and so glad that I did  Staff is very friendly  I ordered the half chicken with garlic and rosemary red potatoes  I took it home and it was phenomenal  I will definitely eat there again  The Mexican Coca Cola was a good twist

Probably one of the best sandwiches I ve ever had  A must try is the steak   which you can get in any cut   on toasted ciabatta with the roasted veggies  add avocado and dip heavily into any of their   luscious housemade chimmichurries  Amazing  I Can only eat half and save the rest for a later snack or meal

The meat here is so good it will convert vegetarians back to reality    Yelp Girls like to say  hidden gem    This is is not a hidden gem   This is a shining beacon to carnivores everywhere to come partake in beef bliss     And the prices are great   All the taste of a high end steak house for half the cost and none of the pretentiousness   Dine in a relaxed atmosphere with brick walls  hardwood floors  and exposed heat pipes and abundant natural lighting   Did I mention BYOB with no cork charge   If you forget  the friendly staff will tell you where you can buy drinks near by   This place is ranked    in the Yelp Top     in the Country   Its not a fluke  Click your Bookmark button   Even if you re a Prius driving Vegan    You won t be disappointed

Stumbled upon this little gem based on the recommendation of our hotel driver   The curb appeal us simple with cute homemade signs but the olfactory appeal was off the chart   We were told that the line often wraps around the building   Not knowing what Argentinian food entailed  we went in  read the giant chalkboard menu   and we were hooked   Tried the pollo sandwich and the rosemary beef sandwich as well as shareable sides   carrots with hot honey and goat cheese   roasted red potatoes and corn roasted in olive oil   Portions were huge   prices were low   This is a bring your own alcohol restaurant if you choose to imbibe   You order and pay at the counter  then given a table  may be shared  and then served   While ordering the kitchen is in plain view   I observed everyone sharing space and humming like a well oiled machine   Everything we ordered was delicious   our entrees came on very dense bread which we discarded but could have been ordered deconstructed   Overall this was indeed a restaurant we shall revisit and would highly recommend   Noted that weekend lines can be long   We got lucky   Go

My absolute favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  It s never been a disappointment  and everyone I take here asks to go back  I d recommend you read the menu  get the type of meat you ll enjoy  because I love it all  Rare   stars from me
unique sandwiches and other dishes that have all been tasty  reasonable prices considering the popularity
Every time I m in Pittsburg I eat here    really a special place and the best steak  They even gave me pointers on how to make steak at home better
Best steak sandwiches I ve ever had   Staff is very knowledgeable and always friendly   The chef Kurt D  is one of the most talented in the city   Always a pleasure to visit

A great establishment in the Pittsburgh area  A must if you are in the area  Here is my breakdown   Pros   Great menu selections   Good pricing for the quality of food you are getting   Quick turnaround on the food   The sauces are amazing   Friendly service  Cons   They take no reservations and there tends to always be a line   plan accordingly   Come at off peak hours to avoid a long line
Simply the best food in Pittsburgh  The food is all super fresh  the sauces are amazing
Cool experience  food was cooked and marinated so well  Loved the sauces   even purchase some To go  Would recommend   come back  Good prices
I love this place  I eat here at least once a week  Prompt service and great food  Get the grilled corn and any of the steak plates

The food was great here as was the service  The only reason I m giving this   stars is how we were greeted when we first there  We walked in with a group of   on a busy night  It was already a lot of people in the restaurant and the line was long  It was so cold so we squeezed into the door and were rudely told to wait outside because there wasn t enough room inside  which we get  However  her delivery could have been better  We hadn t even ordered or sat down to eat and that really just turned us off   Thankful for the kindness and welcoming smiles from the employees taking orders and the attentiveness and kindness from the wait staff  Also  the food is amazing so that turned our experience around   We decided to order a bunch of food and do a sort of family style  We decided to do that because there were so many things that we wanted to try  Glad that we did because nothing disappointed us  We got small plates  sides  and a meat plate    For sides we got papas al horno  roasted red skin potatoes   broccolini  and roasted mixed vegetables  The small plates that we did chor y pan  sweet or spicy sausage   camarones  grilled shrimp   and provoletta  provolone cheese on toast with oregano and salad   Then we did the asado steak platter that came with chimichurri sauce  It was all so amazing

Food was phenomenal    Had the pork tenderloin as per the suggestion of the cashier  The bread that came with it had a Smokey grill flavor that complimented the perfectly cooked pork and caramelized onions  The sauces I got on the side were like a creamy lemon garlic sauce and you can also get chimmichuri   I saw two other sauces but I did not try them and don t know what they are  both the ones I chose were so good that I actually ate some plain right out of the ramekin after I finished my pork lol   it was that good      Can t wait till they get the wine flowing here so I can pair that pork with some Old Vine Malbec  Great food   great atmosphere   Great staff

Made it back and was so happy I did  If you are looking for the entrance it is easy to spot  Just look for the line of people curling around the on ramp to the   th St Bridge   My only problem was parking  I managed to snag a spot but the meter wouldn t take my credit  card and I had just enough quarters for a little over an hour  I hurried over and got in line  They had a new girl who was polling the lines to answer any questions I had concerning the menu  I asked her for the fastest options since I was contemplating having to take my sandwich and run  She suggested the braised beef or the pollo chicken  sandwich  or the pulled pork   Since I had my mind set on the braised beef with caramelized onions and horseradish that would be an easy choice  I really couldn t see much of the restaurant except that I noticed it did have outdoor seating as well as table and high top seating  I waited approx    minutes to order my sandwich and then asked how long would it take  They told me just   minutes and they gave me change in quarters to run out and  feed the meter  while they prepared it   I ran out and back and found that my sandwich was ready and waiting for me  I decided to order the Argentine cookies as a small dessert since I knew that bread was thick  It was almost like eating a sandwich from a NY deli  The beef was just right with the toppings added on it  They did have an area where you could add different sauces to your sandwich  If you want additional toppings then you would need to add      according to the chalkboard menu   While i was enjoying my sandwich the manage came around and addressed me by name and asked how I was liking my meal  I replied  very good  and asked him about my recent visit during the renovations  He explained to me that during that time they were expanding and with the line completely out the door I could see why   They had apologized that they did not have the chocolate or coffee cookies but I was happy with the shortbread ones  They were macaroon filled cookies and they had coconut on them  It was just enough and very good to finish off my meal  Staff is very friendly and helpful   I was able to make it back to my car with time to spare and head on my way  My advice is to allow at least   hours if you are visiting this place since it would have normally taken  I was told        minutes  Take out is available but the wait time is just the same  If you are planning to visit it along with shopping in the strip district then I would suggest a parking lot or garage

Nice little place in the heart of downtown  Pittsburgh    Ordered the mixed meat platter  steak  chicken and spicy sausage   The food was cooked well and pretty tasty   Line up wasn t bad when I came in  maybe       mins  Leaving the restaurant the line up was out the door
The best steak you can get out  The seasonings and wood fired taste is amazing  Call ahead and pickup is best choice during busy times  My go to place when I m in the strip district
I been around trying food over and you cannot go wrong with this place  It s a Gem  It s a little piece of heaven when it comes about meat

Super small place  fits seven people at best  their expanding next door early      though  BYOB  no charge  I got the rib eye to go and was amazed   Good portion sizes too  Definitely a place to try if not make a top spot once a month
Seriously  don t waste your time reading this review  Get your butt in line  now  Try the corn   chicken sandwich  Amazing  Honest   just get there
Food was good but we were disappointed that our appetizers were delivered at the same time as our entrees    Made it hard to appreciate it all

I loved this place   I wanted to eat here again the next day   Staff is friendly  the food is incredible   I highly recommend one of the steaks   we had the bistec  round eye cut  and wished we had ordered the    oz instead of the   oz   The Rosemary braised beef was good  but I m just a fan of juicy steak topped with one of their wonderful chimchurri sauces   Prices are good   Overall      stars if I could

We re from out of town and sought out recommendations from a friend  We placed reservations on Open Table  Our reservations were confirmed  Imagine our surprise when we arrived to find its first come  first served and a line around the block  It s all well and good that a restaurant has these rules however they should ensure they aren t covered by Open Table

One of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh   Every cut of meat is delicious here   For lunch  go for one of the sandwiches   For dinner  come with a group and order a combo platter of meat and the paella   Best to arrive outside of meal time because the line can get long

Rated as one of America s must have meals for a reason  The long line  which exists so long as this place is open for business  is well worth the wait   You cannot go wrong when ordering here  so have no fear

We finally corralled a group to check out their huge Paella pan and headed over to wait in line for an hour on a Saturday night   They don t take reservations and seat your group when you place your order   So plan on an hour wait around  PM on a Saturday   We opened our BYOB wine and drank it while we were waiting and shared it with some nice folks behind us     We started our meal with three veggie and three chicken empanadas with some of their unbelievable chimmi sauces   The garlic sauce was so good  I put a big old dab of it on the Argentina Salad too   Four of us split a large salad and it was plenty   It had some super fresh avocado slices  a red potato  roasted red peppers  carrots  and a mixed lettuce   The dressing was killer good vinaigrette   We stuffed ourselves with all of this deliciousness and then  the PAELLA PAN arrived and took over our table   This thing is HUGE   There was grilled lemon in the center ring surrounded by pieces of grilled chorizo and the entire ring was rimmed with fresh shrimp   The ratio of rice to protein was off but the leftover lemony saffron goodness came in handy before bedtime when round two of paella gorge fest occurred   Our service was outstanding  as always  and the meal was really satisfying for everyone   Super fresh  cooked to perfection and hot when it arrived   We really liked the brick walls and beautiful wooden plank floor   It s a great place for a group or a date   You really can t go wrong

In all the places I ve been  all the time I ve lived in Pittsburgh  and I only JUST made it to Gaucho last night for the first time     but it was so worth the wait   We decided to try to beat the crowd by being there around      on a Wednesday   It was busy  but not line wrapping around the building busy   There were about   parties in front of us and we stood for about    minutes   When we finally got to the counter  they opened our wine and gave us wine glasses and water  then we placed our orders   The menu is large and almost overwhelming because it all sounds soooo good   I ordered the deconstructed carne sandwich with flank steak  My date had the large Argentinean salad with flank steak   We were seated and our food came out about    minutes later    I got two of the sauces   one that pairs well with steak and the other that pairs well with vegetables   Everyone is so insanely friendly and helpful at Gaucho   you can really tell they enjoy their jobs and take pride in the food they serve   Everything was excellent   The food  the wine  the service  the atmosphere   I d say my only complaint is that I think they do such a great business but they could really take it to the next level by making it a traditional sit down  take your order and serve you type of place   I would be more inclined to go back regularly if that was the setup  but I just am turned off by the line   Definitely a place to try ASAP

The food   The  Food   The food   Do it   Yes   Worth the wait   Did I say the food      Wow   No words just wow       Our    and two    year old boys loved it     Suggestion  Just order a lot of small plates and start sharing   After you sit you can very quickly order more of what you love    Try as many dishes as possible   The entrees were nice but when we got back it will be ordering in this style   Trying is key     We had the best experience
Would have been higher without the annoying host making speeches every minute starting at  pm about people in line potentially being denied service even though they close at   pm

This place is Argentinian  Argentina is located in South America  This restaurant is in Pittsburgh  not South America but it is still good  The capitol of Argentina is Buenos Aires  Argentina borders Chile  Brazil  and Uruguay

This place has been the highest rated restaurant in Pittsburgh for a while and I ve been hyped to find out why  The lines have been a problem though  However  I decided to brave out the line  and was it worth it  The steak is beautifully done  The Cerdo  pulled pork  was also amazing  with the super sharp mustard on the side  The Chorizo was great  as were the Papas  In all  we probably ordered way too much food for two but we gulfed it all down  Did I say that their breads are amazing  This restaurant really made us feel like visiting Argentina soon

Go here  It s really a special place in the Strip district  My husband and I got here as they opened on a Saturday  It quickly became crowded  sometimes you ll see lines out the door  but make time for it  We ordered   different empanadas to try  They were good but not the highlight  I had the ribeye steak sandwich  so flavorful and tender meat  Husband had the rosemary pork sandwich which was even better  AMAZING  It s an order at the counter  find a seat and your food is delivered to table type of place  You must try the different sauces that they have at the service areas  The only reason this review is   instead of   stars is that my steak was cooked medium but I asked for medium rare  I really don t enjoy beef cooked above that  but the tenderness and flavor was still there  and the empanadas were just okay but they were enhanced by adding those amazing sauces though
Grilled veggie plate is great along with chi chi chicken  Squash is very good as well  Very fresh and a different take than typical chain restaurants    flavor from actual herbs and spices
Empanadas are truly great  BYOB policy is pretty nice  they offer glasses and will open your drinks for you at no extra fee     atmosphere is inviting and relaxed and staff is friendly
Excellent  Excellent  Great meat and great flavor  Even the vegetables were grilled to perfection  And an incredibly friendly and helpful staff  I look forward to eating there again

Definitely my favorite spot in Pittsburgh  Everytime I m in town this spot is a must stop  This place is very different from your normal restaurant  They are a  crash the counter  restaurant meaning that you come in  order   pay first   then you re seated  I love this kind of style because you know the food is going to be amazing   the food here is beyond that  I also love the open kitchen  You can see all the cooks making everything   they use a REAL DEAL Argentinian grill  If you think you re gonna mosey into this place or make a reservation as well you re in for a rude awakening  Make sure you get there earlier than planned because the line is always long  Yes the food is that good  Also don t expect to see beer or wine on their menu because this place doesn t have a liquor license  The true beauty about this place is that it is BYOB   They also provide wine   beer glasses for you which is awesome  They are one of the only restaurants I ve ever been to that serves Yerba Matte  which won my heart lol  The menu changes from season to season I believe so make sure you go in to catch them when they have the rack of lamb it is TO DIE FOR  They also have a little sauce station with different homemade sauces which are excellent  They have a killer chimichurri   garlic sauce for their steaks  You can t go wrong with anything on the menu everything is great but I would definitely recommend their rack of lamb  It s a little over    bucks but I promise it s worth every penny  Like I said  it s my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh   I stop there whenever I can  Check this place out if you ever catch yourself in the Strip District   don t forget     its BYOB

The food was delicious as were the dipping sauces  As you will read in many reviews  this place is jumping so there is often a wait  Try to go at off times during the day and you ll enjoy the experience much more

Gaucho is great   It s a very cool and unique dining experience   The food has been consistently delicious every time I ve gone   I ve always done some version of the meats  a salad  and I get the empanadas every time because they are amazing   It is on the pricier side but worth it   Their only downfall is the extremely long wait times on busier days   I ve waited for close to an hour before outside in the hot sun since the restaurant is so small   My advice would be to find some way to expand or add more seating if at all possible   It s worth waiting for but it would be nice if the lines didn t get so long   Otherwise a great spot to check out a least once if you live in Pitt

Amazing food and very friendly employees and close to the strip district  I have been multiple times for lunch with coworkers and it is always amazing  I usually get the flank steak plate and the small  oz is plenty large for lunch for me  I get the steak medium rear and it is some of the best steak I have had at restaurants  They also have   sauces that are really good and I usually use the roasted red pepper sauce on my steak and one of the green ones for the piece of bread they serve the steak plate with  I have also gotten the cheese prosciutto plate and the meat plate  chicken  chorizo  etc  and they are both really good as well  I have never been disappointed by anything I have ordered at Gaucho and have never heard anyone say anything bad about it

I stopped here after wondering where to get something to eat for dinner  I was a little worried about how long the wait would be after reading a few reviews  I rolled in around  pm and I gotta say there was hardly any wait  I was army table in about ten minutes and had my food about fifteen minutes later  But on walking in the staff was super friendly and I mean super super friendly  I had any questions they where sure to answer them and help me decide what to get being a first timer  The menu is pretty big and there seems like so many good options I wanted to get it all  I ended up settling on the sliced ribeye steak that was cooked to perfection with a perfect rare temperature  It was seasoned amazingly every bite was so juicy  It came paired with a salad and toast and it was all so fresh and the toast was such a great add on  I added on a side of potatoes and a veggie empanada and a beef one  The potato s where roasted with whole gloves of garlic and rosemary and sea salt it had so much flavor and the potatoes where the perfect softness not over cooked at all  The empanadas where good to but kinda small but they change them up regularly they said so that s a plus  They had a area where you could get different types of sauce in a little cup and all of them where so delicious but the red pepper one was by far my favorite  This place was everything I was hoping for plus more  I can t wait to return here again and try more of the menu  The staff and the food and the setting really just gave it that WOW factor

Gaucho is one of those must stop places in Pittsburgh   You can smell the wood fired cooking from down the block in the Strip      and usually see the line forming to get food atleast    minutes prior to them opening   I usually get the Braised Beef Sandwich with Horseradish when I eat here and honestly  it is fantastic  They have a selection of     condiments for you to apply to your food that are all amazing     from hot pepper to chimichurri sauce   Just make sure you get there early  and be ready to jump on a table when it opens bc the restaurant is too small for the amount of business that pushes through on a daily basis    Stay open minded and give them a shot
The food smells great from a block away  and the staff is super friendly   Be prepared to wait in line  though  and BYOB for that line  because you ll be there for a long while

This Pittsburgh place is an amazing find of exotic cuisine that is freshly prepared for reasonable prices  I m definitely planning on going back again before leaving    Mexican corn Steamed mussels Sauted shrimp in rosemary and garlic Large flanksteak Flan with blueberries and cantelope   Drink

Don t want everybody to know about this place  It is really good  Opt for the steaks and skip sandwich  Corn is awesome and you have to get all the sauces  Probably my favorite place  Not fancy like theses other places that try to hard and fail  Simple awesome food and u almost have to take to go  To small to eat inside

Definitely a place to go with out of towners and show them one of Pittsburgh s best restaurants   We took a group here and they talked about it for the rest of the weekend   If you can  get to Gaucho early because it gets very crowded and you will have to wait in a line out the door and around the corner   The staff has the whole line  ordering  seating thing down to a science  so while it may take a little while  they are very efficient at getting everyone in as fast as they can   I m not that much of a steak eater  so I ordered the steak burger which was     and enormous  it was a little dry  but the sauces at Gaucho are delicious and were the perfect topper to the burger   Other members of my group ordered the Asado platter which is   different cuts of steak and served with toast   They loved being able to try the different types of steak and enjoyed them all   The side dishes here are just as good as the main dishes  we tried the beans n greens and the papas al horno and I could not get enough of either   Gaucho has so much good food and it is really reasonably priced   This will continue to be a place to share with others and to come for a great meal

l read a really positive review in a local newspaper about a year ago and decided to go there  The staff there was very helpful and personable and I ordered the braised rosemary beef sandwich to go  l liked the sandwich but the taste didn t blow me away so a few days later l ordered the carne with ribeye steak  First the focia bread was the best l ever tasted and was a perfect match for the delicious steak grilled medium rare over a wood fire  The fire roasted red pepper and grilled onion perfectly complimented the sandwich along with the chimicurrie   Well to make a long story short l made it my go to place for lunch after my dialysis every week  After trying out about half the menu  I settled on the carne with the fillet medium rare with provolone and saffron rice   l rarely give reviews but gauchos really set a new standard for quality and taste for a restaurant and is very deserving of all the superlatives they receive

Mmm mmm mmm this place is the best place to go for lunch in the  burgh     best known for their Argentinian wood grilled meat  breads  sandwiches  and steak  Sandwiches are really to die for     this is one of the few joints that I know that knows how to do sandwich bread just right  In particular my favorite sandwiches are the carne and the rosemary braised beef varieties  Any of the steak meat cuts you choose is guaranteed to be tender  lean  and juicy     go for medium rare  you won t regret it   I also really liked their corn     never knew that a cob cooked over a wood fire grill could be so delicious  Good small eats include the gauchos papas  seasoned roasted potatoes   which taste amazing due to the seasonings that they put on those potatoes  and camarones  shrimp   which are just impeccable with the seasonings and lemon juice

I do not even like steak but my party member was desperate to come here as it s seen as  THE PLACE  to go to if you are in Pittsburgh  The restaurants  first come first serve  idea is horrible  we had at minimum   people skip us bc they saw their friends  who didn t even end up sitting together   We waited for   hours  Once we ordered we did however get served very quickly  and while the food was appetizing  it wasn t worth the wait to anyone in my party  If you love steak and you don t mind waiting     hours I say go for it  The   sauces were probably my favorite part about the meal I got  ribeye steak plate
Blindly picked this place  Get the carne with skirt steak  Damn  Amazing bread is the foundation of a great sandwich    stars

Outstanding food  If they would only move closer to Oakland      For carnivorous customers this is an outstanding choice  It would be help if they would take reservations but the food is so good     Highly recommend

The empanadas are unbelievably awesome  The chorizo sandwich was delicious  Seriously  not a single bad thing to say  Even the guy at the counter where we ordered was incredibly friendly  Love this place
Loved this joint  Really nice staff there and always yummy food

Good food  Steak sandwiches of all kinds with good sauces  Employees are jerks though  One big bald guy tried to run me over outside  and by the time I go to the front of the line  guess who was putting his apron on  Not just that one encounter though  Aside from a great sandwich  all you get here is attitude  Granted  it is a pretty great sandwich

Truly enjoyed my experience tonight  My pro tip would be to come on a week night and early      ish if you can  as there isn t ever a wait  Because there was no line  my wife and I had like five minutes to drool over the menu on the wall before going up to the counter and spending the next five minutes working with the ultra friendly and helpful staff to get their recommendations   Let it be known that I always look for recommendations on Yelp  but when everybody loves everything on here  it s hard to whittle it down     Per the staff s recommendations we got the sirloin sandwich medium rare and the chory pan sandwich  Additionally  we decided to get two empanadas and a alfajore cookie    The meat was cooked expertly and the empanadas were surprisingly good  I don t care for goat cheese but the pork and cheese empanada was actually my favorite  The alfajore cookie tasted kind of like a shortbread cookie with caramel and coconut which wasn t my fave  but we came here to celebrate my wife and she can have whatever she wants      Will definitely be back on a week night at      for more

Phenomenal  first time in Pitt  on my way out of town I looked for best place for lunch on yelp and this place did not disappoint   Got the carne sandwich with ribeye   Steak was perfect medium rare  smoke flavor was strong throughout  and seasoning was great   Next time in town I will be back
IN LOVE  Hands down the best restaurant in Pittsburgh  We always take our friends family from out of town here to show off our city s great cuisine

This restaurant was one of the highlights of our trip  It s BYOB and there are no corkage bottle fees  There was a line but we only waited about       minutes on a Friday and it was well worth it  We ordered the Asado Platter which includes    ounces of steak    different cuts   potatoes  and   pieces of toast  We didn t care for the toast but the potatoes cut so smoothly and melted in your mouth  The steak was really good  pair it with one of the four sauces they offer  incredible  We went in thinking we already knew which cuts we would like dislike and it ended up being the opposite  The Asado Platter was

stars technically  This place has lots to live up to with the reviews  Came early       p   and there was no line  We were on the stoop just outside the door  BUT   it still took   no joke   a full hour to step six feet from that stoop to inside and order  I can t imagine what the wait time would be if there was a real line   which I hear there often is  We were there a full   hours from arrival to finish with absolutely zero line outside   and this is an order at the counter and sit kind of place  The meat was good   about like what you d grill at home if you have a decent cook in the house  Sides decent  BYO is a great in theory   BUT when you spend an hour in line waiting to crack open that byo beer which is turning from ice cold to lukewarm every minute it sits in your bag    I d rather pay you  x as much for an actually cold beer once I sit down  And  or for a beer to bide the long SIX foot wait from stoop to inside  Service is friendly but waiting so very long when the wait distance in inches was so very short makes me think I d never chance this place in a peak time

This place is amazing   Definitely deserves all   stars   We had the carne sandwich with the ribeye   you can choose with   different cuts of meat    It had chimichurri sauce and was served on ciabatta bread and it was amazing   It was cooked and seasoned perfectly and was one of the most delicious steaks I ve ever had   We also had the potatoes papas which were perfectly crisped and seasoned to perfection  and the meat empanadas were also delicious   They also had a number of sauces you could choose to add and we sampled them all  and all were quite delicious   The staff were also super friendly and attentive  even though this wasn t a full service restaurant  they kept checking on us to make sure we were happy    They seemed to really pride themselves in their product   They don t have much seating area inside  but it was warm and cozy   It was too cold for the outdoor patio but it looked like a beautiful area overlooking the bridge that would be nice to enjoy lunch outside   Portions are also huge and very affordable given the amount of food and the quality

Amazing Fun Entertaining Awesomess  We waited in outside line for approximately     mins starting     pm on a Saturday  Well worth the wait and it s a staple in the  neighborhood  We had Steak  some  the sirloin I savored the Ribeye they were  Served to perfection if you haven t been  It s a must on the Bucket List

Waited in line for an hour and    minutes on a Saturday during dinner time   but let me tell you it was so worth it     I feel like Gaucho is not just a place where you go to eat food  but more for the overall experience  The environment is bustling  warm  and very up and coming  I loved being able to pay for my meal in advance before we sat down so that when it was time to leave we didn t have to wave down the server for the check    We went for the Asato platter and it was a lot of meat  It was cooked amazingly well  I m not a steak fan actually but it was delicious I would say get sides if you go with this platter otherwise the meat is a little too overwhelming  Would recommend the potatoes and vegetables  Will be returning to try the paella    Expect to be there for much longer than a typical dinner because of the wait  But definitively one of the best places in Pittsburgh        would recommend to a friend

This is a unique twist on an Argentine classic      for   oz and  x different cuts of meat decent price  The summer squash side was very good with caramelized onions  the best part was mixing the pepper sauce with the garlic give it a try   Service   everyone was friend   this isn t a restaurant with servers  Ambiance  very modern with hipsters all over  Price     for the entree  side and drink Value   worth it  Taste   steak was cooked well

This was my first time here  I came with a group of friends most had been here before  I had the barn mi which was a pork butt sandwich on a delicious crusty baguette  We ordered root veggies and cauliflower sides both of which were delicious  It was not a particularly long wait  we came in later on a sat night and they close at ten   All of the meals were scrumptious  my vegetarian friend had a melted roasted cheese dish which she ate every bite of  The sauces were very tasty my favorite being the garlic one  All in all a great experience  I will be back

Is the food good   YES   Salad very good  sandwich very good   Is the food great   Almost great     sandwiches and   salads  plus   waters   about       Is that cheap  Of course not   To me    stars would be excellent food  and ideally at a price point I thought made sense   I do recommend everyone try this place  but   stars  to me  means fantastic   and unfortunately I think this place is slightly below that metric

Fantastic grilled meat  Visiting Pittsburgh and was told we had to visit  Initially put off by the neighborhood  The Strip is not much to look at  Any reservations we had about the neighborhood were quickly put to rest once we smelled the food  Started with three varieties of empanadas all of which were savory and delicious   For entrees we had a gorgeous burger served on ciabatta toast  perfect lamb chops and a grilled assortment platter with steak  chicken and sausage   Desert was available but we were too full   Friendly staff  quirky decor   Finally  BYO so don t forget a hearty red

Everyone loves Gaucho Parrilla and for good reason  Their main thing is steak  but I don t eat steak so I always get a salad  which in many cases would be disappointing  but at Gaucho it s not  It s not disappointing at all  I get the El Gaucho salad  which has avocado and a bunch of grilled vegetables  Today I added grilled shrimp and it was worth the extra       I ve also had the vegetable empanadas  grilled corn  and potatoes  I recommend each and everything I ve eaten there  And oh my god  all of the sauces  Delicious homemade sauces for you to drown your food in  or just for a little extra flavor  Whatever you want to do    Each time I ve gone to Gaucho new people have come with and no one is ever unhappy  One person I was with said it was  overly seasoned   but I don t like bland food so I am selectively disregarding his opinion

I don t know how to express how AMAZING Gaucho is   The food  the ambiance  the staff   it is a well oiled machine and worth every second of the wait outside    The steak is so delicious    and the sides  I highly recommend the carrots   and the people are super nice and the BYOB makes it even better   We had a large party and they took great care of us and I think it was probably one of the best meals I have had on my visits to Pittsburgh    Don t be scared off by the wait   it may be long but it is worth every second
Stopped here before going to a show  Food was incredible and the wait wasn t too long  Love that it s BYOB  Would definitely recommend the steak sandwich or any of the empanadas

Food was good but long waits and VERY loud environment  Had a meat tray of variety and a lamb tray  No alcohol served on site but they do allow BYOB  Wish they served as we didn t realize this prior to arrival

I had the lamb and my brother had the tilapia  Both were AMAZING  Great flavoring and ate every bite  They give u options of different sauces with the meats and they are so delicious  I can t wait to come back and try something else  Highly recommended
Food was good but that line  We ll go back to Fogo  which really isn t much more expensive and we can skip the standing around for over an hour

Right on the strip  great for fueling up pre post shopping  The menu can be a bit daunting on your first visit  but thank god there is always somebody in there to translate  The food and service quality has always been amazing and we have never been disappointed  You ll commonly see a line looping around the building  don t let that discourage a visit tho  The line diminishes quickly  so don t fret

What a pleasant surprise  I have never had Argentine food and it was absolutely delicious  Love that they have smaller versions of most items  This way you can try a few different items  My friend and I tried   different things all unique and equally delicious highly recommend this place  Don t be afraid to try the different sauces all very good and unique in taste

This place was great  Great lunch  though it is a bit expensive  I had the chicken sandwich with separate side orders of empanadas and papas  All were delicious  but the sandwich was my favorite  I will definitely be back for more in the coming weeks  My coworkers loved their steak sandwiches

I ve so looked forward to writing this review  Not that writing Yelp reviews is something I daydream about on a regular basis  rather it would mean I had finally tasted the deliciousness that is Gaucho Parilla Argentina and pretty much gone to carnivore heaven  That is precisely what happened    My friend and I talked about coming here for months  but one thing or another kept preventing it  Yesterday we decided to make it happen  I read in some reviews that getting food can take time if it s busy  so I arrived before he did and put in our orders with the friendly and helpful staff at the counter  I loved the open  airy feel of the place and the easygoing rapport up front that the staff created  I also appreciated how the staff dressed and looked more like themselves and less like a traditional army of servers who all look the same  It was one of the most refreshing restaurants I ve ever been in for that reason alone    I made my way to the quieter back section of the restaurant and chose one of the lower center tables  There was sufficient room for the amount of space without feeling like other patrons were all up in your business  The room was also sunny  a huge plus  My friend and the food arrived soon afterwards  and we began to eat   Wanting to sample several meats we went with the mixed grill  which has steak  chicken  and chorizo  On the side we had two orders of potatoes  an extra order of toast  and all four sauces  I can t choose a favorite meat  because they were all utterly divine  The steak and chicken were so tender they pulled apart easily without a knife  and the chorizo had a satisfying snap to it as well as a spicy flavor that I loved immediately  The potatoes were roasted until crispy on the outside  and the toast was chewy perfection  My favorite sauce was difficult to choose  but I would have to say the thinner green one edged ahead slightly for me  I tasted an interesting sour note that complimented literally everything on the table  We ate everything but a few potatoes  and with two Mexican cokes the     bill seemed like a steal for the caliber of food we had just consumed  Gaucho exceeded my  incredibly high  expectations  and I can t wait to come back and share the steak platter I ve had my eye on and try some of the different vegetables  Gaucho  you re incredible

We came here for dinner but discouraged by a long queue outside the restaurant in a cold weather  we left to eat somewhere else  We came the next day for lunch and surprisingly the queue was not that long and we got to wait inside the restaurant which was promising  We ordered everything veg in their menu which tasted like little treats for our taste buds  We were excited by the four different house made dipping sauces which were packed with flavors  They noticed our curiosity and helped us with the details of each one of them  All four sauces were uniquely distinct in their taste and not to be missed during your visit  The garlic one is my least favorite though my friend loved it  I loved the herbs  Chimmi  one the most  Hot pepper and onion ones were equally good for me  We had them with tostado but they can go well with anything on their menu  The sweetness of vegetables came through well in the vegetable empanada  And the sandwich was also good  I would go back anytime for their dipping sauces  But you might want to go back for charge less BYOB or order their s  They are absolutely awesome in their service and the hype is all what they deserve
Don t understand the hype  The food was ok but I paid over     for a small steak sandwich not really what I expected

This is one of the best steakhouses I ve been to  Ordered the New York strip and the flank steak  large portions and it s perfect for a group of   ppl   I like the BYOB option although I won t complain if they have drinks onsite as we may run short of drinks sometimes    outside is the best place to eat specially on a bright sunny day in Pittsburgh   on     please visit if you re fan of steaks

Food was definitely pretty amazing and priced surprisingly cheap  Steak was awesome  sauces were unbelievable and the sides we re really good too    Just wish it was a bit bigger inside  It s also not a place to go if you re in a rush  but it is well worth the wait

Great food  Bad service  When we came in  granted it was    minutes before closing  the man behind the counter said  not like we are about to close or anything   I was very put off by this on my first experience  The food was great but a bad overall experience
Delicious fresh food at a reasonable price  The pollo was so tender and flavorful  There is limited space  but it s worth the wait

I really wanted to love this place  But I think I m spoiled by the good food in the other places I ve spent a lot of time    We walked the  ish blocks in frigid weather and waited for about half an hour until we finally ordered the ribeye and lamb  The lamb was fine though a little cold by the time it got to our table  However  the  pricey  mind you  ribeye was a disappointment  It was so lean that we had to ask the server if the kitchen gave us the right cut  He wasn t sure she d roll it back  only to come back to our table and say  oh it is ribeye  you can see a little bit of marbling there   but could have fooled me    laugh   I didn t know what was funny about expecting  and paying for  ribeye and getting something that looked and tasted like sirloin  but okay     On a positive note  the sauces are delicious  The carmelized onion one was our fave    Not sure I d return if I m ever back in Pittsburgh    P S  I post photos on instagram com letseatwithannie

Though I am not a steak person  I have been here on a few occasions and it has not disappointed  We are well aware that there will always be a line of customers streaming out of the front door  rain or shine  hot or cold  The restaurant does not take reservations and they are a BYOB establishment which adds to their appeal    When entering the building  the menu is handwritten on a chalkboard wall  They have a variety of items ranging from salads  small plates  and sides  to sandwiches  exclusive plates  and specialty items such as paella  In addition they have a few pick up dessert items that they display nicely in glass containers as well as a few other options to have with a cup of coffee   Once deciding on the order  you walk up to a counter where an employee takes your drink menu  We brought wine and some bottled beer and she kindly uncorked the wine  no fee  and provided an ice bucket for the beer  offering for the wine as well  She gave us glasses of water to go along with our select beverages  They do have a few drink items one being Red Ribbon  an old fashioned bottled soda found in a variety of flavors  Next is the order and checkout station  and since the restaurant was packed  we spent time chatting with the employee until our table was ready  She took our order  we paid  and she sent us on our way to our table  I ordered the deconstructed pollo sandwich with toast with a side of roasted spaghetti squash  The chicken came with pickled red onions  lettuce  and mushrooms  The deconstructed version appeared smaller in size than what you would receive on the sandwich  well duh  no bread but still   but with the side of squash and toast  it was enough  They offer four different types of sauces to put with your meal and they are all rather tasty  In the past  I have had the pulled pork sandwich and I think that nudged out the chicken by a hair  It was delicious    This will be a place we will go occasionally  It is a fun restaurant to go to for an evening with a group of friends or couples and to not expect a rushed dining experience  The prices are so reasonable for a steak establishment  they allow you to bring your own beverages  and the food is fresh and made with care
Amazing food    Great people    Worth the wait but I prefer take out that way I don t have to wait    Yummy

My husband and I went there for my birthday and ordered the Asado Platter and six empanadas  the empanadas were too little but everything it was more than enough for the both of us  The chimis are amazing  There is no spicy ones   We waited a long time in line but they immediately served us our food   Perfect service from each and everyone of the people who served us

What an amazing dinner  I had the Pallida Mixta and Veggie Plate  Everything was cooked to perfection  The staff is incredibly pleasant and has a great attitude  Usually when a place is this busy someone doesn t have a smile on their face or you can tell that they don t enjoy their work  Well worth the wait in line that you will have to eat here
I came here for my   th birthday and have since been anticipating when we can come back  The steak is cooked to your preference   whatever you want  I hope to come back soon  This place is great

Awesome steak   Worth the wait   Empenadas and pulled pork were both just okay  but decent enough   No reservations and order at the counter  ordering was actually a little bit weird and inefficient  but the food more than made up for it

First visit of hopefully many   Initial shock was seeing a line going out the door and around the curb for    feet at  pm on a Saturday  It took us    minutes to get to the counter to order our food  Long wait  but well worth it   We ordered an Asado plate which includes all five cuts of their steaks for      We also ordered two empanadas  pork and chicken as well as roasted cauliflower and potatoes as sides  Not that we needed it  but just because of reviews and pictures  we ordered a steak burger sandwich  a small provoleta  and flans for dessert   Steak burger was the best  Asado was great  Flan was very good  Roasted cauliflower was also good  The rest not as much   Prices are reasonable  Their system of ordering and paying at the counter first is interesting and efficient  All staff and servers were friendly  helpful and efficient  Sauces were good but not really needed   steaks are good on their own   All in all  it was a nice experience  and we will stop by the next time we are in Pittsburgh for sure   And  remember that line at  pm  It was still there at  pm when we were leaving     not the same people but equally enthusiastic
Had the steak sandwich and the Plates Pork Platter   Absolutely worth every penny   Have had similar food in NYC and Miami   This place definitely compares  May even be better  Top notch

The staff here is absolutely amazing   second only to the unbelievably delicious food      my cravings continue and anytime I m in the strip I have to make a stop at Gaucho   If you can   try to get there at an off time  harder and harder to find an  off time  as the place is super popular      however it is definitely worth the wait in line    I have always said    I will NEVER stand in a line to wait to get into a restaurant       but for Gaucho I have and will    absolutely worth it

There was a wait but it s definitely worth it  Would recommend getting the veggie empanada  they are amazing  It is a very comfortable setting and my family and I gushed over the food afterwards  I would recommend this place if you want to try something new but not to disappoint
My steak had a lot of silver skin on it  which made it chewy   Expected better based on all the   star ratings

of   stars   Top   reasons to go     food is fantastic    staff is wonderful    cost vs what you get is awesome     although the line is long  it moves very quickly  one reason not to go     parking can be extremely difficult
My husband and I are new to Pittsburgh and we eaten their twice in less than two weeks   Great menu  excellent quality  service and value   There is always a line  but it is well worth the wait
