If you re a carnivore  Gaucho is as good as it gets  Even if you re not  there s an amazing Vegetable sandwich that comes on ciabatta bread  gets me every time  They recently expanded into a bigger area  but I haven t been there since  It s actually challenging for me to eat here  because there are so many delicious options  To top off each selection  they provide different sauces  my favorite is the chimichuri  that you can choose from to compliment your sandwich  However  I have found that the sandwiches are bursting with so much flavor do not even need the sauces  There is nothing like going to the strip Saturday morning and walking into gaucho for an early lunch    I ve never been to Argentina  but smelling the aroma of the meats and just the friendly atmosphere that the employees create  makes me feel like I ve walked off of Penn Ave and right into another country  A winner for me is the filet mingnon sandwich with roasted red peppers  caramelized onions on fresh  homemade ciabatta bread  Trust me  you can t go wrong  Stop in and treat yo self

This place was everything I read about and loved everything  I had the filet carne sammie and tried all the sauces which were all delicious  The empanadas were great had the beef and pork with the pork being the best   The line had us waiting about    minutes but once inside were seated and food arrived within minutes  Definitely a must for everyone to try

I ve now been to Gaucho twice and I m pretty sure I ll be back again  There is plenty of street parking if you like to parallel park   and also a few public lots over on Smallman you can park in and walk over if you suck at parking like me    Both times I ve been there has been right around lunch time on a weekday and I have never waited more than   minutes to get to the counter  Everyone that works at Gaucho Parrilla is very friendly and very helpful  I appreciate the warmness and it s only surpassed by how good the food is  Every single dish that I ve tried there has been fantastic  The meats are so flavorful and tender  the vegetables are grilled and seasoned to perfection  the dessert shortbread cookies are some of the best I ve ever had  The chimichurri sauces that they offer are a great accompaniment to all these wonderful entrees    It definitely isn t a cheap place to eat  but the food and the quality of the ingredients are definitely worth the price    The best tip I would give for eating here is to pay attention to the menu board when you walk in  and maybe snap a picture on your phone for reference when you get to the register  If you don t remember what you want it s kind of a hassle to have to walk back over to check the board
We arrived    minutes before closing time on a Friday night but they were already closed up   Pathetic  don t waste your time

Arrived at      on a Friday night and there was no line so we went for it  The service was great and the food lived up to the hype   We had a large steak plate and one of each empanadas and the corn  The steak was perfectly cooked and the onions bread and salad were awesome  There are four different sauces available and I recommend getting all of them to dip meat  bread and empanadas  The dough of the empanadas was perfect and almost flaky    Enjoy
Un lieu unique   Pittsburgh  La qualit  de la viande est extra et parfum  avec des  pices merveilleuse

After reading about this place for a couple years I was finally able to visit while I was in Pittsburgh on business  After waiting in line for    minutes by myself I finally ordered the ribeye  Oh my  This steak was on the short list of best things I ve ever eaten  I went back the next day well aware of the wait and ordered the steak sampler  It was really good  but I definitely recommend sticking with the ribeye  This place is a must visit if you like steak and you re in Pittsburgh

Hands down the best restaurant in all of Pittsburgh  Don t be scared when you see a line that stretches around the block and maybe even down one of Pittsburgh s iconic bridges    this place is worth the wait   To be honest I loved the food so much I even booked a trip to Buenos Aires to find out if this restaurant would hold up to the real thing  Let me be the first to tell you that every morsel that this restaurant serves is the real deal   I highly recommend getting the Parillada Mixta so you get to try a variety of things but my favorite items on the menu are the Camerones  Shrimp  and Chorizo Spicy  You can t go wrong with any of your choices
Closest you will ever get to Buenos Aires  Argentina   Great Job

This place is one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh   I love to take people here if they haven t been here before  You can get a ton of food for the table to share for not a ton of money  The steak is always perfectly cooked

Get in line early for lunch or dinner   There will be a line   Better yet  order ahead of time  skip the line and pickup your order   This little neighborhood gem is a rare find   Check out their kitchen and bakery through the windows to the right of the front door   The food is terrific   Don t miss this
Helpful friendly staff great food very much a step above the short rib AP is hands down perfect for a warm summer afternoon

Full marks for food and service  less half a star for the wait time   even though the food was more worth it   I couldn t tell you how we got to Gaucho Parrilla  or where it is  but I can tell you from the moment I began researching places to eat for our Pittsburgh trip there was no place I wanted to be more  At first looking at the level of the care and quality used to make the food in the pictures and the name  I expected this place to be uber fancy and pricey   not so  GPA is a little more than a takeaway joint just with seating  not enough mind you    but seating nonetheless    You basically should prepare yourself for a       min   wait time  not inside    outside  You brave that and you ve essentially earned the right to dine here  We braved it  despite grumbling tummies and hangry door blocking to ensure no one got in ahead of us or skipped line   We went a bit crazy for our order but shared everything so we could try as many things as possible  In no particular order   Pork empanadas   more batter than meat  well cooked and flavourful but not super memorable tbh  Spicy Chorizo   the fire roasted bread and peppers served make my mouth water all on their own but that chorizo was a spicy little gift  Could have just eaten     of these and been totally content   Rosemary Beef sandwich   HOLYYEEEEEE  So big  so juicy  so  much  beef  It was so good I wanted to press my face in between the buns and motorboat that meat   judge me if you must but eat here first and then come back to me  Easily top   sandwiches of my life   Large Ribeye   and as if I wasn t already praising glory be to the Argentinian meat gods on high after the sandwich  they go ahead and perfectly cook  slice and season a glorious ribeye steak and smother it with sauce   EF  ME  UP right here  I d stab someone if they got in the way of me eating this   So succulent  dripping with fatty flavours and cooked perfectly   All in this is definitely no veggie vegan friendly but carnivores beware this is your happy place   it sure was mine  First stop when I m back in town for a Steelers game next year is GPA   Eatcrest Out

There s two people Pittsburgh that I truly trust when it comes to food  and Gaucho was the first restaurant that both of them mentioned as a must visit for me   And they were right   Whether you re getting a sandwich  a salad  or a plate  be prepared for charred meaty goodness  and absolutely gigantic flavors   A few reasons I knew I was going to like Gaucho BEFORE I even got my food      There was a gang of grandmas on bikes leaving when we walked in  I ve  never seen a gang of grandmas on bikes before  so as far as I know these grandmas only eat at Gaucho  Which seems like a strong endorsement      The nice young woman behind the counter was wearing a necklace scarf made of receipt paper  and making it look good  Basically  everyone that works here seems like they enjoy their job  which is always a good sign      The menu is full of all the things I want in my life   A few reasons I really  really loved Gaucho AFTER I got my food      The Carne Sandwich  This comes with your choice of steak  I went ribeye  which was a juicy  fatty  perfect medium rare  sliced up and slapped onto that amazing bread with char grilled peppers  If they put more chimichurri on it  it would ve been perfect  Luckily  they have jars of chimichurri  available  I put more on  and it was perfect      The Paletilla de Cordero  This is a roasted lamb shank with root vegetables in a phenomenal gravy  over grits  with a charred piece of bread to top it off  It is impossible to decide whether this dish was more beautiful or delicious  because it was so beautiful  and so delicious      The Gaucho Salad  This fresh and colorful salad is the exact thing to order on top of two disgustingly meaty dishes to make you feel like you didn t beast too hard at lunch  But you did  You really  really did      The sauces  Yes  the chimichurri is fantastic and I want to slather it on everything  But don t sleep on the other sauces  This joint knows flavor  and I would gladly drink the ajo  the pimenton  and of course  the always enigmatic quiquirimichi   In case you didn t realize  my list of things I love after I got my food was all of my food  Because all the food here is delicious  Don t miss it                 It turns out chimichurri is autocorrected to  chino hurry   Which is racist  Apple  But chinos and everyone else should probably hurry to Gaucho before they run out of meat   I don t think they ever run out of meat

Went on a Saturday at   pm  We thought it would be slow but we were wrong  The line went out the door and seating  orders had been stopped until space cleared up  Once we got our food     mins later   it was easy to see what all the fuss was about  We ordered the ASADO PLATTER  Wow  Now I m a steak lover but I don t think I d had an abundance of different  and delicious  types of meat at once like I did that day  My favorite were  the skirt and flank steak  the NY strip was close second  but they were all succulent and mouth watering  Also ordered the CHORYPAN  which had a kick to it but was still very savory and complimented well by the onions  CREMINI SHROOMS were well made and did not have the mushy texture that mushrooms sometimes get  but they weren t dry either  QUIQUI CHICKY was also very well seasoned and properly cooked  The chimichurri sauce that the chicken came in was the perfect touch  Having chimichurri sauce easily available for the other meats was a plus  VEGETARIAN  the place is primarily meat based but there are some options you can customize  empanadas  eggplant special  sweet potatoes  roasted spaghetti squash  cremini shrooms to name a few

This place was just a few blocks from the hotel  As we got there on foot at  pm there were people lined up out the door  It was just   degrees  You wait online and give your order at the counter  then they seat you and will bring your food when ready   It is BYOB   The entire kitchen staff  I think  is in their   s  but MAN can they cook  We had the  oz strip and ribeye with potatoes and grilled spaghetti squash  It was the most enjoyable steak I have ever had  It took us an hour from arrival to seating but it was Sooo worth the wait  even in the very cold  I definitely wasn t dressed for it   I would do it all over again  This is a definite MUST eat here if you visit Pittsburgh

I absolutely loved this place   The food is absolutely divine and the addition of the chimmi churri sauces made everything better  My friend and I both ordered the Parilloda Mixta which consists of the chicken  chorizo  and NY Strip  We also ordered a small plate of grilled shrimp  yellow rice and roasted potatoes  My steak was well done and the chicken with the green chimmi sauce made it more flavorful  The sausage was a little salty for me but the next day I finished the rest and weirdly it was perfect  I wish we would ve remembered to bring a bottle of wine since its BYOB  There was not as much seating as I would have liked upstairs but we managed to snag a table as a couple got up to leave  The menu was a little confusing at first but I just hopped on yelp and the pictures on here helped us out tremendously  We were both extremely satisfied and we will definitely return  Our meals were worth every penny

There is something about Gaucho that makes me drool   Just standing outside you smell the amazing scent of  their grill and hunger takes over   There is usually a line forming  but that s how good it is   I d wait an hour in line for the delicious good at Gaucho     I ordered  Pollo con Pan  or their chicken sandwich with onions  peppers  and so much flavor that you cannot stop eating it till it s gone    Hence why I  don t have a picture     Their Rosemary Beef Sandwich is also amazing     If you re going to the Strip and crave something delicious  stop at Gaucho   If you re not in the Strip  I suggest you go and try the amazing food at Gaucho    You can thank me later

Was the  hr wait in the cold and additional   hr kind wait to order worth it    I don t know to be honest    Maybe if you ve never had an south american Argentinian steak over a fire  I guess this place is a gem in terms of food diversity and culture in the area and is accessible by tourists on the strip as well  If I had my way  I d honestly recommend going there on a less busy time for maybe lunch  We saw lines already starting at  PM for dinner  Maybe a weekday instead of a weekend   They make fresh chimichurri which was delicious  We got the NY strip steak large plate each which comes with a side salad and grilled bread which was delicious to dip in the array of sauces    The steak was perfectly medium rare and they do cut your steak for you if you re not used to that     We also got the roasted cauliflower as well  I think overall the food was fresh  perfectly grilled  and the ambiance reminds me of a family style modern farm house esq place with an almost cafeteria feel I also loved all the local art support  Be aware that it will be noisy so don t expect your intimidate atmosphere   It is BYOB as well    Overall not a bad experience but I honestly don t think it was worth the wait

Very tasty  Love the baked corn  very sweet  and the chief told us no butter on it  just boiled in water and then on wood fire    First time tried the plate  a little too much for two  but after that you ll get to know which one u like the best    Owners invite us to join their every night after work drink beer and shot  and talk to one of the owners  very nice    Gaucho should be one of the must do s in Pittsburgh
Str  fire  Need to go there if you re in town or haven t been yet  Courteous staff  reasonable prices  great food  Try all the sauces
My absolute favorite restaurant in Pgh  The service was quick  and the food was out of this world

Absolutely perfect for meat lovers  This place has such a different vibe and even though it s always busy  the line moves super fast  I tried the ribeye and the beef and chicken empanadas  They were fantastic   I have always loved this place and wish I would of wrote a review sooner   Spent a nice evening alone with a great atmosphere and great food

Yes the line speaks for itself    I don t care for the line    but the food is so delicious    There is definitely attention to details    Had about    different things here    all meats are well seasoned and aromatically open fire grilling    hmmm    Greens on the side are well dressed   Vegetables are nicely roasted   All sauces could literally be consumed with a spoon  kidding  of course    Staff is very engaging and hip    seems happy also     which is a nice environment to be in   The checkout and order line is a bit slow     Could use a business consultant to increase efficiency

Went here and got one of the steak sandwiches  After all the reviews  my expectations were sky high  Cool environment right on the strip and staff is exactly as you d expect  friendly  helpful  and conversational  It was extremely hot outside but the restaurant held cool   The food was good but left a little to be desired  There is a sauce bar     at the front of the back room for you to combine different sauces for the entrees  My steak sandwich was a little tough  bread was piled high  etc  overall good meal  just didn t blow me away  I will probably go back and try a different sandwich

There is a line in front of the restaurant  But don t be scared  it shouldn t be that long  You need to order before you get seated  We order steak plate  carne sandwich and lasagna  We all think they are a little salty  I took a bite and drank some water afterwards  The restaurant is pretty big inside  Overall  good experience

My boyfriend kept raving to me about this place for sometime and I finally got to go any try it  First of all this is a nice little corner restaurant that is way bigger than it looks upon entering  You order from a menu that s written on a chalk board which can be a bit overwhelming especially if it s your first time there  Took me a while to figure out what everything was but they have awesome staff that was very willing to help you out  After you figure out your menu you order up front  get your drink  and then they seat you  We sat in the back which was a nice open spaced area  The place was busy but not to the point where we had to wait long at all  Also we found out that it is a B Y O B  establishment too   As for our dinner it was AMAZING  I was surprisingly impressed since all I kept hearing about was  how good their steak sandwiches are   Me and my boyfriend got small steak plates  I got the ribeye and he got the NY Strip  They both were to die for  They each come on a long wooden board with an individualized salad for what meat you get  Then along side is a grilled crusted piece of Italian bread  I swear I couldn t get it in my mouth fast enough lol  The ribeye was good but I preferred the NY Strip and it just melted in your mouth  Each meal was just enough and I didn t feel guilty of overeating to much  Also we got a side of Fungos which were pan roasted cremini mushrooms with shallots  rosemary and sherry wine vinegar  Who does like steak and mushrooms right  These were delicious and paired perfectly with our steak   I absolutely can not wait to get back here to try out other things  The food I watched come out of the kitchen as we were eating looked so good

This is an experience I would recommend  It s a tiny  tiny  TINY place at the edge of the Strip toward downtown  There are maybe   seats in the entire place  and at popular times  there are people lined up out the door  The reason they re all lined up is that the food is quite good  We had a rosemary braised beef sandwich and a gaucho salad  Both were quite good  The former was well seasoned and balanced by some cheese and grilled onion  The latter was a collection of a variety of veggies    The food isn t too cheap  but the quality is very high
Picked up for lunch  Steak sandwich was brilliant   Empanadas were okay  Prob won t order again  Overall would try again though  Shows potential

Just yes  everything yes  It was all delicious  The sides are as big of stars as the entrees  Also  the cookies were amazing too  A place like this  it s easy to focus on the meat and think you can get everything else somewhere else  I m  no  Just do yourself a favor and order everything  And in case you re thinking  my eyes are bigger than my stomach  no  you re stomach will just need to make room  Favorites included the steak burger  carrots  and the chix empanadas  Fair point pricing on everything  I d say pro tip  but it s more an obvious tip IMO  you want to try the four sauces that you pick up on your way to the table after ordering  Be prepared to pay probably wait a little to order due to lines out the door  but also be prepared for staff who are super friendly and helpful  Also  plan your visit accordingly  they are closed on Sundays and Mondays

My friends and I had a great visit to  Gaucho  this past weekend  This is one of the hottest food destinations in the Steel city  It s usually pack  but in this snowy day there was barely a wait   The wait staff were lovely  Helping the group choose some of their most popular items on the menu  Our group typically buys a bunch of food so that we can each sample  and this place is great for that  Offering small bites that pack a big punch    The food a great  All the meats were perfectly cooked  tender  and chalked full of flavor  My favorite item from this visit with the flank steak  followed by the beef empanadas   I also LOVE the pay up front aspect  Takes the complication out of splitting bills at the end of the meal

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh   Their steak  no matter what cut  is always perfectly cooked and flavorful   The food is definitely worth the wait   I don t really think you could go wrong with anything on the menu

I ve been a huge fan of gaucho even before they expanded to the building next door and waiting in line forever became common  I really like their meat and side dishes  They somehow always manage to arrange for big groups even though it s super crowded most of the time   I am not giving gaucho five stars  though  because they removed the most delicious grilled vegetales from their menu  They also seem to be experimenting with other dishes  The potatoes are not as good as they used to be

Food was sub par dinning facilities were dirty and full of wood chips and dust employees while friendly were unprofessional the kitchen staff was drinking alcohol and eating food while food was being prepared witnessed one employee chewing tobacco and spitting in a cup at his workspace there was a mouse dropping under our table  Well now onto the food  i ordered a burger medium well with BLT and mayo and my wife ordered a vegetable sandwich  My burger came out drenched in mayonnaise and under cooked and I say that kindly  My wife s sandwich was sloppy and fell apart and she had to eat it with a fork  That being said we waited in line for about    minutes then waited to order another    because the dinning area was full eat here if you d like but I just don t see the reasoning behind the popularity

This place is absolutely gorgeous  We went to this place on a Saturday night  We ve been waiting in a line for about   mins  The mix steak sample   different steaks   oz for each  are awesome  The grilled shrimp is also great  The size of the salad is really big  The fish of the day was tilapia which is not very impressive  The service was excellent  Definitely will go back for the steak and desert

Oh my goodness  If you love meat  this place is your Nirvana  Stopped in for a quick lunch while I was downtown  I m from out of town and had no clue where I was  Yelp hooked me up though  This place is so good    I had the rosemary beef sandwich with horseradish and a side salad  The side salad was mixed greens with roasted tomatoes and caramelized onions on it     seemed a little steep for the small salad  but it was tasty  so I m good with it    The sandwich was about the size of my head    and I have a large head  Seriously  if you can finish this sandwich in one sitting  congrats  Tons of beef and caramelized onions and horseradish  Simple and delicious    The best part is that you can try their homemade sauces and the chimichurri sauce is mind boggling  Garlic  cilantro  tons of herbs  vinegar    and some other stuff  I took a take home cup of it because I want it to be on everything I eat for the next few days  Seriously  super duper delicious    This place is for real  Don t get scared off by the       If you just go get a giant sandwich for      you are definitely getting your money s worth    For what it s worth  they also had some tasty looking veggie sandwich options too    Check this place out

My dad and I have heard lots of good reviews about this place so we decided to check it out today  We were told there is usually a long line so be prepared to wait  We arrived around     and there were only a few people in front of us which was awesome  The menu is huge and on a chalkboard wall right when you enter the restaurant  We played our order and were then seated in their upstairs dining area  Super friendly staff and an awesome environment   We ordered two sandwiches  a pulled pork and a steak  ribeye   Both were DELICIOUS  The pulled pork came with mustard  which I am not a huge fan of  but it worked well on the sandwich  The steak was tender and soft  making it amazing on a sandwich with peppers and onions  We also got a side of corn  which comes on the cob  Super juicy and yummy  Overall an awesome experience and would definitely go back  I want to try one of the steak or fish platters the next time  The couple next to us ordered them and they looked super
Amazing as always  In addition to great food  we brought along a bottle of wine  byob   The line to order and get seated can be a bit intimidating but it is well worth the wait

Gaucho may be one of the best hole in the wall places in Pittsburgh  It s tiny any serves of the best beef around  They re a Argentinian meat sandwich joint that s creating a quiet the buzz   They have a special spice blend on their meats of filet  ribeye  flank  skirt with sauces such as chimmichurri  The sandwiches come on a toasted chiabatta bread which is perfect for steak sandwiches     The wait is long if the weather is beautiful out  but I recommend calling ahead and getting it to go  That will let you avoid the line and get your food  This past Saturday it took   hour to wait in line  order and get our food    A Suggestion  Have   person dedicated to sending out food  There s   person doing everything from ringing up orders  refilling sauces  refilling forks  sending out food  This slows everything down and can be frustrating when the line is extremely long    Overall  can t wait to go back to this place  Wow

I was In Pittsburgh for a weekend and my hotel was within walking distance and it came recommended as a place for lunch that I could walk to  It was lunch time on a Saturday and was sort of busy  The gentleman working the front who seemed to be a manager was wearing a Cleveland Browns jersey and was very short with people and was rude  The menu looked good with the steaks but I chose chicken  I asked for my sandwich with no mushrooms or pickled onions and substitute those for caramelized onions instead  After waiting around    minutes to give that simple order it was wrong  The food was ok  I think it s overrated and over priced  The dude with the browns jersey should realize he s in the hospitality business and treat customers with more respect

I went here a few weeks ago  and had a great time  The wait was about    minutes  and the line went out of the door  so if you can t stand for long periods  then maybe Gaucho Parrilla isn t for you  However  they did take our order while we waited  So  by the time we sat down  it was only a few more minutes before our food arrived  It was delicious  and worth the wait

Incredible meat    And I love the street corn and all of the sides  I haven t been in a while and I can t wait to get back there  I m so happy to see that they have added more seating because it used to be really small with only a few stools  The sauces that they have to put on your food are out of this world  They were so good I had to take a couple to bring home with me

Classic spot to feed your inner Carnivore  One of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh  Great place for dates or groups  possibly even special occasions  i e  family dinner over graduation     My one annoyance is the loooong wait and cramped waiting area during busy times    The line will be outside wrapped around the corner  For example  Arrived on a Saturday at   PM and probably waited for an hour    They don t take reservations unfortunately  HOWEVER  if you re willing to wait it out  it s completely WORTH it    Gaucho delivers on the best beef  sauces  and other specialties  shrimp  pork  sides  etc   You can order plates or sandwiches  Seriously an overwhelming number of options  I ve found that for two people  ordering two small plates and a side  potatoes  green beans  etc  is the perfect size to split and leave with a full belly  I recently split the Cerdo  roast pork   small plate of NY strip  median rare   and side of potatoes   ALL delicious  The strip was perfectly pink   red  The pork wasn t dry but tender and flavorful  The Camarones  shrimp plate  and Carne Sandwich are both equally worthy  I have nothing negative to say in regards to the quality of food here  Out of the sauces  which are a must have regardless of your order   I obsess over the Ajo Garlic  roasted garlic  and classic Chimmichurri Yummy  Argentinian steak sauce    BYOB

I always got the Asado Platter  Steak Platter  every time I went to Guacho previously  This time I decided to try something else and I was a bit disappointed    I got  Empanadas  Beef and Pork    both tasted weird  there are like smelly taste  Chory Pan   it was my new favorite at the place if I don t feel like order Asado Platter  Carne sandwich   we ordered our ribeyes Med rare  The steak came out dry and done  It would have taste so much better if it was not too done   Steam Mussels   the mussels is very good  The broth was perfect and not too soupy

My husband and I went and there was a long line to get in but it wasn t a problem  The menu is very vegetarian friendly   The sauces are great  The bread for the sandwiches was a little thick  but the sandwiches tasted great  The flan was the best I ve ever had  and I hate flan   Great service  Would definitely go back again
Not only is the food amazing  but the staff are friendly and cool  Free flowing sauces as well  Rosemary Braised Beef Sammie with Horsey and Onions is my favorite
The food is good  but I m not sure it is quite worth the price and the wait when the dining area is so loud   The hard surfaces make it difficult to have a conversation when the restaurant is full
This is a BYOB establishment  The food was different yet not different  Menu is LARGE  Atmosphere is inviting and warm

What can I say that already hasn t been said  It s true  everyone loves Gaucho for a reason  It could be the atmosphere  it could be the food  it could be the incredibly friendly service  chefs  staff  anyone you end up meeting or cramming next to for lunch   If you eat meat  get some meat  If you don t eat meat  you have fantastic options  Regardless of your  possibly non  carnivorous preferences  get some corn  Honestly  you can t go wrong closing your eyes and just choosing anything on the menu at random  Come with a few more people and convince them you know what you re doing so you don t feel too guilty choosing more than one thing at random   What makes a great restaurant  I m not so sure  but I think Gaucho has it figured out  This is the best restaurant in Pittsburgh

Not thrilled at all  After a wait of    minutes approx  the food was burnt in parts  By burnt I mean charred black  The only good tasty thing I liked were the four kinds of sauce available here unlimited  Instead of forcing customers to stand in line may be a registry service would have been more convenient and time saving for the customers  The table service was nice  Not going back and won t recommend this place  I have been to other non over rated restaurants which serve better food with a similar menu

I know I m going against the grain because most people seem to love this place  We found it to be a mixed bag  First of all  they have a unique way of handling customers   You wait in line to get to a counter and place your order and pay for your food and drinks  They then seat you  The staff is knowledgeable and friendly    I ordered the Skirt Steak  The small portion was      The large portion would have been      It was very flavorful   probably one of the better steaks I ve had  The small salad was good  but was tiny  I also got the beef soup  but it was too salty for my taste  My wife took it to go   My wife ordered the ribs  They had little meat and she found them dry  with little meat on the bone  Her ratatouille was flavorful and she thought that was the best part of the meal  It was too spicy for my taste   Clearly based upon the size of the crowd they are doing something right   though I thought that they were overpriced for what you got  The approach of having you order and pay at the counter before being seated results in long lines snaking out the door at peak times    I m glad we went  but it will probably be a while before we return

The food here is awesome  It is a very unique vibe  It brought me back to my days spent at the Beehive  It is an interesting setup  You go to the front counter and order your food and pay  Then  you go to your seat and they bring your food to your table  We had the mixta  which comes with steak  chicken and your choice of sweet or hot chorizo  We got the sweet  We also got an order of provoletta and pork empanadas  We got sides of yams  mushrooms and greens and beans  I did not eat the yams  so I won t comment on those  though my wife did love them  The mushrooms were fine  nothing spectacular  The greens and beans were very good  if you like garlic  which I do  The steak was great with a really nice char on it  which gave it a really nice and smoky flavor  The chicken was good  a little bland  But let me just talk a bit about the chorizo  I love good chorizo  This was among the best chorizo I have ever had  It was packed with flavor  The provoletta was awesome and I wish we had gotten a large versus a small  The empanadas were good  if not a little dry  which is fine  There is a self service bar to get dipping sauces  They are all great  It just depends on what you like  We got the bread pudding for dessert  which was incredible   The only thing that dings it for me is that if you want dessert  you have to rely on one of the waitstaff to get the dessert for you  which they will do  In which case you have to pay separately for that  My wife did make a good point that because they bring out all the food at the same time it does start to get cold  especially since the serve them on wooden plates  which is very pleasing  but it doesn t help retain heat  But once you are done  you can just leave and you are not waiting for your check
Best food we ve had in years   fantastic flank steak platter   the roasted squash   eggplant on point   the house sauces are amazing

This place is a hidden gem in the strip district and always busy    I ve been here a few times and never leave hungry   The selection of meat especially the steaks is very extensive   They don t take reservations and you literally walk in order and grab a seat   The bread is delicious and recently they went from BYOB to offering beer to buy with your meal   This is one of my favorite dining spots in Pittsburgh

Golf Tec in Bridgeville does an excellent job in showing you through the latest technology  what the proper elements of a solid golf swing looks like  contrasts that swing to your current swing     and shows you through plane  path  depth  face alignment etc  how to achieve your best swing and best results  They monitor ball speed  club head speed  dispersion  launch angle etc   to give you valuable feedback  You can download all lessons and watch repeatedly from your PC or I Phone  Eric Miller is a personable  knowledgeable instructor with  lots of patience  who will answer all your questions  Nice facility  convenient hours  Much better than golf schools I ve attended

Food  Great   Their meats and sauces are incredible  Hands down best Argentinean resturant in the city  Must try and definitely worth the wait  Bread pudding is delicious   Service  Excellent   Everyone is very attentive and prides themselves in serving  even the owner   Overall  Highly Recommend   If you re only In the city for a short time and want a memorable food experience  this should be the first place you try

Wow what an amazing meal   The steak was perfectly cooked and so flavorful   The sauces were delicious   The food makes up for the weird way you order and get seated but for food that good  I d swim across the Allegheny in January if they asked   If you love meat this place will give you the good type of meat sweats   Definitely will be going there more often

Friend and I spent the afternoon in The Strip and planned to wrap it up checking out Gaucho Parrilla   We thoroughly enjoyed our first outdoor meal of the season at about  pm on Saturday   The place is a meat haven and we had two wonderful sandwiches but we found the show stealer to be the PROVOLETTA   That would be grilled  aged provolone with thyme  oregano  olive oil and lemon   Such a show stopper that the table next to us  who had finished already  asked what it was and they started all over again   with their own order   Oh yes  and surprise   There was a small salad on the side   So  yes  the sandwiches were fab  but the provoletta was fab     Almost forgot   the outside seating is complete with the firewood supply  little wagon and all    how cool is THAT

What more can possible be said about this place  It is simply delicious  I was so excited to try this based on all the amazing reviews here  and the only thing that disappointed me is that my boyfriend got to try here before me    It is such a small unique place  everything about it is interesting  The menu being on a huge chalkboard is super cool  although I have no idea how to pronounce most of the things on the menu properly  Makes for a good conversation    I have come here twice and shared food each time  Everything was so good  I highly recommend the corn on the cob and any of the tamales  Pick litterally anything on the menu and you will be a very happy person    Seriously if you have not been here please get in your car and go asap

I am usually that fool that doesn t end up going to places once there is so much hype about it but I have finally gone to Gaucho and I am proud to say that I am forever changed  I got the rosemary braised beef con pan and it was amazing    The sandwich was huge and the meat was delicious  However  what truly stole the show were the condiments  I ate all the chimi and pepper relishes and loved all of them    Everything was so bright and fresh tasting  I would never need another condiment in my life if I knew how to replicate one of these sauces

I was only able to eat here once  because I was never able to get past the long lines  I still love the place   especially their chimichurri is to die for  My favorite was the filet mignon and ribeye  And not overly expensive

Came here on a Tuesday afternoon for lunch  Gaucho opens at      AM  and I arrived at        I was second in line  The staff was great  They were extremely friendly and helpful   For the food I ordered the Sirloin plate  and asked for medium rare  The meat was super tough to chew through which was disappointing but had great seasoning  I d recommend trying all of there sauces that compliment the steak  Besides the meat being tough to chew everything was amazing   Overall this place is a unique place for Pittsburgh and has a wide variety of Argentinian food  Dispite my meat being tough to chew through I will still return to try the rest of the menu due to the reputation of the restaurant for quality food  and quality customer service

All   times have been excellent dining experiences  Food is all so appetizing in its description on the menu  and in the finished product   The only bizarre part of dining there is at the counter where you order and prepay  they have a big tip jar  They provide minimal assistance in table service  if you want to go back and grab dessert  you have to get back in the long line and order it yourself   so how they ve earned a tip at time of prepayment  I have no idea  Pretty presumptuous

Gaucho did deliver  I ve been skeptical and find some of their signage off putting  Maybe I m getting too old or whatever    Anyway  despite them botching our order and totally forgetting one of our entrees  they did fix it on the fly and offered us a free dessert  So  in the end they did the right thing  The root cause ended up being a new  inexperienced person at the register printing out a bad duplicate ticket for the kitchen  So it was not the kitchen s error to begin with    So on to the food  it was absolutely delicious  I ve been thinking about that skirt steak since I ve had it  I ve even gone so far as to call around to butcher shops and ask if they sell skirt  turns out not everyone does     Let me review our order  an Argentino salad with medium rare flank  the grilled winter mushroom salad with medium rare skirt  along with a large order of the grilled shrimp  We ended up choosing the alfajores as our comped dessert    I just wrote about the Rainbow Salad last week at Kaya s and said that it was a salad I would go back for as a meal  Well I guess I have to add the grilled mushroom salad on to that short list as well  The oyster mushrooms were just flame kissed and the brussel sprouts were charred just enough to make the whole salad have a meaty flavor and texture even without a bite of steak  The steak itself was truly spectacular and made my dinner date jealous despite their flank steak being excellent as well    The Argentino salad was very good as well and got rave reviews by my date  The flank steak was cut into thick  meaty slices that were cooked perfectly    Finally  grilled shrimp were excellent  And for a dozen at      while not cheap  totally worth the extra protein   In the end  even the impromptu alfajores were delicious  And that coupled with the BYOB made it an absolutely perfect dinner  So  five stars it is  despite the wait

Best meal I ve had this year  maybe even ever    We had steak  empanadas  charcuterie  potatoes  salads  good lord we had a lot of food and it was all amazing  All the sauces were great  we particularly loved the red sauce   I m obviously very cultured and that s definitely the proper name for the sauce   You will probably have to wait in line but it is      worth it  I ll never go to Pittsburgh without going here

The hype is real folks  Read this review and get thee to Gaucho if you have not been there yet  Seriously  Don t wait  Do it   I split the Rosemary Braised Beef and the Carne Steak sandwich with a friend  GREAT idea because it was the best of both worlds  While I enjoyed the Rosemary Braised beef more  because I love horseradish and caramelized onions  the Carne Steak was just as good  The steak was so flavorful you didn t need anything else      Unless  you re into sauces like I am  I love sauce  They had four different kids of sauce on the table in the middle of the place  I wish I could tell you what every kind was  but all I know is that they were delicious  I just wanted to steal them and put them on everything I eat all the time    It s s small place  so beware you may have to do take out  but don t fear  they re looking to expand shortly and will hopefully offer dinner service and more   So get thee to Gaucho ASAP

I was PLANNING on taking a picture of my food  but the second I got it  I started cutting  I don t want to exaggerate because I love steak  but this was probably the best steak I ve ever had in my life  I had the sirloin and the potatoes and it was unbelievable  The steak was cooked perfectly  it was juicy  it was tender  it was flavorful  The potatoes were unbelievable as well  Don t listen to anyone who says anything other than   stars  The wait in the cold was abworth it    Second time back and somehow it was better than the first time  Can I just go ahead and give this place    stars

I loved my first experience in the newly expanded  well renowned Gaucho  I ordered the chicken sandwich  which came out on a toasty grilled ciabatta  crunchy on the outside  chewy on the inside   yummm   I was unaware chicken could taste that good  obviously I shared only under duress    My lunch partners ordered the skirt steak and the lamb rack  The skirt came out with an incredible marinade  with just the right preparation  an inspired performance  The lamb  while perfectly seasoned and cooked was the only reason for a star deduction  Compared to the other portions  which were huge  the lamb was a paltry   ribs and a tiny side salad  Perhaps they need to charge more and offer a larger amount of lamb  but we were very surprised by the notable difference in meat on that plate    The ambiance is changed from the joint s humble r  roots  and feels a bit more like the hip  buzzing restaurant it became  There is still a great view of the kitchen  and intimate seating  though you are no longer elbow to elbow with the next diner    In summary  We loved it  we ll absolutely be back  just not for the lamb

There is a reason that there is always a line out the door for this place   it s just that good  Gaucho is one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh and one I always tell out of towners to try  I ve never had anything I disliked  My husband and I usually want to try multiple dishes so we get some sandwiches  empanadas and all the sauces and split it  We always leave with some for lunch the next day too  Definitely a spot to try  You won t be disappointed

First I called to get a pick up order and they said they don t do pick up orders   So we went there and ordered and it took    minutes to get our food it was cold and the service was terrible but I could see where the food would ve been good but I will never go back and you re a fool if there s any indication that they re busy and you go

I mean   what is there not to love about Gaucho   This weekend we had guests from out of town visiting us and knew that we had to take them here  I was excited to come back because I haven t been here since it first opened a few years ago  I was impressed when I saw the amazing work that they had to the inside  We ended up getting here around      PM on a beautiful Saturday afternoon in PGH  The strip district was buzzing  so I was sure it would be packed here  Luckily  there was only about       people in line ahead of us and it seemed like the crowd followed us as we stood in line  We only ended up waiting about       minutes  which worked out great    When we finally got inside to see the menu  we were overwhelmed with the menu and how amazing everything sounded  We ended up deciding to order a few dishes to split between the   of us  this is a great idea if you are coming here with a group so you can get a taste of everything  We decided on an order of   each of the empanadas  vegetables  pork  and beef    side of potatoes  the Parrillada Mixta  NY strip steak  chicken  and spicy chorizo   and the vegetable sandwich  we ordered it deconstructed    Where do I even begin  Everything was mouth watering  The meats were all cooked to perfection and were accompanied by the fabulous self serving sauces that they have  You can tell that all the food is super fresh   it all has the perfect amount of char to give it a unique   delicious taste  The empanadas were all amazing and I loved to try the variety of them  They were unique from any other empanadas that I have had before  Even their bread is phenomenal   My ONLY complaint is that they got rid of the vegetable dish that was on their older menu  We ended up ordering the vegetable sandwich as a replacement but I didn t love it as much as the older vegetable dish  please bring it back     Aside from the fabulous food  the interior of Gaucho is also a winner  As I said before  the renovations that they have done in the last few years are outstanding  I love that they are able to fit more people inside and it is still super spacious and a comfortable environment  The staff is also helpful and very kind here  Most importantly    Gaucho is BYOB  I always love a good BYOB spot  I promise you  if you see a line here  stand it  and wait    it is so worth it  Can t wait to come back again

We got here just after   pm and got right in  The menu is on a huge chalkboard as you come in  Lots of good stuff to chose from  Every thing we had was great  Good service  great atmosphere   It s BYOB but that s ok   The sauces are really good too  We had a great time and great food   When your in Pittsburgh and in the strip district this is a must
The food is really good  I love the seafood soup and the ribeye  The price is a bit high for the amount of food you get but it is worth it

Pre wedding weekend bliss with my soon to be bride  We shared the ribeye platter which was INCREDIBLE  We opted for the large    oz  which was plenty to feed us both  My girl is a meat fan  but one of the best things she put on her plate was the sun dried grilled tomatoes in the salad  We liked them so much we asked for extra  The ribeye was tender and flavorful and grilled to perfection  The smoked red pepper sauce was our personal favorite  but all of the sauces were fresh and flavorful  We also ordered the grilled pineapple with blackberries  mint  and creme fresh  My lady had never had grilled pineapple before but I can tell by her reaction she will have it again    I ve read some yelpers had long waits  I can see why there is a line out the door on most weekends  We came on a Thursday afternoon and maybe had a    minute wait to order then probably another    minutes for our food    The biggest applause should go to the staff  Super friendly and helpful  The cooks have a thankless job over a hot grill but are masterful at their jobs and produce a fantastic product    The best advice I can give is talk to Dillon when you get here  He was extremely helpful and professional  and clearly enjoys his work  Great customer service and I m already looking forward to our next trip to this gem

Outstanding food and service  The flavor profiles are out of this world  The wait isn t too long so don t be fool by the long line which is usually out the door    My favorite meal is the flank steak with a side of the small veggies and a glass of Guinness or red wine   btw It s also BYOB

This is easily the best restaurant in Pittsburgh  Do not let the long line steer you away  The wait is usually    minutes to an hour  but the time goes fast knowing you are about to enjoy some pretty amazing food  We ordered the Asado platter  which is   cuts of meat  It was     and well worth it  The meat was cooked perfectly and was so tender  We also tried the empanadas  cremini mushrooms  broccoli and butternut squash mash  Overall  everything we ordered was tasty    It is BYOB  but we were informed that at the end of October they will be charging a     corking fee  That is sill not bad compared to what you would pay elsewhere for a whole bottle of wine

Food still SO good  but Gaucho just got their liquor license  so while you can still BYOB  a     per bottle corkage fee makes it a different experience  My large group went last night and decided not to BYOB but instead experience their beverage program   Gaucho   get your act together or roll the new policy back until you do   First  the disorganization in how they serve booze has severely slowed table turnaround  We stood at the register when it was our turn to order for half an hour because all tables were full  We went at the same time we always have  about once a month for over a year  and we have never had to stand and wait like that for a table  We figured out why when people at our table wanted another glass of wine  Not having waitstaff means having runners who have to be flagged down every time someone wants another glass   they take the order  Then you wait  And wait  About    minutes later they bring your little carafe of wine  Then you have to give them your credit card to run  Then you have to sign for it  Lather  rinse  repeat  We probably ended up extending our time at our table about a half an hour longer than if we d BYOB   Second  you have a nice selection of spirits but virtually no mixers and no clue as to how to make even the most basic cocktails  And you don t even have a lime for a vodka tonic
Amazing service  Amazing food  Portions could be slightly larger but I still think it s worth the price

Amazing   The carne sandwich with ribeye as the meat option was delicious as well as the rosemary braised beef sandwich  Their vegetable side also awesome with a great smokey taste   The newly remodeled interior is beautiful and very inviting plus the BYOB option with no corkage fee adds extra bonus points

I couldn t believe there existed a restaurant with      reviews and   stars so I had to check this place out  Of course I decided to do this on one of coldest days of this year  Despite the tiny space  the guys working there made me feel at home  With so many options to decide  my friend and I got all the options we wanted  jamon serrano  the meat and veggie empanada  gaucho papas  and rosemary braised beef sandwich    My description of the food will never give it justice  I highly highly recommend the jamon serrano  All the components of the dish was picked out carefully to complement each other  I even took the left over goat cheese and picked onions and added to the rosemary braised beef sandwich  If you don t have time to sit down  the sandwich is your best option  Hearty and satisfying  it can even satiate a caveman  The meat and veggie emapanadas were seasoned well and the emapanada dough was flakey and buttery  I preferred the steak but I am also a meat lover so my preference is biased  The gaucho papas weren t anything special but served as a nice accompaniment to our meal    I think their sauces deserve a separate paragraph  One of their workers explained to me the ingredients in all of the four sauces  Their main ingredients for each are  onion  parsley  onion  and red pepper  The chimirri  parsley based sauced  was  my favorite for it s potent flavor followed by the garlic  red pepper  and onion  Their sauces are great companions for any of the dishes  I personally enjoyed the chimirri with the bread and red pepper sauce for the potatoes   Gaucho not only serves awesome food but is one of the few restaurants that have excellent service  The workers truly looked like they enjoyed their job and even offered my friend and I to warm ourselves up by their grill  Their antics along with the food makes Gaucho a must stop  You know I ll be there again

I had been eyeing this place since a brief trip over a year ago  but did not have time to wait in the line that wrapped around the block  Luckily  when I walked by most recently  there were only about    people waiting to get in  It was my lucky day   The menu had so many wonderful options that it was hard to choose  I ultimately went with the   oz  Vacio  sirloin plate  and it was amazing  I loved everything on that plate  from the fresh side salad  to the delicious toasted artisan bread  to the caramelized onions  and finally  to the star of the show   the steak  which was cooked medium as I ordered  with a nice char on the outside  There were a variety of sauces for the steak  but my favorite was the chimichurri sauce  It was nicely herby and garlicky  and its acidity complemented well with the steak    This platter was definitely a lot of food for one person  but I was so hungry that I finished it  For dessert  I tried some alfajores   one vanilla and one chocolate  I ve tried alfajores a few times before  and these were the best I ve had  I believe they make them fresh    The service was great   everyone on staff was so friendly and helpful  They really exuded warm Argentinian hospitality  With such great food and great vibes  I can definitely see why this is a crowd favorite in Pittsburgh

Can t say anything negative about this place  We went on a Saturday evening so a wait was expected  Line moved quickly  I ordered the parrillada mixta which was chicken  chorizo and ny strip  All the meat was tender and delicious  They had    dipping  sauces that really complimented the meat  Empanadas were delicious  but smaller than I expected  We left stuffed and had only eaten half of what we ordered  Will be returning here in the future

Great restaurant  Argentinian steak house  First time trying an Argentinian steak house  Got the ribeye  Was cooked well  Came with salad and a piece of toast  Chimicurri was a nice touch  There are different chimicurri flavors you can try like smoked pepper and garlic  Service was good and restaurant had a nice vibe  Would visit again and try something new

I ve only been able to go to Gaucho three times I think   It s a tough place to get in because everyone wants to eat there   The food is just so magical  It really is  I absolutely love the chicken sandwich and the roasted corn on the cob   If I could eat here on a daily basis believe you me I certainly would
This is honestly one of the best places in Pittsburgh  Well worth the wait and never disappoints
One of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh  We are here for few days and we got lucky the day was very nice and sunny  Long line in the restaurant but was well worth it

There s already a million rave reviews on this place  but just in case you need another one to convince you to come here   please do visit this place if you re in Pittsburgh  There was a wait   it was a Friday night and I probably waited about    minutes  give or take  They seat you in order of the line rather than how many people are in your party   I ordered the sirloin steak plate with a side of mushrooms  Absolutely delicious  The meat was perfectly seasoned and cooked  The mushrooms were so delicious  I also got the apple pie bread pudding dessert  I was under the impression they would bring out my dessert immediately after I finished my dinner  but it actually ended up being like a    minute wait between when I finished my dinner and when I got dessert  All of that being said  though  I m still giving a   star review so clearly that dessert was BOMB  It was SO good  I don t even like dessert and I loved that apple pie bread pudding   Do yourself a favor and go eat here

EDIT  This meal was from December  I was trying to add Gaucho to my BYOB list  and I realized I hadn t posted my draft   end  The hype is real    Ordered   Bife de Chorizo   NY Strip  rare Los Sprahts   Brussel Sprouts  sweet peppered bacon  and cider reduction Caldo del Mar   Mussels  clams  squid  fried capers  lemon  garlic  tomato  and a secret ingredient   My favorite part is that it s not ridiculously expensive  I recommend the steaks  and the brussels were really good  I was disappointed by the seafood  next time I ll just stick to the land meat    I ve looked through the many pictures  and I d want to come back and try the sandwiches too   The only downside or unimpressive part of Gaucho is that the eating area could be improved   it feels like a McD s dining room  Wobbly chairs and tables

I cannot add much more than already was stated  but here it goes   Waited in line for about    minutes to get in  but it was    degrees and it is February  so I did not care at all   Walking in  greeted by a large chalkboard with all the menu items that are available   Tons of options here and if you love meat options on your menu  then you came to right place   We ordered two small flank steak platters  recommended by a fellow yelper  along with   Empanadas    Beef    Chicken    Veggie    My steak was medium rare and was cooked perfectly   The other half got medium and she was quite pleased   The steak smells and tastes so darn good  lots of flavor   The empanadas were also really good   Nice and crisp  with flavorful  guts  on the inside   My favorite was the veggie  shocking for me  but it was spicy and tasty   The staff here  for as busy as they are  are quite upbeat  fun  and courteous   They really did a nice job   The food was delivered within a very reasonable time frame as well     Though a tad on the pricier side  it is absolutely worth it   It certainly has earned the praise it has gotten and it should continue to do so   Go  wait in line  order up and enjoy  all worth it

We went here for lunch   the food is absolutely amazing  Just the wood burning ovens emitting that beautiful smell of fire is nose happiness    It s a bit pricey but so worth it  I ordered the Chirozo sausage in spicy   sweet and the red skin taters  My mouth was tingling in it s most happiness  Even the roasted garlic was amazing to eat whole  It came with a few pieces of roasted garlic bread and it was so yummy    I highly recommend eating here

Food gets   Stars as long as you like meat   However and not to be negative but line is long    hour with my    year old mother in law   They seem to cater to the young crowd only  No menu outside so people in line could have already decided  Too long to order

sauce sauce sauce sauce sauce sauce sauce sauce sauce sauce sauce sauce aUxs  Ah it s so good  everyone is nice   cute  cool dang  got a board of bloody meat fuuqqqq it was yum my mom got the same meat but not bloodddyy   she was smilin all smilin     had really good fig bread puddin  I took a lotta sauce leavin   dang

The steaks here are best in town     We had waited almost an hour to be seated but it was completely worth it  this place has waiting so make sure to arrive soon and u won t be disappointed as the food served is awesome  The sauces were real good  it s a must visit place and unique menu

This place in one word  Damn    I don t know how this food is so delicious  The spices  the cooking methods  the presentation  the atmosphere  the service  It s truly exceptional  We heard it was one of Pittsburgh s best restaurants  and I believe it  I enjoyed the casual atmosphere  but that the food tasted better than a  fancy  restaurant    It s in the Strip District  so you can walk around and visit all the other shops  which makes for a great date    I told my boyfriend that I was actually sad the meal was over  i e  All the food was gone    He got the huge steak plate with   different cuts of steak  The Ribeye was his favorite  I had the fish of the day on a deconstructed sandwich  which had the most amazing grilled onions and arugula with it    A little expensive compared to some places you could visit  but we ll worth it for the quality and flavor

I have to start by saying I did not like how they tell you to know what you want when you get to the counter  no menus outside so that you can figure that out  That almost made me pick a different restaurant   I don t like carrying my drinks to the table   And I don t like a TIP jar at the register   How do you know if you are going to TIP     before you have received service  But then I took my first bite   I am hooked   My husband and I ordered the empanadas  cauliflower  green beans  beef with rosemary  and the pork sandwich   We shared everything   Every single bite was delicious   It was way too much food for the two of us   But we managed to eat every bite   It was that good   I will definitely be a return customer

Not typical of an Argentinean restaurant but man was it some of the best meat I ve eaten   I had the rosemary braised beef Sammy and it was to die for   They have chimichurri  sauce and   others you can choose to add to your food  They were a grilled onion sauce  a red pepper and tomato sauce and a garlic sauce  The only one I didn t use was the pepper tomato sauce  The other three were an excellent addition  I also tried the vegi empanada which I wasn t fond of but I m an empanada snob so my expectations are high especially when you use the word empanada which shouldn t have been used here  It was more like a vegi turnover but if they called it that I would have never ordered it   The employees are so friendly and helpful  They had big smiles and that goes along way   The line was long but seemed to go fast  It was definitely worth the wait  The only thing I was disappointed in was the sides  They really could do better with the options   It was very unique that you could buy a bone for your dog for     Awesome way to keep from wasting them    I can t wait until the next time

If you are visiting Pittsburgh just add this to your list of restaurants you must eat at  Or if you live here and haven t dined here yet   get here ASAP  Just make sure you choose the time wisely  The hype is real and there will be a line  It does go fast though given the ordering set up    I ve dined at Gaucho twice now  The first time was in the summer when they had the shrimp and grilled veggies on the menu  This recent time I decided to get the carne sandwich and campfire yams  I have never ordered something I didn t like here  If you love yams  I highly recommend the campfire yams  I felt like I was out in the woods eating roasted marshmallows  Such a perfect fall dish  The sandwich was bigger than I expected which is why I cut it in half and made two meals out of it  You have your choice of meats and I picked the flank steak for my sandwich  Also  do not skip out on the sauces  They take your already delicious meal to the next level

There s a reason there is a line out the door of this place nearly every time you go there  Everything I ve had from Gaucho including veggies  potatoes  papas  and especially the meat has been absolutely wonderful  I m a person that usually goes for chicken over red meat  but order the steak here  you just have to  Their Chimichurri sauce is amazing  Another place you really can t go wrong with anything on the menu  Try to hit it this place on the off hours though there really aren t any

Wait was stupid long  hr   on a day that was raining like hell   Atmosphere was good   Staff was friendly   My steak was supposed to be medium  but came rare   It was very good overall  but not really worth a hr wait   Prices were very reasonable

This was my first time here  Since I have moved from Pittsburgh they have definitely done an amazing upgrade to its foodie scene and this place fits right in  If you come here though you are most likely going to have to wait in a long line that usually goes fast  that s if their POS system doesn t go down like it did tonight  that was the only down fall lol they said last time it was down for   hours  We waited for    min but the food is definitely worth it  They have flavorful selections cuts of steak cooked to your liking  I chose the steak medium well and it wasn t over cooked and was tender  They have difference sauces you can use to put on your food  My favorite was the garlic one  I also got the roasted vegetables with a fig dressing that was very good  And the peanut butter bread pudding was a perfect ending  It wasn t too sweet and very soft

Gaucho s meat sex shop is a MUST   I mean  this place was voted in a top ten spot on some national foodie list  I really don t feel like googling what list right now    And you might be thinking   well  I don t know  how good could a little local Pittsburgh area steak shop actually be   Why don t I just go to some chain restaurant that I know can cook the BEST filet mignon   with butter     well    Gaucho s is much much different  my friend    I think Gaucho is actually from Argentina   He must be  because I never tasted flavor like this in my LIFE   Whatever his prep process is from his meats  it s      grade prime material  Really talented stuff this guy does     On separate occasions I ve stopped by Gaucho s   Expect to wait  the line is usually out the door   even after he expanded his little stand up shop into a sit down  libation serving restaurant   All of my trips to this joint consisted of me ordering his steak sandwich for lunch  You can order straight up steak plates but for the    I ll save that for a dinner some other time    I mentioned he runs a meat sex shop  because his sandwiches are created as if they were put together in such a place  He combines the perfect amount of steak juice bread combination you could ever want in your mouth

I m newish to the area and have driven by a few times  it s hard to miss the line wrapped around the building so I figured I needed to see what the fuss was all about   First  this place smells amazing   Seriously  waiting in line isn t even bad because you just get to take in all the free smells   It will make you more hungry than when you arrived though    Second  the man that took my order was great   I believe his name was Patrick   Extremely knowledgeable and professional while maintaining efficiency with the line and keeping his cool   I m a district manager  so I know and appreciate good service when I see it   I d love to have this guy on my team         would recommend

My favorite eatery in the Burgh  Delicious  Argentinean fare  no pretension  long waits  and totally worth it    Everything is fresh  seasoned perfectly  and their chimichurri and other sauces taste like the meaning of life

Visiting from Orlando  FL  Very cute little counter order service Argentina restaurant  You need to make sure you are ready to stand in line  The line sometimes loops down and around the building   Ordered the porky emapana  it has chicken and pork stuffed inside  Ribeye Carne Steak sandwich with onions and red peppers   Corn on the Cob   And my favorite dish  QUI QUI chicky  two legs  two thighs with an awesome quiquirimichi sauce on it  The chicken practically melted in my mouth   All that with a Mexican coke only cost
Awesome food  worth the wait in line  I have eaten here a handful of times and definitely will go back

The hype is real   I think I just ate one of the best sandwiches  The Carne  I ve ever had in my entire life   SUPER friendly and FUN staff   Great menu  Generous portions   Incredibly delicious food   The place is a small  meat Mecca     It offers relatively confined indoor seating or a charming  street side patio right next to the place   Plus  they effortlessly handled an ever growing line of hungry customers quite quickly    Gaucho is instantly on my  favorites  list  as I can t wait to be a return customer   Believe the hype     Star  Rock Stars
My favorite dream is when I eat    of these steak sandwiches covered in every sauce

Awesome   The lines around the corner tell the story  great Argentinian grilled meats  and everything to go with them   Nice bright space in a building that sat empty for too long   Can t wait to go back

I have been hearing about Gaucho s for the past   years but only recently had an opportunity to go there   Wow   It was delicious   I had the fish sandwich and then  a week later  had the steak sandwich   This is definitely in my top   go to places for anyone visiting Pittsuburgh

Very rude customer service and not accommodating to serve me  The restaurant closes at  pm during the week  I showed up at the restaurant at    pm and was refused service with only   people in line ahead of me and I was a single eater  I talked with one of the employees and she said that I could not be served  I even offered to take it to go  Please do not waste your time with customer service such as this  I had been waiting for about   months to get off of work in time to try this place out  Never again

A line out the door and around the corner on a Thursday    I think it took me around    minutes to get in and get my food  so it wasn t too bad of a wait   I got the carne con pan   It was good  but a tad smaller than I expected it to be     Wish I could ve tried more food

Ok  I do really really like this place  food is fantastic    been there I bunch of times   But      They do need to work on the experience    I can accept waiting outside in the rain because they have nowhere for customers to wait  and I can accept setting my own table once you claim one    Last night my wife and I made the trip into the city to hit one of our goto places  we arrived at      to a pretty short line  great right   Nope  the poor schmuck at the end of the line had the unpleasant job of telling anyone who comes in the he was the end of the line while holding a giant end of line sign   Really   it s      and they  advertise closing at     I found the whole thing just stupid   Now it s late and we have to find somewhere else to go    I get this is one of those places who s thing is all about the food that you can t get anywhere else   it grew out of that self serve concept which is kind of cool the first few times    Now it s annoying   BTW our flank steak with chimichurri with red beans and farofa recipe is pretty awesome    Look out  haha
Best meat   great service staff  Love their attitudes  Decor is comfy
I love Gaucho   Whether for lunch or a special event  they have been fabulous   I only wish that they were open   days a week

My boyfriend ordered the mixed grill which had the pulled chicken  chorizo  and New York strip steak   I ordered the grilled shrimp   Food is freakin delicious and You need to eat here  Seating is weird but who cares when the food is freakin awesome and the people who work there are sweet as pie

Go here immediately     The meats are amazing  They are cooked to perfection  Make sure to get a cup of each sauce so you can dip your meat and bread into it  The grilled corn was so good  I tried the filet and flank steak and they were full of flavor  I don t think that you could make a bad decision when ordering from here   There is a reason this place had five stars  I am craving it like crazy

HIGHLY RECOMMEND  Especially for steak lovers    This was rated one of the top    places to eat in the US according to Yelp a few years ago  Many people raved about it and I knew I had to try it out  I went here to celebrate one of my friend s birthday on a weekend  We were forewarned about the line and had to wait in line for about an hour  But was it worth it  YES  Everything was under     and for the amount and quality you get  it was definitely at a good price point  Service was great  The waiter gave us free dessert because he overheard us say it was our friend s birthday  I would go back again and try their famous paella that can feed like a whole family    DINNER   We ordered   steak platters  one fish platter    appetizer  and rosemary pulled pork sandwich  The rosemary pulled pork sandwich was sooo gooodd  It was juicy and fragrant  The steaks were all perfectly medium rare  and comes with a side of bread and salad  There were different dipping sauces to dip the steak in  The fish was tender  The yellow rice was standard and the corn was okay  Since this place is known for the steak  it definitely did not disappoint    We ordered banana bread pudding and we got free cookies from the waiter  The bread pudding was good  but a bit too sweet for my liking  However my friend thought it was  life changing

The food and wait staff were excellent but the experience was more than puzzling frustrating  The MENU BOARD NEEDS TO GO  It s a cluster     of confusion  You are standing in a TINY little space trying to read this massive handwritten menu that is all OVER the place while people behind you hover  The ambiance is LOUD and hurried  My party barely talked to each other because no one could hear anything  So  Food A     Experience D   Get it to go and you ll probably love it

I realized I ve been too liberal with my star rating  From now on  my mind has to be blown to get a   star review  Gaucho Parilla wasn t mind blowing but the food was OUT DANG STANDING   I took my fianc  there for his birthday last night and WOW   What a different experience  I got a steak burger  I m not sure what his entree was  and we got empanadas  Everything was so good  especially my steak burger  That was a GREAT burger  Downsides   it was a little bit intimidating for an introvert like myself  You walk in  stand in line and order and pay for your food right away  Then you find a table yourself and your food is brought to you by some waiter coming into the dining room and yelling your name  I didn t like this  I want to be seated  have a waiter and a menu  But that s just my personal preference  I ll go back for the food

Smoky  meaty  authentic food   Really amazing cuisine served up by a friendly staff   I had the steak sandwich  rib eye  with potatoes   There are only about   seats inside but also some tables on the outside   The decor is nothing fancy  but the food is the real deal  I would give them   stars  but I had a half hour wait in line  then a    minute wait for my food

We love it   I have tried to find fault  but the food is consistent  the chimmi is flavorful  fresh and free  the settings is clean and casual     I am usually frustrated with how stodgy Pittsburgh is when it comes to convention and I m glad to see Gaucho break with the typical   sit down and wait an hour for your food  routine   As in Nashville and other foodie cities  you line up at the counter  with a large printed menu on the wall to look at as you wait  then you place your order and choose your own seat   They ll hand you your drinks on the spot and bring your food out when it s ready and usually  that s not too long   I gave it   stars because the food is as good as it gets  but there is one notable flaw  The line is insanely long    I wouldn t say Gaucho is to blame for such a long line  other than producing a hit restaurant  but they generally have exactly   person working the line ringing people up even if nearly     people are waiting  Sometimes the same person gets all the drinks  takes all the orders  and rings each person up   If a party of   pays separately and asks questions about the menu or for recommendations  you might wait    minutes for one table of people to place an order   This makes the wait longer than necessary  even with Gaucho s great popularity  I can t think of another business where that flies     I can see that if they had more than one register  there might not be enough tables  but we ve never been forced out without a seat but we have waited for over an hour to place our order      Keep up the excellent food  Gaucho   You ve already broken with tradition  but tweaking the way you take orders is in order   No restaurant  no matter how lauded  is guaranteed permanent success and it s always a good move to consider your customers first

I was shocked to see how much the place has changed since the last time I was here  It is way more spacious and I really liked the ambiance  The food is still as delicious as the first time I had it  Their chimichurri and garlic sauce are amazing  I usually get the carne sandwich   Fillet mignon  with papas and a beef empanada
Best steak experience I ve had in a long time  A little bit of a wait  but worth it as the atmosphere more than makes up for it  Would go again

Still   stars  This is our favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh hands down  I tried one of their salads with sirloin on it and it was the best salad I ve ever had in my life  I was this close  to licking the bowl clean  Can t wait to come back and try more of their food  AMAZE BALLS
