There s likely to be a line  and you ll wait while smelling some of the grill scents and watching happy people leave the restaurant  Around   PM on a weekend  we waited about       minutes  Once inside  you get to see the full menu   by that point I was so hungry I wanted everything  We got lamb and shrimp plus a large side of vegetables   I was surprised  The food was uniformly perfectly cooked  The shrimp were juicy  the lamb was tender and the vegetables were perfectly smokey yet still crispy  We cleaned our plates   The staff was friendly and helpful despite the constant crowd  the food came out reasonably quick  and the variety of seating makes it a social environment  Gaucho is a must try on any trip to Pittsburgh

If you like waiting in line for an iPhone this is about the same experience with no phone at the end   just some tired feet   The key which I didn t know but know now is to just be rude and push past the line saying a friend is already inside  This happened to me tonight and I ll never go back   I waited here for almost   hours and I had one Guy in front of me   then his   friends show up and I let it slide thinking ok he saved a spot for his friends but yeah   of them all Pitt students   So I let it go and the line slowly moves and right before I got inside a lady and her kid come around the bend and pushed right in   then I didn t make it in the door and they shut the door on me    and no this kid wasn t young or crippled or in any way shape and form couldn t wait the dang   hours i had to wait   another    minutes of me waiting went by all the time I see the lady and kid go to the counter now to order   finally I wised up and went to Kuhn s and bought my own flank steak for   dollars and   dollars of seasoning   People are probably still waiting in line there now and I already ate   This place has by far the worst system I ve ever seen for a restaurant   Next time I ll know to fake throwing up and just run inside   Anywhere else it would probably have lots of fights from the poor queue system

Stopped by for lunch  Amazing quality and flavor for such a quick meal  Choice of four sauces which were delicious  Cool atmosphere as well  This place should be a role model for the burgeoning Pittsburgh foodie scene

We ate at Gaucho s today for lunch when visiting the strip district in Pittsburgh for the first time  This place had good yelp reviews   The reviews were right    There were plenty of vegetarian options  I ordered the provolone toast and charred brocollini and would def order again  My friend enjoyed the veg soup and a big salad   The staff were all terrific and decor was fun  Hope to eat here again on my next visit

I couldn t help noticing that I was the only female in line on a busy Friday lunch hour   I guess it makes some sense since this is place is known for their steak sandwich and men love their meat     Since I m not much of a beef eater  I went with the small plate of shrimp  carones  and the potatoes  papas    The shrimp and potatoes were lightly seasoned but you could definitely taste the fire grilled taste   YUM   I m a big fan of grilled food so this is a place to keep in mind when you have a craving for some fired food   They do have a selection of sauces and I got to try a few of them  can t remember the names    the one I liked the best had cilantro and chillies   it was also the one that was nearly done so it must be popular     Next time I go  I d like to try the grilled veggie sandwich

Delicious  Based on the staff recommendation  I had the steak sandwich with filet minion  It was fabulous  Very well seasoned and the bread was soft without being all soggy  I also love that the sauces are available separately because I m a spice a phobe  but my boyfriend isn t  so we can both be happy  The sides were also excellent  The grilled corn they had in the summer was great  but every side I ve tried has been good   I was tempted to deduct a star for the lack of seating  but the food is just too good  Just be ready to eat it standing up  This place is tiny  It is better in the summer when they have the outdoor seating available

I gave the place             and will look at the place from   different perspectives      Food quality        it is by far one of the best pieces of steak I have ever eaten  Juicy  tender  well cook and seasoned to perfection  Similar to the steak you will get in a good restaurant in Buenos Aires       Place        it is small and there is not enough space to sit  You can always order your food to go BUT it will get cold by the time you get home  Not setup for a large family or group of friends      Service        we waited for at least    min before the steak arrived and there was only   parties waiting  I was getting pretty hungry and antsy and the salad was not helping       Price        It is overprice  The price you pay in a restaurant is not only for the food quality but also for the comfort and atmosphere  and the service  I did not mind the tag because the food was awesome      Parking        the place is located in the strip district and has not private parking  Therefore  eating there requires a bit of planning  a bit of driving around  or a bit of walking   In summary  a GREAT place to eat AWESOME meat if you don t mind the parking  the small place  and the big price tag

You cannot believe your own heart  You cannot deny your own mind  You cannot free yourself From the memory Of beef Of beef like this Between two pieces Of bread Like ass cheeks  Of salted yeast  Tender as starlight  Real as a circus animal s desertion Savoury as the last drop of sweat released  expunged in a faraway land  still clinging to your sunbeaten brow  You gaze at the vast endless new territory Of the rest of your life  You have arrived    but can you leave

Came for lunch around      and waited maybe    min  when they took our order the line was around the corner  So we came at good time  We had the braised beef sandwich and ribeye steak  and grilled sweet corn  All delicious  The salads looked amazing  I d love it they had seating outside or rooftop  Cool place  but felt a little rushed  Service was good  nice staff

Going to Guacho was such a fun experience  The food was phenomenal and the fast paced environment gave it such a lively feel  I ordered the Vacio sirloin plate  the meat was cooked perfectly medium well  It came with a salad and piece of toast   the toast was amazing  The salad needed more dressing so I added the garlic sauce into it  They have stations where you can get the sauce from in little cups  The Papas Al Horno potatoes were good as well  the garlic and rosemary were a great addition  I added the pepper sauce to them and it was amazing  My brother got the Catch of the Day Atlantic Salmon Pescado sandwhich and it tasted freshly made  and caught   Overall I loved the experience of Argentinian food as well as the fast paced Pittsburgh vibes the restaurant gave

Great little restaurant if you like Argentinian food  the quality of the food is sublime and the sandwitches have fresh bread  Alot of sauces to choose from and the dishes are pretty unique if you are unfamiliar with Argentinian food  I would start with a couple different steak sandwiches and work my way through the menu   FYI the lines here can get alittle ridiculous  especially during dinner time so go a couple hours before to prevent standing in line for    mins  Although the wait is worth it

What are you waiting for  Eat here already   The steakburger may be the best burger patty you ever have  It comes on a big crunchy brioche bun which at first I thought was too much bread  but upon further reflection and analysis  I must conclude that a mere mortal burger bun would crumble and disintegrate against this burger s juiciness      Tip  Come early on a weeknight  Like right after work  Do not attempt to come here on Friday  Saturday  or Sunday  It s too small a place to serve all the people who want to eat here

Delicious   Everything we ordered left us wanting more   It does take a little bit of time to get your food once you order  but the quality is well worth it   The staff was very attentive  and the employee who took our order took the time to explain all of the sauces and package up a container of each for us to try   He even told us a little bit about the origin of the restaurant and mentioned that they had converted their small parking lot into a little bit of outdoor seating   Definitely make the stop

If you re in Pittsburgh for any numerous reasons  you HAVE to come here  The lines can get long but with great company and BYOB  it goes by quickly  My friends and I have all heard stellar reviews of this place and they re all wholly valid  We ordered a variety of things off the menu but we left wishing we had more stomach to try everything else  Basically can t go wrong

This might be my new favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh  It is a meat place and I am vegetarian and it is actually fantastic  You have to order your food at the counter when you get there and have your entire party before you can be seated  This is efficient since there is typically a line  The menu is large and has many vegetarian options  I ordered the small Provoletta and the broccolini with a cold yerba mate  Both were so  so good that I wanted to get back in line and get more once I was finished  The service was good and the place is clean and lively  An definite stop while in Pittsburgh

Everyone s crazy about this place  I like the atmosphere  and they have some nice outdoor seating for the summer  but every time I ve gotten a sandwich  it was so greasy  The quality of the food is pretty good  but the line is always so long for something I m not truly crazy about

I finally ate at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina  We showed up around   PM on a Saturday  We stood in line for about    minutes  but we were lucky enough to get one of the last available tables  I ordered a flank steak  which was cooked medium as I had requested and was quite tasty  My husband ordered the Parrillada Mixto  NY Strip steak  grilled chicken  and chorizo  and said that it could have had a bit more flavor  My side of potatoes also needed a bit more seasoning

Okay okay    I m glad I came back here  well I didn t really come back  I made a coworker bring me back something for lunch  I got the rosemary braised beef sandwich and it was really out of this world  Large sandwich  tons of meat  a perfect balance of flavor  I didn t have to deal with the ambiance which probably helps my review  Solid A

The food here is great   Don t let the line scare you  well worth the wait   We enjoyed the flank steak  the NY strip and the pig and pickles  various picked veggies with roasted pork and a yummy aoili      The ear of corn was cooked to perfection and seasoned wonderfully   The steaks were grilled nicely and full of flavor   We also tried the grilled wings  which easily could have been the best wings this eater has ever enjoyed   Oh   and there sauces  the traditional chimichurri and   others    the garlic one was awesome   You wont be mad or diappointed if you stand in line   This place does not disappoint

One of Pittsburgh s most talked about spots did not disappoint at all  We went for a date Friday night around      and did not have to wait at all  We split a chorizo  chicken  and steak dish  Plus we ordered potatoes and shrimp  It was the perfect portion for us to split  My favorite was definitely the chorizo and then the shrimp  But everything was great  Their meat is cooked perfectly with delicious sauces to accompany them  The garlic butter sauce was heavenly  We were certainly satisfied with our experience and will be back again
Worst service and host please do not go to this restaurant  They are liars and trash  Have no representation of Argentinian culture or people   Please spit on them

I was sold on this place the minute I walked in the door and was greeted by the heavenly aroma of grilled meats   If I had it to do all over again  I would order differently  but this place is awesome    I ordered the skirt steak sandwich  the grilled corn  and the fried potatoes   All were absolutely delicious      So why would I order differently   One   because I d want to try more stuff    But mostly because I ordered way too much food and I d prefer something a little easier to eat    The sandwich was great   Flavorful  and nicely commplimented by charred red peppers and onions    The ciabatta bread was a nice choice  but skirt steak is a tougher cut  which perhaps would have been better in a non sandwich form    It was tasty  but really hard to eat    Next time  I would order the filet or something that is a little more tender   or get it in a salad or something    The corn was served with the folded back husk as a handle    Would absolutely order that again   The potatoes were also good  but completely unnecessary   The sandwich and the corn were more than enough     Overall  this place is a winner   Not good for groups  since it is tiny   Maybe six seats inside and eight tables outside    Staff members weree super friendly and took the time to explain everything   including the four complimentary sauces  all of which were good

Walked in there with our own craft beer  the rib eye was sooo good  Every thing like the empanadas and the dessert were great  Is totally recommend this place to anyone looking to try out a legit Argentinian place

A definite go to place  The people who work there are friendly  You can take them beer or wine to show thanks or just for yourself  My go to favorite is the Carne sandwich with NY Strip  I love   of the   sauces   the one that kinda looks like mucous is the one I leave behind    I ve never heard any complaints from friends about everything else on the menu  Whether you eat in or get it to go  it s a great choice

Steak sampler was disappointing   Every cut of meat tasted the same  All the meat was  blue    I understand rare but this was flat raw   I ll give it another chance in the future because I ve heard many good things   My experience was a let down
Always an amazing experience with fantastic food  Sad bc they were out of filet mignon but can t complain much  Nice people wonderful experience and the most excellent quality food

Meat cooked perfectly  service was excellent  we went here for lunch but I wish we would ve came for dinner so I could order ten Million more things   so flavorful  I definitely agree with this rating   The sauces were SO good too  I understand now why they sell them by the jar
So glad they expanding this fabulous little place to get great food  Everything I ve had here is tasty tasty tasty

So amaziiiiiiiing    We came full and this was only supposed to be a snack pitstop and the   of us ended up demolishing our plates     The seating is a little intimate but get all   sauces and find an empty space and get ready to chow down   The staff is a hoot and even if they poke fun at you  they add to the experience    definitely make this a regular if you live here and make this a stop if you re visiting

Exceeded my expectations   Had the Ribeye medium rare and it was excellent   The beef and pork empanadas were also very good  I especially liked the pork   We also had the mushrooms  spaghetti squash and sweet potatoes as sides all of which were nicely done     The sauces are excellent as well   I really like the red version      Preserved the gaucho salad and it wasn t much more than the salad that already came with the steak   It was just a couple extra beets and some avocado   If you already have a house salad with your meal I would do other sides over this     Great place   Be prepared for a wait

The food here is a   so I ll start with that    We started with the picada  which was a huge portion for an appetizer  It was enough for my husband and I to have it as an appetizer for two days  The picada included Serrano ham  Iberico Chorizo  provolone  cabrales  which is another word for amazing blue cheese   dulce de membrillo  which is another name for pear paste   I don t like pear  but thought it was tasty   marinated olives  green and kalamata type olives   toasted almonds and ciabatta toast  We love charcuterie plates and this was by far the best    Next we shared the carne sandwich with flank steak  Originally  we were going to get either sirloin or skirt steak  Then I asked which steak would be the most tender and flavorful  A man who worked there said the flank steak would be the best for what I described  So happy we took his recommendation  It was delicious and made even better when I added chimichurri and some of the cabrales  blue cheese  from the picada  Absolutely delicious  We d order both again in a heartbeat    Now to the reason why I gave them   star less  Their ordering system is a disaster  There is always one person on the register who barely wants to be there  There may or may not be someone else there watching the giant line but not jumping on the second register  Then there is a girl giving out drinks  I think her time would be better spent on the second register ringing people up  There was a woman who took you to your table  Again this seems silly  Why can t she ring the second register and let people find their own seats  There were lots of them  It would be so much better if they just had table service  Then there is the crazy list of rules outside    If you can deal with the dumb ordering process and waiting forever to get to the one person ringing the register  the food is so worth it    You can also call ahead and come in for takeout  You can t eat there after though

Yeah  I know what you re thinking    stars for Gaucho Parrilla Argentina  You re CRAZY     That actually may be a true statement about me  since my mother has never had me tested  But nevertheless  I did not enjoy the charred  ashy flavor of their meats  particularly the ribeye steak sandwich   I didn t add any additional toppings  which might have helped   but I wanted to taste the purity of the meat  Also  the ratio of meat to veggies was ridiculously lopsided with thick cut roasted veggies being probably     of the sandwich  Considering the cost of the sandwich  I would have expected more meat   Although I liked the burger much more  I was not a fan of the hard breads they use to compliment their sandwiches  I also did not enjoy the strong flavor of the roasted potatoes and the beef empanadas were just okay    My tweenage kids took a bite and refused to eat any more of their food  They have a serious dislike for anything that has a burnt flavor and I honestly couldn t argue with them  I love a decent char  but today it was like eating cigarette butts from an ashtray  I felt so bad because I really hyped this place up to them after reading reviews and getting recommendations prior to my visit  So I took them down the street for a bowl of pho to make amends  Another visit may yield a better result  but as a first time experience goes  the food did not live up to the hype  The restaurant itself  the decor and the staff on the other had were awesome  What an eclectic collection of humans     FINAL THOUGHTS  This place came highly recommended  which makes me dread writing this review  I definitely don t want this to be a slap in the face to all the awesome yelpers who suggested Gaucho as THEE place to visit for my one day trip to Pittsburgh  but I gotta be honest  Besides  there are so many positive reviews here that I doubt mine will even be noticed    Ribeye steak sandwich       stars  Beef Empanada    stars  SteakBurger    stars  Roasted potatoes    star  Decor staff    stars
Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is my favorite place to eat and dine  Very recommending

This place was legit  A group of us decided to venture to Pittsburgh and choose this place for dinner   It s situated in downtown and fairly easy to spot  Arrived at  pm and there was already a small line  We ordered  Grill shrimp Empanadas Halibut  fish of the day  Asado Platter Apple bread pudding   The Asado platter was cooked to very well to our desired med rare with a good amount of meat for   men    Only comment is the sauces couldve been better and the bread pudding was bur a bit dry
always perfect  friendly staff  excellent food  wish I could go more often  I d give   stars  but the lack of table service hurts

The food is delicious  as good as it gets   The set up  trying to get a table can be a little taxing   We had seven and all the tables and counters were taken and it did not look like any table was ready to leave so we shared a little table on the patio and were offered a few extra seats from a couple of other tables  We shared the NY strip  ribeye  flank steak  veggie platter  potatoes  corn pudding and shrimp  and pork   All very good  cooked perfectly and with a nice wood smoke flavor    The four condiments were good on everything and are made in house   BYOb and enjoy

An ok place when there s nothing else around   In the midst of the city so parking is at a premium   Decent sandwiches and small plates   Very accommodating service as we had a wheelchair bound person with us  Long lines and limited seating though   BYOB

It may have been because of all the positive reviews  but I expected much more from Gaucho Parilla than it delivered  Don t get me wrong  the food was great  but not amazing    I came here with my brother at what I thought would ve been at an off time  It was neither lunch nor dinner  right around     pm  yet  there was still a long line outside the small entry way  Mind you  Pittsburgh had just received about a foot of snow the night before so most of the streets were empty  however  Gaucho Parilla must be doing something right for it to still have its patrons wanting it when it s freezing outside    It being our first time here  and seeing how busy it was  We could only imagine it to be worth the wait  The prices were a little on the steeper end  but I wanted to try a little bit of everything so we shared the Parrillada Mixta  NY Strip steak  grilled chicken boob and spicy chorizo with   pieces of toast   an order of the beef empanadas  and a small El Gaucho salad    The steak was prepared at a perfect medium rare and was delicious  The chicken boob  sic  was juicy and paired perfectly with the Pimenton Red Pepper sauce  The spicy chorizo was also very tasty  The portion sizes weren t too large and honestly was the perfect amount of food    The beef empanadas are highly recommended  The outer crust is very crispy with the innards seasoned well and yummy  I could ve had just these empanadas and been perfectly satisfied  although it would ve probably taken    of them    I would recommend Gaucho Parilla to anyone visiting or even residing in Pittsburgh if it didn t take forever to get into the restaurant and order  I would not recommend if you re coming with a super large party  although they can very well accommodate for one
Fantastic  fresh  awesome  Try to sample all the meats  Mushrooms  potatoes  and corn are also on point  Try all the sauces too

Had the rosemary shrimp  grilled veggies  and the rosemary beef brisket  It was good but there are better places to stop in Pittsburgh  Sit outside and make sure you grab some spices if you want them  It s BYOB too

it is nearly impossible to find a restaurant that accommodates my paleo diet   and isn t just a boring salad  Gaucho absolutely blew my mind in flavor   service  and our meal was prepared quickly  a relief because the smells in there made me salivate immediately   My friend   I shared sides and an appetizer   do NOT skip the Provoleta  guys  seriously  We had the honey goat cheese carrots   garlic potatoes which perfectly complimented our steaks  each was prepared to absolute perfection  I m still dreaming about this meal  and almost went back the very next day for lunch
Amazing  It s worth the long line

When I came here  I got the corn on the cob and the Pescado special  which was an Arctic char  The Arctic char was incredible  one of the best pieces of fish I ve had  Corn was excellent too  It s BYOB  so if you re looking for a drink  be sure to remember to bring your own  I can t say enough good things about the food quality and service  I ll definitely be back
Great atmosphere and excellent food  We had the flank steak plate and we all devoured them  Thumbs up Gauchos

This place was pretty decent  The staff was super friendly and helpful and the ambiance was super cool but I had to knock off a couple of stars because flavor was lacking a little bit  I ordered some ribeye   medium rare  and it was pretty good  but it was sooooo charred and needed some salt  The chimichurri kind of saved it  but not enough  The potatoes were good  but again  missing salt  I think I might try there again and try a different cut of meat and a different side  The bread  sourdough   was so great  and the salad was good  nothing great about it  but nothing bad
One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh  worth the wait  Love their sauces

Why aren t there more shops like this around   On the West end of the Strip is this little Argentinian restaurant called Gaucho  It s easy to walk by without taking notice     but the wood paneling and the amazing grill aromas will draw you in  They even have fresh rosemary growing in the store to use for their marinades and sauces  There is limited bar style seating along the walls   The staff is super friendly and inviting  The shop is about two months old  so they re still soliciting feedback on menu items and concepts from customers  I believe they are soon opening up their outdoor seating section as well   The menu is actually quite big for such a small shop  with everything from sandwiches  to salads  to full entrees available  We decided to go for a Saturday lunch  and it wasn t too crowded inside at all  We asked one of the staff what the most popular items were  and he said the carne sandwiches were the hot item  I went with a ribeye carne sandwich  you can choose from different cuts of steak    while the rest of the family tried the chorizo and pollo sandwiches    The carne and chorizo sandwiches are loaded with roasted peppers and onions  while the chicken sandwich is loaded with portobello mushroom and onion  They all sit on ciabatta bread  The meats were all extremely flavorful and generously portioned  The ribeye had an amazing rosemary marinade on it that just elevated the taste experience to another level  While there are four different sauces you can experiment with in the center island  I highly recommend trying them all   the carne sandwich really didn t need any extra flavor at all  So good  The rest of the family thoroughly enjoyed their choices as well  I really wanted to try some of the grilled vegetable items  OK fine  I wanted to try everything on the menu   but I was full already   This is such a great introduction of Argentinian grill food to the Pittsburgh area  and I can only see Gaucho gaining infamy as THE place for an incredibly authentic bite of Argentina

I go against the grain  I thought it was an amazingly salty place  I had my month worth of dietary sodium all in one sitting  Still don t know why if it is a steak place they don t ask how a customer prefers his meat like rare medium or well done

Gaucho is always fantastic   This trip three of us shared the paella   Paella is served in a    inch pan  which was more than enough for all of us for a total of       We did not get any bread or sides   With apps or sides the paella dish would feed     people   The dish itself was very good with a nice amount of mussels  shrimp and clams along with chicken and sausage

Ate here last week Tuesday and lunch time on Wednesday  This place is a must if you love open fire flame cooking  The Cordero lamb chops were the best lamb chops that I have eaten in years  The Papas Dulce had amazing seasonings on it  The lamb was cooked to perfection during dinner time  The Lunch time chef didn t get my lamb medium rare like I requested  but it was still tasty  I ll be heading back there in the coming months for work and will definitely make it a destination

I ve been to Guaucho twice now for lunch  once with my fiance and most recently this past Tuesday with my father   The inside of this restaurant is quite small and probably seats only around    people with seating for    or more outside next to the restaurant   There s not too many decorations inside either although there is a chalkboard menu which you can order from and then on a center table there is an area where you can grab your utensils or serve yourself any of their four sauces   Both of the times that I was at Gaucho I ended up ordering the Carn  for my entree   The Carne is their steak sandwich which allows you to choose between one of the   cuts of steak that they serve and that comes with roasted red peppers and onions on a nice ciabbata roll   The first time that I was there I ordered the skirt steak but I heard the owner mentioning this last time that it is no longer on the menu and has been replaced by the hangar steak   So this last time I ended up choosing the rib eye as the cut of steak that I wanted   As with all of the meat that I have tried here it had the wonderful wood smoked flavor to it   My only complaint about it is that it was a bit tougher than I expected and so made for some hard chewing   We also ended up ordering the large portion of vegetables which I have had both times that I have visited now   They consist of onions  roasted red peppers  zucchini and asparagus  Surprisingly  this ended up producing my favorite part of the meal as the roasted red peppers have a great natural sweetness to them and when combined with the sweet balsamic drizzle on top  makes for the perfect counterpoint to the wood smoked flavor   Honestly  I could probably eat those red peppers all day   The rest of the vegetables were good as well and most had a hint of the smokiness but none came close to what the peppers absorbed   My dad was also a big fan of the bread  both the ciabatta that my sandwich came on and also the crostini like object that came with his meal   He really enjoyed dipping them into a few of the four sauces that they have laid out for you to taste and even passed up eating more steak to dip some more bread   The bottom line for me is that I would definitely come back here again in the future   While it has a downside of only being open      Tuesday Saturday and also is small  it is well worth the trip to the Strip District   Their food is pretty amazing and I especially love the smoky flavor on everything that comes out of Gaucho

Their food is always perfectly cooked and full of flavor  The staff is ahead of the game  I would say I wish the place was bigger but I don t think it would matter  Their food is so good it is worth waiting for and I think there would always be a line

This place is perfect and completely worth the long wait you ll have in line  They also have surprisingly good vegetarian options  I have thoroughly enjoyed every meal I ve had here  The staff is friendly and welcoming and the decor is adorable  Pro tip  Go at       and the line is much shorter

Tried the steak burger because the thrillist article   It was pretty good but not mind blowing   I got cheese and grilled onions as toppings   I probably should have gotten another topping  The bread it s on is fantastic  I also got one empanada and it was pretty good  Nothing spectacular   I will be back sometime to try something else   I guess a plate of meat or something

We had an amazing meal here about an hour ago before the game  We looked up healthy places to eat in Pittsburgh and this place came up  They have a wide variety of options for meat lovers and vegetarians alike  All their food is wood fire grilled  The service here is so kind  I m definately going to recommend this place to everyone  We will be returning very soon
Worth the wait  Being in line wasnt too bad  Maybe ten mins  They have a good system so by the time u get to the end u sit right down n the food comes right out  And boy was it delicious

We visited Gaucho in the strip district after seeing many reviews and pictures on social media  We  were prepared for a long wait so we arrived early  and not hungry yet  on a Saturday night  We arrived around     p and the wait was about an hour  Not bad and totally worth it   would have been a lot worse if we arrived famished    Staff was nice and handed out waters to the line as we waited  My hubby and I  ordered the asado platter      cuts of meats  and the grilled vegetable plate  We just split both and it was the perfect amount and we loved that we got to try a bit of all cuts of steak they offer   Amazing amazing amazing  And the four chimichurri sauces were the icing on the top of the cake  We will absolutely be back  We would love to see another gaucho location pop up in Pittsburgh so the wait times could decrease   But     none the less

I was PLANNING on taking a picture of my food  but the second I got it  I started cutting  I don t want to exaggerate because I love steak  but this was probably the best steak I ve ever had in my life  I had the sirloin and the potatoes and it was unbelievable  The steak was cooked perfectly  it was juicy  it was tender  it was flavorful  The potatoes were unbelievable as well  Don t listen to anyone who says anything other than   stars  The wait in the cold was absolutely worth it
Excellent quality meats and food  Very friendly staff as well  Not big so it s either a take out place or you can eat on the patio outside if it s nice out

Sometimes going to a multi hundred five star reviewed restaurant is taking a chance  because how could anything really live up to that sort of expectation   Well  Gaucho does   My first encounter with them was at a Yelp Elite event at which they were one of the caterers   I was really taken with not only the absolute deliciousness of the food  but also the very down to earth attitude of its owner   It took nearly four months since that first encounter  to finally drop in on their tiny  but soon to be expanded  space in the Strip  but it was abso freaking loutely worth the wait   My  God   I got a small plate of the flank steak  plus I split the cheese toast with my friend   Another customer who was waiting for a takeout order also made sure I didn t forget to grab one of each kind of sauce  all of which seemed to be variations on chimichurri sauce   I probably would have found my way to them regardless  but I was glad of the advice   They made what was an incredible lunch even better   I couldn t stop dipping both  my bread and meat into them   I just   I can t even describe how delicious this food was   The best part was that I still felt really good afterwards   More than satiated  but not sluggish like one might be after dishes that rely on heavy fat  salt  and or sugar to get the yum factor   This was just expertly prepared meat  a delicious salad  and perfectly chewy grilled bread   Next time  for there WILL be a next time   I m getting at one of those sandwiches  though

I ve gotta keep this succinct solely so whoever is reading this see s this review  reads it  and go s right to Gaucho to hop in line  Simply put  the food is incredible and ardently cooked and created    The first two or three times I went  I wasn t a vegetarian and I had my pickings with the chicken and steak  Both indubitably incredible  The potatoes on the side are a must    I ve been back  ironically  as a vegetarian and still  the food is just as good  I ve gotten a few salads  without the meat  And I still have no complaints  The vegetables and produce are fresh  and everything is tossed beautifully with tasteful dressing  I feel like I m eating a   star meal without the   star price  It s pragmatically priced and seriously good

I cannot wait to go back         This place gives me an excuse to eat well during the week  and then splurge here   We ordered skirt steak on field greens with carmelized onions  and the shrimp with rosemary and lemon   We loved everything we got   We forgot this place was BYOB and the manager even offered me a glass of his own wine   Super nice people  AMAZING steak   The next time I go back I am doing the sampler   I will say  if you want a standard restaurant with a server  and a sit down menu  and lots of indoor tables   It is not for you   If you don t mind standing  or sitting at a bar or outside tables  then you are golden  It has a New York  Boston  or Paris vibe to me  Which is exactly what Pittsburgh needed   I am a huge fan  and I can t wait to spread the word

Gaucho is nice   the food is good and varied and I love how you can customize all Your orders   Make sure to get the potatoes with garlic and rosemary  I don t appreciate all the waiters there   But the majority were nice   Worth trying and going back
Damn  Get anything  Get everything  It s all insanely good  Don t sleep on the bread pudding

I m never disappointed leaving Gaucho  I have been visiting the restaurant for a couple of years now   ever since they just had the little spot with the nice patio  Everything is delicious  And they have treats for dogs  too

Best meat in the city  I usually always pick the skirt steak  The only downside is that it s quite small so there is usually a wait and not much seating  These guys should definitely expand their restaurant size    they have plenty of customers to fill it up

Amazing quality and taste   Most restaurants lack consistency of  execution  Not here   Every item comes out consistently well cooked and seasoned   If there is a negative it s the lack of space to accommodate the ever growing crowds that galdy wait in line for a taste of heaven
I m obsessed with this place  always a wait because the food is so good  BYOB and reasonable places
Steak and empanadas were perfect  BYOB  come prepare to enjoy your liquid libations  Prepare for the wait during dinner but totally worth it  Will not disappoint  Staff were nice and courteous

I really like the idea of this place and was excited to try it  We ordered the ribeye steak and the camarones  shrimp   The steak was tasty and was cooked properly  and the side salad with grilled vegetables was nice  The shrimp were good but a little on the small side  I was expecting bigger shrimp for the price  Overall  it was good and I like the idea a lot  but the price is high for what you get

Wow  This place is amazing  Hands down the best food I have eaten since visiting Pittsburgh  Take the recommendations from staff they will not steer you wrong  I went in at closing and they still were well stocked with the menu items and everything was so fresh  I had the salmon and it was amazing  The yams were like dessert and they have free refills on soda  The place is BYOB so grab your drinks and put one back for me too

Great ambience  Friendly  knowledgable staff  Fast service  I tried the El Gaucho  which was delicious but I must confess kind of small for     that I paid for it  ordered the large   Will definitely go back  I can t wait to try the steak
Great environment and food tastes great  It s like a party here  Terrible drink selection and not much on vegetables  but everything else was amazing

Meats are good  sauces are fun  but the filet is totally not worth it    usually a lot tougher than the flank and cooked not as well  Compared to the rest of Pittsburgh  this place is probably the best meat you can get for the price    although it s not cheap  still a good deal for getting pure meat chunks   Overall  a great meal and you ll get what you want  I think the salads and side dishes don t stand out as much as the meat  This is a great stop to have if you re ever in the Pittsburgh area    Wait times can get unbearably long  and the waiting area is poorly designed    there s a risk of fire hazard when there are too many people bunched up so they force you to be outside  Lunch times are usually better I ve heard  so maybe try to visit then

We found this great gem via Yelp and it had rave reviews   We went for dinner while visiting the Pittsburgh area for a college visit   As everyone mentions   be sure to arrive early as lines do form and service is first come   first serve   The porters do a fabulous job of seating you and checking up on you throughout your meal  Gaucho is BYOB so if that s your thing   bring a bottle or two   The food was spectacular  We tried the beef empanadas   rosemary beef sandwich   artic char sandwich   veggie platter and carrots roasted in honey with brie cheese   No complaints   but the noise level from time to time was a bit much   We d definitely return and highly recommend Gaucho to anyone visiting the area

This was my first trip here and I was a bit overwhelmed at first  as I have never had Argentinian food  however  the employees were very helpful and I am glad I tried this place  as the food was excellent   I ordered the chor y pan  which was a chorizo sandwich with a beef empanada and my wife and I ordered the Picada to split   Everything was excellent and cooked to perfection   The food was a bit pricey  but worth it   I will be returning

I will always  ALWAYS rave about Gaucho  I m a pretty easy going lady  so my friends and I usually opt for playing  Heads Up  in line instead of just complaining about the wait  which makes time go much faster  If you re upset that the menu is on a giant chalkboard inside  it s also online  And you know you re always looking at your phone anyway    Last time we bought a bottle of wine  and between the   of us we did not mind splitting the     corking fee  We only had one bottle  so I personally cannot speak to any additional time incurred when ordering multiple beverages  We ordered the Asado Platter  rare  and it was perfect  We paired it with some chimi sauce and extra tostado  along with a few empanadas  As for atmosphere  the staff has always been friendly to me and the music is always chill neutral  Love ya  Gaucho

I ve been here twice now when visiting Pittsburgh  And I must say  it has solidified itself as a go to for steak  Both times I had the Ribeye  medium rare  And both times it was perfectly cooked and seasoned  I like the variety of dipping sauces  I d recommend that you go with the beef cut that you like  I personally like Ribeye   Others in my party ordered salads and added steak to it  they looked really good  I will need to go that route next time   We also ordered the empanadas  I liked the veggie and the beef

I have been hating to try this place for a very long time  had tried it about   months ago and had stood in line for about    minutes and line was not moving and we had a concert to go to so we had to leave so this time we made sure to get there well ahead of are plans for the evening  We only had to stand in line about    minutes and was in   Just so you know you will have to wait anywhere from   minutes to an hour to get in  You order you food at the counter and pay and then they will seat you  They have four different sauces for your meats all of them are delicious   We started out with Oui Oui Chicken    legs and   thighs  My husband said it is the BEST chicken he has ever had  We also had   pieces of Empanadas one beef and one chicken  they were so delicious I could have just made a meal out of them  Then we both had Carne Sandwiches you pick your choice of steak and it also has peppers and caramelized onions  it was very good but it is very hard to eat as a sandwich because the bread it so big  I had to eat it as a open face sandwich  the bread is very good and fresh but just to big for a sandwich  They are closed on Sunday and Mondays  the restaurant is very clean and staff works very hard and very friendly

Absolute best steak sandwich I ve had in years   People of Pittsburgh should flock to this place and be lining up out the door   The sandwiches  salads  and apps are amazing   The sauces to accompany the empanadas and sandwiches are also delicious    Wow is all I can say

Food is pretty good  Went with friends and am vegetarian  Had the veggie sandwich and potato empanadas  Good bread  veggies were grilled and a bit soggy  so I removed some  Empanadas were more bland than preferred  but they offer delicious sauces to add a kick to them  Friendly staff and services  I would try something else going back
Everything is amazing  I love all of the sauces  Just don t come here if your in a hurry at a prime eating time

Very poor customer service  I wish i could give them zero  Our friends recommended this place  We decided to have dinner here  We called before we go there  Nobody even bothered to pick up the phone  We were there    minutes before their close time  They said they are closing the kitchen and they wouldn t serve us  We insisted since we drove from Virginia but they didn t even respond and shut door on us  I guess she didn t care

This place was AMAZING  The food was spectacular  the ambience cute  people extremely nice and service fast  All around easily a   star experience  This will be the thing I remember from my trip to Pittsburg  It was easily the highlight and if I make it back to this city  I would eat here again in a heartbeat

I had really high expectations for this place  as I had heard about it from so many people  I knew we would have to wait in line  which we did  but the line went pretty fast and we were sitting down eating within a half an hour  The quality of the meat was very good  but it was not quite as delicious or flavorful as I expected  Regardless  the food was very good  It is a little on the expensive side  but worth it for the quality  Also dessert was fabulous

The steak sandwich  with filet mignon  was probably the most delicious sandwich I ve ever had   The meat was so tender that it was almost of the same consistency as the soft bread   This is one of the few restaurants in the Strip District that I would go to regularly
I will definitely go back  It was delicious  the service was good  Dessert took a little long  but we got it

We have been to this place twice now  After this time we will never return  To start with the food is not very good at all  Second  the place is way over priced  Third  the service is terrible and five minutes after we were finished eating we were asked to leave so they could use the table   The place is super small but they are supposed to have a private banquet facility downstairs  Why not open that up to seating so your not kicking you customers out       for dinner and we were promptly kicked out  Don t go  this place isn t worth it at all

Delicious  Can t go wrong with anything on the menu  I ordered the flank steak sandwich with a side of potatoes  I would order it again   The staff is super friendly  too with good tunes playing in the background  It s BYOB with a selection of soft drinks    Be careful of when you go  For those of you that are not familiar  you wait in line to order your food and then you are seated  We went there around      on a Tuesday and only had to wait about    minutes in line  I m sure it is much long on weekends   But it is worth the wait      Definitely check this place out if you are looking for a good meaty meal

Food was good My only issue with the place is the wait  We waited    mins at  pm To me it s just not worth it  Standing in the hot sun just waiting to get in  I thought would have produced mouth watering food  And by the time we got out the wait was   hours

Definitely one of the best steakhouse I ever ate  and I ate a lot   The skirt steak and the ribeye are my favorite  Really really recommend on this place  Why I gave only   stars instead of    It s because I don t like to wait outside and wait to be sitting  Especially when it s so cold outside  most of the time it s really cold in Pittsburgh   They have to do something about that
The only bad thing to say about this place is the long line but that s testament to the great food  great customer service  and good times you ll have  once you get your food

The only bad thing about Gaucho is how long the line can get  I ve only been there a couple times because I never have time to wait in the huge line  but it would probably be worth it  The food is absolutely amazing  There aren t a ton of tables  but they seat you after you order so at least you ll know you have a place  Then they bring the food out to you too   The sandwiches are all awesome  I love the Carne where you get to pick which cut of steak you want on your sandwich and it s paired with chimichurri  peppers and onions on delicious bread  It really holds up to the sandwich  I got NY Strip this most recent trip  but want to try them all  It was just a perfect sandwich  Depending on the sandwich you get  you ll be able to try some of their sauces  I loved the chimichurri that came with this  but also want to try one of the sandwiches where I can add my own sauce   The roasted potato side is delicious  Also really good is the mushroom side  I d trust any of their food  The alfajores are delicious and a great finish to your meal   if you even have room after all of the tasty food  We were told they were good with coffee  but chose not to get any this trip  I ll have to try it next time since I definitely plan to go back

My first time here after hearing a lot of hype and it didn t disappoint  The line snaked outside on a Saturday afternoon but it moved quickly and as soon as we entered the building we could smell the delicious aroma  The menu was extensive and we had difficulty deciding what to get   We settled on the seared shrimp   camarones   to share and I got the Carne sandwich  one of their staples  All was delicious and service was quick   Would definitely come back

This was my first time trying Argentinian food  and let me tell you  wow   I chose the deconstructed chicken sandwich and my boyfriend had the steak burger  We both really enjoyed our meats  served hot and cooked perfectly   as well as a side of baked cauliflower  which was delicious  The best part about Gaucho is definitely the sauces  though  They have four different sauces you can choose from  and we had a hard time picking which was our favorite  so we used them all  of course   Additionally  the restaurant is BYOB  with no corkage fee which is a plus  The only downside was the wait to get in  since they dont take reservations  There was a steady line out the door the entire time we were there  from about   PM     PM   The food is definitely worth the wait  and I cant wait to get back there to try out some of the other stuff on the menu

I didn t believe this place could live up to my expectations but my food was simply incredible  After much internal debate I got the skirt steak sandwich  Perfect grilled bread and tender meat at just the right temp    Service was also fantastic  The guy taking orders came out from behind the counter and gave us a thorough run down of the menu  His enthusiasm was refreshing and a great example of what service should be like   Can t wait to try this place again

Caramelized Onion Soup with Portobello and a side toasted cheese bread was fantastic  And the Chorizo sandwich with their  Chimmi Churri   homemade dressing with TONS of fresh herbs    was ridiculously flavorful     Love this small little GEM  I just happened to stumble across this place in the Strip  The friendly staff was also great and helpful in explaining the menu if I had any questions   I will definitely be trying it again

Amazing food  We found this place on yelp and decided to try it given all the rave reviews  It was a fantastic meal  We tried steak  chicken  shrimp  cauliflower  and salad and everything was delicious  Don t worry about what to order  Order small plates so you can try lots of variety
It s legitimately one of the best places to grab food in Pittsburgh   A destination for foodies as it is a serious introduction into the up and coming culinary movement going on in the steel city

Delicious food but not worth the wait  If the line is out the door and wraps around to the side restaurant window  you re looking at about     hours   of standing in a line   to order your food at a counter   at a place that doesn t serve beer and wine  If I m going out for a meal  I d rather go to a place where I can sit or put my name in for a table and then come back

Such good food here  And fast service    Came here for a lunch on a Friday at noon and there was a short line  which took a bit to get through  However  after ordering  the food came out super fast and it was so tasty  I ordered the Picada and a set of   empanadas    of each type   The chicken chorizo empanada was by far my favorite  Great textures and flavors  For the picada  the meat was cured very nicely and went well with all of the other components  The toast was a little too hard and crunchy for my taste  but it was still really good   Highly recommended

I asked a few locals  cashiers  uber drivers  etc  what their recommendations were since I was visiting Pitt for a weekend conference and every single person recommended Gaucho Parrilla  It was such an easy decision to come here  and I would do it again     Came in on a weekday and there was still a line out the door  although waiting area line is kind of a small space   and the line went by fairly quickly    I m sure all their selections are good  but I had to go for the flank steak plate because it was one of the cheapest  but it was still sooooo good  It was well seasoned  not too salty  juicy and so flavorful   Also ordered all   empenadas to share with the group  Great textured breading and flavorful meat veggies  Great for sharing  and try a little bit of everything    Great ambiance  service  and food  Highly recommended

Whenever you see a place on Yelp that has over      reviews and     stars  you have to stop in and that s just what I did and I am SO glad     Now I just have to convince them to open a Gaucho Parrilla in Columbus  Ohio    For starters  if you re going to GPA  you need to get there as early as you can because the lines get really long  really quickly   My group of four arrived at around  pm on a Saturday night and the line was already out the door     Once you re in the line  you can check out their chalkboard menu   Be aware that they will erase items as soon as they re sold out of them so have a backup in mind just in case they run out before you can order   After you place your order  the restaurant staff will hook you up with a table in their dining area   The decor is really cool with an old western feel   They have plenty of non alcoholic drinks for your convenience but this is actually a BYOB establishment   They will provide you with stemware and you can bring in whatever you want   This is a great way to ensure you ll be able to drink what you want and it comes at a lesser cost   They don t even charge a corkage fee     Now for the best part  the food   My meal at GPA ranks in the top ten meals I have ever consumed  in my life   I am not exaggerating   I ordered the sirloin with a side of grits   My steak was cooked to perfection and had the most delicious seasoning   It came with a side salad that was fresh and tasty   I also enjoyed a piece of chargrilled toast and it was amazing   Finally  the grits were the best I ve ever had in my life and that is no tall tale   This place gets ALL of the stars     We all loved it and next time I go to Pittsburgh  I will likely eat all of my meals there because that city definitely has nothing that could top Gaucho Parillo Argentina   Keep up the work  GPA   See you next time I m in town    Unless  of course  you decide to take up my offer to come to Ohio

Oh man  This place  guys  Well worth the weekend     minute lunchtime wait  but Gaucho can also be the source of overwhelming joy when you find  as I did  an empty sitting room awaiting you and a buddy on an overcast pre summer weekday in the  Burgh  The rosemary braised beef sandwich is absolutely out of this world  If you are a horseradish fan as I am  read  this classy lady will take some horsey sauce with her fried zucchini at your average nondescript yinzer suburban strip mall pizza joint  yes please and thank you ma am   you will love this sandwich  but the star of the show is most definitely the melt in your mouth beef  The sandwich is big enough for leftovers  but you might find yourself going in for that second half whether you re still hungry or not  Would also highly recommend checking out the sides  which I believe are seasonal   especially if you re with a friend  on another visit in sunny summer  we split a corn salad of sorts which was as fresh as can be  Absolutely love me some Gaucho

Spent   days in Pitt had to eat here twice  Food service atmosphere are awesome  Everything on this menu is simple fresh and amazing  Try the piscada starter and any meat dish  You will not be disappointed or mind that you waited on a huge line to get in  BTW it s BYOB so bring a bottle the staff is more than happy to uncork you and supply glasses  I have three things more to say  GO HERE  go here  GO HERE  Returned back on          it s as good as ever
Best steak salad in the city  I routinely crave the charred but definitely not over cooked goodness that is a gaucho steak  The blue cheese and baby potatoes on top seal the deal
One of the best spots in PGH  but expect a wait  Fast casual and line is usually out the door  But it s so so worth it  Shrimp and flank steak are incredible  Even the cauliflower is fantastic

On my trip to Pittsburg I heard through the grapevine that this place was somewhere I had to go  Well this place was fantastic and it is a must go to place if you are in Pittsburg and you love meat  Everything tasted extremely good  The steak came out to perfection and the sides were very good as well  They also server about     different meat sauces  These are probably the best part and take the meat to a whole different level  This place is kinda expensive so be prepared to spend a little  But it is totally worth it for sure    The building is small  but the food is good so I could understand why there was a long line when I arrived  They have a very nice setup that relied on mostly natural lighting  I like that they had l  containers of spice next to the line so you could taste them  We had to wait about    minutes to get to the desk then about another       for the food  But it was worth the wait  I would suggest maybe googling this place to see when the least busiest times are and go then

We went to Gaucho at around     pm on a    degree Saturday and  you guessed it  the line was out the door  We waited an hour from the time we got in line to the time we placed our order and it was worth every minute  Our party of   shared the pescado  the grilled veggies  an empanada assortment  the smaller meat platter  rice  the short rib special  and the rosemary braised beef sandwich  It was ALL delicious and we ate every bit with the exception of about a half cup of rice  Fun  relaxed atmosphere and the food is served quickly  BYOB makes it even better   we brought a bottle of red to share and then capped the meal off with some cold Rumchata  One of the employees  Micah  was chatting with us  getting refills and brought us rocks glasses with ice for the Rumchata  He was extremely friendly and helpful  My only wish is that you could sit down and order like a  regular  restaurant  And that they held off a bit on the cowbell  it was extremely loud and happened too often for my parties  taste  It won t stop me from going to Gaucho again though  I look forward to the next rosemary braised beef bite
Superb  Long lines at times though  Try going before or after the lunch rush during the weekdays  I talk about this place often  Do yourself a favor and go

I had lunch at Gaucho s today  Let s get the cold prickly s out of the way first    This place is small  There are   uncomfortable stools with very limited counter space and it gets really crowded in that cramp space   Not a very good place to go if you re looking for a nice sitdown meal    It s also pretty expensive as far as a lunch sandwich goes   My sandwich set me back           No sides  no drink    Lastly  it s a bit of a hike if you work in town  To get here from town you would be walking past a number of other pretty good and much more comfortable eateries just to get here  And if you planned on take out  your sandwich would be cold by the time you walked back to you desk    Now on to the  warm fuzzies    The sandwich I had was unbelievably good  Quite possibly the very best sandwich in the Burg  I got the Carne with ribeye steak  It was a generous serving of real ribeye steak right off of the grill  not some shaved imposter    I m a bit shy when it comes to ordering steak when I go out   I like mine well done and most places can t seem to comprehend what  well done  means   This ribeye was grilled to perfection  no pink on the inside  no char on the outside  It was brown all the way through while still retaining its juiciness   Topping the sandwich off was chimmi  caramelized onion   pepper all between a lightly toasted bun  Perfection    Well worth every penny I spent on it    I was lucky enough to snag one of the six stools and enjoy my sandwich as soon as it came off the grill and while it was still warm   If it weren t for the cramped and limited seating I d give this place a five star rating  Unfortunately the accommodations knocked it down a notch       NOTE                  As Lisa G  mentioned in her review of Goucho s  they are planning on expanding their restaurant to include better seating accommodations   I m looking forward to the new and improved Goucho s    Thanks for addressing that Lisa

I ate at Gaucho s for the first time on a date this weekend   We didn t get there until after six  so we waited a while in the line outside  but the food was definitely worth the wait  even considering the cold   The restaurant is BYOB so come prepared with your favorite cerveza   We ordered the Parrilloda Mixta  the Provoletta and the Gaucho Papas   I promise you everything was exceedingly delicious   We ordered the steak medium rare and it was cooked perfectly   The chorizo was perhaps the best I ve ever had and the chicken was well seasoned and tasty   Once we ordered  we did not wait long for our food   You order at the counter  collect your plates and sauces and then find a seat   I think we probably waited       minutes for the food   I must say it s a shame they re closed on Sunday  because as I write this review  I want more Gauchos   Also  they have some really original Pittsburgh art on the walls that is for sale  just an extra touch I thought added to the overall appeal   Great pick John
My new favorite place in Pittsburgh  Food was amazing  staff very friendly and outgoing      well wirth the wait

D e l i c i o u s place  You must try the empanadas  both pork and beef  with the red pepper sauce  The steak was really good  we ate parrilla mixta it was really good  a little bit small to share  but good  this plate cost      You must try everything  cause everything looks good

Gaucho is always packed  The food is delicious given everything is firewood charred  You wait in line to order before sitting  so it s a great place to go with friends  I ordered papas al horno  oven roasted red potatoes with whole garlic cloves and fresh rosemary  as a side  and it does not disappoint  It s extremely flavorful and goes well with the free side dips as well  I also ordered camarones to share  cast iron seared shrimp with rosemary  garlic and lemon   which the searing of the garlic and lemon really brings out the flavor  The bondiola sandwich  roasted pulled pork  spicy mustard   caramelized onions  was also good  but the flavor is lighter in comparison to the  I other dishes  My personal favorite was the cordero  wood fired New Zealand lamb chops done with grilled lemon  toast and fresh tossed salad   The lamb chops were well charred and the added berries as topping to the lamb was perfect

There are very few restaurants that I will wait an hour in line for  Considering Gaucho has some of the best reviews in Pittsburgh  I decided to give it a try and accept the possibility of a wait  We arrived around     pm on a Saturday evening and waited about an hour to get inside  Luckily  it was not very cold outside so we didn t mind    The menu is quite vast  We decided to each order an entree  I went with the rosemary braised beef sandwich  and sides of the provoletta and butternut squash  Everything came out quickly  The sides were fantastic   I particularly enjoyed the butternut squash  The braised beef sandwich was massive   I could only eat half of it  The beef was tender and reminded me of home cooked Sunday meals  Overall  it was great food  very neat atmosphere  and I can understand why people will flock to this restaurant and willingly stand in line for the food    Beware  there is a     corkage fee  This fee seems pretty hefty to me and I have rarely heard of restaurants choosing to opt for only BYOW  Bring Your Own Wine   I would be interested to know why they went that route

Best steak sandwich I ve ever had  You can see them grilling the steak as you order  so fresh and delicious    I got the rib eye steak sandwich and it had     large pieces of steak on a large cibatta  don t quote me on the cibatta bun  it could have been something else   with caramelized onions and roasted red peppers  Mmm  salivating just thinking about it    The server came outside to their patio seating and asked me how the sandwich was  Nice touch    Not much seating inside  but nice patio seating    Very pleased and a must try when you are in the Pittsburgh area
This place is wonderful  I was fortunate enough to get in during the lunch rush and ordered

Awesome Food but there is a line  it does move quickly       Okay   I may get grilled  no pun intended  with this review    Imagine Brazilian Steak House meats served on a plate as an entree with a variety of sauces      This is what you get at Gaucho     We had several plates   My meal was     and I had   ounces of each chicken  beef  and chorizo     The food was done very well and tasted great    The place was busy the food was good but the price was a little steep comparative to other like places I have visited considering what I purchased     It is   stars and I recommend but drink in the experience   The line is fast    The service is fast  in my opinion     The drinks are good   We were in and out in about    minutes off to our next stop

Bon appetit   Being as this was my first time dining here after hearing all the hype  I have to admit that everything that has been said is true  The food was nothing short of phenomenal  I couldn t have asked for a better experience  I especially appreciate the ease of ordering  being seating and the numerous options of entrees and chimichurri    I arrived with a party of   and was delighted that we had a table ready for us  What eas even better was our food was coming to us hot and steamy no more than   minuted later  I found it impressive to prepare appetizers and entrees for   in such an efficient time   I ordered the small plate of shrimp    total  the roasted potatoes and a veggie empanada  All were amazing  I m ready to come back here next week  and how could I forget BYOB completely complimentary
I found heaven    Its the steak burger with portobello and caramelized onions  I ve never been to a restaurants were everything I try is amazing  Until you go  your life isn t complete

Love the food at Gaucho  but was super disappointed when we showed up at      PM on a Saturday night and were told by the last couple in line that they weren t taking any additional patrons  they have him a red stick to hold to show they were the last table of the night   Given they list they re closing time at        I would have expected getting in a short line at      would have been fine

I rarely review but Gaucho is extraordinary   The employees are super nice  the food is unreal  i want to swim in that green sauce whatever it is    Haven t done the bodga yet but can t wait to try it   Love it
I took my boss there who has been to a lot of restaurants  around the world and he said  that s the best restaurant I have ever been to

This is one of my favorite Pittsburgh restaurants  I only go at   PM on a weekday to beat the crowds  I love that the byob has no charge and that the food is consistent  The Ajo sauce is my favorite so make sure to try it

Gaucho does have some great food  but my last visit was quite disappointing  My burger was so salty it was difficult to eat  my dining companion noticed the same  I always worry that cooks add more sat when something is wrong with the food       I don t expect restaurant food to be necessarily healthy  but when the salt burns your lips   something is really wrong  Whats wrong with regular seasoning  not going overboard

The food here is really good   You might have to wait in line to get in  but Gaucho takes the sting out of the wait if you ve brought your own beverages by opening your bottle and giving you a cup   The food  though  is the draw   Customer service is good  and the atmosphere is fun   Always fun

It is hard to open your mouth wide enough to fit the sandwich   GREAT authentic food     My son said it was his FAVORITE place that I took him to eat on our international  gastronomic tour of the Burgh
The beef was top notch   The sauces are great   The non beef was just okay

Hands down one of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh  tied with DiAnnoias   If you plan on dining here  get ready to wait  They don t take reservations and there is usually a long line  My husband and I made the mistake of going on a Saturday night and waited about an hour  This restaurant recently changed there alcohol policy  it used to be BYOB  but is now bring your own wine  with a     corking fee  and they now serve beer and liquor  The food is      worth it  Come hungry so you can experience as much of this amazing menu as possible  The only thing I would ve possibly skipped was the roasted potatoes  they weren t bad but we re pretty basic  Definitely do not forget to get some of the amazing serve yourself chimichurri sauce to pair with your meats

Wow I ve not had a better sandwich in a long time    The bread is soft and delicious  It s not one of those sandwiches you need to fight with to get the job done     it just cooperates  Your teeth slice right through but it s not mushy     it s just perfect    The meat is flavored marinated all the way through  And the wood fired grill makes anything they throw on it taste delicious    And the sauces  My goodness they are to die for  Try every single one  Chimichurri is of course a winner  but favorite is the white garlic one    Bonus  I love the fact that they achieve super savory and flavorful food without tons of mayo and cheese   At least the cheese is optional   I love that most things are olive oil herb garlic based    We ordered the chicken with a side of grilled vegetables which was obviously tasty  and I hope to get back to try the steak    Disclaimer  If you are looking for a place for sit down service this is not for you  It s a small cozy space with a few stools inside and tables outside and you order at the register  I can t wait to get down when the weather is nicer

Went with my sister and brother for her birthday   Had read a lot about this place and must say it was even better than expected   Had heard about long lines   but we got lucky   Arrived around   for late lunch early dinner and spent a few minutes trying to decide what we wanted   The plan was to get a lot of different plates and share     Ordered way too much   but everything we had was great  The service and staff were awesome   Had the ribeye and strip steaks   both were very good   Tried all the sauces and they were very good with the red pepper my fave     Liked the wings best of all   so much so that we got another order to go   Had plenty of leftovers which the staff helped us pack up for our trip home  Now we have to go back to try the sandwiches

Seriously good meat  Extensive menu and efficient ordering process  We had a weekday lunch and were seated very quickly    The flavour of the steak was intense and delicious  It was cooked perfectly to order  Also shared a beautiful burger   Can t wait to go back next time we are in Pittsburgh  Hopefully my Aussie    note is on the wall

Hands down best meal in Pittsburgh  You more than likely will wait in a ridiculously long line on the weekend but this is one of the few restaurants I would always wait for  The prices are amazing for the quality of the meal  Not to mention the service is outstanding  The steak was cooked to perfection  the shrimp were the best I ve ever had   grilled and seasoned wonderfully  They offer three homemade sauces you can help yourself to  I basically wanted to drink them  The atmosphere of the restaurant only adds to the experience the food already provides   eager  helpful and happy staff  happy customers  delicious food  Gaucho is a must
Still by far the best steak in Pittsburgh  If you leave here hungry it is your own fault

My husband and I have been here over a dozen times and love the food  We know to go off peak times so we don t have to wait in line for very long  We arrived on Saturday         around      pm and the line was only to the door so we decided to stay even though it was    degrees   Based on prior visits and the length of the line  we expected to wait about       minutes   Well  over   hour later  we still had not ordered at the counter and  in hindsight  should have left  as many other people did      We know that they often time orders  but this time it was excessive  We over heard the lady taking orders tell a couple in front of us that they were taking turns with live orders  those of us in the restaurant  and then phone orders   Well  when we were next in line  she immediately took our order   We counted     clean and open tables both upstairs and downstairs at any given time while we were in line    Once we ordered  we payed by credit card and were immediately prompted to leave a tip when we signed   Apparently  there is a way to not leave a tip but it was not a clear option on the screen and would not let me complete the transaction without leaving a tip   Manager later said there s a way to not leave a tip and that should have been explained to us    We were led to our table after ordering and told there was water on the table  After waiting and waiting  no one brought water so I had to get up and ask for water  I was handed a bottle of water and told the guy we also needed glasses and he pointed to them on the shelf    I ve worked in the restaurant business  I get it   But  have common decency and communicate to your patrons if wait time are excessively long or the kitchen is backed up  Offer water to those people waiting in line outside your restaurant in    degree heat since this is the business model you want to follow   Do you know how many people left the line  I can only imagine how much money this place loses from this business model  Maybe they just don t care and that s okay    I spoke to a manager before leaving and was told   sorry  sorry  Next time you come  hopefully you will have a better experience    WOW  Too bad he ASSUMES we will be back  The next     we spend for our meal will now go to other great restaurants in Pittsburgh that focus more on their customer satisfaction

The food at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is literally other worldly  I m so happy for the Yelp event that introduced me to this restaurant   My coworker and I came here for her birthday in late January  We were a little surprised to walk into the restaurant and find seating for less than    people  Thankfully  a lot of people ordering were picking up takeout to take back to their offices  so we were able to snag some bar stools   We began chatting it up with the    owner  I forget    who had also been at the Yelp event several months prior  telling him that we had to check out the restaurant after tasting the food at the event  He is such a friendly  outgoing  eccentric kind of guy and is a lot of fun to talk to  He told us all about Gaucho s expansion plans  I can t wait for Gaucho to take over the neighboring space so that there will be more seating in the restaurant   Let s get to the food    We ordered Steak Empenadas  Provoletta  Vegetales  Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich  and Camarones  Even though we had enough food to feed   people  we somehow inhaled almost all of it  The Steak Empenadas were wrapped in a flaky pastry and filled with a flavorful steak mixture  The Vegetales were tasty  roasted vegetables covered in balsamic vinegar  The Camarones were flavorful shrimp cooked in simple seasonings  My friend ordered the Rosemary Braised Beef Sandwich  but since I m not a horseradish fan  I only stole a bite or two and let her enjoy the rest  The only item that didn t totally knock my socks off was the Provoletta  There was nothing wrong with the dish   toast covered in provolone with arugula on the side   but it just didn t impress me like the other items did   The food was so good that we just couldn t resist getting dessert  When Gaucho heard that it was my friend s birthday  they gave her the Alfajores cookies  We didn t try them until we had returned to work that afternoon  and they were the perfect hit the spot melt in your mouth afternoon treat  The Panqueques were sweet crepes filled with a whole lot of caramel and topped with chocolate drizzle  This dessert just requires a love of caramel  The Crema Quemada   aka Creme Brulee   was perfectly smooth and creamy and crunchy   I can t wait to return to Gaucho and bring my husband here to try all the delicious food  He was disappointed that I came without him  and I know that he ll be blown away the same way that I was

This was one of the most amazing restaurant finds ever  and the food was nothing short of exceptional  I wanted to come here for every meal afterwards it was so tasty  It is an interesting ordering process where you wait in line and place your order first thing   then you are seated  The meat was so good   all the chimichurri sauces were mouth watering  We also tried the pork empanada of the day and some chorizo  This place was simply phenomenal  They don t have a liquor license  so you can bring your own bottle of wine and with no corkage fee either  Unbuckle your belt and dig in  it s delectable

Let me just start by saying if you haven t been to Gaucho yet you need to get there ASAP  All the hype is real  I was hesitant to give this restaurant a try as I am not a big meat eater and the menu is mostly meat  However  I had to give it a try since it s the    rated restaurant in Pittsburgh for         My first visit I got the Bondiola sandwich  The meat paired with the ciabatta bread was just spectacular  It was made even better by dipping it in the dipping sauces they have available  I also tried one of the steak empanadas which was also delicious    My second visit I tried the pollo sandwich but I wasn t as impressed with it  I also tried my friends grilled veggies which I would highly recommend    As for the service and environment   the service is very quick and we did not wait long to get our food either time  I ve heard a lot of people say the line here gets crazy so keep that in mind because my guess is the line moves fairly quickly  I personally had no wait because I got there at      and  pm before the rush started  The restaurant is very cute but not really a place for a big group
