Highly recommend this to anyone    Best foods I ve tried so far on my trip  Thanks for such a great experience
Favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  Very affordable  great meat  and it s byob  Would recommend anything on the menu and it s always cooked to perfection

Over hyped   Dishes are too expensive for what you get   Got a salad with shrimp for over       Got four pieces of shrimp  very small slice of avocado  and little else   The atmosphere is decent   I don t know what else you want me to say

My wife and I went a few weeks back after Gaucho was featured on local news food feature  Being hispanic and recent transplants from Texas this place was a must try    The place itself is unassuming but very clean and smells great  It was cramped during lunch hours on a weekday but all outside space was closed due to snow  When the outside is open and downstairs lounge is done this place will be less tight  We didn t mind the tight spaces because the food is absolutely worth the wait  You won t get traditional churrasceria steak served from a skewer here but the meat that ends up on the plate holds up the true argentinian standards and flavors   We shared the rosemary braised beef sandwich and added a grilled corn and two vegetable empanadas  they were out of stock of beef ones  for sides  I was THOROUGHLY impressed at the food    It was delightful to eat and portioned generously such that the two of us had a nice filling lunch despite splitting  The empanadas  although veg  were well seasoned and cooked and generally  southwestern  in flavor profile due to choice of chiles and black beans  Our grilled corn was gently coated in salted butter with just the right amount of creaminess to the smoky bites of corn  The braised beef itself and the bread it was served on were the absolute highlight  Every bite was tender and full of rich marinade and rubbed spices and complimented well by both the chimichurri or aioli sauces provided  It was a damn good sandwich  simply said   We will definitely be returning  I hope that they get more space but it s in no ways a deal breaker
The steak is top notch   Really chill atmosphere  A great place to go with a group

My husband and I went here while I was on the keto diet  Lots of low carb options  He ordered the sandwich and said it was the best he ever had  I ordered the steak and that was good  but next time I will be sure to try the sandwich   I love how they leave the sauces out so you can refill as much as you want   Along with the water    We can t wait to return

Not only delicious  affordable food  but an incredibly pleasant staff  Looking forward to their expansions as the only problem right now is the lack of seating  I would avoid it during the peak lunch hours as you will have to wait a decent amount of time   Favorite is the skirt steak sandwich with a side of corn

I went here with two co workers for lunch on a Friday afternoon   We had to drive around the block a few times to find a parking space as the Strip gets very busy around lunch time   My co worker said this is his favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh so I had high expectations   We had to wait outside because if was very crowded for the lunch hour   I thought this was a good sign   I don t eat red meat and none of the sandwiches appealed to me so I ordered a large side of grilled vegetables  roasted potatoes  and grilled corn on the cob   The vegetables were black and mushy because they were so overcooked   They had a good flavor and the optional sauces were tasty  but it was hard to overcome that they were so grossly overdone   The potatoes were also overcooked and blackened with way too much rosemary seasoning   I had to brush a lot of the seasoning off of them so they could even be edible   The corn was the best part of the meal as it was the only thing cooked and seasoned appropriately   My other co worker ordered the carne sandwich and was happy with it   His potatoes were also overdone and over seasoned   My vegetarian co worker ordered the same thing as I did and also commented that the vegetables were overcooked   I think this place is probably great if you re a meat lover  but probably not the best choice for vegetarians   If I go again  I ll give the chicken sandwich a try  but with so many other great options in this area I m not sure if I ll be back

Oh my god   Yes   This place smells AMAZING as you walk up to it  I was excited before entering bc I knew it was going to be good   The place is tiny inside   There s outdoor seating  but it was raining  and there are maybe   bar stool spots indoors   So there s that  but that doesnt take away from the   star rating  and I overheard someone say they are moving into a larger space next door   My father ordered the ribeye with a side of mushrooms  and I had the flank steak sandwich   Both were amazing   Smoky  moist  flavorful  these adjectives sound so creepy used together but it was like a cornucopia of delicious on my place   I can t believe I haven t been here sooner   I declared that from now on  I only eat at Gaucho but then my bank account was like   LOL  no    This place isn t cheap but who wants discount meat   Don t even get me started about the chimmichurri sauce   It was divine   You need to eat here  trust me

Please open a location in Milwaukee   This place was amazing   I love how it can be an easy going casual lunch or you could BYOB for a pricier dinner  The sauces were delightful  steak sandwich delightful  empanadas delightful  Anyone who comes to Pittsburgh I am suggesting that they come here
We stopped by for lunch    wow   Super tender beef with tons of fresh yummy sides   The people there are very relaxed and there is a fun vibe
Everything is wonderful  just be sure to get there early or you will be waiting in line  but even if you do get stuck in line   worth it
Amazing food   I usually get the small El Gaucho salad with flank steak   All of the sauces are excellent   Get there early because the line is out the door otherwise

We had our eyes on this place for about a year before we worked it out to stop in  We were down in Pgh to see Phantom of the Opera  without the kids  so the timing was perfect  We ended up ordering several empanadas and a couple sampler plates then sharing everything  Don t miss the dipping sauces in the dining area  lots of tasty combos to try  The plates are simple but they re delicious and more filling than they look like  If you can  try a variety and share

Great restaurant  Bit more affordable than a full Argentinian restaurant  The lines for lunch can be very busy  I once waited for a full hour  I recommend going at nights and off hours  The empanadas are crispy  I love their bife de gaucho

Whenever I am asked for restaurant recommendations I always mention Gaucho  Meats are always perfectly cooked with a great selection of unique sauces that are all self serve while dining  and can be bought for future use  The restaurant itself is relatively small making it chaotic in front of the register during their peak hours   over all the staff is excellent  atmosphere is fun  and they have one of the best   most affordable steak sandwiches in Pittsburgh

Awesome   worth wait  which moved faster than I expected   Staff very friendly  Can t wait to go back   I ordered the Rosemary braised beef and side of Brussels sprouts  Delicious  Love the bacon on the Brussels sprouts

Worth the Wait  Waited in line for about    minutes in the sun and goodness every second we had to wait was worth it  They have a sign on the entrance explaining that space is limited so patience is key    I had the steak burger  cooked medium rare  with grilled onions and bleu cheese  Super flavorful and perfectly cooked  The sandwich was the perfect amount of food   If you have the time to wait in line I would certainly recommend checking out Gaucho the next time you are in Pittsburgh

This is by far the best restaurant that I have been to in Pittsburgh   The staff is very laid back and creates a straightforward but friendly atmosphere   Any time I have guests in from out of town  I make it a point to take them to Gaucho   My favorite menu item is the Carne sandwich   You get to choose the cut of steak on your sandwich and there is no upcharge   I usually end up with a Filet Mignon steak sandwich for       The sides are easily shareable   Our go to is always the potatoes  some corn on the cob  and one of their rotating vegetables   The desserts are also fantastic  although they do rotate   I usually go with whatever seasonal bread pudding they offer

So  Where to start  Well I ll start by saying  EVERYTHING was amazing  Like wow  First of all we did wait in line for a good    mins  But if any restaurant has a line  You KNOW it s gonna be good  We went at   and the line was still very long  But it got even longer as the night went on  But anyways for the food  I order the filet mignon  medium  and it was probably the best steak I ve EVER had  They made it sooooo good  The outside of the steak had a nice char to it  but the middle had just enough pink  And it was just filled with juice  It was so freaking good  The salad that came with it was delicious  It was very fresh  And ya know how some salads are chewy when they use real greens  well this one wasn t  It was very light and tasty and just great  I also ordered the carrots with goat cheese  and omg  These were sooooo good  Idk where they get their cheese but holy crap  So good  It was like a dessert  And I also ordered an empanada and that was also delicious  But so if your deciding if you want to wait it out in that huge line  just do it

By far my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  You can taste the flame in all of their meets and the sauces make the already good food exceptional  I recommend the qui qui chicken for anyone that has not eaten here before but I really haven t had anything that wasn t delicious
The     steak came with no sides except bread which I had to ask for twice and was over salted  The portion was very small too  Very disappointed

Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is a must go to experience to have while you are in Pittsburgh  Don t let the long line out the door fool you  It goes fast  and is worth every second of wait time  The food is absolutely delicious and flavorful  They have an assortment of homemade sauces you can get on the side that really go well with just about everything served there  This establishment is also BYOB  so feel free to bring a bottle of wine  etc  to go with your meal  I also liked the process this restaurant has set up  You wait in line  choose your items  get your drinks and pay upfront  They will give you a table number  so you go find whatever table you d like and they will deliver your food when it s ready  After you are all finished  you just leave  Very simple    Can t say enough about the quality of the food and friendliness of the staff  The staff put their heart and soul into their work when preparing meals  I highly recommend this place to anyone    This would be a good place for a date  or a small group of friends  etc  The atmosphere is intimate and nice
This place rocks  yes you have to wait in line but trust me goes quick and it is worth it
wait too long outside   steak and bread are burnt and it taste bitter  The chicken has no taste inside
Believe the hype  Totally authentic vibe  Incredible smokey  grilled flavors  Delicious sauces and seasonings  This is a meat lovers paradise

Great food  HORRIBLE service for the following reasons  all of the below were after spending            After waiting     hours in line  we had a standoffish waiter who was rude  abrupt  and obnoxious  seated at        see below for the rest  of timeline   Waiter s name is Patrick      After finishing dinner  they didn t clear any plates and instead  basically put the bread putting dessert on top of the unfinished paella    They started putting chairs up on the empty tables around us at     pm  this was a SATURDAY NIGHT FYI     We asked for an extra chair for a friend who was coming to meet us for drinks  this was at         remember that we got seated at        they said no   HERES THE WORST PART  sorry we ve been here for   hours and want to go home so we re locking the doors  No more guests allowed   We then ask for the manager      Manager refuses to come  waitress comes back and says  sorry my manager supports me      and doesn t want to come up  sorry bye
Great service  AMAZING food  Loved the empanadas and the lamb chops    the steak sandwich was the best I ve ever eaten   Incredible chimchurri and garlic dipping sauce

I m Argentinian  so when I heard there was a restaurant in Pittsburgh that served Argentinian meat  I was ecstatic  It s really hard to find beef and steaks in America that match the texture and flavor of Argentinian steak  There is a world of difference between how cows are grazed  and therefore how they taste  in America and in Argentina  A few details     Argentinian cows are actually of a different breed than American cows     Argentinian cows eat zero corn  Nothing  None  Cows can t process corn well  which is why in America cows need a ton of antibiotics to survive     Argentinian cows live in large  flat plots of green and healthy land  rather than in cages or small plots of land  Because of these reasons  no matter how you cook American beef  it will never taste like Argentinian beef  The food at El Gaucho is pretty good  don t get me wrong  but it would be a stretch to call it Argentinian  I couldn t recognize at least half the items in the menu  The chimichurri  as well as the chorizo  didn t taste quite like it does back home  I heard the owner is American and actually lived in Brazil for a long time  so this may explain the inauthenticity of the food   I bet that for someone who has never been to Argentina  this restaurant will be a good place to eat meat  But for the Argentinians expecting to get a taste of home    don t come  you ll be disappointed

stars  Worth the hype  Not really  Delicious  Yes  There are   tables outside here folks  So if you re lucky enough to get one there are constantly people staring at you because they want your seats  When there is a line its mass chaos inside and while the employees are friendly there s a hipster vibe  or something  that didn t feel welcoming  The menu is on a chalkboard right before you order so you have to make a quick decision even though you were standing in line quite a while already   The smells in this place are fantastic and really increased the anticipation  We had the carne sandwich with filet  excellent   the hangar steak lunch  very good and with a salad   veggie empanadas  just ok  and fungos  solid   Portions were generous  Overall  I d go back but I m not going to be raving to anyone about the experience

Wow   What an experience for the family while visiting Pittsburgh      Assada platter  chorizo app recommend the spicy    roasted potatoes  empanadas beef and pork  and salad delivered     The kids cleaned up the beef empanadas   We wish we got more

As good as it gets  I would gladly go back to Pittsburgh just to have this steak again  My friend used this place to cater her wedding  so with that kind of recommendation I knew I had to check it out  There s street and lot parking nearby  BYOB but also keep in mind that a lot of liquor stores nearby close by   pm  Be prepared to wait in line  which is        worth it    I split the Asado Platter with another person which was honestly the best case scenario  We loved being able to sample all the types of steak and taste the difference between all of them  Out of the five  the loma was my favorite but I would get all of them again just for the experience  Make sure to get all the self serve sauces as well  I would also highly recommend the bread pudding  Such a nice way to end a meal

reviews with an average rating of      Does this place really need another bangin  review  DUH  Lol  I need a story to go with all the cool pictures I want to post  In town on business and I wanted a unique place to eat so I do what I normally do  I find out what the most reviewed place is in the area and go there  Here I am     minutes before they closed and there was a line out the door a little up the block  Fun Fact  Before closing someone will come outside to assess the line  They will then hand the last person a medium sized board with a Johnny Bravo picture on it that says  End of the Line   With this great power comes great responsibility  It s their job to turn everyone who tries to get in line  away  You get a free t shirt out the deal  It was hilarious and I had never seen anything like it before  The funny part is  people actually respected the sign  being held by an ordinary customer whom they ve never met before  People CAN be kinda awesome   Atmosphere Appearance  Set right on the corner of Penn Ave and the David McCullough Bridge is this place  Apartments above it and a very simple concept  Walk up to the counter  order your food then you go sit down and wait for it to come to you  The menu is GIGANTIC in size and posted as soon as you walk in the door  You can see it for pretty much down the street  Lol  High ceilings  bright woods and a few plants decorate the inside  There are   main eating areas  One in the front right by the menu and the second is up some stairs toward the back  As busy as it was  it wasn t very loud  Just the sound of normal conversation   Service  Like I mentioned earlier there isn t much service  You order and it gets brought to you  Cuts out the need for a tip right  Lol  Everyone was very friendly though and super helpful explaining the things on the menu if you struggle with ordering   Food  I wanted to try several things since I can t remember what Argentinian food may taste like  I ordered all of these at once and here they are in no particular order  The Qui Qui Chicky is  two chicken legs and two thighs with ancient alien quiquirimichi sauce from outer space and grilled lemons   It was phenomenal  I don t think I ve ever had grilled chicken that was so tasty  so seasoned and so    awesome  Chorizos were next up  They re hefty sausages  You can get them in a sweet or spicy variety  The come with grilled red peppers  caramelized onions  toast and pimenton sauce  They come in orders of      or    These were also incredible  Like  can this place just not disappoint   Moving on  I also ordered the Camarones which are cast iron seared shrimp with rosemary  garlic and lemon  They come in a small and large portion  I wound up with the small since I was trying a variety of other things  but they were quite good  Shrimp can be hard to season  I probably would stray away from these in the future  but give them a try  I needed my vegetables so I tried the roasted cauliflower which comes with chili oil  scallions and lemon juice  Delightful  Light  flavorful and you don t feel bad eating a lot of it  Lol  Last  but not least was their Maiz  it s basically street corn that s grilled with olive oil  salt and pepper  The food was all incredible  I want to try everything on their menu  but my eye is set on that quintuplet of steaks next time   Value  Not too bad  but can get spend y if you wanna try multiple things  Maiz         Roasted Cauliflower         Camarones   Small        Large        Chorizos                            Qui Qui Chicky           This place was freaking awesome  I was able to dine with   gentleman I randomly met in line so we all shared a table  not food  Lol  I d love to come back here time and time again to explore the rest of the menu

Great place and so delicious food  I love this restaurant  The sauces are so cool and very yummy  Especially the onion sauce  We ordered the ribeye small and pescado plate  Not too many roasted vegetables  Will try others next time  Thanks

Another   star little spot in Pittsburgh  My brother found this place on yelp when they came to visit me and we went before the remodel  It was a tiny place  only seating was outside but it was well worth the cramped quarters  I got the lomo  filet  sandwich and added some chimichuri sauce for a delish finish  The sandwich itself was a ton of meat  cooked to perfection and the chimichuri was a nice spicy fresh finish  A  on the sandwich  Loved the ambiance of the small place too  menu written on the chalkboard  loud cooks and a friendly guy taking my order   I recently went back and found that they were remodeling  I didn t know and was disappointed that I didn t get to fulfill my Argentinian steakhouse sandwich needs for that day  BUT I went back and LOVE LOVE LOVE what they did with the place  They moved right next door into the vacant building that was next to them  I think it may have been another restaurant at some point  The decorations are adorable  very Latin American retro  They have expanded their menu to include salads  appetizers  veggies and other items  including breakfast   There was already a line at    on Sunday when they were getting ready to open  We were first in line and I couldn t help myself and had to get the Carne con Pan  So steak  bread  onions  red peppers and chimichurri  I had the filet again and my partner had the ribeye  Both were delish and spot on  I also ordered some grilled corn  which was also spot on   Can t say enough good things about this place  Will continue to frequent and hope their business thrives  they deserve it

This place is stellar  We ve been here a couple of times and stopped in today while running errands in the Strip  Like always  there were numerous people eating and then experiencing food nirvana  you know  when your eyes flutter and roll in the back of your head  and you can t speak for a solid minute because your taste buds are break dancing  Nirvana   We got the Chanchito  the Ribeye with the casa salad  a steak empanada and the fungus side dish  We ate it at the store and I collected all of the little dips that they offer  The ajo sauce  just pure garlic goodness  was hands down my favorite  They had another sauce  a red color  that was pureed sweet red peppers  which was equally amazing   The atmosphere was really positive also  The owner is usually at the front of the house  making sure that everyone is having a pleasant time and continually shouts out positive affirmations    All in all  the food is spectacular and it was an awesome time  Definitely will be back

I feel like I arrived pretty late to this party  At least we re there now  Clearly it was better late than never    I held off in the beginning because past experience with Argentinean restaurants had been underwhelming   typical seemed to always be piles upon piles of mediocre meat  Well I stand corrected  This isn t what they deliver at Gaucho  Here you get incredible flavors infused into their meat dishes with well thought out sides and enhancements also packing a punch for your taste buds    We had the good fortune to sample   of their dishes at a Yelp Elite event held at The Pittsburgh Winery  The guys from Gaucho were memorable in personality and their food was absolutely unforgettable    I ordered their skirt steak which comes with a salad and bread at their restaurant the other day and honestly I may have to order it several more times before I ll be able to stray to other menu items  Yep  that perfect   I have no idea how much effort goes into making that skirt steak taste this amazing but I know I certainly will be eating this again   again  It came served over mushrooms and onions that were also infused with all that flavor  Home run   It s very obvious that the team who works here love what they do and their enthusiasm is pretty contagious  They are beyond thrilled that something they enjoy doing so much has been so well received by our city  They started off with such a small space that it s been tough to get in   another reason it took us so long to get here  Soon that will change when they expand their space next door  It s a classic success story  start small doing amazing food  crowds will come   you grow your business    We will return to Gaucho   next time it won t take so long
Best foodie spot in Pittsburgh  Yes  the wait is long  Really long  so y all can step out of line and go down the street to McDonald s   I ll wait
Phenomenal  Saturday mornings afternoons will be tough getting seats  but food is delicious
This is by FAR the best restaurant in Pittsburgh  Bug claim I know but everything is amazing  A bit pricey but worth it  Great flavor  BBQ  South American fusion food
Very tasty sandwich  Can be very busy with limited seating  but worth it  Make sure you have time

Argentina salad  You would think getting a salad at a steak based place would be a mistake  Key to a good salad is veggies and there was so much good stuff and even potatoes with rosemary   Rosemary braised sandwich was delicious  Caramelized onions made it perfect  Bread was incredible  The sauces are plentiful and the best I ve ever had  The vibe is awesome and clean  Super friendly people here  And the girl up front is hot  Dark hair with bangs I m looking at you

Typically I have fun eating out but rarely do I feel that the price is warranted given what I could make it home  This is the only restaurant I ve ever been to where I felt like the price really represented something amazing it was very cheap for the quality and some of the best food I ve had in a long time  We came in well before   o clock   probably      at least   and by   there was a huge line out the door   Try the desserts  too  They are also amazing

Great unique spot in Pittsburgh strip district  The people working there are super organized and friendly  So much tasty choices to order from  Don t forget the home made yummy sauces you get yourself and try on your food  If you order the plates instead of the sandwich  get the toast on the side  So many meat options to order  They also carry fish of the day and had mahi mahi when I went  Satisfying  flavorful meal

This place used to be great but as they ve grown in popularity and in physical space  it s really gone down the tubes  The food is still good  but they ve developed the snobby hipster attitude you d expect in San Francisco  We arrived at      pm on a Saturday  on which they closed at    pm  We were told they weren t accepting anymore customers but managed to finagle our way into seat at a high top in the hallway  We asked for the menu and were told  we don t have menus  you need to look it up online   We proceeded to try and read the lo res photo of a chalkboard menu  Neither of us could actually read any of the descriptions so just crossed our fingers and hoped we would like our order  The experience was downhill from there      The food was fine but everyone from the cashier to the   different waiters we interacted with were down right rude  We will NEVER come back to Gaucho  I won t recommend readers of this post do anything on account of our experience  but I tried to warn you
Excellent food at a very reasonable price   not the absolute best in Pittsburgh  but certainly very good

Tonight was our second night visiting Gaucho  One word to best describe this place   FLAVOR   The food is amazing  I think I could eat the pork tenderloin every day  All that being said dining at Gaucho is unique  Usually the wait is so long you are standing outside on average for    minutes and then an additional    minutes inside  The ambience in the front dining room is fine   there is a lot going on around you with the wait staff and the ordering desk right behind you  The back dining room leaves much to be desired  it really does resemble a fast food joint   Last night was our second time dining at Gaucho  The first time I was so blown away by the food I couldn t wait to go back  But after waiting again and lack of atmosphere we might take a break and go back in a year or so when we have friends in town

First time visiting Gaucho after hearing great things from friends  It lived up to the hype  It is so hard to decide what to order because everything looks great  We enjoyed it all  amazing flavors  I d recommend Gaucho to anyone

We wanted to try Argentinian food and were very pleased with the food  I ordered the NY strip medium with a side of oven roasted red potatoes  Absolutely delicious and would certainly eat here again  The sauces were great too

This place was a solid find  A bit off the beaten path  it s a trek from the convention center but well worth it    Their menu is loaded with authentic argentine dishes and can suit any taste  The queuing tanking system is a bit unorthodox but at lunch it didn t really matter    I had the flank steak meal   it was cooked well and the side salad and veggies were amazing  Make sure you try the chimichurri sauce on your steak and bread

If you happen to stumble upon my review over any of the other hundreds of reviews for Gaucho  look no further than the average rating for the restaurant and this piece of advice  Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is entirely worth the hype   If you must read further  the story is this  I had been hoping to make it to Gaucho for months but could never squeeze it in during trips back home  Now that I m back in the     for the foreseeable future  I legitimately hope to eat here multiple times a month  I came with a friend during the days immediately proceeding the re opening  I hadn t seen the inside before the re open  but I can say the new restaurant is gorgeous  modern  and well ventilated  take a peek in the kitchen from the street  you d never know there is a wood fire in there from the inside    The day of my visit they had to close down early and re open after prepping more food  This apparently had happened a few times and it feels like the restaurant is getting in its groove to accommodate the larger crowds  The line was long  but we were inside  had ordered  seated and fed within about    minutes  I don t think Gaucho will ever not be busy  so plan accordingly   The staff was incredibly friendly and eager to talk about any piece of the menu  I had the rosemary braised beef con pan  sandwich  and my friend had the bife de gaucho  ribeye  cooked to order  con pan  Everything about my sandwich was perfect  The meat was cooked to tender perfection  the horsey sauce was not overpowering or overused  and the caramelized onion probably spoke to my soul  I only managed to steal one bite of the gaucho con pan  but I suspect I will be getting a whole one for myself in the near future  We shared a side of the corn pudding  a warm  savory and spicy dish that did well to complement the meaty sandwiches   If you made it to the end of this review  I appreciate your patience  and for goodness  sake   go eat at Gaucho

I ve been going here since it opened a few years ago  Best food in Pittsburgh  They re always adding to the menu  so it never gets boring  Too crowded on a Sat  Best to go during the week or early evenings on the weekends
Delicious food  This place is worth the wait   friendly staff   quality food  I went here for my birthday in May   loved every bite

Where do I even begin with Gaucho  This is one of the best restaurants in the city  and an absolute must try if you haven t been yet   Gaucho is a tiny little place in the Strip that you might miss if you re not looking for it  Often times when you drive past you ll see lines out the door at this small brick building  I actually like the way Gaucho is set up   instead of being seated and having a waiter  you just wait in line to order at the register and then go scope out a table  The employees will call out your order as soon as it s ready  Overall I think this strategy makes the process go a little more quickly  which is good since it s always so packed  They don t take reservations here  but if you come on a weekday before around   PM you shouldn t have to wait long at all  My boyfriend and I came on a Wednesday at      and had no problem finding a table and getting our food in record time  Bring a bottle of wine with you   this is one of the only restaurants in the city that I ve discovered that is truly BYOB  no uncorking fee     I ve been to Gaucho twice now and have been overly impressed with the food both times  Absolutely everything on the menu here is so deliciously flavorful  you honestly can t make a bad choice when deciding what to get  I highly recommend the classic steak sandwich with the rib eye  The roasted vegetables are also a favorite  I have never had such delicious grilled veggies in my life  The steak empanadas are also wonderful  The best part about Gaucho s food  in my opinion  is the way that all the strong flavors mesh together so beautifully  You won t find a bland dish here   This is one of those restaurants in Pittsburgh that I will keep coming back to again and again  If you haven t been  you need to go TODAY

I had an amazing time here with a college friend  The staff couldn t be more friendly  The bill wasn t too high  And the staff was wonderful  Jean our waiter had an excellent knowledge of the menu and gave us a lot of help sorting through the dishes  I settled on a fish dish and my friend had a steak dish  Both were fantastic  Definitely will be returning
Delicious steak and vegetables roasted to perfection  Go on a weekday during off hours to avoid a wait  Friendly staff

At last  I made it to Gaucho  I ve been waiting to check this place out for years  and I m so happy that it lived up to the high expectations that I had for it  The space is small  and yes you will be greeted by a line  The line leads you right to the counter where you are given your drinks  your wine is uncorked for you  BYOB  and you are then someone takes your order on an ipad  The line seemed to move very quickly  mostly because I couldn t choose what to order off of the chalkboard  so so many options    Once we were seated  our food didn t take long to arrive at all  I absolutely loved all of the food that we ordered  We had one main course  which came with a salad  and then we ordered some of the sides and features  Everything was hot  and high quality  There wasn t much service while we were seated  as in  you don t have a specific waiter waitress they all just help each other out with refills and busing tables    The employees here were all extremely friendly  which is always a    star in my book  I loved that this restaurant is BYOB  I expected the decor to be different  would be nice for them to spruce up the place a bit  Also  i would have loved to have some music playing in the background  We sat on the top floor and it was extremely difficult to have a conversation because it was just so noisy with all of the other tables talking    Would highly recommend Gaucho  Check the hours first  they are closed on Sunday and Monday  I can t wait to go back
Rachel was amazing  great host  Made the time pass easily as it was a long wait  expected at such a famous place  Overall great spot

Third visit for my dear wife s birthday was again outstanding   The carne asada skirt steak was amazing   We tried the campfire yams that really blew our tastebuds away with super charred big marshmallows and potatoes that became uber carmelized in the fire   OMG   Just delicious   And the beans and greens and side of mushrooms was stellar   We love their sauces and their servers cannot be beat   We arrived around  pm on a Saturday and waited an hour to order and be seated   It goes pretty quickly because there is always some primo people watching to be had   Just love you Gaucho

I don t see what the big hype is   If you like under seasoned  over cooked  over priced steak  than this place is for you   Ordered multiple medium rare rib eyes for the table and every one was grey on the inside and basically tasted only of charcoal unless slathered in the house sauces  Chicken was pretty good though   Lol
This place is a meat lovers heaven  I enjoyed my food and encourage everyone to visit this place when in the area

Did I really forget to review this place   Been here a couple times  I very rarely get to the Strip  but I have much more of a reason to go now that I ve found this place    LOVE the grilled veggies  I feel like their  thing  is meat  but wow these veggies are amazing  I am not the type to choose a veggie sandwich  but after having some of them on a salad on my first trip  I went for it the next trip  and I didn t miss the meat  I also love their bread  I love unique eats  and this fits the bill  Nothing too bizarre  but def not your usual fare  either  Wish I could go more often

Definite   stars      I would even give them    or     stars if I could  If you haven t been then stop reading this and go    I had the Rosemary Beef sandwich  Oh my goodness    Lots and lots of goodness   The sandwich was huge   My husband and I split it  The beef had to have been marinated and then slow cooked  I don t like to cook but I would definitely want the recipe to make is  The bun held up to all of the roast beef  That was good because there was a lot of roast beef   My husband ordered the Pollo ala Parilla  It is a grilled chicken  but it s not what we as Americans think of as grilled chicken  It had the skin on which was crispy  You could taste the lemon and thyme  The chicken fell right off the bone  And you definitely want to lick all of that goodness off of your fingers   We shared coleslaw  It was a big helping  You start eating it and you are thinking of how good the crunchiness is and the sweet sour combination and just as you swallow you start to sense the after burn  It s a deep spiciness  It was a compliment to both of our meals   There are a lot of other options on the menu and we want to try them all but we really want to take friends back to try the Pallella

I had to visit several times before I was ready to review  OK  so first off  Gaucho can be amazing  But you need to go with a group  It s not really the place to go as a couple or alone  The reason for going in a group is to try lots of what they have to offer  When I went the first time it was just me and my husband  and we were underwhelmed   it was expensive and we didn t really get much variety as you just order at a counter and your food comes to your table all at once so its not a coursed dining experience  That said  I have now gone several times with a large group  it s not expensive  and we get a ton of food to share  Get you and your friends a few Asado platters  some potatoes  some shrimp  provaletta  and dig into their sauces  which are amazing  Remember to bring your wine  and come early or be prepared to wait in a long line  Four and a half stars   if they had table service it would be five

Padilla Gaucho is a   mazing  saw it listed as a top     Yelps actually    in PITTSBURGH   YUP Pittsburgh    I grew up in Pitt  and have been back and forth once every few years for about    years  I had to try it  I went yesterday      with my sister  I had an idea where it was  I knew the area very well  beginning of the  strip  old old building  they are expanding into the next space this spring and have a pation on the opposite side weather permitting   If you are not going right to it and know its there you would walk by    out of     times  FIRST THING   if the braised beef is available do not hesitate  eat this sandwich   Flavors out of this world  Caramelized onions  Horseradish sauce  You will not eat s better sandwich   But get there early they do sell out of this one  Ate this sandwich on my third visit because it was sold out the first two times I was there     I had the Tilapia plate fire grilled   nice size portions  with carmelized onions   greens  asparagus  grilled tomato they have a little sauce bar    mason jars  but do your self a favor and try each on your meal   sandwich  they each have solid flavors    Tilapia was grilled perfectly  which is not easy to do with this very thin white fish  also ordered the Provelleta  sharp provolone on crisp grilled bread  Sister ordered the steak burger well done and it was again made perfectly hanging right on the edge of well and medium  they give you many options for add ons  she had greens and pickled onions and sharp prov  I could not even speak when the food came out it looked amazing and tasted even better  The staff was so friendly and talkative  never felt like we were being rushed or bothering them  George took our order and walked us thru the whole process again never trying to move us along even as the small area was filling up behind us  He was very kind to every single person that came thru    well folks  the next day  I had to go back this place is addictive  took niece and sister back in today and was greeted with  two days in a row Bob  George greeted us  sister  creature of habit  had the steak  burger again but with some different add ons  I went for the Spanish prosciutto  and niece had the picked chicken  pulled  all these have lived up to the billing as this place makes nothing shabby  Spanish prosciutto is a tad less salty than US or Italian  sharp provolone tops it and I added carmelized onions   Picked chicken was moist and exploding with flavor  we actually cut the sandwiches in  rds so we could try each one   EAT HERE         PERIOD

I did a roadtrip from Chicago with a friend over   days and this was my favorite restaurant by far  We got the rosemary braised beef sandwich  chicken empanada  and argentino salad with flank beef added as a side  Minds blown  The chicken empanada and the Argentino salad were stellar  The beef sandwich was great       but the other ones were      especially with the different sauces  we tried them all and they were all so good    Highly  highly recommend  Wish they would open a location in Chicago     there s nothing like it here
The simplicity of the food and the way it s prepared is what makes it so great  Haven t eaten anything here that I haven t loved

Welcome to hipster hell   This place seems like it is always packed with a line outside the door  However the line is more due to unqualified staff than it is  actual demand  The people taking your order seem to go on a union break or a pause on a regular basis when they think the kitchen is busy or they just need a smoke break or pause    Also really appreciate the guy who took my order and told me all about how sick he was with a fever while taking the order  Really hope this guy was not also preparing my food    As for the food it was great  If you can put up with questionable service and a hipster crowd then by all means try this place

An incredible restaurant in Pittsburgh  This BYOB  Argentinian restaurant took us way too long to get to  as locals  We got four small plates  the flank steak  the sirloin  the Cerdo  pork with carmelized onion   Dijon  and the Provoletta  grilled provolone cheese   The sirloin and the cerdo were outstanding  The flavor in all of our dishes rendered me speechless  We highly recommend getting a few small plates to try together  The menu is so extensive  you d be cheating yourself if you didn t  It s pricier but it s worth it  Tip  get there early before      on a weeknight and avoid the rush       we will definitely return

The good  The food was really good  We tried a little of everything  Skirt steak  excellent  perfectly cooked  with the house salad  funghi  yummy   papas  the potatoes were fine but I loved the addition of the rosemary and grilled garlic   beef empanada  flavorful   vegetable empanada  subtle   not bad   and the grilled provolone  awesome   Once we ordered  the food arrived promptly   Parking was easy to find  They allow you to bring your own beer wine and don t even charge a corkage fee  The coffee was dark and smooth and perfect    The not so good  I guess it s their shtick but I just don t understand why they think I d want to wait in line like cattle to order at the counter before I am seated  then have someone yell my name across a crowded room while I m chatting with my lunch mate   We only ended up eating here because we happened to get here when the line was still only inside the front door  And the line moves SUPER slow  I get that it s a small place so there s going to be a wait  but either let me make reservations or take my number and text me when it s ready  So unfortunately  I m not likely to come back  there s just too many other options without the wait
Believe the hype  It is absolutely as good as everyone says it is
This place is amazing   I definitely recommend  We got Ribeye  chicken  and mussels  each was better than the other
GREAT food  There is nothing bad  The only thing I d say  is that the line is very long  so make sure to get there early  I don t believe they have reservations either

I went to Gaucho Parilla two weekends in a row    the first time was forgettable  I got the rosemary braised beef sandwich which was only ok   but the second time was soooo good   I hear that they used to be much smaller and not really have seating  but the new place  although there is a wait  has basic seating after you ve ordered at the front  and the servers are all so nice and helpful   As everyone has said  GET THE STEAK SANDWICH  We got the ribeye cut  and it was a spectacular slab of beef  Juicy  tender  delicious  All the adjectives of greatness for a steak   We also got a pretty well dressed and well seasoned salad  which was as satisfying as a side salad can get  and the humita  corn pudding with chilis and fresh herbs   The humita was addictive  a bit sweet  a bit savory  a bit spicy  and entirely delicious  I d highly recommend that as well       stars rounded up because the steak sandwich and the humita are truly remarkable

Very disappointing service   we arrived and sat down only to be told there was no table service and to join the queue  which was by now longer than when we came in   being there first  would have been nice to be advised earlier and escorted to the queue    rather than told oh you are now last as you missed your spot on the queue   but there was no queue or line when we came in   rude and definitely not Argentinean    should be more organized and patron friendly   this put us off and we left     Definitely won t be coming back

I have a couple good things to say  a couple not so good things to say   However  Everything aside our lasting impression was made the last few moments as we were about to leave the waitress approached our group spread out her     dollar tip and said  this is all you left   just wanted you to know  If that s okay with you then fine  I just did a lot    I did not drink that evening  everyone else took advantage of the BYOB  Someone in my group handed her    more dollars    before I could stop them   The cash she claimed to  have left over  as her tip didn t match with The money she was given  Additionally  she did not include the     dollars in off those who paid with a credit card   I won t be back  it was so uncomfortable  And I feel she was dishonest  whether by mistake in counting wrong or on purpose  In general not okay    Update  this took place in the downstairs bodega  Never have been to the upper portion of the restaurant

Very nice staff and atmosphere on the interior   wish there was a little more room to sit though  Regardless  the beef sandwich had a lot of potential but it fell short due to a lack of balance in two major categories  texture and flavor profile  This was mostly caused by the roasted red peppers and sauteed onions  Having three smokey ingredients on a bun is a bit overpowering and was too overwhelming on my palate  Concurrently  these roasted peppers and onions combined with the soft meat and bread robbed every bite of a much desired crunch  having cast ironed vegetables would have been a much more welcome exchange   I also felt the onions were overcharred   With all that in mind  I d still gladly come back here and try it again  Nice people

Visiting Pittsburgh for a conference and dropped by here for lunch  It was my first time trying Argentinian cuisine and I really liked the food  place   the people  Will definitely recommend to others

Wow  It doesn t get much better than this  The steak platters were phenomenal    of us each tried the flank  filet and NY Strip  with small salad and piece of toast  however the chimichurri sauce on the steaks was a flavor bomb  Comes in two sizes  oz and   oz  The roasted carrots  with honey and feta  side dish is not to be missed  as was the spicy chorizo and empanadas  Do forget the superb flan for dessert  Incredibly inexpensive given the quality       for     BYOB  Brought a bottle and they gladly opened and served in wine glasses with no corkage fee  I can see why there is a line out the door and down the block even on weekdays    Have an unusual system  You queue in line  no reservations   winding past menu chalkboard  You approach cash register and pay  getting any drinks  including water   If you brought a bottle of wine you give it to them  After paying your bill  you wait at the cash register until they seat you at a table  When we got to the table  wine glasses were already present and wine opened  Food was served quickly as it was being prepared while waiting for a table  Service was excellent   contemporary casual atmosphere  Wait was    min at  pm on a Tuesday  Easy walk from Homewood Suites   Highly recommended

By far the the best steak I have ever had   Every time I am in the area it s a definite go to place   I can t say enough good things about this place and the food    It s on point and Definitley worth the wait in line    I can t wait to go there again

First off I probably venture to Gaucho s no less than   times a month if not more for lunch during the week  not because of the close proximity to work  but for the exquisite lunch food at a decent price  Gaucho Parilla opens up at      am but you should wander over if you don t want to wait in line  preferably   minutes before     This leaves you ample time to browse over the  chalkboard  menu on the wall  A couple of suggestions  if you are overwhelmed by the menu   Appetizers  I would suggest the  beef or chicken  Empanadas or Provolleta  Lunch  Haven t had a bad sandwich yet but my go to is the Rosemary Braised Beef and the Carne   Also  their wings are smoked and grilled with the sauce layered after cooking    They offer   main sauces set in various places around the restaurant that you can grab and taste to your liking   If you are looking for a quick bite or a sit down lunch with friends this is the place  A modern  yet rustic look  topped with friendly employees and reasonable prices leaves this as a go to for me every time
We had a party of     and despite the huge lines  were accommodated happily and efficiently  Food was delicious as well  Would       recommend
Great food   Worth stopping by   The mahi mahi and steak dinner were wonderfully made
What can really be said that hasn t already   Went for my birthday  Had wine  had meat  had sides  had A BLAST         It was incredible

Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is a very unique little restaurant with a lot of flavor  I can see why it is so popular  but since I m vegan and can t partake in the  full  experience which would likely include their meats  I also can t  So take my review with a grain of salt    And some of their delicious sauces because that stuff is ADDICTING    Since I m on the topic  Gaucho Parilla Argentina has four free flowing sauces available to all patrons  I probably consumed too much of the ajo garlic one because it was out of this world  It was creamy but not in a weird way and the garlic was subtle and blended so well that I drizzled  ok  drenched  my food in this sauce  I also love the chimi sauce  but I have a feeling it goes together much better with meats than the veggies I ordered    Speaking of which  I ordered the beans and greens as a side for    and the large Argentino Salad for      The prices are pretty awesome  My boyfriend ordered meat things  and he seemed to really enjoy them  I absolutely loved the beans and greens because they had an awesome smoky flavor  so I didn t really feel like I was missing out by not partaking in the non vegan experience    I think it s totally possible for vegans to get by on the sides and salads here  with the incredible sauces     because they are all so delicious  Just be prepared for a bit of a line and plan accordingly  Also BYOB

Best sandwich I ve had in Pittsburgh by far  So we walked past this place today and the smell of woodfire BBQ stopped us in our tracks  It s a tiny spot and it was a bit of a wait but oh man was it worth  We got the pollo con pan  Pulled chicken sandwich it was phenomenal  Tasty chicken and potatoes The bread was amazing  Also must try the dipping sauces they have out  All of them were bursting with flavor  I also ordered the alfasmorez which was a twist on a s more nilla wafers marshmallow  chocolate  and ready for it  Dulce de leche   Caramel  sooooo heavenly   Must have a sweet tooth for this though   While waiting I saw a bunch if delicious things being served  I also realized we should have came earlier in the day because since everything seems to be in house made they run out later In the evening  First come  first serve  Everything looked and smelled great  Service was also friendly and funny  All in all a gem I never expected to find  Will be returning soon

Three stars because the line is stupid  Figure out the serving system  Is it McDonald s or is it a sit down restaurant    When you finally get into a seat   after waiting an ungodly amount of time  regardless of how long you perceived the line to be  it s always longer than you estimate    you feel guilty for staying and enjoying yourself for even a second because you have the thought of the other hangry patrons waiting in that stupid line    Buck up and be a regular restaurant  It makes no sense and doesn t cater to the regular person who enjoys your food tremendously but doesn t have the time to sit and wait for it  The food is good but is it worth that wait  Probs not more than once or twice

Stopped by Gaucho on a Saturday night date  It was a holiday weekend so the line was extra long  It took us  a party of two  about an hour and a half to get seated  When we were seated we realized there were tons of empty tables and that the congestion was at the ordering register rather than the lack of tables available    I ordered the carne sandwich with the lomo steak  The bread  peppers and onions on the sandwich were wonderful  I thought the steak was good but a lot of it was too charred for my taste    My husband got the chorizos   one spicy and one sweet  He really enjoyed it  He also got a pork empanada which was fresh and yummy  I tried a bit of his sweet chorizo  I am not a sausage person but the flavors were great    I definitely recommend ordering a side of tostada so you can dip the bread in the sauces  There were four sauces at the sauce bar   cebolla  chimmi  ajo and a red pepper sauce  My favorite was the ajo which was garlicky  My husband liked the chimmi sauce which was oily and cilantroy and also good

So after waiting so long to come to this wonderful establishment I am glad to say I finally made it   I ended up paying this place a visit over the weekend at around   pm when the lunch crowds had dissipated and the dinner crowd was yet to show up    Came here with hubby and the in laws when they were visiting from GA  Anyway I was initially overwhelmed by their menu but we started with the empanadas and fungos  mushrooms   For mains  my husband had the seafood soup and I had the Argentinian salad with filet    The empanadas were delicious  and were highly complimented by the various chimichurris they had  Chicken went really great with ajo  garlic sauce   and the beef went great with the regular chimichurri    My salad was excellent  it had greens  tomatos  mushrooms  onion  bell peppers  and some other stuff I dont remember along with a perfectly cooked filet  It was beautiful  it was tasty  and it was a great bang for your buck  I will have that again   As for hubbys soup  it had all sorts of sea monsters  clams  muscles  and calamari in a delicious broth which had a bit of a kick to it    Alll dishes had impeccable presentation  the whole establishment had an extremely clean feel and the wait staff was very helpful and attentive  I honestly could not ask more    I can t wait to go back

Gaucho is a great and offers some of the best menu items in Pittsburgh  We ordered the Paella and three empanadas  The Paella is sized for     people but reasonably for     people  Advice for the next time is to use the paella as a side dish  not a meal  The steak looks too good to resist and use the paella as a massive side dish

Cute location  Restaurant was clean and spacious   I ordered steak and empanadas  The steak was cooked well  Very tasty and nice side of salad that came with it  I ve tasted better empanadas  but no serious complaints
Food was amazing  great place within walking distance  definitely coming back  Also  Steve was a great guy  great energy and a positive attitude

In town from Los Angeles  where there have been some really excellent Argentinian restaurants over the years  in particular the Gaucho Grill    Stop the presses   The Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is the new champ  lucky those of you who live in Pittsburgh  or are visitors   I had the half Pollo  with the roasted potatoes  and the delicious selection of chimichurri  Mr  Atkinson  you have some competition    The prices were reasonable  the portions generous   Can t wait to return
I have been converted   Praise El Gaucho

Ate here   days ago with   new friends  very busy   you have to order in the front desk and then wait to be seated  so there were a huge line waiting there  it took us about    mins to sit in front of table  Ordered Ribeye steak  Quiqui chicken  fried fish  seared shrimp  my ribeye steak was juicy and tasty  other dishes seems all fine too  Ps  The cookies at the front desk are quite nice
The pulled pork and caramelized onions are incredible  Try all the sauces  So good  Would highly recommend
Really long line to get in but that s part of the experience to some extent  Went there about a year ago exactly and still remember how good the quality of the food was

Came here with my fraternity family this past spring  I forget what we were celebrating   Ended up with a whole bowl of paella and lots of appetizers  no complaints on anything  We had gone with a few bottles of wine but now there s a     corkage fee

I wish I could give this place        only downside is that the price is a little steep    However  the food is solidly delicious    Check out my pics for what we got this last time   If you can get past the line  it s got a pretty good vibe in there    Their meat is delicious   and they seem to run out if their signature flank steak occasionally because it s really so yummy    I also forget what healthy portions you get for sandwiches and we usually end up ordering a meat platter     This last time  I got a little daring and ordered their seafood mix soup   and it was really really good   The broth is rich and just full bodied    I could have just had the broth  but the seafood just brought this dish to a future always order category    Anyway   I ll be back

Yesterday was my  th time coming to this establishment       never fails to delight     unbelievable meat   Great atmosphere and friendly  outgoing staff   Only complaint would be the ordering process     it is always a bit tedious  especially when the folks in front of you are new and not familiar with the menu

This place was phenomenal   I went with my friend and her mom and we all got different things and shared and everything was so delicious  Very filling without being too heavy  And I thought it was pretty reasonably priced  Definitely worth the wait   Can t wait to go back

I love this place   I m shocked it took me so long to finally give this place a chance   Just walking by the smell tries to lure me in   Finally  we decided to go after being told we have to  I m so glad we did   They have some of the yummiest meat here    And I m a sucker for good steak   I have tried the NY Strip  Flank and Strip and have zero complaints  Everything we have had here has been great actually  papas bravas  provoletta  corn on the cob  etc     The only complaints are hours    Some days I just can t get here before  pm   Seating  in the winter  it will be tough unless they expand  that is unless you get it to go   I m sure that these are a possible change as they evolve   I can t wait to come back

My husband and I stopped by this gem on a Saturday evening around     pm or so  and boy am I glad we went when we did  When we went to go back in  we were seated outside  to grab some sauces  the line was wrapped around the building  Speaking of sauces  they all went well with the sandwiches we ordered  Sweet Sausage and the steak sandwich with flank  The sandwiches are a bit messy  but very delicious  We also tried the beef and pork empanadas  yum  I don t think anything on their menu would be a wrong decision

This is hands down  the best restaurant in Pittsburgh  I think about going there whenever I am hungry  The meat is unparalleled  the brussels sprouts are a favorite  but seriously  there is nothing they do not do well  I believe  My mouth is watering even writing this  Excellent  Loooong lines  so have a small snack if you need to wait  but stick it out  because it is so worth it
Such a long wait for bad service and an unnecessarily expensive meal  The waiters were eh

I really don t understand why everyone is obsessed with this place  The food is good sure    but the line was an hour and a half when I went  Then you have to stand and wait for a table after you order  The chances are pretty good that you ll get your food before you get a table  People are just hovering over everyone to grab their tables when they look like they re ready to leave  The atmosphere is terrible   more like a Chipotle or Fazolis than a nice steak place  I give it   stars because the steak was tasty  but everything else was just average

Came for dinner around    pm on Thursday night and we were one of the first parties there before the big craze  It really fills up around  pm and the line gets backed up  Bf and I ordered the sampler plate and a cauliflower and avocado salad and   steak empanadas  Our bill was around     and the food was pretty delicious  The sauce options were great but you couldn t really taste one from the other

I have never left Gaucho hungry or disappointed   Wood fired meats and munchies  all world class  It was one of the few places we could eat out while doing Whole   and it was well worth the effort  I ve had much of the menu and absolutely nothing here will let you down    The Empanadas here are phenomenal  Generous portions and so  so flavorful   The El Gaucho salad is a delight  as it adds roasted Beets and Avocado to the already excellent La Casa salad  Get it with the Braised Beef and do a tiny happy dance while you eat it   Speaking of Beef  meats   They are most well known for their meats here and they deliver every time  Get that Asado Platter and share it with someone you love  Nothing brings people together like   cuts of steak   One last thing  Sauces  GET  THEM  ALL
Unlike Yelp  this place is amazing  Order a thing from the menu  eat it and be happy

Rosemary Briased Beef and ALL THE SAUCES   Gaucho has quickly and easily become one of my all time favorite restaurants in the area  If you catch it at the right time  there is no wait  If you go when it s busy be prepared to wait  but it s always so worth it  This is a great place for date night  family night  girls night out and lunch  Still haven t tried the Brussels sprouts but hope to on one of my many return trips
Pretty good food  And the price is fair  But the wait is so weird  It took us an hour to move about   feet   from just outside the door to the counter  And there was almost no one sitting

Just do it   Come for a great meal great service great fun   What an adventure of flavors   What an amazing menu   It is truly a wonderful experience   I look forward to my next meal here   Thank you Gaucho team this was a great food taste explosion

We were recommended Gaucho by some friends and were not dissapointed  the food is delicious   I had the sirloin and my gf had the pollo mmm mmm  The ordering is a little strange and it took us a bit to figure out what we wanted but it did not disappoint
Show up early  bring beer and be prepared to wait  Crazy packed on Saturdays but oh so worth it

This place is AWESOME   If you love steak and are human  you have to make a stop at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina  Everything looked and sounded so good  so we ordered a little bit of everything  We ordered the Asado Platter which comes with all the varieties of steak that they offer  the Rusted Roots  the Chikki Empanadas and the Papas al Hornos  I wish I lived in Pittsburgh so that I can go here once a week  okay maybe everyday   TIP   they don t serve beer wine but they allow you to bring your own
A great twist to Argentina food  Grilled to perfection a very relaxed atmosphere and easy to share plates  You get to choose the best meal for you

I welcome meat coma wholeheartedly when I dine at Gaucho   Their sauces are phenomenon   Chimmi and Ajo are my favorite    I probably spent     of my dinner time contemplating about how to take some sauce home   So standard procedure   you can always expect a long line at Gaucho  except when it is raining on a random week night   We waited about    minutes at      PM on a rainy week day   Here s how the line works   The line is for ordering food   You are only allowed to order if they have a table for you   For easy sharing  my party opted for no sandwich   For starters  we got the chicky and beefy empanadas   They are two bites and done empanadas  so if you love empanadas then be selfish and get your own   Knowing all the meat we were about to consume  we ordered the only non salad vegetable on the menu   the mushrooms  They were glazed with sauce and soft to the bite   For the main courses  we ordered the lamp chop  ribeye  and NY strip  All small at   oz    We ordered the meat at medium rare but the steak all came out a little over medium   However  the sauces made all these problems go away   The lamp chop was medium rare and it was not gamey  thumbs up   I would love to come back and try the flank  but we had a pretty amazing spread   The special of the day was sopa de mariscos   tomato based soup with assorted seafood  clams  shrimp  mussels    It s a great broth to dip your bread   Oh  and this place is BYOB   Apparently many restaurants are    guess we are still learning about Pittsburgh as we go
The food here is amazing  Really nice dipping sauces for your sandwiches

star rating  Well worth it  They are currently expanding to larger location incorporating the next door location  Tried the Bondiola and Ribeye steak sandwich  For apps we did steak empanadas with papas cuna  Came out excellent  Service was phenomenal  Well worth it and will come back next time I m in town

Just got to town for a convention and absolutely starving so decided to look for yelp restaurant recommendations in close proximity to my hotel in downtown Pittsburgh  There was a jimmy johns and seven eleven across the street but after a harrowing   hour drive from DC I needed to reward myself with something amazing    This restaurant was a little over half a mile from my hotel but I didn t care  Made the   block trek in record time and let s just say my stomach thanked me  I had the ribeye steak plate with a salad and the salad was a beautiful concoction of mixed greens with shaved carrots  baby tomatoes and radishes wonderfully dressed with a balsamic dressing and sprinkled with fresh black pepper  This place carries four house sauces  A chimnichurriesque one  a garlic  a Smokey one and one made of onions  All great accompaniments to the steak and salad  I actually drank some of the sauce from the little plastic cup because it was so good  I ordered the broccolini as an additional side and it came with a beautiful char off the grill  I drenched it in the garlic sauce and that just elevated the flavor although it was already divine  My favorite sauce was the garlic sauce but who doesn t love garlic but the others might appeal to others    While the food was pretty awesome the wait staff were also very attentive  While you re ordering someone gets your table prepped and walks you to it  This same individual also brings you a sampler of the four sauces which I think is a nice touch    This place only serves coke products but is byob with and no uncorking fee for those who need some wine with their steak  The table next to me appeared to be having a wine tasting party with their meal

Real good place for red meat eaters   Variety of steak   lamb and pork collection  Quick service and nice ambience Seemed A little pricey for its small scale place though  Make sure you choose a non peak hour to visit if you dont like standing in long lines  This was my third attempt here and i finally made it
I loved the food here  Great taste and good variety in food  I only wish that the portions were bigger

Allow me to chime in with the chorus of praise for Gaucho  My wife and I came here a few nights back  We enjoyed the flank steak  inexplicably cheaper than skirt  though the flank is higher quality in my opinion  and grilled vegetables  Clean plates  not a straggler left  The guys running the joint had great personality and a friend customer   had brought in some homebrew to share with the crowd  I would have given them five stars without the free beer  but it sure as hell doesn t hurt  Highly recommended

Gaucho Parrilla is more hip then Argentinian   Every second I knew I was in the Strip district and not in Argentina   No Argentinian drinks but BOB  The food was prepared with care   spices complimented each type of   meat platter  Servers are energetic but nobody really checks on you when you get it   The line is long and it creates false sense of amazing things to come  Sausage was a bit too spicy but maybe that is a standard because I do not know anything about Argentinian spices  The crowd s estimated age average was      I was at the high end of age scale   I did it   I do not regret it it was very good

Super fresh and inventive food that is worth the wait   Love love love     the salads   fav is the Argentina with grilled fish   The grilled vegetables are sooooo good it makes eating veggies divine   Empanadas with vegetables were super good too  We want to get a nice group together to try the Paella pan   hopefully soon because this place is addictive

traveled to Pittsburgh with my bf who had a business trip to the city   Came in around  pm on a Tuesday afternoon for a late lunch   I ordered a  porky  empanada  small rib eye with chimmichurri  sub salad with oven roasted red skin potatoes   and the campfire yams  It was all so good  Loved the taste of the char on the outer edges of the meat which was tender and flavorful  the potatoes were awesome  slightly crunchy on outside  buttery and soft on the inside the way a good baked potato should be  the empanada was fantastic  nice and tender pastry  flavorful filling  the yams were good my only critique would be that they could ve used some butter  All these things were great on their own  but what sent it over the top was the selection of sauces that you can add on   my personal favorite was the pimenton  red pepper sauce   OMG  I could put this on anything and everything   It was sooooo good  Lastly  the staff  I interacted with about   different people while I was there  were all super helpful and friendly  they made the restaurant a warm and inviting place to be  I don t know when I ll be in Pittsburgh again  but I sure hope to make another trip back here when I do

I truly don t even know if this review needs to be written as it s obviously no secret that Gaucho is amazing  but I ll put my two cents in as well    I always get either the small Bife de Gaucho or the steak sandwich with filet  They are cooked SO beautifully each time I order them  My favorite sauce is the onion y one that I can t seem to remember the name of  Of course  if their corn on the cob is an option  you definitely need to have that in your life    Their BYO policy is wonderful and I really like the new system of how they seat you vs  letting you seat yourself   I also recently had the pleasure of having their Asado truck at a friend s event  and the quality of the food was just as on point  They are killing the game right now

I ve been here twice  gotten the flank steak sandwich both times  The first experience was honestly life changing and I probably hyped the memory too much for the second go around  the steak was a little chewier the latter time  Still  such a simple concept but the flavors are amazing  Their grilled veggies are solid for friends who don t eat meat but their admittedly won t be much else for them

My favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh  The food is fresh and well seasoned and or marinated  without the typical overwhelming acidity or oiliness  The salads are everything  full of a variety of fresh veggies and subtlety dressed  The add on s provide the most satisfying meal  My husband tries different items almost every time  We have never been disappointed

sigh  I really wanted to love this place   Really   The food is decent  The beef empanadas were really good  That sauce that s so talked about  chimi  is worthy of taking a bottle home for dipping on garlic bread and putting it on just about everything   But that s where the good time stopped for us   I m not one to put down a place just because the wait time is crazy long as long as the wait is worth it   but this just didn t ever feel worth it to us   The restaurant was so loud I could barely speak to my boyfriend  Everyone is kinda crammed together but there s no real  friendly  atmosphere here  It s very disjointed and chaotic  We got there on what seemed like a rather  slow  night and still waited a good hour to order and sit  Like I said  the food was just MEH    those beef empanandas I would have totally taken    of those home with me and been content  though   with the chimi sauce    I had the pork  boyfriend had the steak burger  The bread was burnt to almost unrecognizable consistency and I ve honestly had pork just as good  if not better in other places  If I were you  I d skip the hype  stop waiting outside for hours in all kinds of weather  and go find another of the million great places to eat in Pittsburgh
Still by far the best steak in Pittsburgh  If you leave here hungry it is your own fault

We flew into Pittsburgh as part of multi cities driving trip  We only have one day here before we had to go to the next city  We thought the best way to know the city is to  yes     go on the double decker city bus tour    The tour guide bus took us to one of many neighborhood in Pittsburgh  including the street that Gaucho was on  It was around lunch time and the line to Gaucho was noticeably long  The wonderful smell of grilled meat emanated from Gaucho s building  My son and I decided to check it out for lunch   By the time we finished our city tour  made it back to Gaucho  it was almost   pm  There was still a line  albeit shorter  to wait for a seat  The wait was absolutely worth it   We ordered a salad and   empanadas  All were good  And we were absolutely stuffed  Our favorite were the beef empanadas    Had we live in the area  I d want to come back here often to try out other items in their menu
Great place and excellent food  Quality of the meat is top notch and the side dishes are awesome  No wonder its so busy all the time   I will go back again very soon
medium rare
Wonderful  I had the chimi steak and potatoes and they were delicious  For desert white chocolate blueberry bread pudding   Wow this place is doing it right

Gaucho is my far one is my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh  We obviously had to wait in line but it is worth the wait  The portion size of the sandwich is perfect  the service is prompt  and it s nice that you pay up front so you don t have to wait around for a check  The food is so incredibly flavorful and the sauces are to die for

Be advised  Changes to their BYOB policy  Wine is only BYOB option and at     per bottle  What s warrants that  I don t know  Check their website for details   Surprisingly on a Halloween night with rain pouring down  no one in line to order at the register  AND they weren t slowing down the order taking so that the kitchen could fill orders for takeout and their downstairs Bodega seating as was the case the last couple visits    As always excellent food across the board for everything the four in our party ordered

Hands up  for a high five  favorite place for food in Pittsburgh  Casual and fun  but most importantly DELICIOUS every time    Meat is always cooked perfectly  and the vegetables and sides are rich and filling  The variety of self serve sauces are a nice bonus to eat with anything and everything   Environment inside is cozy and welcoming and extends to the back for extra seating  Small patio is also nice in good weather  BYOB    don t forget your wines and beers

Lucked at and didn t have to wait long for the deliciousness that is Gaucho  I had my usual small flank steak  It s served with carmelized onions  delicious   salad and a piece of toast  The small is plenty for a meal    My husband had the condero  which is smoked leg of lamb  He thought it was going to be lamb served how the steak is served  but it was actually more like a stew  Nonetheless  he seemed to enjoy it  Also served with a salad and a side  The side was a marinated eggplant salad served cold  I enjoyed it   We also ordered two empanadas  one beef and one pork  The empanadas rotate regularly  They re small  but good  And the filling to dough ratio is near perfect  a little heavier on the dough     Also love the selection of help yourself salsas and chimmis to accompany your meal  My go tos are the garlic sauce and the chimmi    I m always impressed at how they manage the customer to table ratio  Maybe I ve just been there at the right time  but we ve never had a probably getting a table  after waiting to order our food  of course  and we ve never felt rushed

Gaucho is the quintessential Pittsburgh restaurant  They have a personable and excellent staff who are always friendly and welcoming  Their atmosphere is that of a rustic yet modern cabin  and their food is the zenith of the experience  The wood fired meats and vegetables are the perfect texture  and the restaurant has four options for sauces to pour on top of them  The delicious sauces suffuse impeccably with the meats and the vegetables  creating a harmony of flavors   The desserts are superb as well  Do I need to say anything about a mango coconut bread pudding to convince you   The only issue with Gaucho is the line  They re so good that too many people go there  Get there early  so you don t get caught in the line    They re an invaluable asset to Pittsburgh s food scene

I moved to Pittsburgh   months ago   my boyfriend   I have gone here   times already  This place is incredible  Their steak   bread are heavenly  I recommend the steak burger to anyone  I ve also had their basic salad   even that is incredible  The downside is the wait but honestly it is well worth it for the food  Plus it is BYOB  wine with dinner makes it even better
