Long line up but moves quick  Amazing steak  first time for us to try chorizo empanadas  Bread pudding is great as well  Nice location  just next to a bridge and river

Delicious as always   Meat cooked perfectly with the wood fire flavor   We did take out since the sign said there was an A C issue   Anyway take out was great so we could eat outside today in the wonderful Sunny weather   We took a few of the four sauces to share   Have been to Gaucho many times and finally tried a Chicky Empanada   The Empanada was very good but my Carne Sandwich was absolutely delicious   While we did not have any of the small plates or sides they are usually very good with the wood fired flavor

In my opinion  this is good food  but not worth the insane wait times  Most frustrating about those long lines is that  a  in Pittsburgh there is about a     chance it s raining at any given moment  so chances are you are standing in line in the rain  and  b  there is really no discernible reason the line is THAT long except that the kitchen is just sort of slow   All that said  the steak is really tasty  and very affordable for the quality  Potatoes make a great side  and the sauce  chimichurri in particular  go great with everything else

Surprise  surprise     another five star review   It s worthy of the hype  Go here  immediately  And bring a growler of your favorite beer or a bottle of wine    We ordered the steak sandwich  filet cut  with the grilled corn  along with the rib eye platter  Both were cooked and flavored perfectly  Which is a  shame   because their sauces are out of this world  still managed to use them to dip the bread   Speaking of the bread    it s wonderful  A perfectly baked ciabatta  crispy on the outside  soft on the inside    The staff was extremely friendly  and clearly loved their jobs  The manager walked around and asked everyone how their meals and experiences were  and was quite friendly    Can I go back now

After a busy day in Pittsburgh  nothing beats a great dinner with good food  Even though it was raining  we walked a few blocks to this place  A block away we saw a line winding out from a corner  No mistake  it was Gaucho Parrilla  Standing in the rain  I saw in the faces of the crowd resolution and passion for the upcoming dinner   No sooner than one hour  we finally made our order and got sit down at a table  Waiting staff were very friendly  We brought a bottle of wine  and a server promptly asked how many wine glasses we need  Everything was ready  dinner was served   Wife s Carne burger made with grilled ribeye  was truly great  She also had steak and chicken empanadas  Seeing my jealous look  she cut a small piece to share  It was good indeed  My parillada mixta was also terrific  with medium rare pink colored strip steak  blacken chicken and sausage  made a meat lover happy  I had to reluctantly share some with my wife in exchange for her generosity sharing the carne and empanadas    Great food  reasonable price  byob no cork charge and with wine glass from the house  servers came a few times asking if need any help  Except the noise in the hall made by all the excited dinners and people waiting in line  this is a perfect dining experience for us  Five star and will be back if we are in Pittsburgh

Can t think of how the steak could be better and trust me  we tried all of them  Went to capital grill during the same trip and wished we had returned  to this strip neighbourhood meatetarian  heaven  Waiting on the long like to get in is uncivilised and worth it

One of my favorite places  I ve never had something I didn t love  My go to is the arrachera  I ve waited in line    minutes before and still thought it was worth it    Line tip   try early on a week day  Or call ahead and get take out

Gaucho was AMAZING  This was my second visit  and both times have been incredible  The first time  I got the steak sandwich  the meat was cooked perfectly and the bread is perfectly crusty yet soft on the inside  Tonight I got the fish sandwich  and I can honestly say it was the best sandwich I have ever had  The fish of the day  I believe it was walleye  was flaky and seasoned nicely  and went perfectly with all the flavorful sauces  Also  the potatoes are delicious as well  YUM

This is one of the best places I have been to in Pittsburgh   Food  We spent only    dollars for   females  And it was really really delicious  The rib eye steak was juicy  It is a  must order dish   Qui Qui chicky was tender  Don t forget to squeeze some lemon juice on the meat  And the provoletta is also recommended  It tasted a little salty at first and then a milky taste would fill your mouth  We also had empanadas and steak burger  One of the empanada flavor was great  but I cannot remember it was beefy or vegi        The steak burger was not as juicy as it was described in other comments  maybe it was because we were busy eating other food and did not eat the burger until it was cold    Environment  It is small  Go there early  Better at     Otherwise  you will need to wait a long time   Service  The waiters are prompt  There is no assigned waiter  So everyone passed by would help you if you need help

This restaurant is definitely a gem  The food is great and compared to other Argentine steakhouses  it is very affordable  However the line is very long  usually more than an hour on weekends so I recommend visiting only on weekdays  even then there might be a    minute line

We stopped in mid afternoon  and the line was several people long  but the wait wasn t too long  But it was certainly worth it  We could smell the grill as we were waiting  and the menu  had so many choices  We got grilled cauliflower and grilled broccolini  both amazing  and the vegetable empanadas  along with the provolone fried cheese and toast  which came with arugula and olive salad  which may have been the favorite thing  Everything was very flavorful without being too spicy  even the homemade sauces  which added just the right touch  Parking can be a little tricky  but don t let that keep you from trying it  We also enjoyed that it was a diverse crowd  we  two sisters and a daughter  sat between a table of young ethnic  business women sharing a huge pan of paella and a table of men in white shirts and ties  kicking back with some BYO ale and chatting about sports  Highly recommend

We waited two hours here but every minute was SO WORTH IT  We ordered a tonnnn of food  We got the pork and vegetarian empanadas  chicken sandwich  potatoes  SO GOOD    Qui Qui chicken  Proveletta  grilled provolone cheese   and the Cordero  braised leg of lamb   After all that food  we got flan for dessert  which was also really good  Gaucho is one of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh

I really love this place  The trick is to go there at      in the middle of the week  The meats are done to perfection  The daily empanadas are always great  There s a plethora of meat to choose from but if you feel overwhelmed  which I did  the staff is more than willing to help you  I also enjoy the corn and cauliflower  they have a nice char to them  It s worth the wait and it s byob

Food very good   The wait outside made no sense as I saw   empty tables       counter side seats not in use  Then the weird dieting process  First we had party of       you wait at counter and order individually  then get back in line to pay separately   Weird And inefficient  Meats ordered medium came to table looking medium to Well    got even more well done as stilling cooking on platter    chef should realize that meat still cooks after serving  Overall food was great    next time I order rare or medium rare All sauces excellent  broccolini side just ok    lacked garlic   The chirozios sausage sweet and spicy was worth trip with roasted peppers  onions  BYOB I liked but doing away with at bd of October  The Phan dessert was excellent and website doesn t even show desserts  More grilled fish options   I ll be back and order meat medium rare and raise my stars to

Did you ever go to a spot that you were rooting for and loved the food and once it stated to expand  you had hoped other elements of the dining experience would be just as incredible   I ve been a long time fan of Gaucho and was one of its first customers    The food still is quite amazing but there are some things I would certainly change   They don t take reservations  which is fine  but you wait in a line that wraps around outside and freeze as you wait  They should really invest in some heat lamps to accommodate their customers if they expect people to keep coming through winter    The host is a bit rigid and not the best with service  For instance  if you ve got several people in line outside freezing their tushes off  maybe he could offer to bring drinks to the customers waiting outside  I don t even expect it to be free  some level of effort would be nice to make it an enjoyable experience if you are expected to wait    The area where there is seating is cute but it could be much more ambient in terms of dim lighting  noise level  perhaps introduce some music   etc    I ll be curious to see how gaucho continues to evolve as I really do like it

It s a very hot summer afternoon  We walked into the place which had a nice crowd  We discussed a few minutes before ordering   The order system is order at counter then they ca your name then delivery to your table   We ordered pork and steak small dinner which was   oz of meat and it s plenty   We also ordered potatoes  corn and empanadas as appetizers  We tried all   sources and all every wonderful  Highly recommend this place for a causal place  I do a complaint was the music might be too loud  The table was pretty big so we couldn t hear our conversation too well  Other then that food was excellent   I do love the pickled onion in the salad and the real caramelized onions on the side with the pork

Definitely a new favorite  The Ribeye was cooked perfectly  the fire roasted peppers and onions were delicious  all on Ciabatta bread  which is my favorite  The small plate potatoes were perfection  They have four dipping sauces that are all fire roasted and delicious  The fire roasted corn in the husk was sweet and delicious    When they say their food is cooked with love  that is exactly what it is  I will frequent Gaucho often

This place has great food  friendly staff and lives up to the reviews I ve seen all over the country     My only complaints  not really complaints  are that it is always so packed and the wait is forever  but that is expected in a place that has such great and unique food in this area   The other is that they don t serve alcohol  which is not a huge drawback but if they did  then no one would EVER leave   And the lines would only grow longer   PLEASE open another one in the South Hills      Try this place   you will not be disappointed   Something for everyone

OUTSTANDING  This trendy little place lived up to the hype and was the highlight of my trip to Pittsburgh    For        you ll enjoy a prime cut of phenomenal steak  served with a deliciously simple salad and bread  Our first bites had my buddy and I shaking our heads in disbelief  Soooo good  The chimchurri sauces    different kinds  are simple  fresh and wonderful  these are a MUST to get the full spectrum of flavor   Brand wise  these guys are doing everything right  They ve shown a lot of attention to detail  from the sleek wooden plates to the chalkboard walls and hand stamped take out bags    My favorite part  however  was the staff  They were COOL AS       We came in on off peak hours and pretty much the whole kitchen greeted us  The manager was obviously as passionate about food as he is about the restaurant  He energetically talked us through the whole menu and spent a good    minutes giving us the scoop on other great restaurants when we asked for local recommendations    Seriously loved Gaucho s

We spent the day at the Heinz History Center and about halfway through the museum realized we wanted to eat something more than what the museum cafe had to offer  We yelped and found this restaurant  The place smelled  of smoked goodness when we walked in the door   I ordered two empanadas   one veggie and one beef and the rosemary braised beef sandwich  Side note  they also have canning jars of various sauce accompaniments which I highly recommend getting one of each to taste  they re great to dip the bread in and to spoon on the empanadas  The meat is very flavorful and I loved the bread  So yummy  And again  the sauces were a nice flavor addition  My eyes were bigger than my stomach  I still had half a sandwich left for later  The meat portion in the sandwich is huge    My husband has the Bife de gaucho   ribeye  He loved it  Beef  roast  that he dipped in the sauces  and a nice salad  He ordered the large and it was more than enough  We left stuffed and ready to walk back to the Heinz center to see the other half of what is an awesome museum

Always great food and a wonderful atmosphere  I have never had a bad meal here  Every steak is excellent and cooked to perfection  When in season  I highly recommend the roasted corn on the cob  You are always treated as family here

I cannot believe I had not updated my review  This is hands down one of Pittsburgh s top three restaurants and they earned it  They started in a space the size of their current kitchen  and this was actually the building  and they have since blossomed into a consistent  creative  fun  high end  but not stuffy headed steak house Argentinian style    Everything from the salads with meat added option  which is an excellent value for prime cuts  the side dishes  empanadas  sandwiches  and steak plates are fun  rustic  a touch playful  always delicious  and  simply put  exciting and satisfying eats  I don t really need to break it down because you can find something for everyone here and it will be good  Don t discount how good they can do fish or chicken because they can do it very well   For those that have not been  this is a counter service style restaurant so you cannot save tables or be seated until you have ordered  As part of the success  expect long lines during prime hours particularly power lunches and Friday   weekend dinner  Calling ahead is not always reliable to get your order in but is an option for pickups  The line for the counter can go up to an hour and a half long and on some nights the doors are closed almost two hours before closing time if they are at capacity with a very long line waiting  You will know because end of line will have a wood sign stating they are the last to be admitted    Don t fret though  it is worth coming back another day because what you ll get is worth the wait and the price    and they are still very fair about all of their prices for what is superior quality and you would be charged almost double in a traditional steakhouse

So unbelievably good   I had been to their previous location and loved the food  but the space was beyond small making getting your food to go the only viable option    I was super excited to return once I learned that they had moved a couple doors down into a much larger space with two floors worth of seating  but every time I tried to get there the line to get in was literally around the block  The day we went there was actually no wait so we hurried up and parked and made a beeline to the door   Once inside I was not only blown away by how much nicer the new space was  but by how much was added to the menu since we visited the original location  After about    minutes of staring at the menu board we were ready to order   I chose a Carne ribeye steak sandwich which features your choice of steak with chimmichurri sauce  grilled peppers and caramelized onions  My steak was cooked perfectly  The steak was tender  very juicy and full of flavor  My wife chose the Pollo sandwich which features grilled chicken  pickled red onions  portobello mushrooms and ajo sauce  She absolutely loved it  Our daughter chose the steak burger which features a half pound burger  chimmichurri sauce and your choice of two topping  She added bacon and blue cheese  She loved her burger as well   One thing that I have always loved about Gaucho is that they have always cooked whatever meat I have order just as I ask  It is so hard to get perfectly cooked meat now a days  unfortunately  Service was quick and very attentive  I also like the fact that there is an exit door on the second floor that makes it easy to avoid the line of waiting people downstairs when you are ready to leave   Be sure to try each of their four sauces  Chimmichurri  Argentine Steak Sauce  which has fresh parsley and oregano  garlic  pepper flakes  red wine vinegar and olive oil  Ajo which has roasted garlic cloves with caramelized onions  parsley and pepper with olive oil  Pimenton which has grilled red bell peppers  fresh garlic  parsley  vinegar and olive oil  And Cebolla which has caramelized onion  vinegar  olive oil and parsley  Each sauce is very unique and different and all worth trying
By far the best steak sandwich in the city  toppings are on point and they never fail to cook it to perfection  I could eat here every day

I am not one for hyperbole   But damn  Gaucho Parrilla prepared one of the best sandwiches I have ever had in my life   Please do yourself a favor and check this place out   The food was spectacular   I had the Steak Burger and an empanada   The empanada was just OK in my opinion   I have never been one for Argentine style empanadas so this is probably just bias  still the sandwich was so good I had to give this place   stars    I went with a couple of co workers and we all kind of sat around in contemplative silence when we finished  brains working hard to recall a better sandwich    We all had different sandwiches but left with the same feeling  so I would say feel free to try any  these guys take real pride in what they prepare   I look forward to going back there today and check out another item on the menu before leaving Pitt

This place is tasty and unique  It is one my favorite places that I like to go to during their not so busy times  I eat out a lot so I m not accustom to waiting in long lines   People love this place so at popular lunch and dinner times there will be a line out the door and around the corner   I get it though

My boyfriend and I both really liked Gaucho  He got the Carne sandwich and   piece of sweet steak and I got the beans and greens and Provoletta  We were both pleased with the amount of food and LOVED the AJO GARLIC sauce  yum  Would go back because the prices are fair  BYOB is a plus and it s different from our typical cuisine
No words   Haven t been back since they expanded  but the food is out of this world  The chimichurri sauces are unique  as is the concept   Treat yourself

Loved this place  BYOB  including boxed wine    I don t believe there was even a corking fee  The fish of the day sounded too out there for me so I stuck with the shrimp  Date had the pork chops and they were spicy  But delicious  Will be back soon

As everyone here has already mentioned  Gaucho is amazing  The wait outside moves fairly quickly and is completely worth every second  Once inside  the atmosphere is fantastic   the staff does a wonderful job of keeping it relaxed  hipster ish  and low key  They answered all of our questions and eased us into the entire experience  And so suave   I love that they provide seating but allow the customer to grab their own place settings  glasses and sauces  No cork fee  And the sauces are all delicious  and not spicy     The music is amazing too  like old school  early     s hip hop   Waiting for our food  all we could do was stare at everyone else s dinners with longing eyes  Totally acceptable behavior at Gaucho  btw  I did the Rosemary braised sandwich and it was magnificent  And we split three empanadas  Next time  and there will definitely be a next time  I m definitely going for the grilled corn and an open faced cut that includes a tostado and a side salad  Because I almost attacked my friend s plate for it  The veggies will help break up all the meat and bread   I don t really have to mention it  but everyone needs to stop by  You absolutely won t regret it  Five stars

This place was pretty good  and I totally understand why there are so many positive reviews of this restaurant  The potatoes were super amazing and the sauces added a lot of great flavor  The chicken empanada was awesome  but the beef was only so so   My sister and I were not huge fans of the sandwiches  They had a ton of meat  and we both took a lot of it off our sandwiches  I had the Bandiola  pork shoulder  and my sister had the Carne  steak  sandwich  I thought that the flavors of my sandwich were really interesting  but so intense I could only eat about     of the sandwich  Ditto for my sister   We also got     dozen cookies they had in a display case for the road    hour trip   Those were AMAZING  So  so  good  I think those change day to day  but give their dessert a try

Don t let the line here psych you out   this place is well worth the wait  Plus waiting       minutes for some of the best food in the city shouldn t be much of a deal breaker   Gaucho has a casual counter service set up at the front to place your order  But immediately after you order and pay  you are seated at your own table and its just like any other sit down experience      A friend and I split the special charcuterie board and the Parillada Mixta so we could try the steak  chorizo and chicken  Everything was incredibly flavorful but the steak was  no doubt  the star of the meal  I m also a big fan of sauce  and Gaucho gives you a selection of   homemade dipping sauces     Don t forget its BYO
My absolute favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  Great wood fired food  BYOB  and decent prices
I like the wings a lot  perhaps the best wings in the city   I ve also heard amazing things about the burger  but you can t really go wrong

I m always in the mood for Gaucho  I just moved to the Pittsburgh area  and this is the first place that my girlfriend took me as a welcome to the city meal  I couldn t have been happier    I got the carne sandwich  Amazing steak  The bread doesn t get waterlogged and the paper wrapping doesn t make a mess like it looks like it might    The sauces are incredible  but the sandwiches don t need them    This is the go to place for a treat yourself meal for me  Now that I m in the area  I expect I ll see Gaucho a lot more
The food was awesome  The environment and atmosphere was very hipster ish  The service people were kind and helpful  Not too expensive either  Would go again
Exceptional food   Waited in line outside in freezing weather and don t regret it for one minute

I ve been here a while ago and just writing a review  Definitely come early in the morning  every other time it is packed   Line stretches a block down  Delicious food  Nice portions  Definitely come with friends and have a great time

Just  yes  I took my   years old  there was nothing left on his plate  Great salad  sauce and everything else was a delight  So so fun   delicious  Glad to have tried it   worth going on a splurge or spending less  You ll be happy

After reading all the reviews I can say that the hype about Gaucho is true   The meat is absolutely fantastic   My husband and I split a skirt steak   The only thing is a bit weird is how you order at a counter and sit down for your meal   It is quite pricey for this kind of set up  however given the quality of the food I can let this little detail aside   Make sure you try all of their sauces  absolutely fantastic   I can t wait to come back and try other things

Can t beat this spot  My favorite in Pittsburgh  Food is phenomenal  Staff is quite nice  Today  I got the Bon Mi  It was stellar    I suggest arriving    mins before they open the doors to avoid the rush

Quite simply  the meal was off the charts  Couple that with a modern seating area and fair pricing so if I could give a score higher than   stars I would   Just be aware  the ordering process is when you walk in NOT at the table   So I would recommend reviewing the menu via their website before visiting

I had    hours in Pittsburgh and this is the place that my dad and I really wanted to try   Many Yelp reviews mention the option to call in an order to take out so I was going to try that as our flight arrived after  pm on a Saturday night and I wasn t sure if we would make it by the time we drove down there and had to wait in line   However  when I called the restaurant to place my order literally as soon as I got into my rental car  the person who picked up the phone said that THEY DO NOT DO TAKE OUT ORDERS ON SATURDAY NIGHTS as they don t want to cut the people waiting in line   I guess I can understand that logic  but I haven t seen a Yelp review that mentioned this and there are no mentions of it on their website either   I was definitely bummed  as I explained that I was visiting from CA and when he said that I should visit again on another day  I told him that I would be out of town by the time they opened again  they are closed on Sun Mon    I m sure the food here is amazing  but just had to let the Yelp world know that at least on Saturdays they better plan their schedule to wait in line instead of hoping for take out as you won t have that option

By far my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh right now  Such a cool experience and the food is AMAZING  Definitely recommend to do with friends or date night  it s so unique  Bonus it s BYOB  Can t wait to go back

The line is usually out the door  but it s worth the wait  The food here is amazing  You can t go wrong whether you get a steak or a sandwich  The quality of the desserts is a pleasant surprise  And the prices are reasonable  especially considering the location and the food quality  Don t get scared away by the line and you ll have one of the best meals Pittaburgh has to offer  Gaucho apparently opened a food truck as well  so keep an eye out around town for your Gaucho fix

This place is ridiculous  Visiting Pittsburgh for a day and saw how highly rated it was  so wanted to try for lunch  OH MAN  What a good decision  The food is SO GOOD  We got a flank steak plate and a tilapia  the fish of the day  plate  Both were presented beautifully and were above and beyond our expectations  The four sauce accompaniments that are available are incredible  and I took a special liking to the ajo   We came during off hours on a Tuesday  so there was no wait at all for a table which we were very happy about  having heard people warn of long wait times  The entire meal for the two of us was      which is beyond reasonable for the quantity of the food  For the quality they provide      for those two plates is cheeeeeap   I wish this place were in NYC   I m trying to convince my boyfriend we should go back for lunch before we leave tomorrow

My boyfriend played tour guide for the weekend since he went to college at CMU and knew the area better than me  When I suggested this place for dinner  he said   No way  Yinzers don t eat that   Well he was very wrong and we decided to come here at the advice of our Uber driver  We had the Asado Platter  grits  eggplant  beef and chicken empanadas  This was way too much food for two people but we had to try everything since we had limited time in Pittsburgh  The meat was perfectly charred and done medium rare  per request  and the Asado Platter is a great way for trying all the cuts  I wish more steak houses had this option  The grits and eggplant sides were mediocre but necessary to balance out our very carnivorous meal  I felt the same way about the empanadas  there was a little too much breading for the amount of filling  In the end  my boyfriend also had to admit that this place was pretty great and that Pittsburgh has come a long way since his college days of fried mac and cheese bites  towering sandwiches  and spicy wings    Tip  Dip everything in their   sauces and come early or be prepared to wait  We came    minutes before opening on Saturday and there was already a line of     outside the door

I absolutely love this place  I came in for lunch and there was a wait but it was worth it  The menu consists of several different sandwiches  salads  small plates and entr es  I ordered a pork sandwich  the corn side and split a few empanadas  Everything was made fresh and they had several different delicious sauces to add to your food  The place had a great vibe  I can t wait to go back and try more
This place gets better every time we come  Haven t had one bad dish and everyone working here is happy and helpful  Definitely one of our regulars on the food rotation
This is must see spot for everyone in Pittsburgh  locals or visitors  A unique menu  great atmosphere and great workers   We love the Picasso and the Provoletta  Don t miss this place

Gaucho had been on my radar since they first opened however  I was unable to visit until recently on a trip back to my hometown to visit my family  My mom and I stopped by on a Friday around      pm  The line was relatively short at this time   but by the time we left it was out the door and around the block  When you finally make it past the front door  you are met with a chalkboard featuring the menu all of which made me salivate while reading it    My mom and I  after a few questions about the menu to the lovely cashier  decided to split the Rosemary braised beef sandwich with carmelized onions and horsey sauce  The beef was perfectly seasoned and quite tender  The carmelized onions added a nice sweetness complemented by the kick from the horsey sauce  They have sauces you can choose from and I highly recommend the garlic as it went well with this sandwich  The bread was fresh and was a stealthy vessel for the beef  We also split a side of mushrooms with shallots and rosemary  While these were excellent on their own  I d recommend adding them to the braised beef for extra flavor  Gaucho is BYOB and I noticed several tables  even on a Friday afternoon  taking advantage of this  We both got Diet Coke and never experienced less than half full glasses  Service was top notch and we were checked on a couple of times throughout our meal  I definitely buy into the hype here and would absolutely return on my next trip back to the Burgh

We arrived at        hoping to avoid the lunch crowd   It took us about    minutes to order and another       minutes to receive our food   It was well worth the wait   The pork sandwich and roasted corn were amazing   Just make sure you get there early   the line was out the door as we were leaving
we had empanadas   When we asked the flavors  we were told the main protien but not what else was included   some of which we do not eat

Gaucho has made a name for itself in recent years in the Pittsburgh food scene  Drive by later in the week on the weekend  you ll see a crowd of people wrapped around the outside of the building  Expect a long wait if you go at peak hours  However  I am always impressed with how efficient they are at running the place  they manage their dining room and seating patrons very well  You ll have long forgotten about your wait once you re seated with your food  The menu is very large  always tough what to order  Awesome that their sides make for great share plates  so always fun to get a variety of options for the table  An Argentinian restaurant is obviously heavy on and known for their meat  but expect to be impressed by everything else from their salads  rotating vegetables  sandwiches  etc  I was in last month and inquired about vegan options and was so happy to hear they use oil for ALL of their cooking  So any of the vegetables  breads  salads  etc   can be made vegan or vegetarian  My most recent visit I had the vegetable sandwich and I will say it was WAY too much bread  tough to eat and the fillings got lost  Salads are delicious and fresh  and all their sides are worth trying at some point  Potatoes used to be better years ago they were so crispy and really cooked well  but I wasn t too impressed with them this last time  You must get a sampling of all four of their sauces because each one is super flavorful and unique  A chimmichurri  ajo garlic  pimento red pepper  and cebolla onyinz a caramelized onion sauce  all available for take out as well  BYOB so come with a group and enjoy good company  Lovely ambiance inside with all the rustic wood

The immediate and subsequent surprises you experience when visiting Gaucho Parrilla are more than enough to warrant the five stars that this place has so deservingly received   I d heard tell of this place from a few friends  but for some reason when I hear  sandwich shop  and  the strip  I can only imagine Primanti Brothers  Sadly that image isn t as appetizing to me is it may be to other Pittsburghers   Nonetheless  on a whim  my wife and I decided to drop in here to see what s up and it has since completely rewritten the aforementioned image    Gaucho is the sandwich shop that the city that doesn t need another sandwich shop needed    For starters  the wood fired grill is expertly manned and the resulting meat and veggie creations are tender and flavorful    For enders  the guys running the joint are super friendly and seemingly unflappable    even in the face of a line out the door during a Saturday lunch rush   Great food  sweet vibe  and friendly service  What more do you want  Stop wasting your money on sub par  unhealthy sammies
The setup for ordering is poorly planned but the food makes up for every possible inconvenience

I love the food  the staff  and that you can bring your own booze  Luckily I did not have to wait in much of a line to order  The key is visiting this place on weeknights or early evening to avoid a line  Make sure you try all of their house made sauces
The smokiness of real wood they use for grilling gives the food an intense natural distinct flavor  These guys know their job  Ming Ming rocks

El Gauchos is one of my favorite restaurants in the city  The steak is always cooked perfectly  and it has such a beautiful char to it that makes it irresistible  If you re with a group of people  the asado platter is a MUST   all the cuts are delicious  All of their food is amazing and worth trying    Also  if you like bread  this place has some of the most amazing grilled bread you ll ever have  Trust me  It s better than garlic bread  That s how good it is
Lived up to the hype  I told myself that I wouldn t finish it  watching the waistline   but I couldn t resist  Everyone in the group was very pleased
There is an absolute good reason the line is wrapped around the block on the weekends for this place   it s incredible and worth the wait   I swear

Oh my god this place is amazing  I had never been before but I told my family we would try to get in because I had read great things  We went on a weekday  so the line was short  I had a steak sandwich  which was delicious   It s BYOB so we brought beer from East End  although everyone else was drinking wine  I felt a little out of place    We ended up coming back later in the weekend and waiting an hour  but it was still worth it
Oh man  is this place good  I had to wait about    minutes outside before I got up to order  but it was so worth the wait  Would defiantly recommend this  Mm mm good

This food will punch your mouth in the face  Big  Bold  Freaking delicious  The menu is a little confusing at first and the ordering system feels clumsy   but the food  I had the chicken small plate  husband had a sirloin  Best steak ever  So tender  so juicy  The sauces are all great but the red pepper is the best  If you are visiting  put this on your must do list

Gaucho Parrilla Argentina offered a delicious meal and a wonderfulunique dining experience  For those of you who want a short review  yes  eat here  amazing  great service  best steak burger I ve ever had  just do it   To be more detailed about Gaucho  it s enticing from the start  You walk in and order as if you were at a coffee shop  The lines are usually long enough to peruse the entire chalk board menu  They even have guides on what gaucho defines how they cook their meats  From there  you pay upfront and get seated  While you wait for your food  you have the ability to choose different types of sauces that will complement whatever entree you ordered  I sampled every single one   The food comes  and is outstanding   the service is excellent  and the atmosphere is inviting  The burger was a little more rare than I had expected but still perfection  I can t wait to try more

Overhyped  After walking past the restaurant many times  often seeing a line out the door  we finally had a meal there  The steaks  sirloin and ribeye  were well prepared  The roasted carrots were also good  The ordering process is deliberately slow to align with the preparation time  The result is a long queue in a cramped space  I have no complaints about anything that I ate  However  nothing was so good that I want to return
Amazing     Flavors and textures were awesome    Casual atmosphere   Well worth the wait

Food was very good  and I m not sure you could get better outside of Argentina or Uruguay  where I lived for three years and ate a lot parillada     Arrived about   pm  so our food  while delivered remarkably quickly  was tepid  not hot   The pastry for the empanadas was excellent but the fillings of the beef and chicken were not as flavorful as I had hoped   Both the sweet and the spicy chorizo were excellent  especially with the caramelized onion and peppers they came with   Salads were fresh and delicious  The grilled provolone  one of the great treats of the parilla  was a bit thin  and again  not hot enough  but still delicious   The  Gaucho  ribeye had great flavor but was certainly chewier than it s southern cone cousins   All in all a four star place   We will be back
Overall a bad experience long wait times which is fine  but management and staff were incredibly rude  Will not be visiting again

The food was beyond excellent and service was phenomenal  I lost my CA drivers license on our east coast trip and had no idea where I lost it  I apparently somehow dropped in in this restaurant since they were kind enough to mail it to me  I already had a replacement for my license when I received it but having my original license in hand gives me peace of mind  Thanks for taking the time to mail my license to me  You guys are amazing  Wish we could go back as the food and service there is awesome
This local restaurant was absolutely amazing  I have the vegetable sandwich  The bread was nice and crispy and vegetables were full of flavor  I would definitely eat there again

We are visiting from out of state and let me tell you this is an AMAZING place     We waited around    mins to order and then another    mins for our food but it was totally worth it  We loved the vibe there  super casual with   star food  My boyfriend said it s definitely one of his top   restaurants and we have been to top restaurants all over the world  We got the Cerdo  shredded pork   papas al horno  flank steak plate and shrimp side  Everything was great but we both agreed that our fav was the shredded pork plate  Go there and enjoy   It s worth the wait
Went here for lunch and didn t realize it s all about the sandwich  You really need to know the food so you can make a choice selection  Meat was tasty buy need further review

AWESOME food   You place your order from a large chalk board right as you walk in but they do have seating  There is always a line so be prepared to wait a bit  Everything that I ve ever had here has been great  All of the staff is very friendly and super helpful if you have questions  Don t forget the sauces   They have multiple homemade sauces that you can add to anything  You will not leave this place hungry

Gaucho s has an average rating of   stars  How can we NOT stop by   This place is bustling all hours of the day  We drove past Gaucho s multiple times during our stay in Pittsburgh and there was a line out the door every single time  Rain or shine  Don t be afraid  the line goes quick  I felt like it went a bit TOO quick cause I was still gaping at the wonderful menu plastered on the chalkboard wall    Con pan carne  ribeye steak sandwich       AMAZING  I didn t expect too much from a sandwich that simply has steak  chimmi  onion   peppers  but boy did they serve me wrong  The tangy ness from the chimmi is captured well with the sweet   spiciness of the onion   peppers  Such great harmony  You re probably laughing at my review  but you just don t know  All I can advise is for you to try it   Arrechera  flank steak combo   Steak plate served with salad   toast  Shoot I didn t even bother with the salad   toast cause the flank had me captivated  It was so juicy   tender  All   of gaucho s sauces paired well with the steak and brought out a different charm with each one  I was just a bit upset that the steak came out more medium well than medium rare as requested   Empanada    for      The reason why this review is bumped down to a    It was probably the most untasty empanada I ever had  There was no big difference between the chicken   beef because they both had the same overpowering bitter taste presumably from one of the veggies they used  The chimmi couldn t even save it    The interior is beautifully decorated with cute hippy accents around the restaurant  There is limited seating  If you go to the back room  there is a super low table you can eat on  The bench is higher than the table so you re basically crouching down over your food  Keep in mind that you can NOT sit down until you ordered  They highly enforce the  drinks must be on the table  rule so someone in your party can t save a spot while you order  Keep that in mind

Wasn t sure if it was going to be worth the wait but it sure was  We got the steak platter and sides  The food was amazing and my whole family loved it  even the kids  We would definitely eat here again and I highly recommended it

Excellent spot in the Strip District  Visited recently when I was in Pittsburgh from out of town  Great menu selection of appetizers  mains  including sandwiches  salads  and steak plates  along with sides and desserts  Was there during the weekday lunch hour  which can get quite busy  so plan your order ahead  or come during off peak times if your schedule is tight  The great    s playlist just adds to the whole experience
Mara is incredible opening the wine  I cannot believe how much it cheers me up  Come for the food and hang with Mara

Always a line at this little establishment but worth the wait  The menu is extensive and does take   or   but really maybe    read through to figure out your final decision     empanadas  chicken was the best and veggie came in a close second   The meats were well cooked   got chicken and steak and chorizo   Season was strong but tasty   What I absolutely will order again without a doubt is the flan    That was delicious  Service is very friendly   Only thing I would prefer is traditional style table service rather than counter service

This place was delicious  Good vibes  quick service  decent prices  delicious food  For     I got the flank steak with chimichurri  At first it may not look like it ll fill you up but it was satisfying  The salad dressing was good too  Def a good spot to check out in Pittsburgh

When the line is out the door at      pm on a rainy Saturday afternoon  you know it must be good  It is a one table in and one table out with no reservations kind of deal    but worth the wait   I ordered a couple of small plates as my entree  The empanadas were really good but a bit tiny for the price  The roasted vegetables were on point  The only disappointment was after salivating over photos of the brussel sprouts on yelp and then learning they were out of season  Bummer   If I am in Pittsburgh again I would return  But next time I would know to come about an hour before I want to eat  given frequent line

FYI  This place is where to be     The quaint counter style and simplicity of the interior have nothing in connection with the robust flavors and complex meals   The employees are helpful when ordering and have great suggestions   AND they have Coke in a bottle   I ate the hanger steak and mushroom   I got the small portion of both and still had almost a whole meal left   BYOB if you are to eat there   Be careful  there is limited seating  but the outside area is welcoming when it is nice out    Do yourself a favor and check it out
Fantastic  The reviews are all correct  The food was amazing  The toast was a bit overdone but still tasted great  Too bad it s   hours away from home
So delicious  Friendly staff and reasonable prices  Cute place too  Go early for lunch  the wait can get loooooong  once you try it you ll see why

Gaucho is awesome  Wish they d build another location  There is always a line out of the door and for a good reason  The food is exceptionally flavorful  Get one of the steaks  and try a couple of different menu items  I also really liked the empanadas and the vegetables  It takes patience to wait in that line  but you won t regret it
Great value for your buck  The shrimp is amazing  the sauces too  The red meat was good but it hasn t blown my mind  I only get the sirloin so maybe I didn t hit the right cut with them

Oh ma wurd  How did I not come here sooner  This place is fantastic  Stellar service and amaaaazing MEAT  I had the large  el gaucho  salad with filet done medium well  Perfection  Sat on the patio with friends as well and it was a nice experience  My friend had one of the  chicky  empanadas and it was super yummy  Would come back here in a heartbeat   I appreciated how the employee who explained the meat choices did so very carefully and was considerate about taking his time with me and my friends  We weren t rushed and felt very welcomed   Get here early  The line forms out the door quickly

Amazing  This place is def bang for your buck  I ve been to fancy steak restaurants and this place on another level  It s BYOB without corkage fee and the food is delicious    One drawback was we waited  hr online  The places gets packed and there is typically a line outside to get in
Absolutely amazing  Worth the wait  Extremely nice staff and food is mouth watering  One of my favorite places here in Pittsburgh

Man this place is good  I ve been here several times and I ve always had to wait at least       minutes  However  the wait is well worth it   I haven t been disappointed with anything I ve ordered and for what you get  the price is super reasonable  I will keep going back

This place is tiny but well worth the trip   This is one of the best meals I have had in Pittsburgh ever     We got the mixed plate with steak  chicken and chorizo and every bite was amazing   Best steak I have had in years     Some yelpers said pricey for a walk in shop with no tables but the quality of the food far surpasses many fine dining places in Pittsburgh     This meal would easily cost you         at a fine dining establishment   If you go out to eat for the food above all else this is the place to go   Amazing   I have been thinking all week about my next visit     YUM

Great quality food  Pork empanadas were great  Braised Beef Sandwich  add Avo   was best thing we had  Chicken was solid  not great  but good  Customer was outstanding  Would definitely recommend and come back if ever in area

We had the lamb chops  pulled pork and mushrooms  Everything came with salad and caramelized onions  The meats were so good in their own sauce  you don t need the additional sauces  I ate them all anyway
The food is amazing  I wish that there was more seating so it is hard to come here with a party larger than

I literally have no idea why this place has so many good reviews  The portions are extremely small  I always need a to go container when I eat out  but I was still hungry after this meal  The food was okay  nothing grand at all  Way too expensive for the small portions and nothing special taste

We just had Argentinian food in downtown Pittsburg    amazingly tender meats   wonderful vegetables and tasty sauces  The owner chef is very kind and personable  His assistant is very fast too  Food is better tasting than many more far more expensive steak houses we have been to  There is a reason why this place had a all   star ratings       WELL DESERVED   STARS

Great find while visiting Pittsburgh    We arrived on a Wednesday evening just after  pm  We were told they were closed because the line was already too long to close at  pm    I explained that I have specific dietary restrictions  that make it difficult to eat out and if I could I place a to go order and they obliged  We got our food by      and picnicked across the street    The food was delicious  I was thankful they were accommodating

This is hands down the best restaurant in the entire greater Pittsburgh area    I started coming here over a year ago and it s definitely the first place I take clients when they visit town   If it s your first time here  make sure you come here hungry because you re going to want to try a little bit of everything with your group in a tapas style   I usually order the Parillada Mixta  mixed Empanadas  Camarones  and the potatoes  These never fail me   UPDATE  Gaucho now serves alcohol which makes this a complete experience and you can still BYOB but there is a small cork fee

Yet another treasure of Pittsburgh  The food is to die for   Came here with a couple of friends on a night out and what a pleasant surprise  We stumbled upon it in the Strip District and it was just amazing  We all ordered the grilled chicken breast and papas el horno and they exceeded our expectations  I highly recommend this place to anyone in the Pittsburgh area who wants to try something new

If you are a lover of grilled meats  and really  I am convinced that those who say they aren t are liars        Apparently this is how I started a review of Gaucho in      and then never finished  according to Yelp  Whoops  Well  all I can say is that I love this place  their meats  their sauces  their ambiance  This is the place I tend to take out of towners for a lovely informal dinner  So  so good
The wait kinda sucked       hour wait   but totally worth it the food was freakin amazing

It says this place closes at  pm  Got there at     pm and was told that they were not taking anymore dine in  just carry out only  Also  they have the last dine in customer in line tell other people that they are not taking anymore dine in customers  Shouldn t their staff be doing that   You all are too nice  As a patron  I would not want to take on the stress of turning down other customers and dealing with their complaints  No way  That is management s job  Very unprofessional of this establishment    While I was talking with my partner debating what to do  a staff member locked the door at     pm  Again  this place is supposed to close at  pm  We were then told that they were no longer taking dine in or carryout orders  Not sure if this is a Pittsburgh thing  but in every city that I have lived in  I have never seen an establishment lock their doors before closing time  Very unprofessional   Definitely not going back

Excellent service here  and staffs are all polite and friendly  I really love their beef   sorry for forgetting the name   and their salads is amazing  You can choose different kinds of sauces there  most of which are Argentina traditional sauces  and the spicy one is my favorite  However  with some unknown reasons  their mussels that day were not very fresh  although they guaranteed that mussels are received on that day  Also  the salmon and bread were overcooked that day  We could not have another piece of salmon cuz that was the last one on that day  The food wasn t give me a good reflection  but the manager there was very polite and gave us another bread with some desserts for our lost   Anyway  it s a good restaurant with different and amazing atmosphere  maybe we will come back later

As I am sure is the case for a lot of people  Gaucho was highly touted by many of my friends  I went on a Tuesday night at  pm and had to wait for about    minutes  Thankfully the line didn t quite snake out of the door  and I was able to stay inside in the warmth   The aroma of the wood fired grill and the somewhat rustic look of the interior combine to provide an inviting atmosphere  I liked the fact that part of the kitchen  namely the grill  is exposed to show a glimpse of the inner workings of the restaurant    My party of   ordered the paella and the asado platter  The plate of meat went quickly  but we struggled through the paella  The steak was good  but my favorite part of the meal may have been the sauces  each of the four sauces are delicious and masterfully compliment the steak  One reviewer recommended ordering the paella as a group side dish  which I definitely agree with  Additionally  Gaucho is BYOB  I did not know this but  fortuitously  other members of my party did   Overall  I felt that Gaucho was inviting  fairly priced  and had good food  I won t fault them for the wait time  as it isn t their fault that they re a hugely successful small restaurant  I will  however  admit that friends  prior praises of Gaucho placed lofty expectations in my head  While I felt Gaucho was good and maybe even worth another stop  I did not feel that it was exceptional  So  in a review of my expectations  Gaucho gets

While in The  Burgh this place is a MUST   Delicious food  fantastic staff  great vibe   I had the Small rib eye for my entree    medium    Slammin     The sides  are shareable   brocolini   red potatoes w Rosemary  cauliflower  were all on point     Ot was busy when we were there line out the door  but wait was not bad at all   Ordered our food with the cashier   got a table and food arrived promptly and did not disappoint     If you want feel like a good steak  this place is great

Food is really great once you order it comes fast but the line takes awhile and we had to wait outside for a considerable amount of time and it was really cold  They don t take reservations so keep that in mind  Overall  lots of choices and you can get   different complementary sauces  my favorite is the yummy one  Reasonably priced  Good place to go with a group  It s BYOB  don t forget  Good portion sizes as well

Momijis is one of the best gems in Florida    They made me fall in love even deeper with sushi   My favorites are the Russian revolution sushi and the hibachi scallop and chicken over noodles    It is to die for   Also  It s a great family restaurant that s elegant yet very hip and very cool   Furthermore  I see that the manager WORKS VERY hard to please her customers  She is very nice  sweet  personable  fun  a cool person  I give a big thumbs up

When I went here  it was my first time having Argentinean steak  so I wasn t too sure what to expect  The first impressions weren t too great  lunchtime on a weekend made the already small place quite crowded  so there was little room to navigate or try to understand the somewhat confusing menu without getting in someone s way    The menu was clear in what we could order  but the layout made it hard to read  especially the appetizers and veggies going down the side on the left  unless we were already in line  which wasn t optimal since we haven t decided on anything yet  As embarrassing as it was  we could not figure out the difference between the meats by themselves  was it just meat with nothing else   and the steak sandwich  meat plus   peppers and onions   And why were some of the pequenos just as expensive as the sandwiches     We saw a lot of people going with grilled corn  which looked delicious  but we couldn t find it on the menu either  later we realized we could ve just added it on   And an extra buck per vegetable on the sandwich   Call me spoiled but a really nice suggestion would be to just create some combo orders that include something like a sandwich  a small dish  and a drink  water didn t seem to be an option btw    Okay so we were probably mostly just being silly in failing to navigate the menu properly or get help  but we did end up with two quite delicious steak sandwiches of ribeye and skirt steak  Luckily we were able to find a table outside  and the steak did make up for the confusing experience at the beginning  It was juicy with a touch of char  and the entire sandwich was pretty tender  Next time we ll be sure to know what s going on and know what to order ahead of time

I was in PA over the weekend  and decided to venture into Pittsburg  but prior to going i needed a place to satisfy my meat cravings  I did a yelp search of course and the places that were popping up  i was uninspired  lo and behold i see this place Gaucho  It piqued my interest since it was Argentinian  What made this place a no brainer to go to was the consistent   star ratings  Yes  my decision was done Gaucho P  it was  I was not disappointed  i wasn t going to drive    mins to the strip and then order a sandwich  i went big and ordered the Asada Platter  which is more than a generous portion of   cuts of meats  grilled and seasoned to perfection  I ordered it to go  They were out of empanadas or as they said their machine was broken  The selections the seasoning the chimmichurri sauces that i scooped up fantastic  I have had   meals on those meats and i intend to come here again when i am in the area  Cheers

Great Service and wonderful food  Finished every last bite wishing that there was more  A little bit pricey for your typical college student but definitely a great place to BYOB and chill with some close friends  It s a nice and chic updated place they got there    If you re a fan of meat  it is a must that you go here
This place is for the meat lovers and meat lovers only  just kidding  they have salad and fish

Unpopular opinion of the century alert  I know this place is talked up quite a lot and voted on all sorts of lists  but I just do not get it  I ve been here two or three times and have been disappointed  The meat is always charred and I can not tolerate what I feel is purposely burnt food  It makes me gag  Blegh  I ve had good vegetables here  but um  I can make those at home no problem  A lot of their menu is in Spanish  at least the section titles  which I get and is cute but it confuses a lot of English speaking folks and makes the line move that much slower because YES  there will be a line  Nothing wrong with English in parentheses  Last time I was here I did enjoy their chicken sandwich  but would not make it a point to come back for another  Their sauces are good as well  I will give them that

When I first came to Gaucho  it was because the smells of meat caught my nose and I followed it   My girlfriend and I came in and we were the only people there  So we were greeted with a loud  HELLO  from all of the staff  As soon as we told them that it was our first time  they took us through the menu and answered every question  The whole time  everyone was smiling  music was playing in the background  and there was one guy just dancing  The whole vibe made me happy and couldn t help but smile   Gaucho does meat right  Steaks were juicy  tender  and seasoned perfectly  Seriously  other people should take note  good quality food  good technique  good flavors  I didn t care how messy the sandwiches were  I didn t care that it was wrapped up in paper and not served on a shovel chalkboard etc  What I got was honest  fantastic cooking  No fancy stuff to trick you into thinking something tastes good   I ve come back multiple times and each time has never disappointed  The have expanded recently and I haven t had a chance to go  However  the line going down the street speaks to how their passion for food has paid off

I am in the afterglow phase of one of the most amazing dinners I have had in Pittsburgh  Or ever for that matter  The flank steak is next level  The pork is amazing  The toast and sauces are top notch  Even the salad was good  The veggies have this interesting smoked flavor that works with the meal  Very few times does the place live up to the hype  but this was one of those times

Do not come here unless you are willing to swallow your food and leave immediately after   Because the food was delicious  my friends and I kept ordering more without hesitation  tipping generously along the way   Clearly the wait staff did not care about allowing us to enjoy our meals and desserts and attempted numerous times to clear our plates when it was obvious that we were not finished eating   At one point  as were drinking our coffee  one server gave us  a    minute warning    When I contacted management  they made excuses and said they would give us a gift certificate  but never followed through   Arrogant and tacky

Best taste and value if you want to eat in the city of Pittsburgh  This place doesn t just go up on a Tuesday  it goes up all day erryday  Delicious food and flavors  doesn t matter if you get steak  fish  chicken  vegetables   I don t eat pork but I regret it every time I come here  because I bet its that good     Gaucho was my first exposure to Argentine foods  and man was it a homer  I got the braised beef the first time  They gave a sandwich the size of a damn brick and spots were hit  I also got the chicken sandwich and where it didnt measure up to the braised beef  it was a     in taste  They got some awesome sauces available too  I like the red one I cannot recall the name  Second time I came here I got the braised beef again  but I also tasted the Ribeye and Fish sandwiches  those two were both also incredible and comparable to the Braised Beef that I got    We also got the the Empanadas  which were a great little side    This place gets packed  so to save yourself the time of waiting       mins for your food  call ahead and order it  i am yet to successfully do it  but thats my plan for the next time    A Pittsburgh Ace in cuisine  Affordable  Clean  Good Service  Foreign Tastes that don t disappoint  BYOB    Bottom Line  This perfect deserves a perfect rating and that is exactly what it gets from me

My husband and I went there on a Saturday afternoon and it was absolutely packed  They had to stop taking orders for fifteen   minutes to allow the chefs to get caught up  The wait was certainly worth it  We ordered the ribeye sandwich  chicken sandwich  a side of vegetables and side of potatoes  Everything was cooked to perfection  I don t think I have ever had a better pulled chicken sandwich  the meat was juicy but still large bites  not shredded  It was truly delicious and everyone in there was raving about it

The place is good  Great food with reasonable price  While you have to wait in long line to get served  but it s easy to get seated  because there is plenty of space outside  and on the upper stairs  Easy to find parking lots  but not free

Hopping place   Long line but nice to talk to people   Very neat menu  so many choices    Ordered Asado platter   A lot of steak   Sauces are delicious   Chino sauce is especially tasty  but pimento has roasted red pimento peppers in vinegar   These light up all of your tastebuds   Roasted vegetales round out the meal   Nice spot in the Strip  close to the city    Great for date night    The sauces bring out the flavor of the meat and sensations stimulate the palate   The portobello mushroom was exquisite   This is a must visit restaurant in Pittsburgh

The food here is fantastic and the prices are very reasonable  Although this is my first check in here it is not my first visit  I ve been here  x before  I won t dwell on the food  let others gush  The only thing I don t like about it here is the ordering system  No reservations  The way it works is you order at the counter and then they seat you then bring your food out to you  This doesn t sound bad until you discover how popular it is here  The line often snakes out the door  which also doesn t sound bad except during a Pittsburgh winter  snow or rain  Once you get inside the large chalkboard menu makes you kinda glad for the wait as your mouth waters over all the choices and you likely will over order  The staff here is friendly and pleasant  Be sure to BYOB  bring your own beer or bottle of wine or else enjoy a limited selection of soft drinks or water  Btw  to give you an idea of the wait I wrote this while in line  Don t let any of that discourage you  the food is worth every minute    If you enjoyed this review do me a favor and vote for it or throw me a bone of a compliment

How anyone can give this place anything besides   stars is beyond me  Hands down the best tasting meat you will eat in the greater Pittsburgh area  The line can get VERY long during peak meal times  so be prepared to wait     minutes before you even get in the door  There s absolutely no question that the food is worth the wait though  you will not regret waiting in line

Tried Gaucho at lunch and was very pleased by the food and the service   two    somethings held down the crowd that was exploding on to Penn   I had a braised beef  carmalized onion and horseradish delight   Also tried the spicy Chorizo   a side of tatters and washed it all down with a blood orange soda   They sell out of empenadas so I missed testing   Food was great only complaint is no room to enjoy dining in   I had a seat but the crowded space and setting was sub prime

I was in town for one day and saw that Gaucho had been getting rave reviews  Boy were they correct  I ordered the Rosemary braised beef sandwich which was juicy and every bit as delicious as I imagined  Definitely a go to spot in Pittsburg
Stopped by here to eat randomly and it was absolutely delicious  I live out of state and I m going to be back in town soon  I ve already made plans to stop here for lunch at least once while I m back

Don t really understand the hype if I m being perfectly honest  The food isn t that special and the wait is ridiculous  I could get a steak just as good at a steakhouse and not waste   hours  The process for ordering and getting food is also complicated and unnecessary  All of the staff members are super friendly  That s why they are getting a few stars

Absolutely amazing food and service  Such a great place  Husband said it s the best steak he s ever had  The empanadas were fantastic and the side of roasted carrots are amazing  Must go to in Pittsburgh strip district

This was probably the best meal I have had in Pittsburgh and I cannot say enough good things about this place  I got the steak burger with avocado and pickled onions and it was cooked to perfection  And the toasted bread that it was served on was also fresh and delicious  The burger was so flavorful on its own  though they do offer a nice array of sauces to add more flavor  They have   sauces that you can try as much as you want of  and each sauce is tailored to a specific kind of meat  though you can combine how ever you want  I liked all of them  but the one that was meant for the red meats was my favorite   The wait staff was very friendly and helpful  They have a system where you order as a whole group up at the register  you sit at a table  and then you will get all of your food at the same time  I personally like this system better than the typical waiting for the check system   My friend and I got there at about      on a Thursday  and we got there just as crowds stared to pour in  This place gets super crowded  so I would recommend getting there before      on Thursdays Saturdays at least   Overall  one of the best meals I ve ever had and definitely the best in Pittsburgh

This place was hoppin  not like a fogo de chow  this is pick from a board and get your drink  head to the table they bring your food  and it was superb  Steak and chimi chiri was excellent  pepper and onion were the best  Only thing was not impressed with were the empenada  had steak and chicken kinda dry  Veggies were awsome  Will definitely go back  Staff was great as well

Arrived at Gaucho for lunch  just after noon  and the line was already out the door and around the corner  I had heard so much about this place but apparently missed the concept  because I was very skeptical as to if this place could really be worth it   This is not a traditional sit down style restaurant  you order your food at the counter upon walking in and are then able to choose a seat  they do have an outdoor courtyard area  but with the heat we chose to stay indoors  where you will be served cleaned up after  Thus  while the line outside is a little inconvenient  it moves quickly and is very deceiving of how long you will have to wait   I was still skeptical of this style of dining at first  but for lunch it was great    I was very overwhelmed with menu  mostly because everything sounds so good and all the salads sandwiches sides are very reasonably priced  approx     for a sandwich  there are a few bigger ticket items on the menu such as their paella and vaca  meat  platter  but by the sounds of it they would make it worth your dollar   The staff is very friendly and helpful explaining the menu and making recommendations  I decided to take a healthy route and got the argintino salad  which is the same as the gaucho salad but with more  this took me a minute to understand upon first look at the menu   You can pick really any cut of meat to add  and the host helped me decide on the flank steak  I guess I wasn t really paying attention to what I was reading  because when it came out I was veryyyyyy pleasantly surprised that their were also potatoes on the salad  like an Argentinian play on a Pittsburgh salad with fries   My guest got the bondiolo sandwich  and said it was the best sandwich he s ever had  even though I only got the smallest bite  I would probably agree   I wish I had more time in Pittsburgh to go back and try some of the others   We left absolutely stuffed  excited to finish our leftovers later

Closed their doors an hour before their scheduled closing time and shut off their phones with only half capacity  Gaucho wants to shepherd their customers through the restaurant with the same care as the beef they serve and care little about the customer experience

Good food  However the owner was rude  We walked in and started to look at the menu on the wall and he immediately came over and started barking about keeping the path clear for existing customers  I won t go back because of that d     no matter how good the food was

Came here with my SO on a Pittsburgh trip and decided to try Gaucho Parrilla because of all the great reviews  While I was definitely INCREDIBLY impressed with the rib eye platter  and would come again on future trips solely for that  I found the sandwich and veggie platter disappointing    We waited in line for about    minutes  the line is outside  beware on hot days  before were ordered and were able to sit  It seems that the hold up isn t so much space seating as much as the fact that there is only one person taking orders  so hopefully the restaurant adds an additional register soon    The food   Rib eye platter  This is why you come  for the straight meat dishes  The rib eye was DELICIOUS and I m not normally that into meat  It was cooked perfectly and was amazing on its own  but there are dipping sauces in case you want any extra flavor    Rosemary Beef Brisket  Good but VERY oily and very heavy  I would skip this and get one of the cuts of meat w salad bread instead    Small veggie platter  We ordered the veggie platter for something healthy in anticipation of eating way too much meat  but unfortunately the veggie platter itself was oily     Peach cobbler  Solid  but no different than any other peach cobbler you ve had     BYOB so come prepared    Come early to avoid the line

My husband and I decided to try Gaucho for my birthday yesterday  after hearing nothing but praises by friends over the past couple of years  They were certainly not wrong  We waited in line for maybe half an hour  which for good food is not long at all  I had the pollo and my husband had the carne sandwich  We also ordered a side of potatoes  Everything came fast  it was hot  and amazing  My husband said it was the best steak sandwich he s ever had  We tried all of the sauces with our potatoes  our favorite hands down was the red pepper sauce  All of them were tasty though  We will definitely be back again

Amazing restaurant with plentiful vegetarian options   at the top of my list of favorite Pittsburgh restaurants   I normally get   empanadas    daily types of empanadas  with one of them always being vegetarian  and the Vegetale sandwich  As I am not a huge fan of mushrooms  I usually request that provolone cheese be used to replace the mushrooms in the sandwich  which the employees are always happy to oblige with  with no hassle or extra cost  Keep a look out for the seasonal pasta special as well  a good mix of tangy aioli sauce and vegetables  Also  the condiment sauces are to die for  Be sure to use these generously with any entree you order   BYOB  I d recommend going at off peak hours  for example    PM for early dinners  to ensure the line does not get too long  since they don t take reservations
O  M  G  Best food I ve eaten out in like forever  Terrific service too  Fun ambiance  You go here  You go here now

This place is definitely worth the hype  Every time I ve been there the line has been out the door  but it moves very quickly  They have someone delegating where you should sit which helps with the wait time worry around finding a place to sit  I m on a strict diet for lifting and their meat veggie options fit into my diet  Highly recommend the flank steak

The food is so good  Even the grilled bread is mouth watering  I love that it is byob  We stopped in for dinner one night  We were asked if we wanted to go downstairs for the chefs tasting  It was     per person and worth every penny  We got to try a little bit of everything on the menu   I highly recommend

Excellent quality meats and so many to choose from  The hype is real  I got the carne sandwich with filet mignon and the papas al horno on the side  Everything was so fresh and you could tell they use high quality ingredients  Steak was tender and cooked to perfection  The caramelized onions and roasted red peppers were the perfect accompaniments in the sandwich  A little heavy on the bread but you can order it breadless or open face  I just took off the top piece and ate it with a knife and fork  It was perfect  Papas were served with rosemary and roasted garlic cloves  What stands out are the   sauces that are self serve on the  nd level   chimichurri  ajo  garlic   cebolla  caramelized onion   and pimenton  smoky red pepper   My favorites were the cebolla and pimenton  Put some on every bite to experience the different flavor combos   Food came out promptly and service was friendly   Will definitely stop by again to try more items the next time I m in town
There is a good reason for the   stars review  It is just awesome  The sandwiches are spectacular and so tasty  Great job guys
I had the Palletina Decornado  I forget the spelling   The grill lamb strip was not what I expected   But the Empanadas was fantastic
Great food but the wait was CRAZY  Didn t order nearly enough food to quench my hangry ness  Shrimp was fantastic but not quite filling

WORTH THE WAIT  I think this was one of the only dinners that was eaten in complete silence because we were enjoying the food that much  Seriously one of the best meals I ve ever had   The large rib eye  the rosemary braised beef sandwich  a small order of vegetables  and grilled corn was perfect to leave us very satisfied    I think the flavors of the meat and veggies were so amazing that when we tried the empanada  it was just average so I ll skip that the next time

Stopped in the newly expanded joint on Saturday for lunch and it was just as delish and magical as the first time I went  I love the new set up  and particularly all the windows  Its also such a cool concept where you seat and sorta serve yourself  but there is also staff that comes around to check on you and refill drinks   LOVE this place  as always   If you haven t come here yet  what are you waiting for  I will say that you should get their early  We arrived around       and there was a line  but by the time we left around       the line was out the door
I d rather avoid the long lines  and BYOB  and go to a good Brazilian BBQ place   The food here is fine  but just not worth the wait and ensuing chaos
Very busy every time I go but it is worth the wait  Great food and priced reasonably    Chorizo sausage is the best and they let you bring your own wine with no corkage fee

Come by around  pm and they were out of half the items we wanted  We were staying in a hotel with an infant  so we decided to get take out  We ordered a few sides and the Ribeye Vaca  large   We were assured it came salad as stated on the menu  When we got back to our hotel we noticed it was clearly absent and weren t about to walk back to the store for a salad   The relatively small steak and toast were not worth the price paid   Last time we went  in their old facility  it was one of the best meals I have had   Sad

Came here after a day s work and finishing a job site  Let me tell you this food just made me sooooo happy    We had the Pollo al a parilla with a beautifully cooked flank steak with corn pudding   The food was sooo good   The service and staff was excellent as well the decor was homey and earthy    I will definitely be coming back here

Wow  Gaucho has some of the best steak  We came around   pm on a Friday afternoon  so there was a bit of a line  With maybe       or so people in front of us  the line moved pretty quickly    After ordering in the front  they tell you what table to sit at  When your order is ready they call your name  All of the sauces are so flavorful and fresh  I liked the caramelized onion and of course the chimichurri too    The steak in the sirloin was delicious  So flavorful  juicy and that perfect smokiness from the wood oven    It s well worth it  and Gaucho has great vibes too  Don t miss it

Excellent service  delicious food  friendly and attentive staff  and ordering paying at the counter first gets the boring stuff out of the way  We were staying close by and every time we walked by the place it was mobbed  always a good sign   We popped in a little after    AM today and since they had just opened it was much quieter  The food came out so quick  This was our last meal in Pittsburgh and it was easily the best  We were pleased to have accidentally saved the best for last  I m sure I ll be dreaming of that ribeye plate from     miles away with an ache in my stomach    if you read this  please order it on my behalf

The meat here is excellent  That deserves a five star  The ordering process makes some sense for the business based on how they operate   However for the customer it s just confusing  I had about four to employees invoked in between ordering  serving  and clearing my table  They were all nice so while confusing still five stars    I ordered the sandwich  Too much bread    but other than that delicious  So my tip just order the meat  Forget the sandwich  Delicious but what you really want is the meat   This place is one of those amazingly good restaurants with some stupid quirks    Oh and Jesus    Great bathrooms  Literally smelled fresher in the bathroom than outside
