This place is fabulous   I got two sandwiches so I could share with my friend   This place is more for take away or outside dining which is kind of small   The day I went it was very hot outside   And at around   pm there were   people in there waiting until I showed up then the small store front got packed and even hotter when they fired up that wood grill    The man who took my order was very friendly  The sandwiches were delicious   I got the filet sandwich and the chicken and can honestly say these were the best sandwiches we have had in a long time   I tried most of the sauces and they were very flavorful   I dropped the sandwich halves to my friend who was working and he texted me to say  how much he loved them and how good the sauces were    This place is a must try  I can t wait to try more of their items

My friend and I went here for her birthday today  I have never been here or heard of the place until the other day when my friend was talking about how good the food is  I decided to try it today to see for myself  I ordered the chicken and beef empanadas  the roasted carrots with goat cheese and the yerba mate tea  The empanadas were delicious very filling   the roasted carrots were probably the best I ve ever had especially with the goat cheese on them they were perfect and the yerba mate tea was good it s unsweetened though so you have to add your own sweetener to it  They have salsas set up in the front of the restaurant you can get yourself to add to your food  I would definitely come back here they have so many different options on the menu I d like to try more of them  They also have BYOB that s always a bonus

This place is amazing  Don t be discouraged if there s a line outside because it s worth the wait  I ordered the flank steak and it was the most tender and flavorful meat I had and the bread was so crispy  I will definitely be coming back to this place  Don t forget to bring your bottle of wine

Visiting Pitt from Philly and this is easily the best restaurant I ve ever been to  Everything on the menu is amazing and perfect  from the meats to the salads to the side dishes  The atmosphere is friendly and warm and the lines are definitely worth it

Been living in Pittsburgh for almost a year and after a few failed attempts of coming here on a Sunday and also coming way to close to closing time  we finally made it    And the line was long  But we finally got our carne and bondiola sandwiches  and they were absolutely delicious     I asked the girl who took me order what she would recommend for my carne sandwich  and she said the sirloin  which was a little tough  I will get the ribeye next time  My husband had the bondiola and he loved it more than the carne  My only wish was that they didnt serve it on ciabatta bread  We also got the gaucho papas and maiz  which was fine  we ll just be sticking to the meats and sandwiches in the future though  because they are incredibly filling    and I would much prefer not making room for anything else other than my carne sandwich  And the sauces     My favorite is the garlic

Hands down the BEST food I ve had in Pittsburgh  The hype is real  The food is incredible   Customer service was good too  I totally understand why people brave the mood swings of the weather and wait outside in a queue to get a table    We got four dishes  The que que chicken  steak platter  mushrooms  and flan for dessert  Each of them were delicious on their own  perfectly seasoned and the balance of the flavors were fingerlicking good  The sauces they have also paired quite well with everything    When my friends and family come to visit  this restaurant is on the top of the list of restaurants I will introduce to them
Can t believe I waited four years to go to this place while my son was in college in Pittsburgh  Truly a local treasure

This place has   stars for good reasons     The food is extraordinary and the service as well  Very complex tastes  We tried the Pollo sandwich  the fillet steak plate and a grilled corn  All were out of this world  Best steak I ve ever had  Don t miss their food if you re in Pittsburgh

Lives up to the hype  I d wait in line for a couple of hours to eat here    We came at  pm on a Friday  No line   winning so hard  I think the magic starts here in two ways  First  the wood fired oven they use  so the type of wood  and the high temp   and the freshness of the meat  which is all from regional providers   Beyond the meat  ALL of the ingredients were so fresh  and such high quality  that you wonder how the prices on the menu aren t higher    Everything we had  empanadas  provoletta  chicken sandwich  and the gaucho platter were divine  Of course  their four housemade sauces are seemingly made by the hands of angels   My   year old niece begged us each day after to take her back here  This place could be a Paleo Paradise  but the bread is so so so good  from a local bakery  can t recall which one  that you re going to go all in on the carbs  This is one of those times when each bite you take  you have a foodgasm  and you  perhaps awkwardly note  that everyone around you is experiencing the same thing     Not cheap by any means  but you re getting top quality food prepared with expert precision  so worth every penny  Highly recommended

Second time at this restaurant and I still love it  Unfortunately we had to wait    minutes on a Tuesday evening to order but the food was still delicious  We wanted to order empanadas as our appetizer but they only had   left at     pm    I got the Argentinio salad and it was huge  The papas  potatoes  were slightly hard but all the other vegetables were grilled nicely and served hot warm over the salad  Mixed some of the veggies with the sauces they provide on the side and it was a treat  My friend got the catch of the day  Salmon  and it was cooked very well and was soft and flakey  definitely recommend this   The service is always great and everyone is super friendly and casual

You best come early to this place if you don t want to wait   There is a reason why the line is always long   their food is simply delicious  They make homemade sauces and their meat is seasoned to perfection  I personally get the rosemary braised beef  either as a sandwich or on one of their salads  Staff is always helpful and knowledgeable about their menu  You order at the entrance then sit and your food is brought out to you  Check it out

One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh  as their food is very flavorful   In particular  I really like their ribeye steak sandwich as well as the potatoes  Gaucho papas    I took a star out because they re somewhat victims of their own success    the restaurant is always crowded with a line out of the door and the seating is limited  even after expanding their space

Gaucho offers almost  every  kind of meat  and it s my favorite spot in town for a cheap but delicious sandwich   If you re unlucky you might have to wait for a bit  sometimes the line is     people   but it s totally worth it and hopefully it s not raining outside  You order at the counter  and then wait for the order at your table   I typically get the sandwiches like bondola or braised beef with a bunch of sauces  Salads are tasty and pretty big  this is about the small salad

Amazing food  Great service  I ve been there about       times the food is high quality every single time  The only downside is that long line outside the place which you can t really fault them for  The braised beef sandwich is absolutely delicious  The quality of ingredients is noticeable and the menu is diverse  I m glad I found that place  Definitely a go to place when I m in the area

Amazing food   worth the wait   Every single item melts in your mouth   I don t know how they manage to consistently produce excellent food with amazing flavor   We come back again and again   You can t go wrong here

On the pricier side  If you aren t in the mood for meat you ll have trouble here  I cane here for my roommates birthday and had the Provoletta and two empanadas  Everything tasted good but I will probably not be back

Probably one of my favorite establishments in my very brief adventures in Pittsburgh  I got there after work and was greeted by a line that circled the shop onto Penn Ave  This was probably the most unfun part since it was starting to get cold and I forgot my thicker jacket  Several patrons had the right ideas of bringing some beers to enjoy  which was the better idea it took almost    mins to get inside  Side note  BYOB and no corkage fee   I ordered the carne con pan  which is basically a steak sandwich with roasted bell peppers  caramelized onions  and chimicurri inside  I chose the ribeye  cooked medium rare  of course   and I was not disappointed  These folks know how it cook it right  HOWEVER  skip the roasted bell peppers as they overpower the meat  The extra sauces salsas on the side it made it that much better  And if they have it  grab a side of the marinated eggplant   straight fire   Good stuff  I ll be back again soon when the line is shorter

I can t believe I haven t reviewed Gaucho yet  The food is amazing  especially the sauces  I normally don t eat beef  but I do here  because it s so good  The menu is very reasonably priced for the quality and quantity you get  and it s not a concept that you see in every city  at least I don t know of any in Portland yet   I always take out of town guests here as a starting point in our food crawl tour of Pittsburgh    I try to come at off hours or order ahead for pick up  I stick to the steak or Rosemary braised beef sandwich  I ve had the fish and chor y pan  but wasn t too impressed  Beef is definitely the star here

Amazing food  The sandwiches are the best deal as you get to pick your cut of meat for the same price  It s an order at the counter then sit kind of place  Make sure your whole party is there when you walk in  They won t seat you otherwise  You can also bring in your own bottles of wine  No corkage fees

It doesn t surprise me at all that this is the    Yelp restaurant and has been for quite some time  Whenever anyone visits from out of town  I try to take them here  The food is AMAZING  Seriously some of the best meat I have ever had  I ve had a bunch of different cuts and none of them have been disappointing  I usually go for one of the steak platters  although they have sandwiches and some other dishes as well  The platters are a great value since it is a good portion of very high quality meat  a piece of toast and a small salad  I ve occasionally gotten a side of veggies or brussel sprouts to share and YUM   Seating was a nightmare when it was about half its size  but now that they have expanded  there is much more  I have occasionally had to wait for a table  especially with a larger party if going during peak hours  I ve driven past this place when there is a line out the door  I would try to go during non peak meal hours  but it is worth the wait anytime    The staff are always pleasant and extremely friendly  This place is A  all around and I can t wait to go back for more

Actually  I had my reservations because I was worried this place was  just hype      however  Gaucho s goes beyond just  meat ing  your expectations  For anyone who argues otherwise is mis  steak  en  trust me   There tends to be a long line out the door for a reason  The food speaks for itself  For the quality of the meats  prices are very modest  There s no unnecessary  fluff  when it comes to Gaucho s  It s authentic  raw  pun unintended  and straightforward  You want well cooked  nicely seasoned meat  Go to Gaucho s    FOOD  I tried the  Asado Platter  which features   different types of meat  about     pieces each  cooked medium rare  the only way meat should be cooked     delicious  If I were to be more critical  some of the meat was a little overcooked  but this didn t discourage me from eating everything  Needless to say  I didn t really have a reason to complain  The accompanying sauces  which were in cute mason jars  were also great  I personally liked them all  I had a lot of fun pairing certain cuts with different sauces  I wish I had a salad or something acidic to cut through the heartiness of the meats    but again  this isn t something I m complaining about  more so me planning my next trip     SERVICE  The workers were very chill and friendly  They definitely know how to handle  hangry  people professionally    ATMOSPHERE  Although I didn t get to see the  upstairs  or elevated platform  I enjoyed the  vibes  of the place  Everything felt rustic  raw  again  pun unintended  and warm   Would I go again  Yes  but I ll be sure to go on an empty stomach  portions are very generous  in my opinion

Good not great  Going to this place for the first time I had extremely high expectations based on the reviews that I read  My date and I each got a speciality sandwich along with an appetizer and everything was just okay   Other than the meat being cooked to perfection  nothing was out of this world  We are looking to go back to this place soon to give them a second chance and to try something not from the sandwich menu     I would like to point out that the BYOB aspect of this place is great and the service was very good

I m not quite sure I ve had a REAL steak sandwich prior to my encounter with the ribeye carne steak sandwich here  My word   what do I say    First off  let me say their customer service is AMAZING  I called for takeout within the hour before closing and apparently they ve turned folks away in the past but the gentleman on the other end of the line made an exception for me  I m SO glad they did  I placed my order for the carne and grilled corn and was a advised it would be about    minutes    I arrived on the scene with my gangsta lean    oh wait  that s a song  Sorry not sorry   Anyway  I walked in and was smacked in the face with the aroma of garlic and roasted  grilled meat  If they made a perfume out of that  I might be tempted to buy  I looked around and noticed the homemade chimichurri sauces  There was a group of   in front of me but the sweet guy at the counter looked around them to greet me and offer his help  I explained I was there for pickup and he turned to grab my bag of yum  He proceeded to explain each of the chimichurri sauce offerings and neatly packed up a hefty sample of each one to go  Did I say the customer service here is AMAZING     I headed back to the car so I could head towards home to conquer and devour     Once home  I opened my bag and pulled out the little parcels  each of which wreaked of yummy garlic  First I opened the sandwich which was huge  It had onions which were perfectly grilled and sweet  The red peppers added a subtle sweetness which complimented the sandwich  The meat was tender and the taste screamed Brazilian steakhouse   Yes  I said Brazilian   carry on   I mean it was perfect  Even the bread was fresh and perfect for this meal  Oh God  I m sweating and salivating just thinking about it  Now on to the corn  It wasn t the frozen stuff or baby corn on the cobb  It was a whole cobb of corn roasted to perfection and wrapped to go  Yummy   Just about every other Yelper thinks the same   this place is AWESOME and it s officially on my faves list

I have a couple good things to say  a couple not so good things to say   However  Everything aside our lasting impression was made the last few moments as we were about to leave the waitress approached our group spread out her     dollar tip and said  this is all you left   just wanted you to know  If that s okay with you then fine  I just did a lot    I did not drink that evening  everyone else took advantage of the BYOB  Someone in my group handed her    more dollars    before I could stop them   The cash she claimed to  have left over  as her tip didn t match with The money she was given  Additionally  she did not include the     dollars in tips off those who paid with a credit card   I won t be back  it was so uncomfortable  And I feel she was dishonest  whether by mistake in counting wrong or on purpose  In general not okay  Update  I got a message asking if my review was for the wrong place  we were in the lower bodega area  where there are wait staff  Just want to ensure it s clear since the top portion of the place must operate very differently

Although this is a fun and casual place for dinner with friends  I think the seasoning on the food here is overwhelming  The steaks are also pretty expensive for the amount you get  about     slices for small  which typically runs me         Their sauces are colorful and interesting  but way too oily  I also don t understand why they would serve the steaks with chimichurri sauce if they think we would also like to try their other sauces  The rub for the meat is also too salty anyway  I wish I could appreciate all the flavors in their sauces  but I think to save on costs they dilute the sauces down with oil  I have tried to reproduce some of their sauces at home and I can guarantee they are more interesting with less oil    Food also takes awhile to be served  but they are BYOB so drink it up while you wait it out    Overall  I keep coming back mostly for the cool vibes and decor  but the steaks could be so much more

Not worth the hype    First freeze your ass off outside for    min  then another    min till you order   Then they bring everything out at the same time   Appetizers and entree   Watch your food turn cold as you eat   Kills your appetite  Not coming back
A must visit in PIttsburgh   Wish I lived closer so I could eat here every week
Brilliant  Cannot go wrong with any of the selections  Definitely recommend trying the empanadas and then on of their sandwiches  DO NOT FORGET THE SAUCE

I ve been here twice now and each time gets better and better  I am OBSESSED with Gaucho  The menu is huge   I feel like you can t go wrong with whatever you get  There are so many options  from sandwiches  to small   large plates  to appetizers   more  This place is incredible  I ve never had a wait before ordering which is always nice  The first time I was here I got their catch of the day which happened to be salmon  It was INCREDIBLE  And the serving of salmon was huge  It was served with a side salad and a piece of toast  I swear their toast is made from God himself bc it is just that good  The next time I went I made sure to grab and extra order of toast  I ve tried the sides of spaghetti squash  yams  and potatoes  Everything is amazing  There is so much flavor in everything they make and it is just all so amazing  I got the pulled pork the last time I was there and it was the best I had ever had in my LIFE        for sure

I have been here for lunch and dinner  I have to say the food has always been great  Fair warning  there are no reservations nor a waitlist  You have to stand in line  usually wrapping the building  outside  That being said it is completely worth it
Can t say enough about this place  It s great  Arrive early for lunch  it gets packed

Overall  Solid steaks  Good flavors   Very casual ambiance  Was slightly confused about ordering food first then being seated  But I actually liked that it s not like swanky steakhouse  Like sauces are self serve and they have to go bags to grab so you don t have to wait for the waitstaff to get your cheque to go boxes   Food  Asado Platter   ribeye was the winner for me  To be honest  I didn t care too much for other cuts  But my friends each liked different cuts so it worked out    Ribeye is the fattiest  Flank was leanest  Skirt was thick cut and juicy  Ny strip was somewhere in the middle in terms of fatty and lean  The fifth cut whose name I cannot remember was also very lean and most meaty gamey imo  Good for sharing  The only caveat is that their medium rare was more like rare   idk if you like that  great  But wasn t fan of how tough the raw center was to chew   Shrimps on skewers are off the menu item that are also great   grilled and herbed    Sides  good portion for the price  Beef Empanadas were great  Sweet potato with caraway seeds and sunflower seeds were the group s least liked  We wish we got something else instead    Desserts  dulce de leche shortbread cookies were so good  Could eat that every meal  Shortbread is very soft and dulce de leche isn t too sweet  And the whole cookie is coated with toasted coconut shreds    Sauces  prob the second best thing after steak    different kinds  All delish  Kinda wish they served tortilla chips so I can dip them in
Everytime I go there is always a wait but it is well worth it  To avoid the wait go at   am on a weekday but by noon there is a line  Taste a little bit of everything  you wont be disappointed

I ve been dying to try Gaucho for so long now  So much hype surrounding this place and I must say it did not disappoint  However  I m not the biggest fan of the first come first serve concept    First let s talk food  to simply put it    amazing and absolutely delicious  We tried the beef and chicken empanadas  both were really good but I felt the chicken was a little dry so I dipped it in sauce but still really good and I d get again  They have a few different choices for empanadas and they are written up front so they change them out  We also had the grilled shrimp and they are grilled to perfection  They have that perfect char grilled tastes  You get   shrimp and they are a good size  We opted for the summer squash because we wanted a veggie side and it was good  A nice size side perfect for   people and only    so definitely worth it  For the main course we had the parrillada mixta which consists of strip steak  chicken  and your choice of sweet or spicy chorizo  we chose the spicy   This dish also comes with   pieces of grilled bread which is fantastic  I wanted more bread  The steak was cooked perfectly  The chicken was my least favorite there just wasn t a wow factor for me  Spicy chorizo is also delicious  This dish was a great combo to get your first time to try the different meats so I recommend  It s a big portion too  we had leftovers to take home  They have   different sauces for dipping and all of them are amazing  Honestly  the sauces may have been my favorite part  I can t pick a favorite cause they all are so good  I dipped everything we got in each one  Gaucho is also a byob establishment  I think our total was around     for all that food which really isn t bad for a good meal    Gaucho is located in the strip district which means finding parking can be an issue  It is also first come first serve  no reservations  Since this place is so good there is often a line that wraps around the side of the building which is my least favorite part  I wish they took reservations and you didn t have to wait but there is obviously a method to this madness because it s always busy and a very successful establishment  Since it s byob I feel like people will also sit longer to finish their alcohol which makes the line longer  They have a sign that indicates    pm is shift change and they have to feed their employees so the restaurant runs much slower  I went on a Saturday and got in line around      and was inside and ordered about    minutes later which was not too bad  I will say I wouldn t wait much longer  Food is great but I don t want to wait in line any longer than an hour for it    The inside is small which is also another reason the line can take long  You order at the counter  they seat you and bring the food to your table but you do not have a server  The employees all seemed super friendly and everyone had a smile on their face  The vibe is super casual and relaxed    I do recommend trying Gaucho if you haven t  The food is unlike any other food I ve had in the city  I will def be back but maybe on a week night when the line isn t so long
I lived in Argentina for a year and this is pretty damn authentic and unique  Highly recommend

One of the tastiest meals I ve ever had  I got the b n mi sandwich  pork loin   papas  potatoes   and maiz  corn on the cob   There was a long line but it was well worth the wait  It actually gave me enough time to look over the entire menu    Everything was delicious  That may have been the best corn on the cob ever  The restaurant was clean with a rustic look   casual feel  The staff was very friendly   attentive   All four of the homemade sauces are incredible  and you can take to go cups  I particularly like the pimenton  spicy pepper  and ajo  garlic   They don t serve alcohol but you can BYOB  and there is no cork fee if you bring wine
They do steak the best  Their plates and small plates are the best  Their sandwiches and other beef dishes are only okay  The sauces are excellent  Definitely do not skip their sauces

Went on a Saturday around         waited in line for about    minutes before we were inside the restaurant to place the order  Ordered the Asado platter for medium rare but     of the meat was well done to medium well  The temperature of the meat also wasn t as hot or fresh as expected  The potato salad is good  I would go back to try other things

We d gone a couple years ago before the renovation and it was one of the best meals ever  We live pretty close so I m not sure how this didn t turn into a go to after that    However  we went last week with friends  I know the waits get long here but it was early evening and we thought we d be safe  From line to food  it was probably       minutes  Kudos to these guys for having a devoted following  However there isn t enough room to accommodate the folks waiting  it s cramped and in front of the door which blocks thru traffic  I loved that they offer Mexican coke  something I treat myself to every time I see it  Meal wise  we were all obsessed with the toast  Man  is that good  Between the four of us we got a huge chunk of the menu  the sides are definitely a strength here  The potatoes  bread  grits   all really good  My steak was unfortunately stringy and the small platter it was all served on was pretty small for the amount of food on there  The service was thoughtful and kind  Tbh  this probably would ve been a four if some of the details  waits and serveware  were a little more thought out  I would definitely go back but in a more obscure hour  for sure

This place was incredible     Ordered the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich and Roasted Cauliflower which were both unbelievable in there own right   Top these two things off with their Ajo and pimenton sauces  and if I lived in Pittsburgh  this would be the only place I d ever eat lunch    Also  I really liked how the owner found people a place to sit before they ordered their food   This service was very much appreciated  especially when your in a very busy restaurant

Meats and sauces  Boom  Just out of downtown  this place serves up the goods  Pork sandwich on my plate and steak sandwiches for my friends  All given rave reviews  Additionally  loved the empanada and potatoes  and the service was outstanding    Seriously  order as much as you can afford and gorge yourself

We ate there on Aug   st and it was phenomenal  The sauces  the meats  the sides  boom   It was great   I do not recommend wearing overly nice clothing as the deliciousness drips off the sandwich and can easily get on you   The staff was very friendly and helpful with questions on the menu choices   I anticipate they will need a larger location very soon  Well done

I grew up in Argentina   specifically in Patagonia  I ve eaten in some of the better restaurant of Buenos Aires and this is a far cry from Argentine food  Very disappointed with the lack of authenticity in the chimichurri as well as the empanadas  I realize it s difficult to get Argentine beef but they don t even try  The worst thing is the style of restaurant  I guess they want you to feel like your being herded like cattle

By now it s just known that Gaucho is one of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh  I ve never had a single menu item that wasn t absolutely perfect  I always look forward to the bread and sauces which are mouth watering  The line is usually out the door  but it s always  always worth the wait  The outdoor seating area is just as charming and warm as the indoor  I ve enjoyed an array of the menu items  from the steak to salad to sandwiches  The time and skill put into cooking these amazing dishes is always apparent in the amazing flavor  If I won the lottery  I would probably eat here every day

Attended a private function in the basement room  The space was so cool  like eating in an old European building or secret grotto in South America  Candles everywhere  and a great staff  The food was just amazing  can t say enough about the bread  the cooked meats  the Chimichurri sauces  the grilled vegetables  the dried meats  the cheeses   I ate everything but the shrimp  allergies  and each bite makes you moan and roll your eyes it s so good   Can t wait to come back and try the main restaurant  The wait is worth it
We came on Thursday for a bit later lunch and were surprised at no line  While our first visit  it will not be our last   Casual  yet excellent food

Wow that was a lot of meat  We got there at around noon  and just missed the big rush  Once inside there is a huge line outside  This is definitely not a place for vegetarians  We got the braised Rosemary beef and the pulled pork sandwich  both huge  both delicious  Meat was perfectly cooked and the bread was perfectly toasted  We also had the empanadas as a starter which were amazing  Took our sandwiches to go  which we have been able to stay and enjoy all the different sauces  Definitely a must if you re in Pittsburgh

You can only log into Yelp so many times and see Gaucho listed on the main page as a  Best Restaurant  with a zillion   stars reviews before you start to feel like you might be missing out  I get it Yelp  I need to go to Gaucho  So to Gaucho I went   The place is tiny with limited seating  but we went around      on a week night  and it was perfect   still quite a few customers  but not overwhelmingly busy at all  I ordered the pulled chicken sandwich and my husband got the rosemary braised beef    it was described on the menu simply as  f  kin fantastic   which we got a kick out of  Then we split the veggie empanada  grilled corn  and potatoes as sides   So  let s talk about this food  In this case I can only channel Janice from  Friends  and say OH  MY  GOD   Have you ever been legitimately sad when your meal is over and all of your food is gone and wished that it was socially appropriate to order a second dinner  That is how I felt about my meal at Gaucho  The pulled chicken sandwich had tender  melt in your mouth chicken  sweet caramelized onions  crunchy  well seasoned potatoes  and meaty mushrooms  all mixed with their KILLER garlic ajo sauce and served on bread that was just the right balance of chewy and crispy  I didn t know it was possible for so many textures and flavors to be combined so perfectly into one delicious bite  but Gaucho managed to do it  As for the sides  the hands down favorite were the potatoes  Oh my  those potatoes were bursting with flavor  super crunchy on the outside but soft on the inside  and pretty much the best potato I have ever eaten  The grilled corn was also well done    perfectly cooked and was especially yummy when smothered in one of their   sauces  And lastly  the veggie empanada  though the least favorite thing we d ordered  was still damn tasty too  It was packed with tons of flavor  but it was little dry  so I d recommend taking that for a dip in one of the sauces as well   I asked my husband how his rosemary braised beef was  and he was shoveling it in his mouth so fast that all he could do was point to the menu board description where it says  f  kin fantastic    Well said  When he finally could talk  the only thing he uttered was   I m having a love affair with this sandwich    Ordinarily I might be worried  but hell  I d understand if he leaves me for Gaucho   Not only was the food out of this world  but the service and atmosphere were too  The guy running the counter  I assume he was the manager  was super friendly and clearly has a passion for the business and the food  He eagerly talked us through the menu  explained the different sauces to us  and even later checked in while we were eating to see what we thought of the food  And I love that we could see back behind the counter into the kitchen  where several bearded men were happily drinking their Yuenglings and grilling up our food  It felt like I was having a chill meal in someone s hip but cozy house instead of a restaurant   It is maybe a touch on the pricey side  but so well worth it for the quality of the food  In fact  I m pretty sure that I d be willing to promise my first born in exchange for a gallon of their garlic ajo sauce  Btw    a glorious bonus was that I was still able to taste the flavor of that sauce in my mouth for the rest of the night  I was really sad when it was time to brush my teeth before bed  Yep  it s good stuff   Moral of the story  Go go go go go go go go go
Very nice  and not just beef  which is about all you get in Argentina  Try to get there about       a m  on weekend mornings  or you ll be sorry
The food is pretty good  The way to go is two smaller plates instead of an entree  It s a little confusing in the sequence of ordering b   u r seated but just roll with it

The food is very good  The atmosphere is wonderful  Their service is extraordinary  They were so  polite and thoughtful  This was especially evident when they didn t kick people out who had been lingering there for hours without ordering more food  This is a BYOB place  They do not make money from liquor sales  As a result  they have to turn over tables at a rather efficient rate  It was shocking to me how entitled bourgeois drunk people are so inappropriate to such a lovely staff  You can put a saddle on a jackass but it doesn t make it a racehorse  Bravo to you staff of Gaucho

There s no flaws in the menu   Not a single thing I ve had here has been disappointing  The experience is interesting as you pay before you are seated and there is no waiter service  This takes away from the restaurant feel but also gives you the privacy of not being bothered during your meal  The drawback here is that you can t really add to your order if you under ordered  This can be remedied by over ordering which is encouraged because as I mentioned before  there are NO flaws in the menu    Fish  good  Shrimp great  Everything cooked to perfection  That being said  I d recommend getting it a little bit more towards the medium  medium rare side then the rare side   because they will serve it RARE   like raw  Even so  it is delectably delightful meat and all the sides and sauces compliment well and are all more than reasonably priced  BYOB only makes this the best place to bring a date    It s only a little bit upsetting that I wanted more but waiting in the line for potatoes or more vegetables was just not worth it and you can t just cut everyone and add to your meal or ask your waiter  So order everything

The meats are phenomenal here  I always go for the asado platter which is full of flavor and juicy  The food is always fresh and the atmosphere is wonderful  The sauces that come in huge mason jars are so tasty  You must try all of them  They are all unique and delightful    The interior is full of vibrant colors and warm wood  It makes me feel at peace and happy whenever I m here  I m always satisfied when I come here  My only complaint is that parking is difficult here there is not a parking lot and sometimes if you re lucky  there will be street parking nearby    The customer service is great here  Everyone is always so smiley and accommodating  I also appreciate the order first then wait for your food process at Gaucho  It s very efficient and helps with the almost always long line here

One of my FAVORITE restaurants in the Burgh   Great food  casual  relaxed atmosphere and BYOB   what more could you ask for    We are FREQUENT visitors   The food is always cooked to perfection and the ingredients are so FRESH   EVERYONE   from those that assist you in finding a seat  to those that take your order  to those that act as severs   is SO friendly and accommodating   We took my dad to Gaucho tonight to celebrate his birthday  he loves it there and always requests it  and  of course  it was a great experience  We brought a cake and they kept it in the fridge for us during dinner and then brought it out with a candle and sang Happy Birthday  I did not ask them to do that  they just did    I have never had a bad meal at Gaucho   Some of our favorites include the Qui Qui Chicken appetizer  the steak burger  the rosemary braised beef sandwich and the salads are AMAZING    So fresh and delicious    The only drawback to Gaucho is that they don t take reservations  so you may have to wait in line  We try to go at  off  times to avoid the line  but the food is DEFINITELY worth the wait if you must stand in line   They have a great system in place and run like a well oiled machine  though  so your wait will not be unpleasant in the least   If you have never been there  RUN  don t walk   I promise you will be glad you did

One of the best restaurants in town as can be seen by the constant lines wrapped around the building  The food is a        The flavors and variety are out of this world  It was recommended to us to try a little bit of everything which is exactly what we did  empanadas  tostado  corn  carne  mushrooms  and all the sauces  Can t wait to return for more

I am not judging the review based on the wait time  because we went on Saturday night for dinner around   pm  which is definitely their busiest time and the two hour wait was expected  Plus we had a party of    no reservations allowed at this place    The food was definitely lived up to the reviews   especially the steak  The ribeye sandwich was a steal really  just     for   oz of meat that s well seasoned and had great aging and char  This is not the tender  flavorless steak I m used to from steakhouse chains  This Argentinian style had texture chew and great flavor  We had fun trying the   sauces with the steak but it honestly didn t need it  I felt the toast was really hard  not sure why other reviews raved about that   We also got the qui qui chicken but that was really not the most unique thing  go for steak for sure  I d invite friends here who are visiting town  and use the     hr wait time to catch up
This place is so delicious  Packed with people as always so the wait time is a bit long  But the staff has always been very friendly and the meats are super tender and juicy

This review is fairly late  short   sweet  but I have yet to forget about how amazing the food was   Gaucho s   This is the sandwich by which all other sandwiches must be judged   If you were allowed to give only one five star review per Yelp account  this would be my ultimate end all be all five star   Amazing   I am forever spoiled     Hopefully these incredible chefs gather a solid following and branch out to other cities and venues   Holy foodgasm  This is what Pittsburgh should be known for        awesomesauce   Can t wait to go back   A

This place is a gem    More then a gem it is everything that is good about eating   You smell this place before you see it  The aroma is mouthwatering   The meat is perfect  If Francis mallman were here he would shake Anthony s hand  I have never tasted a more well balanced chimichuri   Thank you for added this to the Pittsburgh landscape   Bottom line  The food and service will change your taste buds forever

A gem in the rough  We came here on a whim  finally   and it was about  pm and we were already waiting outside  the line didn t seem too long  so we didn t mind  However  the line did move pretty incredibly slow  for the not so huge menu people ordering off of  I should have checked that this was BYOB  no fees  Which would have made standing in line with our  yo a breeze  Once we ordered  the waitress checking us out was incredibly nice and professional  Additionally  every worker there thereafter were extremely great  made sure your water was tipped off  and worked collectively great together  I ordered the chicken  boob  sandwich  my fianc  ordered the steak burger  It did not disappoint  Incredibly filling  Chicken was very tender and well seasoned  his burger made medium was perfectly juicy topped with avocado instead of cheese  It was honestly half an avocado  While we waited for our food  we tried the sauces with some toast     the toast was perfection  it had the real wood burning toast flavor but without it tasting burnt  A real skill     there is not one flavor of sauce I did not like  It was hard choosing a favorite  Ultimately  i liked the chimmy  and the roasted red pepper    oh and the garlic  shoot  the ajo was fine too  Honestly  i would give this a solid    but I am going solely off my first experience  waiting  no options for my picky  yo  but clearly we know how to be prepared next time

Well worth the wait if you have one  I went during lunch and it only took    minutes to get seated  Food is awesome  Definitely one of my favorite spots  Had the pulled pork sandwich and veggies  Sandwiches are huge  You don t need a side to fill you up but I would recommend just so you can try more awesomeness  Staff is friendly  prices are on par for what you get    Do it

I love it here  I mean  what s not to love   Except for the wait   I could eat here everyday  The chicken sandwich is my favorite  and the side dishes are also incredible  I always eat my meal way too quickly so I don t have any pictures unfortunately   you ll just have to take my word along with all of the hundreds of other yelp reviews

Love this place  The only downside is that long impending wait for a table  Other than that  best BYOB place in town I would say  The food is great and very fairly priced  Grab your favorite bottle of wine and get there early so you can be seated quickly

I heard they had     vegetarian items on the menu and I thought I must go  I ordered a pabrecito  one of the vegetarian options  and it was horrible  The grilled veggies I was promised consisted of a single bell pepper and there was too much salt  Not recommended for vegetarians

The food that I ordered was good    sides  Had to send back one of the sides because they gave me the wrong one  My daughter ordered the        steak platter that had no sides with it  was over seasoned  WAY OVER PRICED They forgot the grilled bread had to ask  twice    Would not go back

I have various food allergies and experienced nothing but the best at Gaucho  I was informed that Gaucho uses      olive and corn oils  no blends  and no butter or milk  at least in what I ordered   I had the sweet potato mash  mushrooms  avo salad  and tried some of the steak burger  Very friendly service and cool atmosphere  Definitely recommend

Service is absolutely AWFUL  My roommate and I went with our mothers and we are          We told our order several times at the front  keep in mind the line was non existent  so they weren t rushed or busy   They were so distracted by my roommates real ID that they forgot half of our order  They seemed very suspicious of her ID even though it was real and she was with her mother  Then we got four wine glasses at the table  and the woman came over again and asked to see our IDs when I clearly was not drinking  Best part  they asked us to leave immediately after we finished because there was a short line  No one else around us was asked to leave  and there were people who were there longer than us  Good food  but absolutely not acceptable behavior  I work in the restaurant business and that is the first rule  you cannot ask people to leave  I do not recommend

Hands down my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  it never disappoints    I always take people from out of town here and it s always a crowd pleaser  Just be prepared to wait in line for an hour if you go on the weekend at any time
Very few words are needed  Long lines  get there early  Amazing food  Hard to pick   Awesome sauces  Give them all a try  Small salad was a perfect size for lunch  Lots of veggie choices too

This place is so good that I signed up for a yelp account  While traveling through PA we stopped at this gem  Unique food with flair  The service was outstanding  The atmosphere was more casual then expected  but the food did not disappoint  If I am in Pittsburgh again I will come back for sure

Coming from our road trip from Chicago my fianc  and I decided to stop by Pittsburgh and check out the city    Arriving during lunch hours   I yelped for some restaurants and this came up   I never had Argentinian food before  so what a great way to have it  plus I couldn t say no based on the  pictures and reviews I read    We arrived at the restaurant right when it opened so we were greeted by a very friendly worker  The menu is written on a huge chalkboard on your right  Since it was my first time here  a helpful server was nice enough to take us through the menu and also telling me some of his favorites  The way it works is that you order from the menu  then you pay and then they bring the food to you  I ordered their el guacho salad with flank steak and a side of sweet chorizo  The fianc  got the chicken and papas    After you pay  you grab your untensils and your chimi sauces  We didn t wait long at all  The meat was delicious  season perfectly  well  juicy and tender  I asked for my flank steak to be cooked well done and I was even surprised that my meat was still juicy and not chewy at all  I got that small salad which was packed with lots of greens  corn  red radish  asparagus and few slices of avocado  The sweet chorizo was also juicy and perfect  I tried my finance chicken which was moist and season well  If you want to add more flavors you can dip your meat in their chimis    I enjoyed my meal and I would highly recommend Guacho  I would advise to prepare yourself by looking at their menu before walking in and know what to order because the lines can get long fast  Other than that I give it a   stars
The food is soooooooooooo good here  Wow  One of the best places I have ever eaten at

I ve been here twice and am overall very pleased with my experiences  I went around lunch and there was a long line but it moved quickly  The staff was nice and accommodating  I was pleasantly surprised that even though it s not a server based model  they still walk around and check on how the food is and if you need more water  The space is beautiful and modern  exposed brick  chalkboards  hardwood floors  subway tile  textbook hip restaurant  I had a Rosemary braised beef sandwich that hit the spot  I took a tip from a regular and used some of the sauces oils they make available  The bread was crusty and fresh  the beef was flavorful and rich  I felt like I was eating a really good meal  You definitely feel like you re getting a good value for your money   I wasn t blown away but I was totally satisfied    Parking is tough because    Strip District  no sides included  it s hard to find a seat bc they re so popular
Ummmmmm      amazing      The food is so good  They have really good options for vegetarians  However  you have to watch what time you go here because they start to get really busy

Amazing sandwiches  Had to stand to eat  but worth it anyways  The empanadas Haf a great spice to them  We also tried the skirt steak and spicy chorizo sandwich which were awesome   both had peppers and caramelized notions  yum  The bread is fantastic  and the chimichurri is sooo good

Believe the hype   All  Of  The  Hype   Gaucho is that good   I made my maiden voyage to this meat mecca on a warm muggy Friday afternoon   The line was out the door   all in all about a       minute wait   The queue fits surprisingly little few people indoors  which might be my only gripe about the place   Ambience  From the outside  you would not know this place existed   Tucked away on the far end of the vibrant Strip District  I actually mistook the kitchen entrance as the front door   Once inside  you find a really tastefully done interior   Wood finishing is prevalent throughout  covering everything from the the condiment islands to the plates that the meals are served on   Taken all together  it s a great match for the food that Gaucho serves   Service  In two words   friendly and attentive   Despite being an order at the counter establishment  the table bussers appear to double as  servers   checking in on us several times after we sat down  doing everything from offering silverware to refilling water   Great model   Food  Nothing I ve written would have mattered if the food didn t match in quality   and boy did it   Collectively  our group ordered   sandwiches  ribeye  fish  and pork   a side of potatoes  and an empanada   The potatoes were golden and crisp on the outside  creamy on the inside   Perfect for dipping into one of their   sauces    sauce sidebar  try them all  over and over and over   Each one was delicious in its own right  from a classic chimichurri to a roasted red pepper   The right dip to bite ratio is       just trust me    Ok  back to the food   I ordered the fish sandwich  which came with perfectly charred white fish  cod  perhaps    sweet carmelized onions  and a soft chewy bun   Great bun to meat ratio  great balance of flavors   Each sandwich came with the same bun  but slight variants on the meat accompaniments  peppers for the steak  mustard for the pork    all were delicious

This is a go to favorite place for take out or bodega night private event  The salads  sides and rosemary braised beef are my favorites   Get spoiled during a private event and go for the paella  It won t disappoint  promise  Estis is our favorite server for private events  The line to eat upstairs is the only negative  and can t even call it that   get takeout and no line will effect your meal

It is by far one of the most tasty places I ve been too  not to mention the price is very fair  I got shrimp and pork chop here  I think the meat here is excellent however seafood is prob not their best  perhaps due to their geographic location    I would come back here in a heart beat and try out other cuts of meat

I brought my parents here after reading  Gaucho Parrilla Argentina was dubbed one of the top places to eat in the country  in the Pittsburgh Visitors Guide  The food definitely exceeded our expectations  It s kinda insane how good the food there was    ESPECIALLY the sauces  chimichurri  garlic  onion  red pepper

Honestly don t understand why this place is so popular  Service is great but food is not edible  I went there twice and almost everything was burnt both times    If you are gonna burn everything and then call it authentic Argentinian grill  I don t have to pay for the price and could just do it at home

Believe the hype  Carne sandwich is amazing  Try all four sauces  I can t decide which is my favorite  They are all distinct and amazing  Get the toast for a buck and dip in all the sauces  Staff is super friendly and helpful  Awesome spot

I brought some friends from out of town here on Saturday around  pm   And just like Gaucho was before the renovation  there was a line out the door    but as expected the line and wait wasn t too bad   We waited for about    minutes to order and easily found a place to sit for a party of five     Everyone was very pleased with their food  some saying it was the best that they ve had in a very long time   I generally eat a mostly plant based diet and fish every now and then so I got the fish sandwich   It was pretty large and well worth the     I paid for it  however I think I would have preferred something other than tilapia   I think it s a pretty cheap fish for a place serving amazing steaks   The non meat items seem to be considered an after thought  so that was a little disappointing for me   However  this disappointment was saved with the corn and papas   My boyfriend loves this place  so I m sure we ll be heading back  but I d be reluctant to order another fish sandwich   The non steak and sausage items don t appear to get much love

Tried this spot with some friends on a hunch only to discover that it was the home to one of the greatest steak sandwiches ever  I got the carne with flank steak and it was more than enough in terms of both portion and flavor  They also have a great environment with an incredibly welcoming staff  Excellent spot

The food here is fantastic  We ordered family style  We chose   meat dishes and two sides which was more than enough for   people  I don t remember the names of the dishes   the first was a mix of chicken  chorizo and steak  All amazing  The second was the chorizo three ways  Again  perfect  Like always my favorite part was the side dishes  We had the brussel sprouts that were sauteed in bacon and brown sugar  I loved them so much that I ve been making this at home ever since  The second was the sweet potatoes topped with marshmallow  This was the highlight of the meal  I think with all the intensely flavored meats and salt you need this sweet and savoury dish to balance the meal  I live for a BYOB  remember to get your own glasses from the side bar and have a drink while waiting for the line to die down

In town for a visit from a Maryland  Decided to venture to Gaucho for the Carne sandwich  It was one of the best sandwiches I have ever had  Also enjoyed the papas  in all of the   different sauces  and the spicy chorizo   This will become a regular stop when in the area

I love smoked food  This place makes some great sandwiches  All of the meat is smoked fresh and the prices are great  The dinners are a bit more  I haven t had them yet  But I m sure they re pretty awesome too

Yep  Gaucho is about as good as it gets  I went last night with   of us    total  We waited in line outside for about    minutes before we made it in  I ve had some sandwiches before here  so I know how good it is  Everyone else knows also I guess  We brought a bottle of wine which they corked for us for free  I got the house Paella  It was amazing  It says feeds        of us got that as our meal and I gave a leftover box for all   of us  Carne sandwich  Shrimp side with sage and butter  Fish sandwich and a burger  Everything was awesome  The servers are fast and there to fill up your drink  Everyone is friendly  I highly recommend this place  Not expensive  great food  great service  One of my fav spots in the burgh

Long wait  but totally worth it  Everything we ate was seasoned perfectly  Price is very reasonable  The sauces are perfect  especially the chimmichuri   The only negatives are    the wait and    how small and cramped it can get  Think of it like the ultimate food truck  You order your food  then take it to the seating area behind the restaurant  Had to wait about    minutes for our food  Probably wouldn t have minded so much  had we been seated and sipping on a brew

I ve been meaning to try Gaucho for some time now but they re only open on certain days and they close so early  Well  it was definitely worth the wait because the sandwiches are AMAZING  The skirt steak sandwich melted in my mouth and the roasted tomatoes and sauces complemented the sandwich perfectly  Highly recommended

Worth a visit to give it a try   Atmosphere very noisy food quite good    Pittsburgh has a lot  of good places to eat and this would not be a place I would go again    We were a group of   and none of us was impressed with our meals

Holy hell  thank you for Gaucho  Meat is life  Meat is good  Meat is my savior   For all the millennials   meat is   don t judge me       Bae   Anyway  I used to drive by Gaucho all the time when I lived in the Strip District  naturally  After I got off the bridge and headed straight  let s just say my nares hit Liberty Street before I did   All the worries of a stressed out resident physician in Pittsburgh were relinquished when the smell of Buenos Aires markets hit my nose    The smell of a slow parilla style roast of our good friend who  moo s  overwhelmed me everytime I would pass by    My go to  The asado platter   all the meats from our farmer friend cooked to perfection  The meat is some of the most succulent I have had in Pittsburgh and I have to say  Pittsburgh does meat pretty damn well  My second favorite  the Paella  Let s put it this way  I am allergic to clams and mussels but if ever I had a craving  an epi pen is going straight into my right thigh before I devour this pot of edible gold  The saffron gives the rice such a airy spice that it takes me back to flavors of Spain  though this is Argentina we are talking about   Regardless  well done   Kudos Gaucho  thank you for being here   Highlights  Meat cooked to perfection  parilla style layout  outdoor  garage type feel like some of the places I ve visited in Argentina   beautiful spices and herbs with a strong m lange Pros  Above Cons  sometimes the wait is BRUTAL  But well worth it Recommend to a friend  Yes Recommend to family  No  because we have been all over and obviously have had authentic style food in South America and they will probably not go anyway   Just being honest Go again  I go once a week at least

There s really not a lot to say about Gaucho that hasn t already been said elsewhere  better   Great food   I always make time for a stop here when I visit Pittsburgh   The wait times can be long  so go prepared   And by go prepared I mean look at Google   We went on      on a Thursday  and walked right up to the counter   I realize many may not have that kind of flexibility  but if you do then it really helps

Was there on a  Tuesday evening  There were not many customers  My soup was cold  My friends food was cold and not good  The mixed drinks increased by    in a week period  There were no pecan balls which come with dinner on Tues nights  They had no ice cream at  pm  Definitely has changed from the former Kretzler s Tavern  So much for the original family place to eat

A friend who lives in Pittsburgh suggested I try this place while visiting for a long weekend  After waiting in the long line  outside I might add  for over an hour you have to order your food at the counter and cannot change once you order  The food was definitely delicious  but after waiting in the long line I was not nearly as hungry as I initially was  Two positives to the place is that it is BYOB and the menu has an enormous amount of options to chose from  some of which sell out rather quickly though but are constantly coming back as the night progresses

Gaucho is my favorite place and I will definitely go there often  We went on a Tuesday afternoon around     ish  We had no wait   Our family from San Diego was in town and said they wish they weren t leaving the next day so they could go back   We ordered the pasta salad with baby peas  each of the empanadas  a charcuterie board  lamb  shrimp  cauliflower  green beans and tostadas and we loved every dish  Our only disappointment was that we got full and could not eat all of it  Every dish we tried was flavorful and amazing enough to stand on its own but even more amazing with the  salsa   We tried all the sauces with each dish and were excited about the way every sauce complimented every dish in  the most delicious ways  We each had our favorites   I ordered a bread pudding to go and was just slightly disappointed as it was not as amazing and over the top delicious as the meal we had  That s ok though  I still give Gaucho a   star review

Had an A MAZING dinner in Pittsburgh strip district tonight   We had a few people so we could sample a variety on our first visit  The   cuts of beef were all cooked perfectly and the shrimp were very good also    We went specifically to try the empanadas and were only disappointed because they only had a few left  However  the ones they had available were ours and the were delicious   We also sampled a variety of vegetables  The zucchini  sweet peppers  onions  mushrooms and asparagus were all grilled to perfection   That being said  the grilled corn on the cob is a must    The potatoes were somewhat average  but they are potatoes so what can you expect  but to quote my wife     the toast tastes like Christmas     All topped off with very friendly and attentive servers and four varieties of  sauces to top your meal  you can t go wrong at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina located in the strip district of Pittsburgh    You might think the prices seem marginally high when you walk in but I promise you ll think you got a bargain by the time you leave    This was our first visit to Gaucho  but certainly won t be our last

This place is really good   GOOD    The FOOD is just great   Pork sandwich  roasted potatoes  grilled brussels sprouts with bacon  La Casa salad   all really tasty and well prepared   The bread on the sandwiches is delicious  especially when toasted    The setting is fresh  clean  and un cluttered    The service is great   Everybody is helpful and cheerful   OPPORTUNITIES    The entryway and ordering area is too small   Even a short line goes to the door  so you sometimes can t really walk in    The chalk board menu looks nice  but is hard to read quickly   Confusing or fuzzy menus can create anxiety for some patrons  especially when the line is short and you sort of have to order now   Overall  this place is great   If you have not been here  give it a try

Got the steak sandwich  It was super meaty and I was definitely in love with the vegetables in there    The empanadas were a bit  doughy  and dry  Maybe because I m used to fried ones  I d skip out on them    The people working here were super nice

You have to come here  We had a couple of flank steak sandwiches  Very well seasoned  you can tell steak was marinated overnight  On great chibada bread with peppers and onions  Small place but they know what there doing

Having heard such great things about Gaucho Parrilla I had high expectations for the meal  That being said  the food was just good and well deserving of at least a four star rating  The problem I had with the whole experience was the setup of the whole restaurant  Not only was ordering annoying and made me feel like I was at a high class fast food joint  but the menu was extremely wordy  confusing  and the only way to view it was on a huge blackboard up front  It is also worth mentioning that with this setup you ll be stuck up front holding others back while trying to figure out what to order  If it s busy you will probably feel pressured to make a quick decision from a lengthy menu   Despite the annoyances up front I had no issues with service and the food was good enough to save Gaucho from a lacking experience  Besides burnt cut of toast  the steak  chicken  and chorizo that I ordered was done well and accompanied with some tasty sauces  I guess I can forgive Gaucho for it s annoying setup for a good meal

Another non traditional restaurant  There s a very large menu on the wall when you enter and you re not seated until after you ve ordered and paid  Yes  it was weird tipping before being served     The food was all very very good though especially El Chorizo  my personal favorite  The shrimp and churrasco were EXCELLENT also

I can t say enough wonderful things about this place  The food was absolutely delicious    The only  downside  was not knowing beforehand that it was BYOB  Other than that  perfection  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Of course this place doesn t need any more positive reviews   but if certainly deserves them   Went here with friends for lunch on a cold Saturday  had to wait outside for about    minutes but it was worth it   We love brunch so brought in bottles of champagne and orange juice and mixed up our own mimosas while we were there   I got the Argentino salad and I highly recommend adding shrimp to it     The staff was all very helpful and friendly and I will definitely be returning   Good to know   you can order ahead so that you don t have to wait in the potentially out the door line      brunchsohard

It s       right  The experience with a restaurant begins when you look online  Outdated menu  no menu  shitty website   your anticipation drops  Restaurants  if we have to wait for approval on email reservation  requests   forget about it  This seems comparatively more common in Pittsburgh than DC  Baltimore   Use opentable or have a person answering the phone   My first minute with Gaucho       Look up ph  on yelp    Phone rings   times  get a real person      GAUCHO    What are your hours           We ll be by later   Ok  Byob BROTHER    I m already smiling about my meal  Haven t seen the place yet  That s how it s done   Roll in to the    seat spot and the smoky fire hits your nose immediately  You salivate  Your eyes drift across the orange paint and sparse yet rustic decorations that give off the gaucho vibe  The wood is stacked high  Orders are placed at the register where friendly service awaits with recommendations and attention   Food takes a while  the scent teasing you  The oily chorizo app arrived with sandwiches  should have come first  That s about all I can complain about  The chorizo is salty and awesome  if needing some grain mustard though the accompanying toast cuts it  The skirt steak sandwich  got talked out of the ribeye  was INTENSE  Delicious char  perfect temps and medium rare without request  The house chimi drips onto your plate alongside the healthy dose of onions and peppers  which are all pro except lightly soft  The bread borders the crunch soft levels perfectly    Seriously  best steak sandwich in Pittsburgh  Maybe ever
Tried yesterday a hanger steak and a sandwich  and this place is now in the top in Pittsburgh  Come early because this is pretty packed  Good meat  BYOB  what else can you ask for

Seriously   Why I don t go here weekly is insane   I ve only been here once and I completely understand why it is so highly rated  The food is some of the best I ve ever had   My flank steak was cooked to perfection  Heck  the smoked toast was even the best toast I have ever had   Try and go at an off time  because the line wraps around the door   I will be sure to come back here quite a bit

The smell outside of this place is enough to make you want to come inside and wait  as long as it takes  and place an order of your own  I should stress the need for patience in here  Lunch time the place is slammed  The menu is very extensive  It s a unique place to have in Pittsburgh  I do think it s a bit way over hyped  in most cases overpriced  I would recommend that someone try the samplers they offer so that you are better able to get an good idea of the offerings  As a fairly well travelled person  I find that it s simply incredibly hard to reproduce any ethnic offering outside of the originating country  Can I say that  The meats are just a bit high on the sodium count   this was my personal experience  I d go back for sure  but not often  I particularly liked the Brussel sprouts with bacon topped over them but it was for sure fairly NaCl ed  Good thing is the byob  too  Make sure you bring lots  You may need it not only for the reasons mentioned  but also to help drown out the noise levels  No one said it would be quiet
Great sandwiches   The second we walked in  we knew we were in for a great experience   We had the salmon  carne and pollo   The grill on the sourdough bread is fantastic
So good    Just got takeout  the grilled skirt steak and vegetables were incredible    Looking forward to future visits and trying more of the menu
This place is probably one of THE MOST delicious restaurants I ve ever had the pleasure of patroning  A M A Z I N G  I will definitely be back on my next trip to the Burgh

So good   I don t think you can go wrong with the menu  That said  it s a little overwhelming to read it all and make a quick choice so I d recommend browsing the menu ahead of time on their website to you have an idea of what you want  They have a great system  as far as ordering  seating  service  They were knowledgeable and accommodating to a severe gluten allergy in our group   I got one of the empanadas of the day  chicken  scallion  and lime if I remember correctly   which was awesome  The spicy chorizo with peppers and the fire grilled toast was equally delicious   They have   signature dipping sauces you can help yourself to  Each one is unique and it was fun to try new flavors with every bite   Plan to go back to try more of the menu  first visit did not disappoint

Like a previous reviewer  I too put off trying Gaucho for fear of not having any vegan options  Turns out there are at least three on the menu  no modifications necessary  It tastes as great as it smells  Very helpful and very sweet staff  Amazing sauces  too  Will return

We showed up at the perfect time          am on a Saturday just before the lines started to form   The food that was served is as good as the hype that surrounds this restaurant   We shared orders of the pork and caramelized onions  Broccolini  grits  steak sandwich  and pollo sandwich  The food came out hot  fast  and it was very good   I would definitely go back   I thought the prices were reasonable given the amount of food we were given

I ve never loved a lunch more than my lunch at Gaucho  So my suggestion to you is that you should go with a group of people and just order one of everything because everything was so amazing  Chicken empanadas  yes  Shrimp with rosemary  YES get     Steak  yup  Salad  even that was remarkably delicious  Melted cheese on grilled bread  get      What I m trying to say is that there is nothing on the menu here that could possibly be bad  If I could give it extra stars  I would  And I ve eaten a lot of food in my day    If you re in Pittsburgh  please make it a point to stop here for a meal  I hear there are lines out the door though so maybe plan to go for late afternoon snacking

Meat  Delicious  delicious  juicy meat  Shared a couple of the sandwiches with a friend  bread to meat ratio on point  and I got a corn on the side  I would totally come here every day if I could    Service was also fantastic   my friend brought her dog and the dog got a bone half the size of her

Don t be discouraged by the line around the block  that s a good sign  Probably one of the best restaurants in the city  I brought an out of town friend here a few months ago and when he came back recently  he specifically requested dinner here again   I did the regular menu for my first one or or two visits  but last week a group of us were offered the chance to skip the line and do the prix fixe menu downstairs in their private events room   Great decision  definitely more expensive  but fun for a change   The servers were really knowledgeable and personable and seemed concerned with us having a good experience  I ll be back

Wow  Just WOW  This place is amazing  I got the ribeye sandwich and corn on the cob  It melted in my mouth  The meat was cooked perfectly  We got there    minutes after it opened and there was all ready a line  By       the line was out the door

Gaucho is the best restaurant in Pittsburgh  I am not speaking in hyperbole  I ve been to almost all of the trendy restaurants in the city   i e  Eleven  butcher and the rye  salt  soba  etc   and I would pick Gaucho each and every time  When I leave this great city I will come back to visit friends and gaucho  Try the steak sandwich with skirt or flank steak and some empanadas
Been twice now  Always during lunch  Heard it was an insane wait if you went on a weekend night  Everyone is super nice  Food is DELICIOUS  Not a lot of seating
Best food in Pittsburgh  Went with a group of   and each one of us left so full  The steak burger was awesome  The only negative is the wait but that s because of the high demand  well worth the wait

Want to know how to cook steak  Take a lesson from these guys  The steak sandwich here was excellent  I loved the chimichurri sauce  the bread  the whole thing  Only complaint is it could have been a bit bigger OR less expensive  Also  I wish there were things on the menu in general that were more lunch prices than dinner prices  For non red meat eaters  they also serve a tilapia sandwich  I went back one day to try and get more of that delicious beef in my mouth  but alas though the place was supposed to be open  I  along with other surprised customers  found it closed  It s a pretty serious pet peeve of mine  going somewhere and thinking it will be open but it s not  It s pretty unprofessional  yet many places here do it  I am sure there were reasons etc  and I didn t starve to death since Vietnam s Pho is nearby and a pork sandwich there is half the price and also good  I just went there  But just a note to businesses  your customers notice when you are not open during your regular hours

This place is amazing    We were at pittsburgh for a conference and found this place on yelp with     rating  It is absolutely one of the best restaurants i have ever tried  I had the flank steak and it was great
There are enough reviews here that I don t need to get too lengthy  The food is amazing here  Just go  You won t regret it
Service is a bit autistic  But the sandwiches are amazing  The wait is always stupid long but that s part of it I guess

Wow  Phenomenal place and truly worth the wait  I had a small Lomo   oz filet mignon  and the Calabaza Asada  roasted acorn squash  pickled cranberries  arugula  and spiced pecans   Both were delicious  The Lomo came with two crispy slices of this amazing bread that you could dip in four sauces as well as a nice side salad  But about that filet   it was absolutely incredible  The steak was so tender and the flavor had thoroughly been marinated into the meat  And the Calabaza Asada was nice too   the acorn squash formed this lovely bowl for the arugula salad  The smokiness of the pecans and the acidity of the cranberries provided the perfect complements to the sweet squash  The restaurant was packed to the door  and for a reason  I was very happy with my experience here

Any place that calls vegetables and other green stuff grass  has to be fun  When I walked in I thought this is an gimmicky type place  You know I don t like Chucky cheese you don t go there for the food  However  everything I happened to have Will bring me back when I m back in Pittsburgh   I enjoyed the lamb cooked medium rare with some grass  LOL I also had a beefy empanada that I think was prepared right before they brought it to me and was not sitting in the back waiting to be warmed up  It was crispy on the outside yummy  juicy and delicious on the inside  Accompanied with the choice of sauces that they have this place is phenomenal   I did enjoy the fun atmosphere  That also is why it only has four stars  A bit strange for the cost of the food  The quality of the food is definitely worth the price even with the strange set up
Fantastic  The ribeye was juicy and flavorful   The bread was soaked in steak drippings  But in a good way  I would go back in a heartbeat  Could eat that sandwich weekly  Great experience
Great people  delicious food  and cool vibes  Also  you must try every sauce they have out in the mason jars  Get there early because the line ends up out the door

There was a line out the door when we arrived but the folks in front of us had already been and  said it was worth the wait  After about an hour and a half  we finally got to order  The food was so good it actually erased all memory of the wait  Everything was fresh and made with with care  The waitstaff is super friendly and the vibe is perfect

Food was exceptional  Super fresh  We loved the strip steak  braised beef sandwich  chirazzo sausage and brussel sprouts  We also had a combo dish that included chicken  which was totally delicious  Staff was super friendly  Atmosphere is great  Tip  Get there at   am for an early lunch to beat the long lines that wrap around the building

Group we were with wanted to go  so thought we would give it another shot  Prices are way too high and the food quality is still mediocre  This time though our food was accompanied by a side of fruit flies  We told the waiter who said they would tell the manager  which did not help our situation but hopefully they get that addressed

On a recent business trip I purposely stayed close to Gaucho rather than closer to my meetings downtown   It was worth the walk in the snow  ice floes drifting down the river  The chanchito is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had anywhere     Also  there were two burly men who had literally driven from Ohio to eat here  and while they were they were calling their friends telling them to do the same     Ridiculous   Yes   That is  until you ve eaten their food

Made a day trip to Pittsburg with the family  Checked yelp and trip advisor for places to eat and Guacho s was on the top of the list  And rightfully so I must say  So many positive things about Guacho s      The super friendly service from all the staff  We probably spoke with   or   different staff members throughout our time there  and they were all so friendly  We were afraid that we might be forgotten because we were the obly ones sitting outside  but in fact it seemed almost as if we were getting very personalized service      They are dog friendly  Seriously  major   for that  We had to sit outside but it s all shaded and even on this    degree day  it was very comfortable     Finally  the food  drooooool  For   for us  pup included   we ordered the asado platter    different types of meat      oz and   pieces of their delicious bread   the argentino salad and the mussles clams  My husband is very particular about food  especially his meats  and he absolutely loved it  My mom and I loved the salad  it had super fresh ingredients ans the grilled vegetables in it were so tasty    The only downfall would be the wait  as it always seems as if there is one  But it was well worth it  We went around      pm hoping to beat the dinner rush  Waited around    minutes to get to the front of the line and then another    minutes for our food    We re unfortunately not locals but would definitely go out of our way for another visit to Guacho s

Lost a star due to the setup  You walk in  get in line  sometimes out the door   order at a counter  then have to find free for all seating while your meal is prepared  Pretty annoying set up when it s crowded  Would have   stars if it was traditional restaurant service   Menu could also be more descriptive  One of my party thought they were getting some kind of fries and we got something more like potato salad   Aside from that  everything was fantastic  Got the lamb and it was cooked pretty rare  which they warn you about and which I was okay with  but it had a nice char and amazing flavor  Other people I was with both got the ribeye option  which was also fantastic  and had a fantastic char  providing the right amount of crisp   A nice little touch was the side dipping sauces they provide  There s a garlicy softrito style sauce that s out of this world
