My short lived journey throughout Pittsburgh led me to Gaucho  Ironically  I walked past the location earlier in the day and returned after circling through the Steel City  I heard the lines would be long  so I called to see if I could place a carryout order  It was my lucky day because they allowed me today do so  Now  picture me walking past     people as I head to the entrance  I m sure more than half thought I was cutting the line  I picked up my order and overheard a few comments   He s smart for carrying out    good idea   and  that smells good   Momma always said that I was special  I proved her right that day    The food  I ordered   empanadas    beef    chicken  If you want to know what heaven is like  order from Gaucho  using the carryout option  of course   Your stomach  and mother  will be proud of you

My friend and I were coming back from West Virginia from his residency interview and we decided to stop by Pittsburgh to see the sights and grab food on the way back to NY    We found this cozy little Argentinian grub hub  We were immediately greeted by the staff and one girl promptly came to help us decipher the menu choices    I had the chanchito sandwich  cuz I love arugula  and my pal had the carne  choice meat was rib eye  sandwich    It came promptly and my my  it was delicious  Pork was tender  right amount of tangy from the pickles onion and bitter from the arugula  I inhaled my sandwich    My friend thought his beef over seasoned and both meat and bread was a bit burned  He did enjoy it tho    T was a nice visit to Pittsburgh  def recommendation  Surrounded by nice chill spots on the Strip  Too bad we had to leave early  Beautiful city  black and yellow painted all over

Hell yes    This place is amazing every single time   The line is a little bit annoying but I guess that s because everyone else figured out how awesome this joint is too   Try to go there during off peak hours and you ll slip right in

Oh Gaucho grande  how I love thee     The new space is incredibly beautiful  Everything from the exposed brick  the space with wooden tables and chairs by open  wonderful windows and new chalkboard menu is incredible  It was day one of new Gaucho and the lines continually wound out the door  Still everything seemed to flow nicely  This was a happy  appreciative crowd   We worried we d be unable to find a spot to sit  but everything was perfectly timed so that we found a comfy  sunny spot in plenty of time  Don t be scared off by the lines  it s more than worth your small investment of time   The new expanded menu is great  The new veggie empanadas were just amazing   We had the veggie and fish con pane and our favorite papas   The sauces were  as always  super tasty and the old butcher block serving station was a welcoming site to see after the hiatus  Everything was Scrumptious   We cannot wait to try the paella and see the soon to be opened expanded dining room

What s a Baltimore girl doing while shes driving   hours to get to Pittsburgh  She s dreaming about the amazing food she s going to get once she finally makes it to Gaucho  This is my first stop as soon as I get into the city  And it almost made me move there  The smell as soon as you get within a block is incredible  The firewood stacked along all the walls scream of authenticity  and the people who work there are so cool  I m a fan of the steak burger  and its been consistently good  Last time I had it with some bacon  and the bacon was way overcooked to the point of being charcoal  I would say to stick to veggie toppings on the burger  but it wasn t egregous enough for me to knock off a star  and I m sure that if I had said something they would have fixed it immediately  A word of caution  it does get hot inside  Great for the winter  not as fun in the summer

Phenomenally delicious meat   BYOB  So  so  so good   If you re looking for a burger   def get the steak burger  So good  Any meat of the grill will not disappoint  The seasoning are on point  This place gets crazy lines on the weekend  but you should be able to snatch a table on a weekday evening if you get lucky  The place is small but does open up around backs and has a hipster ish ambiance   You order at the counter and then take a seat  if available   Tons of great chimichurri sauces are available for dipping  I had the carrots with goat cheese for a side and they were surprisingly delicious and recommended to share   If you re arriving  just be aware for the potential for long lines and no potentially no place to sit  The food though  Worth it

While visiting the Strip District a few weeks ago  I stopped in for lunch at Gaucho on a whim  It turned out to be the best decision I made that day  It s a small place  it can hold       people max   and it s easy to miss if you re walking by   The first thing you notice when you walk in is the aroma from the grill  your mouth is already watering before you sit down  I ordered the carne sandwich with ribeye  which comes topped with grilled peppers   onions and chimmichurri sauce  The meat was well seasoned and cooked perfectly   juicy and tender  with a really nice char  I washed it down with a cold Mexican Coke  It s not the cheapest sandwich you ll find  ringing in at      but it s more than worth it  I came in hungry and left full   Besides the food itself  what really made my visit great was the excellent service  The owner of the place was super friendly and very patient  explaining the various items on the menu  They also did all the little things that take customer service from just good to exceptional  For example  one customer walked in and placed a      order to go  Gaucho gives a     discount if you call ahead with your takeout order  pro tip   but they went ahead gave him the discount anyway and helped him walk his  order out to his car in the snowy conditions  That is how you do customer service

Definitely one of our favorite restaurant of Pittsburgh  Good meal  good price and good service  The only problem is the long lines on Saturdays  so it s better get very early or after      p m on Weekends
Fantastic and authentic Argentinian food with a unique and urban atmosphere  Hands down one of my favorite places in the city
Absolutely fabulous place    I travel an hour  plus willingly stand on line    Every time  It s delicious  family friendly  and great service  A must place to visit in Pittsburgh
How can people be so friendly     Haha  Everyone who worked there was cheery and welcoming  The food was yummy and unique too

The food is pretty good   no doubt   but the menu is pretty limited if you don t eat beef   pork like me  There are plenty of beef options so if your only restriction is pork  you ll find that the selection is pretty good    More than the actual dishes  what I absolutely love here are the three sauces that are offered  My favorite one  hands down  is the chimichurri sauce  it s green   It s amazing and I  fill up multiple sauce cups of it because it is amazing with the lamb    The line on weekends is usually out the door and I don t think they take reservations  To avoid the lines  I tend to go at awkward times like     pm before the dinner rush starts  The first time I went  we waited for     hours outside and then an additional   hour for food but we went on a Friday night  I believe  The subsequent times  I went at around     pm and there was no wait or line    Overall  a great place

I have been to Gaucho several times  and it s definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh  I would recommend it to anyone visiting the area for the first time   I love getting the steak sandwiches  but honestly anything is good here  As a side I would recommend the potatoes  One of the best parts of the Gaucho experience is the self serve sauces they have  When I go with friends we usually have a good time talking about which is our favorite  I maintain that the ajo garlic one is the best    Sometimes when I m extra hungry I even get some toast to eat with the sauce  but a sandwich or any other entree is usually more than enough  Prepare by going with an empty stomach   Just one note of caution  lines can get very long  I have waited in a line for around   hours to get in on a Friday or Saturday night  If you want to get in quick I would recommend going for lunch on a weekday  but there still might be a bit of a line  It does go pretty quick though  On a similar note  they don t take reservations and their system is that they seat you after you order at the counter

My friend took the guy she was seeing at the time and said it had awesome food and was BYOB  Its hard to tell if the food is good because my friend is a vegan but she was completely right about Gaucho  The sandwiches are amazing and big  We had arrived there around      on a Saturday and most of the food was sold out  especially the bread   We had ordered the chorizo which was unlike any chorizo I had ever tried  It was suppose to come with bread but because they wanted to save the bread for sandwiches  so no bread  But we had also ordered a steak sandwich and grilled corn  The corn was amazing  Sweet  char grilled  So good  The steak sandwich was good too and with the added sauces that they have out  One  if not the best steak sandwich  I can t wait to go back  I also love the smell driving past Gaucho  If that aroma doesn t get you  there s something wrong with you  Hahaha

Just as good  Definitely crowded on a Saturday afternoon  I got in at       and had to wait in line to order but when I left the line was out the door and around the corner    I need to remember to get my steak medium  I usually get medium well but I was served well done    This time around I tried the wings which were very good  the potatoes which were overly seasoned probably wouldn t get again  and the grilled corn which was so good    There sauces are amazing and found out that you can purchase them to take home  I m going to use that on everything

I really can t say it any better than all of those before me have  its just hands down amazing  Simple food cooked perfectly  seasoned perfectly  and served in a fun environment  I kind of hate myself for not coming sooner   Go with the sampler Parrillada Mixta  a sampler of chicken  steak  and chorizo served with olive oil soaked grilled bread  Its great for splitting with two people  Make sure you get all of the sauces so you can mix and match flavors

Everyone said this was THE place to try  Come early  especially for lunch and dinner  Otherwise  be prepared to wait in line for       minutes  And yes  that line goes outside and around the side of the building  rain or shine or snow and bitter cold  They take debit credit cards    Food  We had the lamb  a NY strip steak  and a ribeye  All the meats were prepared to the requested level of doneness  Lamb has a bit too much salt for my liking  but otherwise fresh and flavorful  Good char on all the meat  No one in our party of three cared for the charred bread accompanying the meats  Salads that came with each meat were lightly dressed in a vinaigrette  Empanadas were amazing  The pork empanada was our fave  Sides of cauliflower  broccolini  and green beans were simple and tasty    Service  You line up and order from the main counter  There is NO TABLE service  Drinks first  then food  Staff are proficient in explaining what s on the menu  which is a massive chalkboard on a wall as you enter  Based on your time in line  you should have plenty of time to review what s on the menu  Specials are posted lower on smaller individual chalkboards near the front of the line    Cost  A small lamb   oz  ribeye  and  oz  NY strip steak with side salads    pc  shrimp appetizer  sides of cauliflower  green beans  and broccolini  with a pork empanada and a chicken empanada ran us about     after tax  Not cheap and portions are so so    Overall  I wouldn t line up for it again  but it s worth a try  They do have a sign for the last group to be seated to hold noting they are the end of the line  This is so more folks don t wait in line in case they run out of food
I have only been here once  it was an hour and a half wait in line for lunch  but it was amazing   So good  And the atmosphere was excellent  Going back for sure   TK

The aroma that emerges from the restaurant is so tantalizing that i would stop by for a second meal  I ve been to Gaucho several times  and by far I d say the best part of their meals is the sauces  However  they can seem a bit heavy  so use with discretion  Food can be seasoned better  I feel that it is a hit or miss or perhaps all the seasoning went on one end of the meat  and I didn t get any of it   but when I do it tastes terrific  Lastly  I ve consistently been getting overcooked steak  but thankfully their sauces make it much better
Steak sandwich is ridiculously good  seasonal sides are amazing   only downside here is the line  but also totally worth it

We went for a private party and  oh my god  it was fantastic  I will definitely be going back  The sauces and vegetables and desserts were truly outstanding and the meat was perfect  Really great restaurant  Highly recommend

This is definitely top   restaurant in Pittsburgh for food  Their grilled meat  especially steak is absolutely amazing  The only gripe I have is that it is almost impossible to get a seat there  Every time I drive by there is a huge line  No reservations   no No Wait app     only option is to stand in line  I just don t want to wait in line for     hours for a restaurant  I just had their food truck  Asado   and it was amazing as well  Great lamb sandwich  Top   for sure  but who knows when I will be able to enjoy it again

Well  I had high hopes based on all the hype  Arrived today and waited for quite awhile in line  Staff was friendly and place looked nice with the new addition  Food didn t live up to the hype though  Sandwiches were ok  I liked the roll bread  It was fresh and tasty  The steak was ok  not as good as I hoped  Or at least not as good as all the reviews would lead you to believe  I liked the sauces however they offered  The empanadas were not good at all  Skip them  bland and just not worth it  Corn on the cob was good and potatoes were ok  All in all I felt it was expensive for what we received  Soft drinks were a bargain however at    with free refills  All in all it was decent but just didn t live up to the hype for me  I would not make it a priority to come back and would select other places over this

Okay yelpsters failed me  Im trying to figure out why this place has     stars  The place is a cool hipster place  staff was extremely friendly  however  this place is flawed in a few but major ways  First of all  the menu is this HUGE  mural  written on the wall in chalk  I think this menu is a little extensive to be written on a chalk wall and luckily it wasnt crowded or we would have felt super rushed trying to figure out what we wanted in line  Secondly  I personally dont think ordering filet mignon at a counter and waiting on your food to arrive is acceptable  It felt so weird ordering    dollars worth of food and going to sit down to wait for your order to arrive  At least they actually brought it to us I guess  But dont expect to get asked if you need anything  Its self service after that  And lastly the food was good but not bragging good in my opinion    I CAN say that the filet would have been amazing had it actually been cooked to medium well as we requsted  One of them was definitely on the lower end of the medium spectrum and the other one was closer to medium well but not quite  Since the steak was sliced already  and topped with chimichurri  I didnt want to send it back but clearly was not medium well and I think cooks should be able to recognize this before sending it out  especially with it being sliced already  Flaws aside  this goes in the book as one of the most tender  juicy  and most flavorful pieces of filet mignon I ve ever eaten and Ive eaten a lot of filet mignon in my lifetime  The chimmichurri paired very well with it  It complimented it unlike a lot of places that serve chimi as a necessity to cover up lack of flavor    I also had two beef empanadas  The cashier told me that the beef wasnt  just shredded beef and it was pulsed through a blender so I was expecting a  picadillo style  filling but made with pulsed beef instead of ground beef for a more gourmet filling  however  I was disappointed to find it filled with dry  long chunky pieces of shredded beef  There were a couple of olives mixed in but the beef empanada didnt make the cut at all in my  book  It was very dry inside   And lastly  the proveleta  This was very good  Ive never had anything like it before but it is a thick slice of provolone cheese  seasoned with herbs and fried on each side leaving a delicious crisp on the outside and chewy goodness through the middle  It is served on grilled toast  I ate it with the chilled grilled vegetable medley that came with my steak plate to make  bruschetta  and it was very good that way    Overall  this place has some decent eats but not good enough to write back home about  Obviously im in the minority with this opinion so I guess this is one of those try it yourself places    you might love it

Omnomnom  The empanadas were the best  especially with the pimenton sauce  roasted red pepper with olive oil and balsamic vinegar and other stuff     poured into each bite  My boyfriend got the steak sandwich with the ride year and loved it  His dad got the steak burger and loved it too  The sauces are all amazing  try all of them  There s also grilled veggies that are yummy for the vegetarians  or health conscious    There are only   seats or so inside  but when we went it wasn t crowded so it wasn t a problem  There s tables outside for the summer    The owner is a long time restaurateur who finally decided to settle down and cook his family s native cuisine  And I  for one  am appreciative that he did

Came here for dinner last night for a friend s birthday  We wanted to come on a week night since the weekends are crazy packed  We got there around   and there was a little line  We waited in like for about    minutes  While we were in line a lady came around and asked how many people were in our party so that we could be seated once we ordered  I thought that was a nice touch  I ordered the small flank steak plate and an order of maiz  corn on the cob   Everything was delicious  My steak was tender and juicy    i got mine medium rare   The chimichurri they put on the steak is amazing  They have four sauces  a chimichurri  a garlic sauce  a Smokey pepper sauce and a carmelized onion sauce  All four were so good but the chimi and garlic are my favorite  This place is also BYOB with no corkage fee  This place is worth the visit

i have nothing to complain about for this place  the people are very welcoming and they have a system that works great  the menu is filled with delicious options for everyone and i walked out feeling stuffed after only one sandwich  i recommend the carne sandwich but add an egg  the chimichurri is also tasty and adds a lot to the sandwich  i wouldn t recommend if you are planning on coming with a party of more than   people

Great Argentinian food for a fair price  This is a fast casual type of place so you order at the counter  they seat you  and then they bring out your food  Everything we had was very good  though the highlight was probably their   homemade sauces that you can put on everything   a chimichurri sauce  a carmelized onion sauce  a smoked pepper sauce  and a garlic sauce  They have sandwiches  salads  plates of meat  empanadas  and sides of veggies  I don t think you can really go wrong but I recommend some type of steak and something with bread so that you can dip it in all the sauces

I am in love with Gaucho   I have to get the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich every time I go  Please never take it off the menu   Nothing should stop you from sampling this sweet deliciousness  The reviews speak for themselves

Gaucho is a tiny spot with big  BIG smoky flavor   Walking in is like being immersed in a forest fire that all of Bambi s delicious friends have failed to escape   Me and my brother went here for his birthday dinner  and the first thing that struck us  aside from the size and the smoke  is the minimalist staff  one guy on the register  one guy in the kitchen   But both of them are seriously good at what they do   The guy up front was warm  funny  and knowledgeable  providing atypically excellent service while the guy in the back works the grill like a friggin artist   Here s the breakdown of our meal   We ordered three sandwiches  the skirt steak  the fish of the day  mako shark   and the steak burger   The skirt steak was cooked astonishingly well   Generally when SLABS of steak and not those paper thin slices are used in a sandwich  it doesn t eat well  doesn t break apart nicely when you bite into it so the sandwich falls apart or you end up pulling out more meat than you intended   The steak at Gaucho eats well  and is wonderfully tender   Our only complaint was that the steak itself was a bit underseasoned and was overpowered by the caramelized onions and red peppers   The mako shark was also cooked perfectly and seasoned very well  tasting lightly of lemon but still recognizable as shark   If you ve been disappointed by tough or bland shark in the past  I definitely recommend trying Gaucho s take on it   Finally  the steakburger was the smokiest burger I ve had in Pittsburgh  and in terms of sheer carnivorous sublimity ranks up there with the best   The smoke complimented the flavor of the meat perfectly  giving it depth and nuance that all the toppings in the world could not   Of course all of these sandwiches were served on delicious bread that held up to the juices dripping out of the proteins     All in all  these sandwiches are pricy  but they are damn well worth it   The executions are excellent and the flavors are generally well balanced   I d also recommend trying the four condiments they have available  with my personal favorites being the chimmi and the ajo   I have to say  existence of this place gives me much hope   Here is truly good food and good cooking without pretense  striking a balance  and a striking balance  between artistry and accessibility
YES  It is worth standing outside in the line  This is the absolute best meal I have had in Pittsburgh   Rosemary braised beef sandwich Empanadas  Sweet potatoes Papas  AMAZING

Not sure what else can be said about this place   The burger I just had was excellent and rivals anything in Pittsburgh  The meat had a twinge of wood smokiness that was balanced great with caramelized onions  arugula  and chimichurri   You pick your extras   The sweet potatoes were out of this world and I will now seek to replicate them  The service is something I would liken to a bee hive  organized chaos   The prices are more than fair     stars

Great steak and great sandwich  You can smell the grill upon entering the restaurant  First time I had a great fish sandwich  All the herbs are fresh too  The staff is friendly  Not too much can be said since our experiences have always been great  Maybe they should stock up on corn so they don t run out when business is good

Amazing   The service  the food and the atmosphere were all top notch   Service was amazingly fast   My kids really liked it because the flavors are exceptional    Can t wait to grab a bottle of wine for a date night another night soon

This place is honestly overrated  The steak was tough to cut  and the sauces were too oily  The paella was so salty to the point where we could not eat it  It didn t have a lot of shrimp and mussels in it  either  Save your money and go somewhere else  It s not worth standing in a line for an hour for subpar food
Very good  Totally worth the wait  Also make sure you grab some of their sauces  they were awesome  We will definitely be returning

Slow and overpriced  The food was good but not outstanding  We waited in line an hour to find more than half the tables were empty inside  They need to improve efficiencies  I may try again with a takeout order but will never wait in that line again

Amazing food  Awesome staff  I stumbled by this place looking for something quick  cheap and get a sense of local fare  I smelled the food from outside and decided to check them out  Walked in and couldn t figure out the menu so I asked the girl behind the counter about the menu  She came from around the counter and explained everything to me and my family  and shared what was popular there  I loved that she took time to do that  The food wasn t cheap but everything sounded so good that we tried a few things  Lol  The steak sandwich was an experience of awesomeness  The shrimp was great  I wish I tried the corn  Do yourself and palate a favor and check them out

Not much new to say  as the overwhelmingly positive reviews are      accurate  the food is incredible  Everyone in Pittsburgh should try it if they haven t yet   That said  it appears that everyone in Pittsburgh IS trying to have it  so getting into the restaurant is roughly as hard as getting an unannounced table for eight at Noodlehead on a Saturday night  But the food is so incredible that I can t take a star off for the awful wait you will undoubtedly have  It s still worth it    Go early  go with a small crowd  and go hungry  You won t regret it

So good  we went twice on our visit   Bring your own wine   We shared the chicken  awesome   Their garlic sauce is off the hook  well  all of the sauces are   We also split a salad   Again  very well done   It s nice to see a restaurant where the staff works together

My favorite restaurant in the Burgh  Never disappoints the Flank steak sandwich is so delicious  On crunchy Ciabatta bread  the wood fire grilled flank steak cooked perfectly to medium  the char tastes so good  Topped with fire roasted peppers and onions  smothered in their choice of four fire roasted dipping sauces  especially their garlic aioli  A side of roasted red potatoes  roasted with rosemary and garlic  this food is soooooo good   A little dessert cookie with dulche le lecher rounds out a perfect meal again  Gaucho is the best
The food was very tasty  especially their s signature sauce  But there is one thing  it takes long time to wait at the outside  almost a hour  Everything was good except that

It s in the    s and bitter cold  Place is small so with the crowd it took    min just to get inside  It was an hour to order  at the counter   be seated and served  It was worth the wait  I had a ribeye  sliced with chimichurri   fantastic  Potatoes with roasted garlic  very nice  And such a welcome surprise in flavor was the spaghetti squash with smoked honey and pecans  As we were eating the line waiting outside to get in was getting longer  It is worth the wait

I spent a few days in Pittsburgh over the holidays and G P A  was on my must visit list  My husband and I went for an early lunch and only had to wait       minutes  The staff were very friendly  You order food and drinks  soft drinks only as it s a BYOB  at the counter where you pay and the staff seat you and bring your food out  Our food arrived swiftly once we were seated and I think part of the reason that you wait at the counter is so that the kitchen doesn t get swamped with orders  G P A  isn t fine dining   its a casual lunch dinner option with a friendly  relaxed atmosphere  I was surprised to find that the tables were spacious and well spaced out and I appreciated that they didn t rush us or pressure us to leave even though they were busy  The food was very good  simply prepared and very flavorful  We shared a mixed grill of sausage  chicken and flank steak which came with some grilled country style bread along with a house salad and two empanadas  this made for a hearty lunch that was satisfying and extremely reasonably priced   The empanadas had soft tender pastry and tasty fillings  the meats were well cooked and juicy and the house salad made a nice fresh accompaniment  we had a small salad and it was plenty enough for two people   The meats came with chimmichurri and in addition there were large jars of it around the restaurant that you could help yourself to  we tried four different sorts and they were all amazing and complimented everything well   We only had time for one visit  but I can t wait to visit again on my next Pittsburgh trip

One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh  But forewarning  if you re going on Friday Saturday night be prepared for long lines out the door  You wait in line to order and then are seated  where the food is brought to you  Well worth the wait though  I ve been there a few times and love the skirt steak and chicken sandwiches  The meat is always so tender and the sauces that come with     wow  Healthy  fresh  and oh so flavorful  A must eat in Pittsburgh

They have a party room downstairs which provided the perfect setting to celebrate a friend co worker s birthday   Food was delicious  space was warm and inviting and allowed us all to mingle   The staff was extremely attentive   I would go back in a heartbeat

It s not the first time I visit an Argentinian restaurant  I was excited hearing this place since it had amazing reviews  I was extremely disappointed    It was a long wait to order food which would have been fine if the food was cooked properly  We ordered the Parrillada Mixta  steak  chicken and chorizo   One word to describe the food would be  DRY  The steak was chewy  I ordered medium rare and it came well done   the chorizo was rubbery and the chicken well flavored with the garlic sauce was also dry    We also ordered the Arrechera platter  flank steak   I ordered it medium and it came out burnt  I had to cut all the outside  so I didn t  have to taste the bitterness  On the positive side  the salad was delicious and fresh  The Chorypan was good  Extremely overrated place  or the kitchen had a bad day

The price is a little bit high but they cook other meat to perfection  Their sauces are amazing  Honestly everything here is really great and I really recommend it for everyone to come here  All my friends who have visited here loved it and would not stop talking about it  If you have a large party I would suggest getting a seafood paella

out of   stars    Ok maybe the fact that i was starving when we got there on our road trip past Pittsburgh contributed a half star but nevertheless one of most memorable restaurants I ve been to  My wife a I shared the Parrillada Mixata that included a choice of steak  we tried NY   spicy chorizo  bbq chicken and toasts  We also tried the chicken and beef empenadas  Everything was amazing  The portions were generous and enough for the two of us  The sauces couldn t be any better  Specially the smoked pepper sauce  The service was great and the staff were super friendly and attentive  We were lucky that we got there a bit early for dinner but there was a huge line for dinner by the time we left  The prices were also very reasonable  Overall i wanna go back to Pittsburgh just to go to Gaucho Parrilla Argentina    Food      Service and atmosphere      Price       Overall

Ridiculously good   Worth the wait  be patient   Chorizo is so good   As I the roasted cauliflower   Of course the steak and chicken is perfect  The   sauces are so good it s hard not to sample while waiting   The staff is very good and friendly   They do keep the line slow  but only to ensure everyone gets a seat   Worth every second

Amazing     Food is so good and fresh  And it s byob  I wouldn t go when your extremely hungry because when we got there at around  ish for dinner we waited in line for an hour  To me  I think the line is worth it for how good the food is  But I love good food
Great service  incredible food and very experienced staff  You can t find this anywhere else in Pittsburgh
I have been there a couple of times and had a steak sandwich  It is better as a lunch place than dinner   Make sure to get something to

Had only   day in Pittsburgh and ate here for dinner  Steak was excellent  salad was perfect  but bread was super burnt  My meal was      Line took an hour at       Staff was nice  We ate outside and it was cute but loud from nearby club  BYOB is an awesome thing that I wish I had been prepared for    I ll have to go back someday with a bottle of Malbec

WOWOWOWOWOWWWW  I LOVEEEE their menu selections  TBH  taste is like a       but their sauces  ambiance and service kick it up to      Came at    AM and there was already a decent line wrapped around the building  Fear not though  they are speedy and efficient   Basically  you choose your protein and can top it on a salad  small or large   sandwich or just on a platter  There are obviously lots of other protein options too    but I LOVE MY COW    Everything was well prepared  I definitely don t have enough experience with the menu yet to advice people of what to get  but if you ever have questions about what you should get  ask the cashier  He is hella nice    Parking  busy area  Almost like a Chinatown Farmers Market area on weekends  Street it    Overall  a must try if you are in PA  A pretty solid spot for brunch and dinner  Come early before they run out

This place is the legit  real deal delicious sandwich place   This is a place that you go out of your way to visit    I had a matambre sandwich   The meat was smoky  delicious and well seasoned   The bread was great too    Definitely coming back to this jewel
Good food  Meat is greta with a lot of variety  Sometimes the char is too much   Get there early before the line goes out the door and up the bridge

Amazing  I could tell from the smoke billowing outside that this meal was going to be good  but it surpassed my expectations   I had a steak sandwich  and it was fantastic  They have unique condiments in a table in the middle   I liked the chimichurri the most  But the meat was so good it didn t even need it

Hands down the best place to eat in Pittsburgh  Just the sauces alone are enough to give   stars for  I have been known to eat the Chimichurri sauce by itself while waiting for my food  The wait is well worth it  The wood fire flavor is out of this world and it seeps into every food that they serve  The roasted veggies are to die for and a must to order as a side  The steak sandwich is a classic and so filling  I can hardly ever finish the whole thing but still order sides because I just can t resist    Finally  the star of the show  THE PAELLA  I lived in Spain for some time and it s the closest I ve experienced in the states to authentic paella  It s cooked in the traditional cast iron skillet so it gets that charred  crunchy rice at the bottom that I have bene missing  Truly worth it    And the price just can t be beat  For such an outstanding  renown and acclaimed restaurant  it astounds me that they haven t raised their prices  I myself can eat there  and feel like I don t need to eat for days  for      And for a group of four adults  we got an order of steak  that came with a side salad and grilled bread   four pieces of corn  an order of the veggies  an order of the wings and the     paella and our entire bill came to just      And we had leftovers  It was fantastic  Plus  the fact that it s BYOB makes it even better    The only set back is that you can t sit and bask in the glory of your food coma because there are so many people waiting for a table  But it s honestly part of the experience    Just remember to tip the staff too  They work so hard and the service is great  Just because it s not your typical sit down service doesn t mean they shouldn t get some cash thrown into the tip jar at the register  The whole staff  including the kitchen  shares the tips  and that s always been something I ve appreciated in an establishment
As a vegetarian  I was hesitant to come here  To my surprise they had a few options  I got the veg sandwich and it was so good  My other non veg friends got steak  and said it was delicious

Drove through Pittsburgh from NYC to Memphis  Looked up on yelp the best rated place that would be open  in the area and     This amazing little gem was the only one with   stars and it definitively deserved it s   stars  Nice staff  super good and charming environment

What an experience   The food was incredible   we ordered all   choices of empanadas  flank steak  and   sides   everything had a ton of flavor and was cooked perfectly  There was a huge line but the manager was very accommodating especially because we had a baby with us  Easy   stars

The food here is UNREAL    Absolutely delicious meats  My only grievance is that you can t sit down until you order  and there is usually a very lengthy line  so you end up standing for about an hour before you eat and then feel a little rushed as you eat what you ve been waiting for
Always have a good experience here  The employees are always excitable and kind  Food is always delicious  I love the flank steak  shrimp  toast  and the dipping oils
This spot is all that   some  I wasn t too fond of my chicken empanada  but my sister said her veggie one was good  Their favors are so delicious
Eat here     It s amazing  Great for a fun night out to wear a cute outfit for sure but you can totally go there wearing and feeling whatever  It s perfect  Food is amazing  Style is unique  I dig it

If you love meat simply the best  Take a bottle of wine  or a   pack  and enjoy   While we have loved the Asado platter on many occasions  the steak burger is simply delectable  Take out is also a possibility  Worth the wait  which wraps around onto the   th St bridge and not Penn Ave  FYI
Great good great personality  Would go back anytime and I strongly recommend this place for a great meal

The food is all that it s cracked up to be   Not only is everything cooked to perfection  the spice combinations are new  to most of us  and delicious   It s a little like the experience of the first time you dive into Indian food   The service is also super friendly and helpful   Very reasonable prices for what you get   The only thing not to like is the weird order  wait  sit  set up that has to be learned   It doesn t ruin the experience  but it would be so much more relaxing to be seated and then order   I hate seat insecurity  it s something that goes back to the high school cafeteria   You know it s not ideal when there are signs warning you to relax before you enter   BTW  that s not a problem if you want take out

Huge line on Saturday night  We waited    minutes outside on the street before stepping in to order  I had a ribeye sandwich and she had a pork platter  The ribeye was juicy  but tough and not trimmed of the gristle and silver skin  Huge sandwich on ciabatta bread with roasted peppers and chimichurri sauce  Difficult to hold and eat  The pork platter was shredded and was served with grilled onions and a salad  The meal was ok  but not worth    minutes in the cold with the exhaust from the broiler blowing all over us  Maybe better on a warm evening and different menu selections   The staff looked like they had gotten off from their day jobs at Trader Joe s and come straight to the restaurant  A lot of colorful hair  piercings and ink

A terribly easy five stars to give    I got the ribeye steak plate  It s an immaculate piece of perfectly cooked steak  thinly sliced on the bias  and served on a wooden board with a small side salad and a piece of flawlessly grilled bread    The steak was incredible  The bread was very purposefully included to soak up the insanely good juices that run from the steak as you eat it  and the salad is a wonderful fresh accompaniment    We also tried a side of humita which is described as  Corn pudding w onions   fresh herbs   This was fantastic and added a nice contrast to the meal    The only thing I didn t enjoy was the empanada  and my fellow diner agreed  The texture of the pastry was off and the filling tasted a bit funny    But I still refuse  boldly refuse even  to give this place   stars  because the steak was so gut punchingly good that if I found myself within     miles of Pittsburgh at any point in time  I would drive out of my way to enjoy another meal at Gaucho    Good thing we came in when we did  cause the line snaked inside the restaurant as we were eating  It was actually hard to leave    not just because people were blocking the door    but because I wanted more steak    and to live there    inside the restaurant

Not impressed at all  Tried their steak sandwich  and found the meat to be hard and dry  It was very hard to chew  Also tried their sauces  and I would say I am not impressed  Food wise I would just give it a threr star    Probably reading the previous reviews set my expectations too high and I don t find it live up to the hype  Also rather pricey  The long wait makes this place overall   star for me

With all of the   star reviews I guess I was expecting more  It was very confusing as soon as we walked in  One sign says wait to be seated and another sign says don t stand here  With no hostess in sight we were left trying to read the huge black board menu  At least half of it is in another language  Finally some from behind the counter filling water glasses gave us the scoop  This is actually like a fast food restaurant  You have to pick your drinks  order your food  and then find yourself a table  Now we realize there isn t any silverware or plates  you have to get them yourself too  I had the ribeye which was good but it was over cooked to med well when I ordered med  The salad that came with  it was served actually on top of the steak and was drenched in some oily dressing  Terrible  I guess that was something else nobody told us about  and we forgot to ask with all of the confusion  You can t pick your own salad dressing  Next time I ll pick an american themed restaurant

I have eaten only twice here but both meals made it to my top meals ever in Pittsburgh  I have eaten sandwiches  empanadas  chicken wings  and the alfareho cookies amongst other things  There was not a single thing I didn t like  The food is packed with rich deep Flavors  the meat is unbelievably juicy  soft and tender  The only problem is waiting in the long line after searching for a parking spot

I went there on a Saturday at   pm  and the wait was about an hour and half to get in  However it was certainly worth it  as this restaurant serves some amazing food  I had the spicy sausage sandwich and a chicken empanada  I would highly recommend both of those options for they were delicious  and I was able to eat the whole meal considering the hunger I built up waiting in line    I was told there is no line around      and      on weekdays if you have the chance to go then

The food was great   the line   wait for ordering  not so much   Terribly thought out flow of queuing  ordering   seating  that makes the wait far longer than it needs to be   We have to grab our own silverware  etc   which is kinda silly   Having said that  the food was excellent  and worth a try   I d suggest a weeknight to help avoid the unnecessary line   wait

On a warm summer Thursday afternoon  I did a self directed gastronomic tour of Lawrenceville and The Strip   Gaucho was recommended over and over  even by other restaurants and bars  I was warned that there was going to be a huge line  so I was glad that I went at     pm and was able to get right in  The huge chalkboard menu to the right of the counter lists all their features  which is a true reflection of an Argentinian parilla  Chicken  pork  beef  shrimp  all go on the grill with herbaceous and flavorful sauces  I ordered the spicy chorizo  shrimp  and empanadas  and everything I had was delicious  They are BYOB and the staff is more than happy to help you navigate the South American menu  Jars of self serve sauces featuring chimichurri  roasted tomato  roasted garlic  and roasted onion sauces are openly available and pair great with   well  a spoon  they are that good

Busy  eccentric place in the Strip  A must try to everyone living or visiting Pittsburgh  Everything we ve tried was awesome  Be willing to wait outside when you go  but that s part of the fun      Can t wait to go again  Oh and they do take out too

All of the other reviews have this place covered   It is incredible   Been here many times and I am always impressed by the food   steaks cooked to perfection and extremely fresh ingredients   Very reasonably priced   not cheap  but not overpriced either   Nominee for favorite restaurant in PGH   Love the   star food without the stuffy environment   Always bring out of towners here as it is sure to be a hit

I was really looking forward to this place since we recently moved from Philly and would love a good sandwich   We ordered the sandwich with filet  side of potatoes and the side of rice   The staff was really friendly and helpful    I wish the sauces had a description written down on the menu or somewhere so you know what s in them   They were all full of flavor  The flavors in the sandwich were really good   The onion  meat and bread together tasted great   The meat was seasoned and cooked well   The wood flavor is really enjoyable   What I didn t like was that the sandwich was hard to eat because the meat was hard to eat   If they sliced the meat thinner it would be easier to eat  Overall  good sandwich but meat is hard to eat   Great staff

There isn t much else to add that has not already been said     BYOB  great food  and prices   One of the ladies working here encouraged us to take home some extra sauce to accompany our breakfast  sammiches  etc  Excellent peeps here   Warm and modern environment without being pretentious  Well done   Update  So far I ve had three of Gaucho s sandwiches  the Bondiola  pork shoulder   carne  I had flank steak   and rosemary braised beef  The Bondiola is my favorite of the lot   For around     for a delicious sammich and potatoes  I think you would be hard pressed to find a better deal in Pittsburgh for the skrilla
Delicious  A place I would take people to explore when they visit Pittsburgh
Great meats  cooked to perfection  Long wait  but service is friendly and they try to get it to you as soon as possible   Get the meat sampler  it is amazing
This store is completely evacuated  Don t know where it is moving into  Really miss the good food there

It s definitely a great place but not deserve   stars rating  I ordered fish of the day plate and it was very salty  The NY strip plate was good but not much special  If it wouldn t take me   minutes to wait in line  I ll give   stars

Being new to Pittsburgh I have slowly been trying new places and was invited to enjoy Sat night dinner here  So to start off the place is busy on Sat night first come first serve no reservations expect a line but it s popular so it s expected The are a lot of choices from steaks  sandwiches  seafood paella  and appetizers  We got the paella with a side of beef empanadas and some ribs which were all good  The place is BYOB which is a plus  I will have to return again some time and try a steak to give it a full review but it was good  The place for the record is young and youthfull with music playing and isn t by far a quiet romantic place  It s all part of great food and great service

Worked in fine dining for   years and this may have been my most euphoric food experience yet  Part of   of us we each tried each other and every thing was absolutely to die for  Smoked pulled pork sandwich with caramelized onions and mustard was fantastic  Other person got sweet sausage sand witch and sausage had a very unique twist in the flavor that worked in perfect harmony with rest of flavors  I got the Ribeye medium with side salad  by far best ribeye I ve ever tasted  They aced the medium temp on their wood fire grill   Even side salad was very tasty and prices aren t too bad    of us was roughly     and that included a tip  This is the rare kind of place where every last menu item will completely knock your socks off  Can t wait to return
Two words  Smoked Meats  Get there  this place is amazing
Amazing food and awesome people  I recommend their streak burger  The meat is incredible here
Great food  Be prepared to wait  in a line

Damn     This place is awesome  Best bang for your buck in the city of Pittsburgh  Never had a bad meal and I LOVE the MEAT SWEATS this place give you  The sauces are impeccable  Everything is amazing

Gaucho is beyond awesome  The meat is high quality product  over the top well prepared  The staff is enthusiastic about what they do  The whole experience is like going to a good friend s house  discovering that some of your other friends have also come over  and then being served implausibly good food
A bit pricey for the amount of food you get  I heard lots of great things about it  but it didn t live up to the hype in my opinion

SETTING Very small place with very limited bar stools along the wall for dining in  Menu is written on blackboards that stretch along the walls  More seating outside  Wood everywhere   FOOD We ordered the top two recommended sandwiches  Ribeye sandwich  medium rare  unless you tell them otherwise  and the Rosemary braised beef sandwich   Wow  the ribeye was perfection  Definitely a heavy sandwich with thick cuts of ribeye topped with roasted red peppers and onions on a ciabatta type bread  The rosemary braised beef sandwich was delicious as well  a little lighter than the ribeye  but still filling  The horseradish sauce went very well with the beef and caramelized onions    The four kinds of sauces they offer were excellent  Definitely try dipping your sandwiches in them for an extra kick   SERVICE Despite the long lines  the food was made in a reasonable amount of time  To make the line more bearable  there was always loud and silly banter amongst the cooks and register  It was as if I was at an improv show  One customer was taking a photo and the cooks immediately struck a pose  Another was hugging his girlfriend  and the cooks joked out loud to their customers that he was actually  holding her up from falling down  due to the long wait  Hilarious  Order up front and they call your name once your order is ready   IMPRESSIONS There aren t many places that serve such quality meat inside a sandwich at a reasonable price  Each meal comes with a side of laughs as well  Everyone there is happy and leaves with his stomach happy  this is why Gaucho s is a must visit   just be prepared to wait at least    minutes

Great food and friendly staff  I recommend coming a little earlier than when you want to eat as the wait is a bit and there is no reservation mechanism  Once you ve order though food comes out quick  Definitely recommend
Service was awesome  Food arrived to the table fast  We ordered a BUNCH of different stuff and shared  It was all delicious  A bit pricey       tip for    but well worth it

What can I say about this place that hasn t already been said  Not much I m guessing   The meats are flavorful and have a great char  The bread is fresh and toasted  My favorite part are the grilled veggies  I would come here just for them  The sauces are flavorful  My favorite is the chimmi  I look forward to trying the empanadas and grilled corn next time  Yes the space is small but they are working on an expansion  If in the area this is a MUST try

If I could  I would live on a cross beam of the   th Street Bridge  so I could eat here    times a week   Great food  reasonably priced   Friendly staff   Parking can be a pain  I suspect   But my party got there early  about       AM and we missed the noon rush   I had one of the steak sandwiches  my pal had the pork   We also got a sample of the empanadas   We were very happy people    We did not want to leave   Ever    My pal called today   he went there without me and had the wings   He says they were fantastic   He now joins me in looking for a cross beam to declare residence near the restaurant

On a ling weekend from Chicago and found this place on yelp  The Carne sandwhich with ribeye cut  medium rare  was without question the best sandwhich I ve ever gotten  Roasted potatoes and empe adas were really good too  All   sauces offered were amazing  Cant say enough about the whole experience  Will definitely visit before leaving town and every time I m back  Definitely check it out
I highly recommend Gaucho  All of their selections are very high quality  and it s a reasonable price  I have tried the Rosemary beef and the veggies  and they were both great

Made a trip here from Cleveland this past weekend   First let me say that my wife is from Argentina  and I have visited there   The food here was better than any restaurant that I visited while in Buenos Aires   My wife loved it as well  although she said the empanadas were not as good as her mother makes   We both had different steaks which were cooked to perfection  Long lines  but they moved quickly and the food is definitely worth it   I only wish there was one in Cleveland
This place rocks   No alcohol  but byob   The food is out of this world   Argentine steaks grilled and sliced perfect   Huge Paella and grilled appetizers   Fed a group of   of us and so much fun

I could live without red meat  Chicken and fish  I need  but not red meat  So this review is partly mine and partly my devoted carnivore boyfriend s     The meat is really tender and seasoned really well  We ve had the lomo  filet  with chimichurri  the flank steak with some pepper sauce  and the lomo sandwich  They were all really good  The only issue for me is that the cooking temperatures are not very consistent  I ordered a dish of lomo and my boyfriend ordered a lomo sandwich and mine was medium rare and his was well done    maybe between medium well and well  He will eat any meat  but I am pretty strictly a medium to medium well person  so the medium rare was way too raw for me    He also usually gets a side order of the potatoes and I get the grilled bread  I love that grilled bread  I would install that grill in my home just so I could paint bread with olive oil and grill it like they do    The guys who work at Gaucho Parillla are total hipsters  but really friendly guys  We ve gone around closing before and they ve walked out  to smoke  chat  get some air   and said  don t steal anything while we re gone   and just walked out for a few minutes    Now  I just asked my boyfriend  what do you want me to say about the Gaucho place   as he has been urging me to write a review  He said  best meat ever  and  it s wonderful  and when I said  why    looking for more details   he said  psht  What do you mean why  You know why   So he s not very helpful  but definitely a fan  so take that as you will    Tip  It s BYOB and the nice guys cooking your meat would enjoy a beer from your   pack

Once you get past the extremely long wait  yummy food awaits you   I thought the food was tasty  especially the grilled vegetables but I thought the portions were kind of small overall   The small grilled vegetables was supposed to feed two as a side but I could have devoured that thing myself in addition to the small flank steak plate I ordered   If I ever visit Pittsburgh again  I would definitely like to come back and try the asado plate steak sampler

Oh man  the food here is so so so good  Like  just    oh man  The staff is great  the menu is on the wall  you come in  order and grab a table  I had a pork sandwich and some potatoes and something else  I ve forgotten  it s been a week   the person I was with got stake and some veggies and a bunch of other things  The empanadas are so good  I got some kind of cookie thing for desert  and my friend got a fruit crumble thing  Just  everything was so good  eat here  come hungry  it is so worth it
This is the  rd time here and it never disappoints  I m looking forward for my next visit  Amazing food and service    Meat lovers this is your heaven   Make sure to try the empanadas

This is one of the BEST restaurants in Pittsburgh  The food is awesome  The flavors and quality are what sets this place apart  I ve had several types of steak  All were excellent  Probably the best steak salad I ve ever had  Chicken is also excellent  Must try the homemade sauces  Service is good for a place where you order at a counter  But even with lines of customers out the door  service moves relatively quickly

We were walking by Gaucho and it smelled so good we knew we had to stop  Their was a small line but it was all worth the wait   We ordered the fugazza  the provoletta  chicken empanadas  the rosemary braised beef  the campfire yams and rice   The fugazza was good but you must love onions and rosemary  If not  it s not for you  The provoletta was tasty  The chicken empanadas were just ok  not super flavorful  The rosemary braised beef sandwich was delicious  The rice was plain and the campfire yams were sweet and delicious  they would even make a good dessert    If I lived in Pittsburgh I would definitely go back  The only thing that bugged me was you feel a little rushed while eating since they are trying to seat as many customers as quickly as they can

Love it  Food  fantastic  Even after expanding the restaurant the quality and taste remains  worth it  The service we had was better than   out of    of the best local restaurants in Pgh   You order at the counter and the staff helps find a seat for your party   There are no reservations and you are not seated by a hostess but these guys have it down  They serve your food make sure everything is cool and check in on you  If you want additional items they ll place the order for you vs having to stand in line again  Lucky to have in Pgh

I was just visiting a friend in the area and had no expectations about Gaucho   On a Saturday evening  we waited in line for a little more than an hour  maybe an hour and a half   The line moved quickly and everyone around us was friendly   The weather was great and this place is BYOB  so we busted out the cups of sangria while in line   Once inside  the two of us ordered a selection of things including the Zanahoria bebe  baby carrots   chorizos  provoletta  and the qui qui chicky   The qui qui chicky is amazing  I literally had a dream about it   The provoletta was also delicious   I don t remember for certain  but I think our total came to under     including tip   I would highly recommend

This was an amazing find in Pittsburgh  The most delish salad and topped with filet mignon  Everything looks delish here  Yummy veggies and proteins  Excellent service  And to top it off no cork fee  If your in the city it s a must

Had to line up by the door to order first  Even though there s plenty of seats inside but you can sit until you ordered and paid  We had Pork round shape  and Beef  dumpling shape  Empanadas  the beef one tasted better   medium cooked ribeye  tasted great but the meat did not seem very fresh   small Gaucho salad  and the featured pasta  Everything is amazing  The line went fast    mins for us on Friday noon   so don t be afraid of waiting too long
Absolutely our favorite place in Pittsburgh   I cannot say enough good things   the staff is fun  the food is amazing

Went for lunch on a Saturday and sat outside   The food is well done while the atmosphere is a bit frenetic   Grilled meats do not disappoint   BYOB is a plus as we brought a nice bottle of Malbec   It s a good place  but  as some contend  one of the best in town  not really   But would definitely recommend

After eating here today I now know why they are ranked    on America s top     by Yelp  I ordered the carne sandwich with a side of potatoes  both were very filling and the chimmi sauce really kicked it up a notch  It can be a little pricey  but it s definitely worth it  Between the extremely helpful service  cozy atmosphere  and great food  this is my new favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh

Yelp led me here    THANK YOU   This has to be one of the BEST sandwiches I have ever had   You can smell the wood burning stove before you see the place  And it smells like heaven  They have a lovely little patio that uses their wood pile as a backdrop  Inside is small but the space is used wisely  It has minimal but special decor  There is a huge overwhelming  read you will want it all  chalkboard of choices   At the island in the middle are   sauces that pair with all of the food nicely   I am not sure what they are exactly  but each one was better than last    The girl at the register was very helpful and explained what things were and gave a helpful suggestion for a fist timer  I placed my order for the filet mignon  roasted red pepper  caramelized onion on ciabatta with a sauce    The owner manager brought it out and chatted with me a little about the concept and the space    He even  apologized  in advance for the cravings I would have   I thought we will see     He was not lying   I told my husband the next day I wanted to go again  It is that good      You will be very glad you tried it  I can t wait to go again  I want to try the roasted corn

Awesome  awesome  awesome  Everything here is done so well  I love the beef sandwiches  My wife talked me into getting a seafood stew and that was unreal  One of my favorite places on the strip for lunch or an early dinner

I m so upset it took me this long to get here  but I was always nervous about the long line   Luckily  when I went  there was no line at all   There s nothing but good things to say about the food   It s delicious and you get a lot of it   I was nervous that I was only getting a sandwich  so I also ordered the mushroom side  but I didn t need it   The sandwich would have been plenty    I can t wait to come back again and again

If your in the strip district  you need to go to this restaurant  It s an experience  You will wait but it s worth every minute  It s a BYOB and make sure you are hungry  We ordered the empanadas for the table as appetizers with some chorizo too  Perfect starters  Then we ordered the strip and omg is the only way to describe it  The chicken is delicious too  Sides of potatoes and root vegetables made a perfect combination    I will miss this place when my daughter graduates  Might have to make a special trip

Food is excellent  We have tried most items on their menu and everything is delicious  Meat is perfectly seasoned  Grill vegetable is tasty  Their waiting staff is very attentive    The only downside is the line can be very long and sometimes you need to wait for more than    minutes  people actually start drinking while waiting   They will not take your name and force you to actually stand in the line to dine here  which is extremely inefficient

If you see a long line in the strip across the street from Altar Bar  it s not because some major new band is playing in town  No  Altar Bar is back to being a church and it s Gaucho s notoriously long line to try their    authentic  wood fired Argentinian grilled meats  Like Smallman Galley  they don t accept any reservations  but they have a much smaller staff location  so the wait can be a bit daunting  especially if you re waiting in the mid day sun during the lunchtime rush  I recommend going during the mid afternoon lull on a weekday if you don t like waiting for potentially over an hour  Otherwise  be prepared to spend some time chatting with hungry strangers in the Strip  Once you finally get inside  make sure you try the their collection of self serve sauces which include chimichurri  roasted tomato  roasted garlic  roasted onion  etc

I think I am in the minority here  but I can t help but think this place is a bit overrated   Too much oil  too much fanfare  too little meat  too pricey for my liking   My qualms       Why have Flank and Skirt steak  Seems a bit redundant and the two times I have ordered the Asado plate I could not distinguish them  The Asado plate is also expensive and a bit of a let down      The Empanadas  Ugh  maybe I caught them on a bad day  I certainly hope so  It was dry  crusty and crumbled at the touch  I am a huge fan of meat pastries from every culinary persuasion and this was a surprising folly for a place so highly touted      The salads  Skip the Argentino with steak  Never had the heart for any of the others because this was just floating in oil   Overall  I still can t help but love this place  I can t  You don t find places like this in Pittsburgh and it is so refreshing to have the option for a  high end  steak sandwich in the strip  Still  I am just not into paying    bucks for lunch   in Pittsburgh   from anywhere   If the line is short and your pockets a little too heavy I would definitely recommend  Nice people too

If you re looking for a lively place with fun  flavorful dishes  Gaucho is for you  When you get inside  you need to wait until your whole party arrives before you can order  but you can pass the time by browsing the extensive menu on the board  The two times I ve been there  the wait was under    minutes  but most nights  people wait out the door  However  the wait is really worth it  The food has so much flavor and the sauces are really yummy    My first time there  I ordered the Qui Qui Chicky which is listed as a  small plate   but you get   pieces of chicken so it s forsure big enough for a meal  The next time I was there  I got the   oz flank steak plate  The steak was very tender and grilled perfectly  Both meals pair very well with any of the sauces  Also  there is a paella that I haven t gotten but I feel is worth it if you re in a large group of    people   Gaucho is great  and I m only giving it   stars instead of   because I also had their empanadas which I heard really good reviews about  but I don t think they re anything to write home about

I lived in Denver for   years before moving to the burgh and so I was spoiled with all the fast casual restaurants to choose from  Pittsburgh REALLY needs more of these kinds of restaurants  My husband and I have been to Gauchos a few times now and have loved it every time  We enjoy just ordering our food at the counter  getting everything we need  eating amazing high quality food and leave at our leisure  Perfect when you have small kids  The food is top notch every time  We take our families here when they visit  It s in our top   places to eat in Pittsburgh  There is no negative things we have experienced with this place   the only down side that parking is street and paid

Aaaammmmaaazing  I can t express how awesome this place is  I have the rosemary braised beef sandwich with empanadas and papas  I want to bring this place back to ny with me  Best sandwich I have ever had

This is probably my favorite place to eat  I had a small filet and it was delicious  The sauces are so good  Grilled corn and cauliflower was superb  Will go back and wait in line because it s just plain worth it  Friendly staff  Clean  Love love love this place

Kind of disappointed at this place  Came herefor my birthday and I felt like there wasn t a lot of flavor   spices in any of the dishes except the empanadas and steak was great  On the other hand the sauce area just looked like a mess  flies were surrounded it and it just looked unappealing to try

Everything was amazing  I ordered the Flank Steak Plate  chicken empanada  and the grilled vegetables  The flank steak had a perfect crust that married so well with the chimichurri and other sauces  So very tender and delicious  That being said  my favorite part was the grilled vegetables  They were absolutely stellar  I put the grilled onions and peppers on the olive oil soaked bred and then rubbed it with the chimichurri  So so good  The empanada was nice but not the star  It went well with the pimenton sauce    I d come back to Pittsburgh for this
Dined here about   months ago  the owner personally came up and said hello to us   Fun atmosphere delicious sandwiches   Great service and atmosphere vibrant fun place
I ve been here twice now  Great food every time  Everything I have tried has been awesome  I am not a huge fan of the line style ordering but the place is cool and has cool decor  I will be back

I think that Gaucho might be my favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh  which is a little strange  even though their new space is about      larger than their old one  it s still not a comfortable place to sit   But the food is just  so good  that it doesn t matter  I will come back again and again     It s not fine dining  but my favorite thing on the menu is the steak sandwich made with ribeye steak   Nearly all of the food is cooked directly over their incomparable wood fired grill   The house made authentically Argentinian sauces complete the sandwich  so don t be shy and be sure to try them all   I can t decide if I like the pimenton  smoky red pepper  or ajo  garlic  better   If you d looking for a side dish  I can t recommend the grilled veggies enough   Who knew that something so simple could be so delicious   Also  I say skip the paella   It was fun to eat as a group  but it lacked so much in flavor   Arrive early or in the middle of the afternoon to beat the wait   BYOB

Definitely one of the best Restaurants in Pittsburgh  Quality is consistent  Also extremely friendly and eclectic staff  The boy with the pink hair was really cute and nice  Great place for lunch or to take the fam to in the early evening

One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh  While the wait may seem intimidating  it is always extremely worth it  The staff is friendly and always bring out the food in a timely manner  Can t wait to go again

This review isn t about the food  which is mostly excellent based on the two times that I ve been previously  I tried to go tonight for takeout and was told that I would have to wait in the long line for people actually sitting at the restaurant to order my food because I hadn t called ahead  It s beyond preposterous to make people wait all that time simply to order takeout  I ve never heard of this happening at other restaurants  On top of that the employee was brusque and even a little bit rude  I understand that places like this restaurant are really popular and as a result the staff often get overworked  but this policy doesn t make any sense  If you re going to prevent walk up customers from ordering takeout at the restaurant itself in a timely manner  then you shouldn t offer takeout any longer  And if your staff are overworked and having to stay late every night  as other posters have mentioned   maybe you should adjust the closing time accordingly

Visit Pittsburgh every two weeks or so for work and thought we d venture to the Strip    After the crazy long line and all the hype  left the restaurant somewhat disappointed    Stood in the line the meandered along the length of the building  on a narrow baking hot concrete sidewalk  directly abutting the tarmac street  Hostess wouldn t commit to how long of a wait  with a canned response for each who asked  Many rules to follow  explicitly stated along your route  aka  Seinfeld soup nazi   As you reach indoors  the highlight of the experience is a large lobby with views of attached kitchen and a large wall sized board describing a multitude of culinary options  Many varieties of steaks  poultry and fish options  Helpful diagrams of how they cook their meats  Views of the kitchen as you order your food in the cafeteria line is entertaining  Very friendly cashiers  Wait for them to seat you    Entering the dining area a bit of a letdown  Nondescript smallish and visually isolated back room that feels half basic coffee shop   half small town airport fast food sit down  Mix of recycled    s and    s office tables and chairs with seemingly little thought put into the room  The procession up to and including ordering is obviously the focus    Had the   oz filet mignon       with a roasted potato side       Steak was sliced  decent but not spectacular  with a roasted garlic salad side   Various dipping sauces  Finished with a tart and coffee for dessert    As we left  passing the others anxiously waiting to place their order  and seeing how quickly visitors cycle through once they get seated  I could tell you exactly how long of a wait to expect for a given line length  Enjoyable experience  but for our group of    thinking not standing up to the hype

HOLY CRAP   This place is the place where food dreams come true   This place right now is hard to find as it is in the smallest little whole in the wall you ve ever seen that has zero seating and almost as much standing room but anyone who has tried this place would gladly stand and eat their food   So stopped in here on an afternoon for the first time and got the rosemary braised beef with horsey sauce and caramelized onion on a baguette   First off the bread  because anyone who knows me knows I m all about the bread  A baguette can get hard sometimes and the roof of my mouth feels the paid after a few bites but NOT here  The baguette was soft and not too bready and was the PERFECT accompaniment to the meat   Now onto the good stuff   Walk anywhere within a miles distance of this place and the cooking meat will grab you by the nose  pick you up and drag you right into this restaurant where all your carnivore cravings will be satisfied   The meat here is sublime  Juicy  flavorful  and they PACK it on   I have never tasted braised beef like this in my life  and I m not really sure I will ever again which makes me sad   This place is amazing  I cannot tell you enough just how amazing this place is   If you are a local or a tourist like myself  get in here  grab a sammie and fall in love with your food  You will not regret it

Since I enter this place I really like it  Gaucho is a small restaurant with really polite and warm people  The food is just amazing  one of the best I have tried in Pittsburgh  The meat is juicy and so soft  I truly recommended  The corn is just  barbecued perfectly
Wow  Great place   We both had burgers and loved them    Sat out on the porch and enjoyed the patio   Absolutely will be back

I love the steak here  I have no idea how they keep the prices so reasonable  I went here for a loved one s anniversary and it was absolutely amazing  I love that I can order without sides and not waste anything  The sauces are all mind blowing  A new favorite for me  Meaty
The best Rosemary beef sandwich in the whole city  Just a heads up you going to be ready to wait in line for at least half an hour no matter what time of the day it is
Delicious food  great atmosphere  and wonderful owner staff  There is usually a line out the door but they are very efficient in getting people in and out  It s definitely worth waiting in the line

The line extended out the doorway and wrapped around the side of the restaurant and it always will unless you go on a off hour  Then the line will only extend out the threshold    I waited an hour and didn t regret a thing  This was one of the best meals I ve had in Pittsburgh and have gone twice since  Their rosemary braised beef so juicy and tender but I enjoyed the pollo more  The pollo has everything I love  mushrooms  onions  chicken  and most importantly   potatoes    Tip  Always  always  always get their gaucho papas and dip it into every sauce that they offer

The food is absolutely amazing  Be sure to try any of the BBQ  and get plenty of sides to try everything  Each ingredient is so well thought through and executed perfectly  I ve also ate from their food truck which was just as fantastic  The only reason I gave   stars is because of the set up of the restaurant  You have to wait so long in line  which usually goes out the door  I prefer the traditional restaurant seating of being able to sit first and then order from the menu  so you don t have to wait upwards of an hour in a cramped line  It is still worth it to taste this wonderful Argentinian food
Heard great things but was average in my opinion  Unique but price was expensive for what I got

Delicious   They give great suggestions if you re feeling overwhelmed by their menu   The meat is perfectly cooked and all of the dips and sauces are delectable  Lunch for   costs around     and there unfortunately aren t many seats unless it s nice outside  then they have patio   Highly recommended    Word on the street is that they re beginning work on the seating  That can t come soon enough

I fell in love with this place   Sarah was our server and she was fast and fantastic  She recommended a few items that we all ordered and shared     The grilled shrimp   can t remember the name of it   was the best thing I ve ever tasted   I usually don t care too much about shrimp  but this we amazing   When I go back I ll be ordering it   We the group of us ordered about    things and shared   All of us had different favorites   Along with the shrimp  my favorites were the grilled vegetables and Papa s potatoes   Others loved the potato salad  corn pudding   A couple ordered sandwiches that they found to be their favorites   I also had a small chopped salad that was perfectly dressed   it was lovely  but I loved the others more   Try it   I plan to bring my son there to try the shrimp   Be prepared though  it s not a sit and order place   When you walk in your arrived to a giant chalkboard of their menu   You order at the counter and then sit down   Tips are collected in a jar at the register and are shared throughout the staff
delicious steak  cool  casual atmosphere  long lines but when you re standig in them with friends  they go by fast

Genuinely amazing food at a decent price  I had the steak sandwich  skirt steak  sweet potato   empanadas  The sandwich  steak   potato were absolutely to die for  I ve been thinking about the food for days since leaving  Would skip the empanadas next time  not that they were bad but they were just good and I d rather leave food for the excellent meat and sides  Great ambiance  Can t wait to go back soon

Gaucho s legendary status is well earned  when it comes to sandwiches  there is Gaucho and there is everyone else    Perfection is their filet sandwich  expertly grilled filet complemented with smoky  slightly charred vegetables  all piled onto lightly toasted bread that s sturdy enough to hold everything together yet delicate enough to let the ingredients shine  An array of available sauces creates an impossible  delicious dilemma  the only rational solution is having some of each    This is the sandwich of my dreams

Quality beef  fresh bread  and vegetables you can actually taste  when was the last time you could say that about a bell pepper    A word to the wise  seating is quite limited  so until the restaurant finishes expanding  it s perfect for takeout during busy times   Now  stop reading this review and start gorging

I absolutely love this place  Given its popularity  the lines can get long during peak hours but I can assure you it is totally worth it    I ve had the cordero  lamb  which comes with a crostini  side salad  and some sort of pickled mustard seed spread  I ve also had the pollo a la parilla  half roasted chicken  which I really loved the even though it didn t come with any sides  But the chicken was cooked so perfectly that it didn t matter that it didn t have any sides  The empanadas have always been really good too  My favorite ones are the veggie  Both times I went  they did not have the chicken wings which I have been told is a must try    This place can get expensive depending on what you order  The lamb was     while the chicken was      I liked the chicken a lot better   Even though it s really busy and crowded  the service has always been great
