First off  the trick with Gaucho is to order in advance  then skip the wait  walk and grab your food  and then hustle down to whatever apartment you call home and enjoy the delish  On my second night in Pittsburgh  my dad and I walked the   th St  bridge after unpacking and proceeded to wait in line for just under two hours  After about an hour  we noticed that people were able to walk in  skip the line  and grab pre ordered food to go and we looked at each other solemnly   I have eaten at many good restaurants in some wonderful and underappreciated cities in my time  None of them  including Gaucho  is worth a two hour wait in line  Would I wait    minutes  Yes  The food IS good  but at some point the waiting time supersedes quality food  To be fair  the service staff and cooks do a great job of pushing the line and balancing between encouraging finished diners to depart while also giving you good service   Regarding the food  it is very good like I said  The sandwiches are underwhelming though and need to be complimented with any of the wonderful sides  Personally  if I want some meat  I go with the wings now  They are sizeable  perfectly grilled  and have a delightful zest to them with fairly complex flavors  They are quite nice   Many people love the grilled vegetables  but as someone who grills veggies at home with regularity  I don t see much difference  I do recommend the Papas Dulce and Fungos though    The sauces are good  but again  waiting in line for two hours to order something you drench in sauce seems a bit unusual  Your mileage may vary though

Upon reading the other reviews  we headed straight here   No way could a place be this good   we said  Our minds are blown  This place is fantastic  When in doubt  stick to simple meat dishes which is what they do best  we had carne sandwich with filet mignon  empanadas and mushroom appetizer   Simplicity and beauty  This place is a must

One of my favorite places  takes effort to not eat here everyday  I don t know if this can be beat  GET THE CORN AND THE GAUCHO PAPAS  Hanger is probably my favorite  but it s hard to go wrong    With apologies to Gaucho I would recommend a fattier cut of meat than the filet simply because of how outstanding the flavors are on all of the dishes and sauces  Filet stands well alone and while fantastic the flavors feel less impressive on that cut   You can not go wrong here though  Get creative and push your boundaries  you are in excellent hands at Gaucho   Finally  try the rosemary short rib sandwich at least once  before you lay down for the dirt nap   The line looks more daunting than it really is  Once you order and pay  your food is typically out within    minutes  at most   compared to conventional restaurant where you wait at your table

Wow  they have great steaks  Gaucho is a must try restaurant in Pittsburgh    There is a great variety of meal choices here listed on the front wall  Most of them are priced well  I suggest you try one of the empanadas  which are all unique and flavorful  The side of charred bread is so good    Please keep in mind that there is usually a long wait that wraps around the outside of Gaucho s front door  Dress warm in the winter months  It s worth the wait
Hands down best food in pittsburgh   Fresh and high quality ingredients  I got the Argentino salad with a side of toast  Must try the chimmichurri sauce
Rosemary braised beef or ribeye Sammie  No need for talk  just go now and thank me later
Wow is this place as great as everyone says   I need to figure out a way to eat at this place more often
The food at Gaucho is well worth the wait in line  We had the steak sampler  can t remember what it s called   the paella and empanadas  all were outstanding  both in taste and presentation

Wow  That s all we could say after dinner at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina  It is WONDERFUL  We went on a Friday directly after work  got there about       and there was no line so we stood there and chatted with the guy manning the counter and the guys in the back added their two cents as well  I order the chicken sandwich and it was amazing  I am so glad this places as popped up  It s a must try for anyone in Pittsburgh
Always a line out the door  Super popular joint  Call ahead for takeout  The food is worth the wait

If you like delicious food  Gaucho is an absolute must try  I live in the Strip District and drive past Gaucho daily and the wonderful smells that come out of this place are hard to resist  so I don t  The last time I went  I ordered the Carne  a fantastic steak sandwich with your choice of steak  marinated and grilled peppers and onions  served on a fresh bun that s doused with some delicious oil butter garlic combo  It was heavenly  The prices here are extremely reasonable and it s BYOB  so it s well worth the long wait in line that wraps outside the building that you will probably encounter  ours was    minutes on a very cold day   So bring your booze and someone fun to talk to in line and enjoy your experience at Gaucho

fantastico    great food and great service at very reasonable prices   Had empanadas  Arrechera steak  baked yam with marshmallows and honey  saffron rice    wish I had known that this is a BYOB place
my son loves this place tasty food good service and very clean

I really wish I d tried Gaucho when I worked just across the street  It s not as convenient any more  but we ll definitely be back  I suggest going early  so the line it s too bad  You get a lot of food  so it s better to eat early anyway    The line moves very slowly  but everyone is so friendly  so it doesn t seem as long as it would be without the friendly atmosphere  As I d heard from many friends  the food at Gaucho is WELL worth the wait  It s delicious and they are BYOB with no corking fee  so you can take your own beer or wine to enjoy with the wonderful food

WOW    The food and service were amazing    We were in Pittsburg for the Society for Applied Anthropology Conference   found it on Yelp and the rest is history    The food was so so so good    The sauces were fabulous and I feel like we just made great friends in the staff    I ve been to Argentina and nothing there could compare to this    I just wish they were in California    However next time my son and his girlfriend come to Pittsburgh to visit her family I m placing my order
Good meat  I m still not sure if it worths the wait  something that makes me not want to go back but the food was great

Ate here on a trip to Pittsburgh for work   The service was great  food was even better   Only minus for me was that they don t sell any alcohol   You walk in and stand in line in front of their huge menu on a chalk board   You order your drinks first  then the next step in line is ordering your food   Someone else will ask how many people in your party and then go ready a table   I had the large ribeye  medium rare with a side of the roasted red potatoes   My friend had the steak sandwich   Both got to our table quickly and were cooked how we ordered them   The salad that came with my steak was terrific  as were the potatoes   The ribeye was seasoned nicely and sliced  and had two toasted slices of bread laid in top   The whole thing was a great experience  helpful staff and great food     I will add that I found it amusing that the  hipster   apologies for lack of a better term  appearing staff work at a steak house   In Seattle   twenty somethings that look like them would only serve vegan fair trade farm to table food that tastes awful

This is my first Argentina restaurant  and sure they didn t let me down  The receptionist are very nice  When I show him the picture that I want to eat  because I couldn t guessed what kinda meat would be like without a picture   even though the dish is not in their menu anymore he recommended me something very similar and even out some pickled onions to mimic the closest version  Incredible service  Will definitely go there again next time when I m in Pittsburg  I ordered qiqi chicken this time and I ll lamb or steak next time

So I was in town for the weekend and stumbled on this       review on yelp and never tried Argentine food so figure I check it out  I read the previous reviews and it said that this place gets busy  I called ahead and they said it was a hour half wait  I went because people swear by this place  And the line was wrapped onto the street and it was pretty cold  I ended up waiting for about an hour half like she said  I ended up ordering the carne sandwich with rib eye medium rare with the peppers and caramelized onions  I gotta say it was a       It was good and it had this bomb red sauce on the side you could pair it with  They gave a generous portion  I couldn t even finish it  But the steak was cooked good  it was hard for me to cut my knife into the bread of the sandwich but overall it was okay  the hot cocoa bread pudding was a little of a let down          I love bread pudding but this didn t blow me away whatsoever  But overall I wasn t completely disappointed with the place  Staff there is super nice  And it s tight on seating too  I don t know if I d be back but I didn t think it was worth that long wait   I give this place a      overall
One of my favorite places to eat  Especially if you like beef
Absurdly great ribeye steak sandwich   This restaurant is sensational   Can I give   stars   Please

This is the story of a girl   A girl with a dream   A dream about steak   A week before I had a random Wednesday Thursday off  I decided that Thursday would be it   The day I finally made my way to Gaucho   Of course I ve heard the hype   Who in the Pittsburgh Yelpiverse hasn t   Clearly at this point Gaucho is well established   I didn t expect to be disappointed   The question was just how happy could a lunch at Gaucho make me   I knew I had to do my research   I drooled over the menu several times ahead of time trying to narrow down the choices so I wouldn t panic when I ordered   I read several of the hundreds of Yelp reviews looking to learn the ins and outs of how to order  at the counter  take a seat and wait for your name to be called   when to arrive  since it seems to always be busy  often with a line out the door   how the service was  friendly  and what people thought of the food itself  amazing      The night before I had attended a Yelp Elite event at a local brewery   I hit up three local breweries that day  it s kind of my thing  and came home with an IPA that I thought would pair well with the steak I was anticipating   And then the waiting      I planned to arrive at Gaucho when they first opened at   am   I scored rock star parking just in front of their location   I got out of my car and could immediately smell that wood fired grill  The outside patio was intriguing but it was a little muggy so I decided on dining inside   I went to the corner entry door  don t be fooled by the two other doors that are not entrances for patrons  and made my way inside   The inside is welcoming and the huge menu greets you as you approach the counter to place your order   I was the first to arrive  but only long enough to place my order and pick my seat   I kindly told the first girl who asked me if I wanted a drink that all I needed was a glass since I brought my own beer   She happily obliged and the girl next to her took my order   I went with the small skirt steak plate  medium   I took my seat in a corner table so I could watch the magic behind the scenes   I watched the efficient symphony of servers emerging from the kitchen  dancing through the dining room calling out names to deliver food to anticipating diners and clearing tables for incoming patrons while another employee transferred wood from the dining area to the grill in order to keep the fire going     My meal was delivered to me within    minutes and it was such a thing of beauty that it brought a tear to my eye   I almost didn t want to eat this work of art   Gaucho is simple but captivating with its presentation  in this case my medium skirt steak with chimmi  toast and salad   I took my time to savor every bite and every angle   I tried the   different sauces they had on the counter as well and liked them all  but found the meat did not need any extras   Good steak like this stands on its own     It might seem questionable as to why I only gave   stars   The overall experience of Gaucho is definitely not to be missed  don t get me wrong   But I think I would have been confused about how and what to order if I hadn t prepared myself ahead of time   I also think that despite the efficiency in service it can be disruptive when names are yelled out through the whole restaurant   I guess what this really means is I ll have to go back again and try something else to see if I can have an even better experience   Sigh   If I must

The only downside to Gaucho is that the wait can be quite long during peak times  However  the food is amazing  The sandwiches are very generous portions and delicious  I love the sauces that you are able to help yourself to and add flavor to the meal  The sides are also delicious  especially the potatoes
Amazing  I had steak but literally tasted everything from friends plates  You will not be disappointed  make sure to try all of the sauces

trips thus far and this place has been very consistent  Wonderful food and selection  Long wait times to be seated  The steaks themselves have always been perfectly done  the one knock on the place is that you can definitely tell that you arent eating a premium steak  The quality of the meat just isnt the same as most higher end steakhouses  which they dont claim to be  Will continue to return whenever I visit Pitt
Ambiente agradable muy buena calidad en los alimentos presentaci n del personal muy bis

Having salivated by Gaucho on several occasions  I had no choice but to walk in on Thursday afternoon when the ever present line was missing  I knew the cupboards were bare at home  and I wanted to bring the hubs something savory  Serious thanks to the nice young man at the counter   I told him I wanted  steak and potatoes  and he helped me translate that into a great to go order  I got the rib eye  but   per his suggestion   kept it rare  It reheated perfectly to a nice medium rare  The small red potatoes came with garlic and herbs  Delicious  And  there was a nice side salad  radishes  carrots  tomatoes  which I ate the next day  Seriously good food and a big shout out for being so nice to me about my initially non special order

If you find yourself anywhere near Pittsburg and crave mad flavor meat  Arrive here  An out of stater  next time I m bringing a cooler to stock up on massive leftovers  Since I gave up buying sides of beef years ago  lllllong hairy story  my freezer has the room
LOVE Gaucho   The Bondiola sandwich is my favorite   Great service  excellent food
Worth it     Best steak sandwich I ve ever eaten

mind  EXPLOSION   i had the grilled chicken sandwich  it even had some potatoes in there  BREAD IS AMAZING  next time  gonna get involved with some STEAK   my friend got the corn on the cob and it looked so legit  he wouldnt even share   I DREAM OF THIS TYPE OF FOOD

Elevator Review  Long line  but deliciously worth the wait for meat lovers   Or order takeout    Gaucho is fantastic  On our first visit we waited in line for more than   hours  And it was worth it   I had the Cerdo  roasted pork with roasted onions  greens and grilled bread   This was quite possibly the greatest pork I have ever had  Juicy  flavorful and paired perfectly with sides   My wife had the small strip steak   again perfectly cooked   We shared roasted vegetables and empanadas   both delicious   But to me  the real star is the dipping sauces  My wife is obsessed with the chimichurri  while I love the garlic and roasted onion    Tip    Gaucho doesn t serve alcohol  but they don t have corkage fees and encourage you to bring your own  Bring wine  which many people did  or walk down the street to one of the many fine purveyors of alcohol in the Strip District  we went to East End Brewing Company     Tip    If you don t want to wait  just order for carry out  Call early and walk right to the front of the line and take your order home

The   stars for this place is well deserved  It s hard to put into words how good it really is  My advice to those who haven t been here before is to come at an off peak time  if that s really a thing  because the line can grow very long really fast  Back to the food    ordered the pork sandwich with the corn pudding  Melts in your mouth  Don t take my words for it JUST GO

Amazing  Great food and lovely atmosphere   We had the Ribeye Steak plates and lemon bread pudding   The staff was friendly  pleasant and the service was good   We can t wait to return   When we got there   it was just before close and the line was long but it went pretty quickly and we got into a conversation with some other first timers   we all had heard good things and were excited    I caught up with them after their meal and it turns out we all had the same thing    They were raving about it as much as we were    Parking was a challenge but well worth it

REVIEW          stars  Gaucho lives up to the hype  My goodness       Everything is great and cooked perfectly  Honestly  this is also one of the best value meals in the city  The quality to cost ratio is really amazing for the consumer    Here s what I recommend  Carne Sandwich  Ribeye cooked medium rare   Any two sides  they change seasonally   Empanadas  mix   You won t be sorry    The food is a   stars  the atmosphere is a   stars  the seating is a   star  So  if you get there any time after        get ready to wait  Like       Kennywood  Phantom s Revenge on field trip day wait  The wait is long  BUT that makes your dining experience really nice because the main dining room is small and not overcrowded  I still give   stars because this food       Heavenly    Tipping is up to your discretion because you pay up front  It s a laid back environment  Great sauces  Everything is amazing    Go to Gaucho  Seriously  go now

Growing up in PR  we didn t have fancy Brazilian Steak Houses  we had fancy Argentinian Parrilladas  When we were exploring places to visit in our visit to Pittsburgh  this place popped towards the top of the places to visit  and when my friend mentioned it  I couldn t be more excited   This Parilla is a casual place where you place your order at the counter and then are seated  The food is delivered to your table  They have sodas and water but not beer or wine  They do have a byob policy   The menu consists mainly of Argentinian specialties  and  of course  the ultimate Argentinian specialty  beef   Since there were   of us at the table  we ordered a sample plate with an additional flank steak  We also ordered the grilled corn  Gaucho Papas  and humitas  a savory corn pudding   We also got the empanadas  and chicken wings as starters and the grilled pineapple  and alfajores for dessert   There was a selection of different sauces to pick from  from the traditional chimichurri to a slightly spicy pepper one   The chicken wings and beef empanadas were ok  not really that great  The beef needed seasoning and the wings were a little dry  Using the sauces provided helped a lot with these items  The same with the humitas   The alfajores were a bit dry  the cookie was crumbly and dry and took away from the delicious filling   But everything else was really good  The steaks were delicious and flavorful and the sauces complimented them to perfection  The grilled corn was really tasty  although I would have preferred a bit more salt  and the grilled pineapple is probably the best application of this idea I ve ever had  so damned good   All in all the meal was a hit  with not one dish that I would consider bad  and many items that I would happily eat all the time   For the price  this place definitely deserves the   stars

A small restaurant where people are standing and eating  Why are they all smiling  They know something that when you walk in off the street you could not know   The food is excellent and fresh introducing you to many new flavores  The shrimp is some of the best I have ever eaten  The service is pleasant and helpful and fun  Don t pass up this one

We arrived right around opening on a Saturday afternoon and the line was already out the door  By the time we finished and came out  the line was wrapped around to the bridge  so come early or be prepared to wait    The food was fresh and made to order  They have a system where you order first and are seated afterwards as tables open up  We tried the bife de gaucho  cooked perfectly to medium rare   gaucho salad  empanadas  one of each  and the chorizo  They also had a variety of sauces to try with the food  We didn t think our order would be enough for   people  but we were stuffed by the end of the meal  Everything was delicious and we d definitely love to come back if we re ever in Pittsburgh again

The food is great  I went on a Thursday night around  pm and there was a bit of a line to order but didn t have to wait for any tables  Any wait time is worth it though  I got the flank steak and it was tender and flavorful  The toast is delicious too

Best steak sandwich I ve ever had  Although the ribeye sandwich I had was thoroughly cooked  it was still very tender and flavorful  The prices are not cheap  but it is worth every bite  I wish I had the chance to try more from their menu  The new restaurant is very nice  The decor gives the right ambiance for the type of food they are serving  Would recommend this to anyone who s visiting Pittsburgh
This place has the hype and still knocks it out of the park  I got the ribeye steak sandwich and it was next level  No complaints  One of the best meals in Pittsburgh

My father is born and raised Argentinian and my family knows great food   So when I came to visit my father in Pittsburgh we heard so much about this place and we made the trip down to the strip district   This possibly might have been one of the better dinners I have ever had  Authentically cut beef  Empanadas were good  Veggies amazing  The roasted garlic dipping sauce  The braised beef sandwich absolutely to die for with the perfect bread to stay crispy and soak up juices     Why yes that is   different cuts of beef  Yes that is beef empanadas  braised beef sandwich  flank steak  grilled veggies and salads  And yes it was magical  Probably one of the best places I have ever eaten at   You have to get here early or you will get stuck in line outside the door  But if you get caught     It s well worth the wait

Gaucho s is a must stop while in the  Burgh   Absolutely delicious meats and sides  herbed potatoes and grilled vegetable platter were both awesome    We had the Asado Platter which at     gives you slices of   of their different meats   This was enough meat for our family of   when paired with sides and of course a side order of chorizo   For chorizo  go with the spicy selection which in my book was perfection   The set up here is you wait on line to order   On a Thursday night around  pm we waited about    minutes     Once you order the food comes quickly   Wait staff helps finds you a table and you help yourselves to sauces  plates and silverware   Be sure to BYOB and keep in mind I wasn t able to find a liquor store in the immediate area   Desserts are delicious   the cinnamon bread pudding was exceptional   Only minuses for us were      Our waitress dumped our food across the floor when she lost her grip on a serving tray   This isn t typical and she almost cried which made me feel bad for her   They apologized up and down and brought a replacement within minutes   Hey  it happens      They encourage you to order dessert up front and that they ll hold it for you until your ready     They dropped it at our table mid meal so it was starting to cool when we were ready for it   They need to get this better sorted or simply wait to order it   Despite these minuses  I still give it a solid   stars for what it is    Meaty awesomeness   Give it a try  you won t be disappointed
So   wow    Normally  I write lengthy reviews on food  service  aesthetics  atmosphere  etc   but I will get right to the point    This place is amazing in every way  Go

Even an hour wait for dinner could not detract from this amazing place  The service should train everyone else in the business on  how to provide the best service   They were caring  kind  attentive without being intrusive  knowledgeable  honest and made the night  Oh  and the food  We came for the paella and LOVED it   It takes about    minutes so we ordered the wings too  Flavorful  slightly spicy and incredibly tender  Would love to return to try EVERYTHING  Great night
Amazing food and well worth the wait  We re from Mississippi but visit Pgh every year for a week  No matter what we have planned  this place is a must
Quite possibly the best Hamburger I ever had   The meat was seasoned perfectly   Try the various dips they have to add some extra flavor

Absolutely amazing food   We were lucky enough to get there when it wasn t super busy and were able to get a table   I had the chicken sandwich and it had an amazing smokey flavor and was very juicy   Definitely will come back

This place  under most circumstances  would get five stars  The only downside is the long wait  During our most recent visit my wife and I spent    minutes in line  The food and service are amazing and well worth the wait  BUT  if you can get there right when the restaurant opens or go during the week you can avoid the lines   I always get the Bondiola    roasted pork sandwich with a mustard sauce and caramelized onions  AMAZING  The bread is incredible     My wife got the El Gaucho Salad with chicken added  She also gets QuiQui Rimichi sauce on the side  DELICIOUS   BYOB    You won t be disappointed

The Rosemary Braised Beef is every bit as mythic and mighty and marvelous as its now incredible internet hype would have you believe  There s a baguette that holds a generous wad of paper thin savory  fragrant beef sheets that are cooked slowly for an eternity  Caramelized onion and horseradish sauce are added for the sake of sweetness and punch  That s all there is  It is a Philly Cheesesteak gone rustic and cowboy  the campfire aromas of this small establishment beckoning people from late afternoon to early evening  So yes  GPA does a     job of making mundane meats taste extraordinary in a confined space and within a quick serve framework   I don t seem to be reading much about the desserts  though  I don t recall GPA selling them during my last visit  Regardless  my readers should give them your undivided attention    The bill of fare lists   of which Kay and I tried    First at bat were the spectacularly scrumptious Panqueques  A crucifix of slightly scorched crepes  each rolled wafer resembled a tuile cookie in terms of flavor and chewy brittle mouthfeel  Topping them was merely chocolate syrup  but filling them was a creamy  carnal  somewhat briny caramel that clung to the palate like a desperate lover    The second sweet treat came in the form of Alfajores  Coming off as a cross between a macaroon and a Fig Newton  the trio of cookies come either with lemon or cinnamon flavors and also contain caramel  La Dorita Dulce de Leche   Soft  sticky  and full of sugary bravado  one could imagine having these with tea in more genteel surroundings instead of the gritty Strip District    Apparently  Gaucho Parrilla Argentina fits the definition of a runaway sensation while still measuring up to the buzz it has unassumingly created  Who would have guessed they be the kings of Pittsburgh Yelp    years ago on a February night  I was hoping they d remain a secret gem    P S  Outdoor seating is available now  Indoor seating remains very limited  Prepare to opt for take out
Awesome carnivore BYOB paradise   Steak  braised beef  chorizo  yams and bread pudding to die  and wait in line  for   A real gem   Been there twice in past two months and can t wait to go back

It s possible to get here when the line isn t impossibly long  but you have to time it right  Every steak I ve gotten here from every cut has been delicious  Obviously it s not a place to take a vegetarian for their birthday  but if you like steak you have to go at least once
Delicious ribeye steak plate with salad  sweet onion  and chimichurri  I would love to come back and try the carne asada and other delicious meats

Holy crap   I had Gaucho for lunch this summer  but it was their food truck   No offense  GPA   but that food truck isn t necessarily doing you any favors   Not that it was bad   It wasn t   It just wasn t as great as the food I got at the restaurant     Which   okay   was great   Sorry for the spoiler   Great food     No reservations  so there s usually a line  but honestly the wait was no more than probably   minutes AT LUNCH     I had the special   Gaucho Banh Mi   It was delicious   See above   My date had empanadas that she then shared with me   Because she s awesome  but we re not rating her   the empanadas   ALSO awesome     Every sauce condiment was drinkably good  though honestly  i don t recommend that    The staff was super high energy and friendly   So if you don t like friendly people this may not be the place for you     Cool vibe  great food  great staff   Five star   Bang   Done

This place is always a solid good casual meal even for upscale foodies  Aid place to chill out and have tasty food  First time having their chicken and it was yum  Always a lot of people here so make sure you go in or order at most an hour before they close because they WILL cut you off  No soup for you  Their gaucho sandwich is off the wall but it s been a few years since I first tried it  Don t think anything has changed  just gotten better  So if you eat beef  WHADDAYA WAITIN FOR  The only thing that has changed is their expansion which means more people have gotten to appreciate this place as much as I did a few  Years ago

There were four of us so we tried the Asado platter which gave everyone a taste of five different cuts of beef  flank steak  filet mignon  sirloin  ribeye and one more   The filet and sirloin were considered the tastiest but all were good  We added corn  potatoes and mushroom sides  Perfect combo along with our mate iced tea

Absolutely amazing meal  the best we had while visiting Pittsburgh  Went on a Saturday around   and had to wait about    mins on the line before we got to order  totally worth it  We tried the sirloin steak platter  medium rare   the sweet and spicy sausages  empanadas  and a flan for dessert  The steak was amazing and perfectly cooked  The sauces are really fun to try and dip the steak in  Really loved the sausages  preferred the spicy ones  I got too full to even try to empanadas  The flan was just Okay  would skip this next time

Today was our first time here and from the service to the food to the decor of the tiny place we give it   stars  This is a must visit if you are in Pittsburgh  I highly recommend the con pan Carne with skirt steak  Yum

It s truly the best restaurant in Pittsburgh  The people are friendly  the food and sauces are awesome and the brussel sprouts with bacon are to die for  It s sort of a pain having to wait in line but its so worth it

I just love the rich flavor of the food here   I got the Rosemary Braised Beef  which was just so delicious and filling  I would totally get it again  and all the other options on the menu seem so yummy as well  There was a period of waiting outside and inside as well  since the seating area isn t particularly large and part of the inside area is also a waiting area  Nonetheless  the wait was bearable and it didn t take too long  I would say it was definitely worth the wait  and I would be happy to come here again to try another one of their menu items

Incredible food  by far my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  Usually I need extreme spice to enjoy my food whether in the form of peppers or hot sauce but the medley of flavors in these dishes is perfect and no spice is necessary  The braised beef with horseradish is a must try and any of the salads with any of the steaks  i love the flank    BUT they do have lots of delicious of sauces if you need something to perfectly compliment your dishes  see photos     New on the menu are the scallops  which I love more than anything they serve  especially the fresh grapefruit mixed in with the seafood dish    I could go on but essentially anything I ve ordered at this place has been phenomenal  And they now have outdoor seating as opposed to just the small space available inside

Favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  handsdown  The only hang up is that there is always a line  Trust me  it s worth the wait  The steak is always cooked perfectly and the i highly recommend getting the seasonal sides like the corn

We were supposed to visit friends today and they were going to treat us to a special dinner they were going to make but they had the flu or the crud or something     so instead we went to Gaucho and had a SCRUMPTIOUS meal to help assuage our disappointment  Man  was it good  This little place is a gem and the short wait in line was really worth it  We had carne of filet mignonette and rosemary carbones accompanied by simple toasted  taters with bacon  The sauces    all fresh made and take as much as you want    were indescribable  This place is killer  And the best part  We re going to send the bill to our  sick  friends and they ll never even know it was for us because they re so ill  They won t have a clue  Hahaha

It s been   years and the physical shop has greatly expanded to a very warm  inviting space   Although the place is packed  the tables are spacious with fresh flowers and a napkin dispenser   Cause you may need a lot of napkins  Beef can be messy   Wash your hands before you start  finger licking will commence   The Provoletta is still spectacular  Steak sandwich  flavorful and delicious  Mashed sweet potatoes as lovely as they are tasty  Rosemary beef sandwich  a mile high and so  so yummy   A lot has changed  but the important stuff is exactly the same
The chocolate is out of this world  Tried the bacon chocolate and pretzels they both were amazing
food comes in a big portion  Empanada was delicious  Pre paid system  Servers are very friendly and they are fast with refilling water

This was quite possibly the best lunch we have ever had  The line to get in on a child  rainy Saturday morning was not too bad  the menu was easy to follow and quite impressive  and the staff were very welcoming  They even ask if you have questions before you order and one guy showed us a picture of one of the meals  We could tell they are all proud of where they work  On to the food  The roasted pork was one of the most delicious things I have ever put in my mouth and the sausage  spicy  was delicious as well with the red peppers and onions  We would go here again and again

Let me just start by saying the people that work here are friendly  well mannered  and awesome    They welcome you help you order and participate in the entire experience   My boyfriend got the Rosemary beef sandwich   And loved every bite   I got the carne asada sandwich and it was delightful   The music playing was artsy and fun  The whole atmosphere was positive and happy   Be sure to try the sauces with whatever you order they come in mason jars near the ordering area and are yummy   Was curious to see if all the hype was real and it s definitely worth your time to stand in like and enjoy the food

I sort of liked this place  It s just awkward because there s not many places to sit and where they are located isn t an area where you can go outside and find a place to eat  I m glad they are here  it s nice to have something different to try
No complaints at all  Very tasty  reasonable  and I look forward to going back    Customer service was on point  The sauces for the dishes almost steal the show   almost  The meats were fantastic

This is probably my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  The meat is phenomenal and the sauces are a MUST  The menu has staples but the sides and small plates are always changing which is nice to spice things up
So much hype that it was VERY hard to get my husband to go with me   The silence as we devoured our steak sandwich said it all   The hype is true    the food is amazingly delicious
Attended an event in the lower level   Food was terrific and owner was there to make sure all went smoothly   Great mixed drinks and an over all good experience

My sister suggested I come here during a work trip  I was absolutely not disappointed  Very cool funky atmosphere and awesome employees  It s a quick service type place but they run your food out and bus tables  I got a small ny strip steak for      and it was fantastic  Good portion size  cooked perfectly and came with a great salad and toasted bread  Wish I lived closer

AMAZING  This one word describes it all   This is a small joint located right before the market strip  Although underwhelming on the outside  the food offered inside was absolutely delicious    The one thing that could ve  used improvement that the great food made up for was definitely the service  Although the lady who took our order was not entirely rude  she wasn t the most helpful or friendly either  We were trying to get her opinion on what to order but she sort of gave us the  arms up  attitude and claimed it was all good  As there was a lot of items on the menu it was hard to decide  Everything was also written in Spanish so you really had to read the descriptions to know what you re getting yourself into especially if you don t know Spanish    We ended up ordering a Rosemary braised beef sandwich  pork tenderloin with caramelized mushrooms and onions  a side of roasted potatoes and two empanadas to start  All of these items were absolutely to die for  The beef brisket sandwich came with a horse radish sauce that elevated the flavour to another level  The pork was so juicy and tender it practically melted in our mouths  Even the roasted potatoes were packed with flavour leaving no tastebuds behind  Our empanadas were also a great way to start our meal because the beef inside them was well seasoned and perfectly balanced    During our meal one of the kitchen staff also came to ask us how our meal was and that definitely redeemed the initial service we had  Especially considering the layout of this restaurant is small and offers limited seating that is first come first serve with a order and bring your food to the table kind of vibe    This place definitely knows their meat and they offer great flavours  If you re ever in town or have been thinking of making a visit  JUST DO IT  You won t regret it

BottomLine  Destination  yup  Faves  wing  pork  shrimp  In a bizarre way  their pork is my fave pulled pork in PGH  It s wonderfully smoked  and you can accoutre it w chimi or garlic or onion sauce  but it s awesome on its own  w the crusty bread that comes with   Backing up  we started w the wings  Just say   Yes   This could be an entree  Big  meaty w a wonderful smoke   K had the shrimp  and it was fantastically grilled and  flavorful enough so they definitely made it theirs  but not too much to step on the subtleties of the beast   Evil dark chocolate dessert  If you can t make din din for some silly reason  get the deep dark chocolate loveliness   Table full of regular guys had sammies  and they looked all that  even if you just see the bread   Ambiance is plain  functional but the chunky wooden tables and seats appeal to me  Staff is knowledgeable and very pleasant  those who are fans of fashionable female form may get more from their visit   I believe this is still a BYO

Stopped in for dinner and at first I was a bit unsure of what I had gotten into  The decode is interesting with a huge menu up on the wall with a short walk to the counter  There isn t really anywhere to give the menu a wince over and make your choices  That however is the only negative I encountered  The staff  when we ordered we re super nice and helpful  We were shown a table and went to gather our extra plates and tableware  The floor staff made sure our drinks were filled and knew our name for the order to be delivered  When the food arrived it was perfectly cooked  I got the   steak option  All seasoned great with perfect char and tender  Wee has the potatoes with roasted garlic cloves   so good  Mushrooms and risotto both were hard to stop eating  There was also pulled pork at the table that was enormous and absolutely excellent  Ended with the chocolate cyan cookie    wow was that good  Really glad we went here and will absolutely go back

In terms of combining amazing food and a great atmosphere  Gaucho Parrilla Argentina stood out head and shoulders above the rest of the  very good  restaurants I tried on a recent trip to Pittsburgh  Plusses  amazing food  both vegetarian and meatetarian  hilarious staff  who were yelling and singing and just having a blast the entire time  like  imagine the happy townsfolk at the beginning of some Disney movie  Minuses  Gaucho Parrilla Argentina exists only in the world and not inside us  as in  to return I will have to return to Pittsburgh
Um  YUM  Every sauce was awesome  best potatoes ever  how do I make those   I m going home to try  The staff was friendly  our food came quickly and I wish I lived closer so I could try more items

Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is one of the best restaurants I have ever dined at  My experience began rocky  with a    minute wait  But  the wait was completely worth it  The food came quickly and was extremely hot  We ordered the provoletta  empanadas  pescado sandwich  el gaucho salad  flank steak  and roasted cauliflower  Everything we ate was delectable  The el gaucho salad was scrumptious  with fresh vegetables and a light dressing  The provoletta did not disappoint either  and was one of my favorite dishes  The flank steak and pescado sandwich were otherworldly  for they burst with flavor  The empanadas were fine  but a tad lackluster in flavor compared to the other dishes ordered  My personal favorite component of the meal was the toast  Though almost everything comes with toast  but do not undermine as a plain food or label it as the underdog  It was seasoned to perfection and the right amount crunchy  To be honest  I would eat at Gaucho again just for the toast  Making Gaucho even better  the staff is amicable and quick  They made conversation with us as we waited  and you could genuinely tell they were trying to move as fast as possible so people could sit down and start enjoying their meal  The wait  in my opinion  was completely worth it but not something to be ignored  Nevertheless  I can guarantee you I will dine at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina again  even if I have to wait an hour
Over an hour wait in the rain but worth it  The staff was pleasant and our food came fast  The food was delicious

Great food  Got a bit of a buzz drinking some craft beers with my doctor friends  so I don t remember what I ordered  I do remember it was meaty and good  Your belly will appreciate coming here  I would have given it   stars but I was a bit tipsy when I went and don t remember some of the night

The food was very good  My flank steak was grilled perfectly and I loved the seasoning   We had chocolate bread pudding and cookies for dessert  A great way to end a great meal  Really amazing   The best thing about Guacho was the staff working there      Excellent      They were friendly and very helpful  We were very impressed with Isabel      My friends and l will be back due to great food  and even better service
Rid culos  So tasty   Treat yourself to this little gem before the line reaches Argentina

Talk about awesome and tasty food  I loved this place when it was a small hole in the wall and the quality definitely did not suffer when they expanded  Highly recommend eating here   especially the Rosemary Braised Beef
Gigantic amazing sandwiches   Yeah   Freaking good meat   I love the apps too   Soooo good

This place was great  Food was delicious and their sauces were on point  I recommend this place to anyone  Chicken was a little dry but other than that everything was great  Will def come back if I m ever in the area again
Got the Roasted Pork sandwich and it was amazing

This place is    on the Yelp      list of places to eat in america  why haven t you been here yet      This place is also BYOB and the service style is different which is a nice change of pace   You stand in line  get there before  pm for dinner  you will only have about a    minute wait   If you wait later you could wait for a LONG time   You place your order  find a table  get all your sauces to each on the side  crack your bottle of wine  beer  etc and relax   Servers will call your order s name and bring it to you   The last time we were there the servers were super friendly and accommodating     I have had the meat plate with skirt steak  brussels  spicy and sweet   a filet sandwich  and a skirt steak sandwich in my   times there   The bread they serve the deliciously favored meat on is reason to go alone   The only thing to be aware of is they serve the meat pretty close to rare mid rare  so if you don t like meat cooked that way  let then know when you are ordering   I love the red sauce and the garlic one  but try them all and pick your favorite  This place really is great  so get there sooner than later

You do EVERYTHING right   The menu comprehensive  prices reasonable  the staff educated   the food so deliciously different than same old stuff   Had the steak platters  corn on the cob  papas  and delicious dulce de leche cookies   There are no complaints  other restaurants should take note   Will return again

I was in town for a Steelers game last weekend and we had decided to go here for dinner  Some of the best food I ve had  I love that you can bring in your own wine and they will uncork it for you right in line while you wait to order

Alright  so it s not like this place needs anymore fantastic reviews  but after a meal as delicious as the one I had here  I feel like I should add one anyway  My mom and I came here for lunch at the end of the rush hour  so we chose to order a bunch of things  since we figured it wouldn t take very long  and take leftovers home  Each of us got small El Gaucho salads with skirt steak  plus the Provoletta app  a   pc sweet and hot chorizo app  and a side of  rusted roots   The salads were awesome   the veggies were crisp  the flavors meshed well  and the steak was truly amazing  I always order rare steak and this place cooked it perfectly  The quality of the meat was excellent  as well  The Provoletta app was delicious and perfectly melty    however  I took half home and had it for dinner  cold  and the cheese was still a stand out  even cold   We could barely take more than a few bites of the chorizo app and the rusted roots  but not for lack of trying  The chorizo  I preferred the spicy but the sweet was good too  was juicy and had a great blend of spices  Finally  one of the things that made me want to try this place in the first place was the veggie pictures  and I was not disappointed by the rusted roots  This place proves that you can be  meat centered  but still serve up some amazing veggie dishes  I highly recommend the parsnips but frankly all of the veggies in the mix were excellent  One more note about food   try ALL OF THE HOMEMADE SAUCES  On your veggies  on the toast  on the meat   they are all different and so  so good  The service was great  although again  we came at a slow time   A little on the pricier end  but not horrible   you d probably end up spending about the same if you went to Panera Bread  and there is no comparison to the quality here  I will definitely be a repeat customer

Asked for a recommendation and the gentleman at the counter said to get the steak sandwich with ribeye or skirt  I went with the skirt steak medium rare  Honestly might be the best steak sandwich I ve ever had  Served in a paper wrapping  topped with roasted red bell peppers  carmelized onions  and chimichurri sauce  Phenomenal

I went to Gaucho with   friends who were visiting from out of town  one of them has a father from Argentina   As a vegetarian  I was prepared to just vicariously enjoy her enjoyment as I sat and had a minimal meal   Not so   I was very pleasantly surprised that this very meat heavy restaurant also has plenty of vegetarian options that are extremely delicious   It also has a fun vibe   Just thinking about what I had there  one of every vegetarian side  makes me want to head back there soon

In my   years in Pittsburgh as a college student searching for the best local places to eat  none have come even close to Gaucho in terms of quality  price  and overall experience   The   star rating accurately reflects how good this place is  and I would say without a doubt that it s the single best restaurant in Pittsburgh    As you walk in the door  you are greeted by the glorious smell of a fantastic assortment of meats sizzling over a wood fired grill  I have so far tried three different dishes  and honestly cannot choose a favorite  as they re all that good   This is one of the first places I ve ever been to where I actually want to make an honest attempt to try everything on the menu      Prices are very reasonable  especially considering the quality  A lot of love goes into these dishes  and the chefs take great care in both cooking  and plating them   The food itself is a work of art  and tastes absolutely every bit as good as it looks   Everything that I have tried so far has been very well thought out  with all the pieces of the dish working exquisitely well with one another  creating a tantalizing dance of flavors that envelope your taste buds and give them a big warm hug that says  I love you     Service was spectacular as well   All the way from the chef to the cashier who will bring your prepared food to wherever you happen to be sitting  the service was flawless   Very friendly  very efficient  and shows a great deal of caring about what they do  and making sure you as a customer get the fullest possible enjoyment out of your experience    I honestly don t think I ll ever go anywhere else ever again for meats  Gaucho is so far above it s competition that they seem like cheap fast food in comparison   Give this place a try  I guarantee you ll find something there that you ll love
I love this place  Food was cooked to perfection and very tasty too  Will definitely go again on my next visit to the  Burgh

I wish there was a   star score   I wouldn t feed this to my dog  if I had one   I got a pulled chicken sandwich   First three bites had a chicken bone in each bite  one piece was nearly an inch long   Then  there s the charred beyond all recognition things  maybe onions    in the sandwich   Further examination showed undercooked  pink  pieces of chicken   How they scorched some of it and undercooked some of it is quite a mystery    Unfortunately  I got my food to go  so I can t complain there   If you want to risk it  eat there and examine your food carefully before you bite in      I have a picture of the mess  if I can figure out how to upload
There s really nothing I could say that hasn t already been said about the great food this place has  Oh wait  they don t take Amex  Lol  Great food

Had a great meal here   Fantastic grilled beef  chicken and shrimp  The beef  especially  is so flavorful and has a unique texture to it   It is really different from traditional American BBQ or Brazilian BBQ   You have to try this place to experience it   Yes  the line is long and they don t take reservation but it is well worth the wait   Service was very friendly and efficient

The wait here was very long  but that is because the food is delicious  You order at the counter  and then you sit down and the staff brings you your food  The portion sizes are great and the food tastes amazing  especially the bread  My boyfriend got the steak sandwich  which you can choose your cut of steak  and I got the fish sandwich  made with fish of the day   Plus we split veggie and pork empanadas with some potatoes  There are small containers with   chimichurri sauces that you can bring to your table to sample  The price is very fair for the quality and taste of food  The casual atmosphere also is a plus

Great experience  Hip place   Crowd was mostly young adults   some looked like empty nesters  Had a San Francisco joint feel to it which I liked  Trendy but relaxed atmosphere    Food was nice   Tried their grilled shrimps  chicken wings  and the beef burger  It had a fancy name that I don t remember  Be prepared to stand in line for a while on a busy night before you order  After you order and pay  you are seated and food brought to you relatively quickly  Kitchen is behind he counter so you can see the action while waiting in line  Prices are fair to a bit high  Don t go there if you are looking  for a quite place  Louder music and people talking in a not so big place  We were loud too so were fine  Saw a couple changing seats due to noise but I m sure it didn t help    If they could do something about the long lines which easily goes out the door around the block and noise levels  would give them   stars

There is almost always a long wait for this place  but for good reason  The food is amazing  and they have all these different kinds of sauces that you can help yourself to  The desserts are great too  try the bread pudding

This is the place to be if you were to ever visit Pittsburgh or a Pittsburgh native  This restaurant is worth the long line because the food is delicious and so worth it   I highly recommend the rosemary beef sandwich  I also recommend trying the different types the sauces that is readily available on the stand

Very good  always a line  but worth the wait   Hanger Steak  Flank Steak  Grilled Vegetables and Potatoes were all very good   The different sauces they have are awesome   This place lives up to everything that is said written   Must visit   it s pretty much a take out place  but they do have limited counter seating

AMAZING   The wait outside was soooo worth it   Everything from the meat to the sauces to the vegetables  salad  even the toast  everything was amazing   The food was excellent   We will definitely be back
This place is off the charts great  Don t let the long line keep you from going   it moves fast  The food is fantastic  staff is friendly  and the atmosphere is cozy  I cannot wait to go back

I ve been to the strip plenty of times and drove past this teeny place on the way out and always wondered about if it was any good and if we should try it but we were always on our way home with a car full of groceries  When I read the reviews I had to go to see if all the rave reviews were true   How I wish we would ve stopped a long time ago   Everything everyone I went with ordered was delicious and cooked to perfection   I had the rosemary braised beef sandwich   SO GOOD  My sister got the skirt steak small platter and it was so tender and flavorful  which is hard to do with skirt steak   My nephew got the ny strip small platter and also done to perfection   There was more than enough food and everything was amazing   We couldn t decide which sauce was the best   they were all so good   Get the roasted potatoes too   you won t be sorry   I m already planning my next meal there   will definitely be back   Don t hesitate   just go  The only thing you ll regret is not discovering this place sooner

This is our new favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  Despite the    minute wait to get a table  it is well worth the wait  The food came out quickly and it was done to perfection  I got the spicy chorizo sandwich which was incredible and my wife got the steak which was done to her liking   Highly recommend but it is a first come and first serve  Well worth the wait

Fantastic food  Highly recommend the wings   The customer service could use some work  Manager owner looking guy was rude when I came in the door  rude when I asked about seating and rude when I requested that they add avocado to my salad  since I had paid for it and it was nowhere to be found   He ruined my experience

I have updated this review to five stars  because I never followed up with a better review  but I have been back on several occasions and have had amazing food every time  Every  Single  Time  In fact  I recently tried their empanadas again  which I always counted as the weakest point in their game  and I was stunned by how much better they are than I recalled   For the sake of history  my original review  where I assigned them two stars  follows   I love Gaucho  It is my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh   Unfortunately  today I had a terrible meal at Gaucho    far worse than any previous experience there  My coworker and I both had steak burgers for lunch  and we both thought that they were very salty and overcooked  We both ordered our burgers to be cooked to medium  and they came easily well done  Additionally  the bread they were served on was more burnt than toasted   Gaucho is still a favorite  but I hope that food like I had today will not be recurring   I fully expect to leave a far more favorable review on my next visit

This place was a pleasant surprise find in Pittsburgh  Meat was cooked perfectly and had great flavor and the chimichurri sauces were all delicious   For sides I had the gaucho potatoes and the maiz  corn on the cob  and they were both really good  To my surprise though  the prices seemed a bit much for Pittsburgh  coming from San Francisco  I m used to paying a bit more for things  and this was comparable to the prices we see out in SF  Besides that though  the place had a good vibe  it appeared to be pretty popular and I m glad I found it for when I come back next time
Amazing cuts of meat but their provoleta is a glorified open faced grill cheese  Not how it s authenticly done

Came here for late brunch on a Friday  Our party of    was able to find seating quickly  We ordered everything from paella  sirloin steak  steak sandwiches  potato sides  and chorizo sampler dish  Everything was cooked very well  Meats were tender  juicy and well flavored  Potatoes had a nice garlic and thyme herb roasted taste to them  The salads had a variety of spinach and other greens your not limited to just ice burg lettuce   Paella took about    minutes to prepare  Feeds around     people  They put plenty of sausage  chicken  mussels  shrimp  and clams in this dish  Shrimp was a lil overcooked and rice should ve been cooked for another   minutes  Rice still had a lil of the hard texture to it   One of my friends who lives in the area recommended this place and we were surprised we got seated quickly  They have a sauce and silver ware station  Sauce here is everything  They have this roasted pepper  chimichurri and pesto type sauce that everyone needs to try  It s so good that you need to try different combinations on all of your food  Everything seems to be self service  but the kind waiters do come out to clear plates  refill drinks and check in on you   Highly recommend this place if your a big meat person and enjoy Argentinian dishes  Portions are reasonable  food is priced fairly and you get quality ingredients here  There is plenty of street parking in the area  I do hear the place can get crowded so expect a wait  Parties are first come first serve and you can t reserve seats

I m going to sound a little insane  but I was stalking this place for a while  I d heard good things about it from my friend  who described it as  that godly place in the Strip that has five stars on Yelp   Naturally  I was a little curious  I swear  I checked their Facebook page every few days while it was closed for renovations to see when they d be back up    Well  as you guess by this review  I finally made it  And it was worth it    ATMOSPHERE  while I hadn t been to the old one  the new interior is lovely and has many different seating options  Unfortunately  this place can get full quickly  so we were stuck at a table where the setting sun shone directly into our eyes   SERVICE  amazing   While we were waiting in line  one of the staff came out and asked if anyone had questions  I asked about one of the sauces on the menu  and he brought out said sauce with a small spoon for me to try it  If you re intimidated by the Spanish on the menu  just ask for help  Also  one of my friends wanted to switch out one of his sides for corn on the cob  and they were totally cool with it    FOOD  my rosemary braised beef sandwich was delicious  I am a huge fan of crusty bread with big beautiful air pockets  and the meat was cooked to perfection  If you re at this place  it is basically assumed you love meat  so be ready to eat plenty of meat  However  two pieces of bread and all that beef was too much for me to bite at once  so I did an open face sort of thing and used the other piece of bread to dip in their various sauces  I encourage you to test all the sauces and find your favorite
Yum  Great food  AWESOME service  Cheap  easy  fun little place and Pittsburgh needs like ten other spots to open that s run by these guys  Highly recommend

The line out the door is totally worth it  Even in freezing temperatures  Ok  maybe not but hey  you can call and skip the line   I totally didn t know that   I ve visited Gaucho once way before they expanded the space  I loved it then but I had to check out the new space before writing a review  Despite the added room  it s still rather an uncomfortable experience when coming here because of the cramped  waiting  area  However  there is a defined process for ordering and eating  but the board right outside the door will tell you exactly how it works which is great and prevents confusion and chaos  Usually there is a line out the door  which is dependent on when you come here of course  When there is a line out the door  the point from the door to time of ordering is about    minutes  Sounds crazy but it isn t that bad  Once you order and they seat you  food comes out in a snap  I think this makes up for the waiting time in line    Anyway  Food  Everything is well seasoned to perfection here  As if the dishes weren t so bold and flavorful already  they have four sauces that are each out of this world  They re all tasty but if you aren t sure  ask them to describe what each sauce is  My favorite is the red one  Pimenton  which is a red pepper type sauce that is just great on everything  When coming here  you ve got to try a steak  whether it s a plate or it s a sandwich  you can t go wrong either way  Personally  I like the plate because you still get bread plus a small salad  However  the sandwiches are huge  The sides are also absolutely amazing  especially the Brussels sprouts    Overall  totally worth the hype  and wait  and it s not that expensive either  If there wasn t such a long line all the time  I d probably come here much more often than I do  I highly recommend Gaucho if you haven t already tried it out for yourself
So yummy    The best burgers in town for sure  Lots of flavor but not oily  The price is also affordable

We are here visiting Pittsburgh for a day and decided to give this place a try since a friend on FB recommended it  I ve got to say  seriously      this QuiQui Chicky is ridiculously addicting    I m actually writing this review while still licking my fingers  This a must try dish  We also ordered some Empanadas  which were very tasty  but this chicken dish     omg
The prices were quite reasonable and the food very delectable  The empanadas were a little underwhelming the day after  Remember to bring your own drink if wanted

As a top rated spot in PGH I decided to finally give it a try   After reading about long lines and waits of up to an hour  I decided to order take out and go at lunch time  I called up to place my order and was told by a young woman that  we are very busy and might not be able to get to it   After picking my jaw up off the floor  I vowed I wouldn t go back   But after a few weeks of jonesing for the grilled veggies  I decided to give them one more try   This time a very pleasant young man took my order   Although there was a line of   people perusing the chalkboard menu  I got to scoot right up to the far side of the register  pay  and scoot right home  The grilled veggies were excellent  I also got a rosemary braised beef sandwich which was also very good  albeit a bit on the soggy side  even though I only live about    minutes away   Parking on Penn was a little tough  you might have to park a block or two away   They might want to consider getting a hold of the empty  but blocked off  lot next door

This place is terrific  For those of us who are unfamiliar with Argentinean food  the menu may require some explanation  The staff was very helpful in making recommendations  I wound up with the pulled chicken sandwich and grilled corn on the cob  Both were great  Although there is limited counter seating in the restaurant  there is a very nice outdoor patio   A great addition to the Strip   Will definitely be back
This place is heaven  Tried different cuts of meat and they were all delicious  Great environment and unique service

The food here is of really great quality and has great flavor  The biggest issue is the waiting to order and sit  We waited in line for over an hour  In this day and age  they should be able to have a system to text you when it s your turn to order so you can walk around and enjoy your evening  For this reason  we would not return even though the food was very good

This place is absolutely amazing  I ve lived in the Strip for a few months and it wasn t until just recently that I ate here for the first time  and I ve already gone back since     It s totally worth the   hour wait that extends out the door  So if you re starving and see the line  maybe opt for it some other time  The second time I went knowing there would be a long wait  so didn t show up hungry    I had  the chicken sandwich which was delicious and tried out the assortment of sauces they have on hand and I was very impressed by them all   It s also BYOB  so if you re in the long line it s wise to bring a cooler  We forgot and they let us put our beers in their fridge  so they are also great in terms of customer service
So delicious  We got the Provoletta and the Rosemary Braised Beef   melts in your mouth good  Can t wait to go back

Had been eager to try this place after seeing it be in the top     yelp restaurants  Even on a Tuesday night around       there was a line still to get in  Do not come at    because they lock the doors around         I had ordered the chicken wings and a small lamb chops  The wings were amazing and will definitely be back for them  They were marinated very well and had a great tangy flavor  It was five whole wings so it was good to split  The wings were so flavorful I didn t need to use any of the extra sauces    The lamb chops were also cooked well with a mustard seed dressing  The salad and tostado was a nice break from all the meat  My friend got the chicken and said it was fine but not great  a little dry  She preferred the wings over the chicken platter    Overall  I know I will be coming back  Simple food with great flavor

Great food  Meat Meat and Meat what s not to love  The staff was very friendly and helpful as the menu is overwhelming for a first timer  I would go back again anytime I return to Pittsburgh  I only wish I would have know it was BYOB

We had the opportunity to check out Gaucho Parilla late last summer  We were there with our two boys  age    and      My wife and younger son waited in line while my older son and I went to a local wine shop to grab an adult beverage for the meal  The staff at the restaurant was extremely friendly and helpful  The restaurant was packed but the staff never appeared flustered or made us feel rushed  We were seated and served fairly quickly  We ordered empanada appetizer main courses of beef  chicken and veggies  The food was fabulous and was the dining experience    We were so impressed that we recently reached out to the restaurant staff to help us with our family Christmas Day meal planning  We wanted to  mix things up a bit  for this German Polish family by switching the dinner to a traditional New Mexican theme    We wanted to include empanadas but did not feel confident preparing them ourselves  Gaucho enthusiastically helped us customize the empanada ingredients and offered their expertise regarding the best way for us to pick them up on Friday as we drove through Pittsburgh on our trip to Buffalo NY  They  par cooked the empanadas and packed them up for us  When I arrived at Gaucho to pick them up  the chef brought them out to me himself and took the time to give me his recommendations for completing the cooking process on Christmas Day  He also hand picked and packed up sauces for the empanadas  Very reasonable price    I was extremely impressed with the attention to detail demonstrated by all the staff  and the care they took to make sure their peice of our family dinner was a success  Our family meal was begun with the empanadas as I pulled them from the oven  They were golden brown and piping hot  The dough was perfectly flaky and the fillings were flavorful and moist  They really set the stage for the rest of the meal    Thanks so much to all the staff at Gaucho Parilla Argentina for the wonderful product you put on the table  the friendly and casual  atmosphere you create in your dining room and the obvious devotion you show to your customers    No wonder there s always such a long line of eager diners at their door  It s mostly definitely worth the wait
LOVE this restaurant   The food is always phenomenal and the employees are polite   The line gets pretty long at times but it is well worth the wait

The best  and only  argentinian cuts you can have in Pittsburgh  The flavor is amazing  the presentation subtle and the portions have the perfect size  If I could I would go there every week  The sandwiches are great but what really worth is having one of their amazing cuts  BYOB  Take your favorite red and enjoy
Our steak was overcooked but they gave us a new one immediately and it was perfect  Love their sauces  We also had the grilled chicken which was tasty  Will def be back for their paella

Very tasty foods  Both for the meat centric or a less heavily reliant  BOOB is nice  to let us choose the pairings  Friendly staff are there if you need em but unbothersome otherwise  The lineup is pretty much worth it  But from a managerial perspective  somewhat unavoidable  But its an asset to the institution that is probably a deliberate keeper to passively keep the hype  I ll play the game any day for food that tasty though  bravo

This is one of the BEST sandwiches I ve had  I came here after splitting a primanti brothers sandwich and we both agreed this was WAYYY better   The guy working here is super friendly and helpful  We even got to try a sample of soup for free  We split the  Carne  sandwich and I got the filet cut  several cuts of steak are available to you   It came out very moist and flavorful  Seasoned very well  must have been marinated i guess  and cooked on the grill it was great  It also came with some roasted peppers  If I lived here I d eat it all the time   HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Went there feeling a bit adventurous and wanting to try something new and different  The line to order was a bit long so if you re in a hurry for to go  call ahead  I wanted to get a bit of everything so I got a steak empanada  chicken empanada  Gaucho Papas  and Tostados  The sauces were the best part  My personal favorites were the pimenton and the Cebolla  Also BYOB and no cork fee

Amazing    My new favorite go to restaurant   Just had the Pescado sandwich   potatoes  and corn   Everything was so delicious and fresh   True Argentina style cooking   All the sauces were delicious   fresh   Seating was limited during lunch but I enjoyed the casual atmosphere of pulling up a barstool and enjoying delicious food

I got lucky because when I arrived there was no line   That is unusual   This place is popular    Since I am not from the area and only travel here for work I haven t tried this place before   I am so glad I did   Wow     The carne  steak  sandwich was a tender cut of meat on a great piece of bread with saut ed red peppers and onions   Delish    Add one  or more  of their   home made sauces and even more delish   I also had a chicken and a beef empanada   They were also fantastic    I will be back
Had the flank steak sandwich   Very tender and tasty   Would definitely go there again

I have been waiting a long time to write this  The first thing I can say is  it was worth the wait  Walking down pen avenue toward the bridge the sweet smell of wood fire and grilling hits you about a block away  The line for lunch can be a bit long at times  but it moves pretty fast so don t give up  The chalk written menu is easy to follow  small plates  salads  main dishes specials and grilled beef and pork  For lunch I have been waiting to try the braised beef with rosemary and horsey sauce on a fresh focaccia  It was everything I could have imagined and more  The beef was tender and juicy and the rosary and grilled opinions were a perfect addition without hiding the flavor or the star of the show  I also had the pork empanadas which were the best I ve ever had    Period  I can t wait to try everything   My goal is the paella which serves     humans   I am sure I can find a few volunteers for that mission

Brought our son and his friend here for dinner before the Pirate game  When I looked at the menu I was worried the kids wouldn t like it  Boy was I wrong  they devoured everything on their plate  My husbands chicken sandwich was very good and my Rosemary braised beef sandwich was to die for   On top of the delicious food the staff were all so friendly and helpful  A most enjoyable dinner  The DeCarlo s will definitely be back

Fantastic    The smells emanating from this beautiful eatery are tempting enough   You step in and the decor is beautiful   The staff was friendly and helpful  as this was our first visit  won t be our last     We had the steak  filet   sandwiches  which were SO good   We also shared the Provoletta appetizer which was fantastic   The combination of provolone  toasted bread  arugula and Kalamata olives is just delicious    Every aspect of our lunch was so good   The ciabatta used for the sandwiches is perfect   I can t wait to try everything on the menu   Definitely an outstanding restaurant on the Strip

Believe the hype    I ve only been in twice  both times with a line out the door  and most recently had one of the most deeply satisfying Filet con pan  sandwich  I can ever recall  along with a side of spicy caramelized brussel sprouts  I share the overwhelming love expressed for Gaucho

Went at      on a Friday   I was not in a hurry  but if you are call ahead   The place has some character to it which I really enjoyed   I got the steak sandwhich  ribeye    It was very good  as well as the ciabatta bread   I also got a side of the potatoes   They were slightly above average  as the rosemary was somewhat overpowering   I will be back again and will likely try them empanadas  sp   and a different cut of meet   I would give it     but they get the benefit of the doubt

Amazing   Amazing steak  amazing steak and amazing sauces   My rating is for the food   My review of everytthing else  There is very little seating  a surprise   and the seating there is  it is outside and uncovered   There must be room for eight people to sit inside and that includes      barstools at counters  It appeared that most of the customers get their food take out  There are no servers  really  although someone nice nice came to our table and delivered the food
Every bite is Awesome    Soooo Super Yummy  The roasted chicken and steak    Yummy  The mashed sweet potatoes and roasted red potatoes w  garlic sooo yummy

of us went during the weekday lunch rush and we waited probably    minutes at most in line before we ordered and less than that to get our food once we sat down  The host serving staff was friendly efficient to take our order and seat us  The kitchen staff was extremely knowledgeable when we asked about different dishes  I had the Argentino salad with steak  medium rare and it was prepared to perfection  The   different sauces they offer are all equally delicious and different   The inside is clean  decorated well  and we love the yinzer vibe in there in addition to the authentic argentine feel      stars and more  Love everything

Absolutely delicious authentic tasting food  sauces are too die for  I get a salad or a sandwich and it s always amazingly delicious  Lots of things on the menu I have yet to try but I can imagine it s all good  It can form quite a line sometimes but it s worth the wait
This place is amazing and everything on the menu is excellent  However  the most cost efficent is the steak burger and always call in to skip the line

Holy Mary mother of sweet baby Jesus     Forgive me   One of the best mouth orgasms I ve ever had  If you love meat their steak sandwiches cannot  Be touched    Perfect quality perfectly toasted bread delicious accent veggies    I ordered a sandwich and the empanadas  I experienced food amnesia because the empanadas were so good I literally forgot I ate them both  In a matter of minutes    Don t walk here run now

The food is amazing  The atmosphere is nice   Friendly service from the moment we walked in   They explained the menu and gave great recommendations   I had the ribeye my friend got the flank steak and shared an order of grilled vegetables   Everything down to the grilled toast was some of the best food I ve had    I will definitely be back on my next trip to Pittsburgh

Came here specifically for the paella after the place had been recommended to me multiple times from multiple people  Not sure if it s because of the high praise or if they were having an off day but I was sincerely let down  I felt pretty uncomfortable from the getgo   as if I was judged to be not  hip  enough to be eating there  While ordering I asked for no chorizo on the paella and was asked if I wanted to substitute it for either tilapia or salmon  Neither sounded particularly appetizing so I opted for neither  The dude handling the order gave me a raised eyebrow look but proceeded in taking the order  While walking away to our table I turned back and overheard one of the cooks talking to the guy to reconfirm our order and seemed rather frustrated by my request  The place itself was rather hot and the music pretty loud  music selection however was    Other than that   everything was otherwise clean  aesthetically pleasing  and the wait staff refilled our waters appropriately    The paella itself was pretty lacking  There was no rice crust on the bottom  which felt sacrilegious  The shrimp on top were fresh and good quality but didn t have much flavor  nor did the rice  I know I asked for no chorizo but I didn t realize that they were incapable of imparting any flavor without it  Such a let down    It being my first time there and not wanting to waste food  I asked one of the wait staff for a box and he pointed to the front room and said boxes were available in that vicinity   tbh I didn t really hear exactly where the boxes were because he turned his head to that
