Wow  what unique food at a wonderful value  Does it get any better   Friends urged us to try the Gaucho Parrilla Argentina food at a Yelp  event and it was absolutely mouth watering  The staff was very helpful and nice and served us even though there was    minutes left to go of the event  I tried the Rosemary Braised Beef   Horsey sauce and caramelized onion  and the Chanchito   pork tenderloin  pickled onion  mushroom and arugula   The Rosemary Braised Beef was pretty good  I pretty much love anything with caramelized onion  so I knew I wouldn t be disappointed  but I didn t know that this beef dressed with horse radish was going to be so good  The horse radish flavor was subtle but you definitely tasted it every bite  I m not a usual fan of horse radish  but the hint of it on the beef really made the dish exquisite  I favored the Chanchito dish over the beef though  The pork with the arugula  pickled onion and mushroom was just the perfect amount of flavors that complimented each other in a way that most palettes haven t been accustomed to  It was a unique way to dress up pork and a flavor experience like none other  I am so happy this Yelp  event introduced me to Gaucho s amazing eats  I already have my eye on a couple dishes and I cannot wait to try more food from Gaucho

There are so many reviews on this place so I will make it short and sweet    Just eat here  eat anything that sounds good  and you won t be sad  You will be full  happy and in love    The staff take their time to help recommend something that you will love and I didn t feel rushed at all to make a choice  I want to work here just so I can eat here everyday

Absolutely fantastic food  One of the only few restaurants that leaves me speechless during every bite  The workers there are very friendly and are more than happy to explain the large menu and offer you recommendations    On the rare occasion when they re not as busy  you ll receive a more standard waiter style service  Our host seated us at our booth after order  checked up on us from time to time  and refilled our waters  However  expect to fill up your own water and retrieve your own plates and utensils during peak times   My go to s are always the baked empanadas  a pollo sandwich  and the alfajores for dessert  The empanadas are freshly made  amazing  and have a different filling each day  They feature three main fillings   a veggie  beef  and chicken  sometimes pork  option  The fillings are intricately crafted and the flavors mesh incredibly well  Pair these with any of their god tier signature sauces and you ll be swimming through a sea of flavors  Get these for sure    The Pollo sandwich is large yet inexpensive  and full of flavor  just like everything else on the menu  The grilled ciabatta bread is crispy and robust  the perfect bread to almost contain the overflowing scrumptious contents of this hefty sandwich   caramelized onions  mashed rosemary potatoes  grilled mushrooms  and the thick cut of chicken breast  The chicken itself is marinated in their legendary Ajo garlic sauce  my personal favorite   Cut the sandwich in half  scoop on some sauces before each bite  and you ll wish the sandwich never ends    Their steaks and steak sandwiches are out of this world as well  Generally cooked to a medium with an amazing wood fire chear and sear  topped with their chimmi sauce  Hands down the best steak I ve ever had    Lastly  the Alfajores    on their website they have kind of a stale description  flavored shortbread with dulce de leche   toasted coconut  but the Alfajores are so much more than that  The shortbread on these cookies are unlike anything I ve ever had before  The Alfajores are a tiny cookie sandwich rimmed with the toasted coconut  The cookie is unbelievably soft and the dulce de leche is the perfect choice to hold these two soft pillowy shortbread cookies together  Each bite is an otherworldly experience    The sauces are essential with every meal at Gaucho and can be paired with whatever is in front of you  except maybe the Alfajores   I ll try that next time   So  I will attempt to do my best to describe the four    Ajo   My favorite sauce  pairs well with everything on the menu  Has a robust garlicy and rosemary flavor  Scoop this on everything   Chimmi   Fantastic on steaks and the chicken  a bit more watery than the other   heavenly sauces but the herbs and flavors of this one keeps me coming back   Pimenton   Has a slight vinegary tang  but the strong fire roasted pepper comes through in this one  with a hint of freshly ground black peppercorn  Great on any of the empanadas Cebolla   Amazing balance of flavors featuring caramelized onions that have been slow roasted and melded into this amazing concoction  Great on everything as well     I d be more than happy waiting   hours in line to just grab a single empanada from Gaucho  This place deserves nothing less than   stars  and it shows in their quality  preparation  and flavors of their food

Went for lunch on a Tuesday  line wasn t bad at all  Had the small filet plate  beef and pork empanada and arroz rice  The filet melts in your mouth and tastes amazing with the chimmi  The empanadas were the best I ve ever had  Definitely will be back

Wasn t extremely hungry  but have wanted to check out their new space  so I stopped in around   on a Tuesday night  Gaucho boasts an expansive menu that will delight just about anyone  Their newly designed space is also huge in comparison to their older location  which means they can now offer ample seating  which wasn t really available before   Given I wasn t in the mood for a large meal  I ordered two of their chicken empanadas  they also come in steak and vegetable   The empanads are modest in size  but were really tasty and not greasy or heavy  They have an assortment of sauces that you can try and add to just about anything you order  I can t remember which I tried  but it was delicious and I d assume they are all made on site   Tip  If heading over to Gaucho on the weekends  be prepared for a potential line out the door  That said  give yourself some extra time if in a rush
Had a really big meal with friend  Food were tasty and service was good  You have to go there early especially on Saturday since there would be a lot of people and a long waiting line for you

Absolutely love this place    Even for the non meat eater you have options   Mikey  the manager is always friendly and in a very good mood   The food is fantastic and the portions and price are fair   Make sure you have your entire party together before going since you order in a line and then pick out a table  instead of table service
if you come to pittsburgh  How could you not try burger in Gaucho

Amazing food but prepare to wait in line before you will be able to get your hands on some  The staff is super friendly and helpful  They will answer any questions you have about the menu    As for the food  it is one of the best places in Pittsburgh  All the ingredients are fresh and well prepared for all the dishes they serve  I am a big fan of their  sammiches   sandwiches   They are made on crunchy  grilled bread and whatever else comes with that specific sandwich  Their empanadas are dank   sooo good  They come straight out of the oven and I wish I had one to eat while writing this  They also have four dipping sauces throughout the restaurant which are so good you can eat them with a spoon  Their shortbread cookies are also scrumptious for dessert    All in all  Gaucho is deserving of more than just   stars for its food and service

OK  with     reviews and a solid   star rating on Yelp  there is no question the food here is outstanding   Not because I am saying so  but because     other people are saying so     So I am going to choose to not speak about the delicious morsels we consumed for lunch nor show you photos of those morsels  but rather to express a bit about Anthony  the owner of Gaucho  who was behind the counter taking our order and running the register when we stopped in today    Go to Gaucho because of Anthony   It is a rarity to meet someone like him in the restaurant business   Because the beauty of a great meal is not only about the food  but it is the  experience  that comes with that food     In addition to really having a winning personality and a top notch customer service touch  Anthony has a passion for his menu  his kitchen  his food and his staff   Although he does not seem like the kind of guy who is ever going to flash his culinary credentials  after prodding it out of him a bit  clearly he has a great pedigree in the business and it is to Pittsburgh s great fortune that he has chosen to share the culmination of this experience and his craft here in the Strip District   He was sincerely welcoming  genuinely interested in sharing his knowledge about the food from his kitchen and exuded respect  fun and flair with us and also with his staff     Go to Gaucho because it is a worthy unique opportunity to taste something special   More importantly though  go to Gaucho because you want to meet Anthony and support this good guy and his great staff who are really doing something special in the food world

SOOOO GOOD  If you have the opportunity to go here  go    They have a really big menu  so there are plenty of different options    It s a pretty relaxed restaurant environment as well  You get your drinks and you order at the front  and then you sit down wherever  A server will call your name when they have your order and they ll bring it over to your table  Also it s byob  I got the pescado sandwich which was amazing  The bread is grilled a little bit and the sandwich itself is very flavorful  They have additional sauces around the area that you can bring over to your table and make your order even more delicious  The empanadas are also really good  and they are adorably tiny  The flan was delicious  and comes with apples on top  Basically  the food is great

Gaucho is one of the best restaurants in town  Very down to earth and quick  The line is always long  but well worth the wait  My boyfriend and I had the cheese bread and a small meat platter  The meat was so tender and flavorful  it was so delicious  The employees were helpful and patient as well as informative  We will definitely be back to try more of the menu

I m soooooo glad Rich C  pointed this gem out to me   Anytime you can smell an intoxicating aroma well before you can even see its source  you know that some serious grubbage is about to go down   Walk in  and you re greeted with an open and welcoming  dining  room     more or less a center island  housing a variety of to die for sauces and additions for the unreal grilled creations offered  and a set of wrap around wall bars  standing only    The staff were very attentive  and best yet  honest   When asking for a recommendation  I was steered towards the skirt steak sandwich  hands down  over the premium priced filet equivalent   Be well aware     this is not a fast casual joint per say   Each order of meat is hand cut and grilled to order   The fiancee and I decided to split a sandwich and order a pair of empanadas  which I had  until this point  failed to find a good representation of in PGH   and in whole  it took about    minutes from the time we ordered to receive our food   After tasting it  it was WELL worth it   The steak well deserves the typical   literally melts in your mouth  tag phrase  and my brother s sausage was equally decadant    Hands down   one of my new favorite stops on our monthly strip adventures
Great set up  Food is delicious and I am glad this type of cuisine showed up in Pittsburgh  Worth the wait and the money

I ll be brief   this is the best tasting  highest quality steak sandwich I have ever eaten   The guys were EXTREMELY friendly  and even offered us beers right before they closed   I can t wait to fly back to Pittsburgh just to eat here again
Line was very long and parking was difficult on Saturday  But the food was amazing and totally worth it  Got the flank steak  It was perfectly cooked and the flavor was excellent
There s always a wait  but it s so worth it  One of my favorite lunch spots in the whole city  Everything is tender and cooked to perfection

LOVE this place  The steak is excellent  and everything is good and reasonably priced  BYOB is nice too  Don t skip dessert  the bread pudding is phenomenal  The only down side is the wait can get long at certain times  Go a little early or late if you can  but if you do have to wait   it s worth it

After reading reviews and seeing a line out the door the day before we visited  hubby was a little disappointed  I thought it was great  We tried a few different items from the menu  Everyone is raving about the Rosemary beef  I enjoyed the pork more  Excellent burger  though we did have to send back to cook longer   it was for one of the kids   Spicy chorizo was excellent   and spicy  The sauces are excellent   the chimmi was our favorite
Great food  They ve been mixing up their counter service table service but it s always fantastic food and it can either be a splurge or an everyday meal

What an amazing ethnic restaurant and just sorry it took so long to finally stop in  The food menu is extensive and TAAAAAASTY  From the steak to the papas potatoes to the empanadas to the salad  everything was exceptional  The sauces are available to go  BUY SOME  Better than store bought hands down  The service is attentive and super friendly and helpful  You will have a wait to order but it s highly worth it  You will leave happy

Came here with a friend based on recommendations of other friends  This place lives up to the hype  I ordered the NY strip steak medium rare  My only complaint was that the steak came out medium  not medium rare  Regardless  it tasted delicious with all the sauces available  The salad and the toasted bread were also good

Words cannot explain how much I love this place  The food is freaking delicious  and the service outstanding  They serve Argentinian wood fired meats  and man do they do it well  My favorite thing to get is Bife de Gaucho served medium rare  The steak is so juicy  flavorful  and tender  Drooling thinking about it  I have also tried the gaucho papas  empanadas  and carne  All delicious  They serve freshly made chimichurri and sauces that are served as sides  This is a must try restaurant  you won t be disappointed

Absolutely the best place I ever eaten in Pittsburgh  The place is a little hard to get and finding parking relies on luck  but once you are there  the food is divine   The atmosphere is a classy  hipster type and the different types of food from snack dishes  to salad  sandwiches or real steak and desserts are there to make up for all the hassle you have to go through to get there  My SO had ribeye steak and I had a steak sandwich  I had to say  the steak was really good   moist and juicy and cooked to your desired level  However  what amazed me was the seasoning they put on the sandwich bread that made me go ooh aah while eating it  Most of the time  the sandwich places make their fillings taste good but fail miserably with seasoning the buns condiments that go with it  With Gaucho Parrilla Argentina  however  they get both right   Even my SO still raved about this place and the place stood out in both our minds when we thought about the best meal we had in Pittsburgh as well   Price was really reasonable  especially with the portion and such awesome taste you get  The waiter cashier were super helpful  too  It does also help that the atmosphere is classy super inviting  too  Go  if you are in Pittsburgh   and definitely make a case to stop and eat at this place even if you are just a visitor in town  Next time I m back in Pittsburgh   I will hike my way there again   D

I ve been eyeing this place for a while  by which I mean smelling it    You can smell the smoke rolling off of a place such as this from blocks away  It s the same reason why you never see an ad for Cinnabon  If you get people by the nose  their ass will follow promptly    I was pleased upon entering to see a clean  and well decorated place  I dread walking into a new place  and seeing that perhaps someone can cook  but be clueless as to how to make a guest feel welcome  The sun was bursting through the windows onto saffron colored walls and butcher block counters  A giant rosemary plant sat in the window  Every detail was in place    Prices for sandwiches looked little steep  but what landed in front of me was the size of my  th grade lunchbox  so no worries there  I was still in a daze looking at the sandwich on a giant piece of ciabatta bread  when our host was directing us to choose from sauces on the center table to garnish our lunch  Ajo  Pimenton  Cebolla and Chimi Churri  or to you  Anglo  este es roasted garlic  roasted red pepper  roasted sweet onion  and the tradtional sauce of many South American barbecue styles  What Chimi Churri means depends greatly on where you happen to be standing  Some places use a bit of oregano  others some cilantro  All of them center on fresh parsley  olive oil  a bit of garlic and red wine vinegar  These all sat in tasteful jars with sample cups to portion out  It was hard to not get carried away  to be candid   My sandwich was big enough I chose to cut it in half  and try the pimenton on one half  the ajo on the other  The ajo is thoroughly grilled  so the flavor almost has a savory nuttiness to it  instead of the pungent sulphur blast that we often associate with garlic  The pimenton was even better  grilling having mellowed the sweetness of the red pepper  balanced with a pleasing combo of herbs  oil  and vinegar    Let s get something out of the way here  Pittsburgh  Corn on the cob is not to be boiled  As they do south of the border  and also at Gaucho  the ears are placed directly on the grill  Soaked in water first  and grilled with the husk still on  it arrived in a bit of tinfoil  the husk charred black  Peeled back  and used as a handle  there is no need for the Midwestern American plastic corn cob holders  Throw those ridiculous things in the recycle bin  please  Corn originates from Meso America  Trust me  our neighbors to the south know exactly what they re doing  The husk protects the corn from scorching  and it steams in it s own skin  acquiring that important smoky flavor  The carmelized flavors of the cebolla sauce were a perfect compliment   I am almost afraid to tout this place so highly  in that it may become too busy to get some of the awesome grub they re putting out

SO GOOD  My boyfriend and I were extremely ambitious and we got a small Casa Salad and an Asado Platter to share between the both of us  The salad was    and really tasty with red curly leaf lettuce  radish  grape tomatoes and shaved carrots  It had a yummy but not heavy salad dressing  which I really enjoyed  The Asado Platter was     and included a small portion of each of the five cuts of meat  Flank  sirloin  filet mignon  NY strip  and ribeye  My favorite was the filet and my boyfriend s favorite was the sirloin  Every cut was super tender  The chimichurri sauce was the best of all the sauces  Also  the Asado Platter is absolutely way too much food for two people  It s a   person portion and comes with toast  Definitely recommend this place

As everyone knows by now  this is no longer a well kept secret in the Strip District  Gaucho certainly has a cult following and its worth the wait in line up the street  I would recommend going with a smaller group because the seating is limited and we had to wait about    minutes until a table opened  It s all first come  first serve seating  but the staff was more than accommodating to assist you as you waited  They opened our wine and consistently checked on tables to be aware of the status  If you re looking for a leisurely meal  this isn t the spot  but you re only coming here for the food and it is truly excellent

Took a bunch of guys here again and it universally got the nod as one of the best steak sandwiches every one had ever eaten     I don t know if I even remembered to breathe while inhaling its deliciousness   KEEP IT UP
Went to Gaucho for the first time today and it certainly won t be my last  The food was delicious  especially the Rosemary braised beef sandwich  Yum

The meat is so nicely seasoned  Anything you eat here will satisfy you  I tried almost everything from the menu and I never got disappointed  Only downside is the usual line you have to wait to get your hands so some nicely cooked meat

Really  Really  Really Good     I had the El Gaucho salad with Chicken   It was awesome   Also had the grilled corn   It was perfect    My friend had the ribeye sandwich  it was amazing   The roasted potatoes were great too    A hidden gem in Pittsburgh
I miss the old Gaucho   This new Gaucho has adopted the Portland concept of slow ordering to create a massive line so that you appear popular   It is disrespectful to your customers
Gaucho s is bar far  in my opinion  the best food in Pittsburgh  I don t think you ll find a better steak sandwich on earth
Food taste awesome and have a great atmosphere  However  I felt  like portion of their food was relatively small for it s price

Excellent steak sandwiches at a great price  The staff is also very helpful at recommending a dish for you if you re unsure  They ll happily explain anything on the menu  They also offer great sides    The only negative of this place is the line and seating as a result of its popularity  If you can  try to go outside of the lunch hour  They recently expanded  but it still can t contain the horde  My hope is they keep up with their success without ever diminishing the quality   This place is amazing

Fantastic food and atmosphere   Worth the wait and its byob   Absolutely loved it   The steak platter was amazing  And the paella was filled with fresh seafood   Don t get me started on the sauces  Chimicurri and garlic are the best I ve ever had   Will definitely go back and try the sandwich

Unreal  No other words besides unreal  Being from New York where great restaurants abundant and being spoiled with good food I was skeptical when I came to Pittsburg  In look for a restaurant with real  fresh food was the mission  Luckily I passed this restaurant driving and saw a line of people out the door with almost    people down the road  I made it a goal to try the hype the next day  Menu is very accommodating to any kind of meal you d like  So I decided to order a little of it all    The steak  medium rare rib eye COOKED TO PERFECTION  And the flavors  Incredible  The el Gaucho salad  so fresh tossed with a balsamic vinegar   The chiqui chicken small plate  chicken cooked so tender  The spicy chorizo  if you enjoy heat  this is most definitely the dish for you   The layout is great  open kitchen  multiple sauce stations for my saucy people and best of all BYOB    WITH NO CORKING FEE  Hello  This place is amazing    Point blank

Amazing  just amazing and very tasty  Had this been in nyc or sf they could easily get    x the current pricing  I d say that this is the one of the best steak restaurants i ve had in nyc  pit and sf combined  The vibe is cool hip casual  easily could be the best place in the strip for a date or if you want to pamper yourself with great food

Man  How did I forget to review this one  This was actually probably our favorite during our short stint in Pittsburgh  I heard they were expanding  but when we were there it was pretty much a small and tight space  which felt even smaller considering its rabid fans   And you ll see why if you sample their meats  And their sauces    and just about anything they serve here  My recommendation is to get the meat platter with most of the meats    Perfect

Honestly  this has got to be the best restaurant in pittsburgh  The meat is flavorful and just perfect  The sauces are incredible and make you lick your fingers  The bread is divine  My only problem is the lack of seating  reservations  or some smooth run system  You may wait    minutes  or more  in line just to order and wait even longer to get a table  Take out is not always a possibility    Gaucho  expand   This place will become a Pgh staple pretty soon

After wanting to go here for a number of years I finally drove past and didn t see a huge line outside  Anything and everything on the menu here is great  This is one of the best places in all of Pittsburgh
The line was unreal but so was the food  I am giving them the benefit of the doubt on the line considering it was the Strip Music Festival  If it wasn t for that  I d definitely give this a   star

Wow  what can I add that so many of these other reviews haven t already said  Not much  My sons and I each ordered carne sandwiches  They had the flank steak and the filet mignon while I had the NY Strip  They loved theirs  As for me  that might just well have been the best sandwich of any type I ve ever had  Just absolute perfection  The bread  perfect in this role   crunch in the crust but soft on the inside and able to soak up all the juices and not fall apart   the roasted  marinated peppers and onions  the fresh chimichurri  and the absolutely incredible meat  So flavorful  so juicy  so full of wood smoke  Perfection  And no need for a knife  Just melts in your mouth  I live in DC and cannot wait to come back  This place does Pittsburgh proud

I ve only been once  but this is one of the best meals I ve had  Luckily the long lines move quickly so don t be deterred  The staff manages to keep cool   friendly despite the ravenous customers  Everything I tried was spot on  seasoned well   cooked perfectly  I was surprised to find such an authentic meal in Pittsburgh  I actually considered a weekend getaway just to try again

Another Pittsburgh institution I had to wait in a long line to enter but  oh man  this time it was DEFINITELY worth it    First off  BYOB  Don t wait until you get here to try and find liquor  as there s no shops in the immediate vicinity  We resorted to East End Brewery for some beers which is around the corner  If you want wine  come prepared    I was with a group of five  so we decided to split the asado plate  FIVE cuts of steak on one plate with toast and chimichurri  On the side  we ordered a house salad  eat your greens    smashed sweet potatoes  roasted potatoes  and empanadas  We chose to sit outside and they happily gave us an ice bucket for our beers which was a great touch  After a little bit of a wait  our food starting rolling in      HOLY MEAT  Be sure to ask for the sauces so you can try them all  but really  the steak can stand alone  I honestly don t know which cut I was eating when  but each was as delicious as the last  The smashed sweet potatoes with vanilla and caraway and sunflower seeds was probably my favorite side  but the salad was actually a refreshing addition  I wish we got more toast to soak up the juices of the steak  but it s probably for the best we didn t  All that food was certainly enough for the five of to roll out full and happy    Wait in line  Order all the meat  Eat all the meat  Dream about the day you can return

I just found my new favorite steak place in Pittsburgh  Wood fired  smokey meat at an unreal price not to mention a great BYOB policy   Needless to say it took a good    minutes to be seated on an early Saturday afternoon  but the wait is very much worth it     I went here with my wife and friends from Buffalo   The setup of ordering is different than most restaurants as we ordered before being seated   I ended up getting the steak sandwich  Carne  which was your choice of meat served on a ciabatta bun with optional toppings   The couple we went with split the steak platter which included a variety of meat to select for a total of    oz   We brought a    pack to split between us over dinner so we drank that while waiting for our food   When the food finally came  all of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals and were absolutely stuffed afterwards   The meat had an amazing smokey flavor  and in addition to the meat there were   amazing sauces to pair with your food   I would highly recommend trying all       The steak here is extremely impressive  It s hard to beat the smokey flavor and the complimentary sauces   BYOB is a nice option to have with your meal   My only disappointment from the meal was not trying any sides or desserts  I even ordered a sandwich to go to eat later   I will definitely be back here with friends to introduce them to such a great dining experience
Fantastic  I was looking for a healthy meal and the pescado plate  sword fish  hit the mark  Both the salad and fish were absolutely scrumptious

Excellent  My favorite spot in the burgh  The sauces and flavors are unique and the meat is quality  The smoky flavor from the wood fire grill compliments every item on the menu  Every time I am a this place I leave satisfied  It s one of those places you need to visit so many times to try everything

After a   hour and    minute wait on a Saturday night  I was awarded with the finest Argentinian steak I have ever experienced in North America  If it s a perfectly cooked rare steak that you seek  I highly recommend this amazing steakhouse  WELL worth the wait

This is one of my favorite places to eat in Pittsburgh  if not thee favorite   I always go with a carne con pan  filet mIgnon medium rare  and I add goat cheese    Cooked perfect every time  it might be the best sandwich I ve ever had

Wouldn t have known about it if it wasn t for Yelp  Believe the hype  This place kicks serious butt  I d drive hours out of my way to eat here again  The skirt steak is to die for the homemade sauces are ridiculous

Amazing   We were visiting Pittsburgh for a weekend and were Yelping places to eat  My boyfriend couldn t wait to try Gaucho because he s a major carnivore   The line was out the door when we got here on a Friday night for dinner  The spot looks small at first  but there is seating all the way to the back of the restaurant as you walk in more   The menu is written on one entire wall that you can view when you walk into the restaurant    The process of ordering is pretty simple   You pick what you want  order it  pay  and then someone will bring it to your table when it s ready   There are little stations with their delicious chimichurri sauces  regular  garlic  onion  and red pepper  Loved all of them  but red pepper was probably at the bottom of my list   We couldn t get enough of the chimichurri   I had a small flank steak   oz  and my boyfriend had the small NY Strip   We also got a side of roasted potatoes along with some beef   chicken empanadas   The meat plates came with the best bread and a small side salad  Everything was absolutely delicious   We are still dreaming about Gaucho today  Can t wait to come back so we can eat here again  Wish they sold their sauces in bottles

I like Gaucho sandwiches as much as the next person  but I can t give it   stars because I haven t found a holy grail item that I d like to order again and again   This place takes really good care of making your sandwich  whether it be the smoked meat  variety of sauces to try  or fresh bread    The interior is coolly decorated and it s definitely a chill place to hang out  I ve gotten the rosemary sandwich  which was decent  Up for trying the burger out next
Super delicious  I ve had the arrachera meal a couple times and the meat is perfectly cooked  The brussels sprouts are also amazing

This place is fantastic  I was lucky enough to come when the line was short  and even then it reached the door  I ordered the Parrillada Mixta which was a huge portion  You get a spicy or sweet sausage  grilled chicken  steak  and some crispy bread  All of the meat is extremely flavorful and juicy  The steak came out amazing tender and still had lots of juice  They give you salsas on the side that makes it taste even better  Everything is wood grilled so it has a smoky taste  too  I also ordered empanadas on the side  and total this meal was good enough for me for the day  I would love to come back  and my first time trying Argentinian food was very positive

Love love love love     My husband and I ate inside here on the hottest  nastiest day of the year so far   We were quite literally sweating our you know whats off  but despite that  Gaucho is an awesome experience   Everything here is wood fired and super delicious   My husband ordered a steak sandwich and they offered him like eight different cuts of steak to choose from   I m kind of a veg head myself and was delighted to find woodfired asparagus and caramelized onions on my salad  YUM   All their condiments are delicious as well  if you love them as much as I did  you can take home a jar for         We will come back again and again and again  it s BYOB as well  which we didn t know  plus we were there for lunch   and I know we ll be spending plenty of fall nights on the cute little patio enjoying delicious food and a bottle of malbec   Seriously  so awesome    It s kind of off the beaten strip district path  but SO worth a try
It s worth the wait  The sauces are all tasty  Excellent sandwiches  large enough for left overs

Be prepared to wait in a long line that wraps around outside the business  But it is well worth the wait  We came about  pm and only had to wait    minutes to order which I hear is towards the shorter end  The staff are all super friendly and helpful so be sure to tip because they all share tips and they definitely deserve it  We got empanadas  a carne sammich with skirt steak  and a small skirt steak plate  THE BEST PART IS THEY HAVE   SAUCES THAT ARE ALL AMAZING AND YOU CAN HAVE AS MUCH AS YOU DESIRE   We also got our food fast and it was so delicious  My mouth is still full of flavor  Definitely recommend but don t go at peak lunch or dinner time if you don t want to wait a long time

Best decision I ve made in recent memory  I had passed by Gaucho numerous times while in the strip and I made a mental note to try it  I was somewhat concerned it was going  to be like the Brazilian and argentine steak houses with massive amounts of meat and prices to match  Oh but how wrong I was  I came in on a Tuesday evening after deciding eating at  pm reservation was way too late for my five year old  I was overwhelmed by all the meat options and somehow ended up getting a gaucho salad   don t judge I love meat  after asking the charismatic chef for recommendations   My salad had fancy lettuce  avocado  roasted corn carmelized onions and other stuff   Somehow I missed that it didn t have meat   Boooo my reading skills suck  My guy ordered the rosemary steak sandwich and I tried his   My salad was good but I coveted that steak sandwich like it was salvation or an invisibility cloak  It was so tender and flavorful with great bread  This is definitely a place I ll take friends family when I wanna show them the best Pgh has to offer

This place is ridiculously good  Authentic  delicious wood fired treats  Everything Gaucho s serves is incredible  I make it a point to go there any time I m within a reasonable distance of Pittsburgh  If you give Gaucho s anything less than a five star rating  I m going to assume you re either a competitor  or some dummy who doesn t understand that you sometimes have to wait in line for things

Came during the week for a late lunch  around  pm   and the long was only a few people with lots of table seating  You order when you get in and then there s a host who will find a table for you    I wasn t that hungry so got the Provoletta  Like an open faced grilled cheese the provolone was melted over a slice of wood oven toast  Perfect vehicle for the sauces they provide  Nom nom  The provolone came with a small side salad   The other dishes are sized for one hungry person or two light lunches  Sadly I didn t get to try anyone elses dishes are they were all gobbled up

Outdoor seating   BYOB   I had high expectations of this place with all the rave reviews and   stars   I was NOT disappointed   I have a feeling that the  word  is getting out fast about this place   Their menu was full of delicious sounding creations it was hard for us to decide   We asked if they could just put us together some mixed grilled vegetables and meats   That they did   We enjoyed a platter of mixed meats with shrimp  a large salad  toasted bread  grilled vegetables and delicious sauces   Everything was so flavorful and cooked perfectly and their home made sauces went well with everything   The staff was super friendly and accommodating   It was nice enough to sit outdoors and we enjoyed the atmosphere and the food   It is a small place  some may describe as a  hole in the wall   but I disagree  it is small but  charming   Their food is unique and tasty  tasty  tasty and BYOB  well that is just fantastic   We will be back to try some of their other items   YUM

I concur with most of the reviews that rave about the quality of the food  However  the overall dining experience in both of the   times I ve eaten here would have to be ranked somewhere between unsatisfactory and downright unpleasant     The wait time for actually ordering food is so out far out of control as to defy belief  If there is a line of any length outside the door  be prepared for at least a    minute wait to reach your turn to order  As someone who designs and re engineers processes  it was a particularly painful experience to observe such a complete lack of competence in this restaurant s food ordering procedure  Unless the intention is to actually limit revenue  management would be well served by hiring a consultant to streamline the process  there is so much hanging fruit  or at least visit and learn from restaurants that use line flow best practices

Kay  her friend  and I were to come here on President s Day  but damn it if they re not open on Mondays  A concert the following night at Altar Bar eventually brought me to this diminutive  re purposed house of finished wood as I was determined to explore the world of Argentine cuisine for the first time    And like other ethnic cuisines I ve had tastes of  it all seemed so familiar yet so peregrine    As I took in the interiors  I felt as if I was in for a blasphemous celebration of meat  Benches and tables resembled butcher s blocks  Flames as orange as the noonday sun shot up from a metallic grill that was fueled by smoldering logs fit for evenings of campfires and eerie storytelling    I was greeted by a white haired man in a black turtleneck who resembled Anderson Cooper  I ll shall dub him Prince Carne  He introduced himself and gave me a tutorial of sorts as he showed me their chalkboard menu  Having always wanted to sample some empanadas  I settled on those as a snack  Feeling indecisive  I allowed Prince Carne to sell me on the Matambre sandwich and awaited my meal as I read reviews of independent films  gotta take in  Searching For Sugarman  now  on a news sheet    I can t figure out what the empanadas reminded me of most  pierogi  dumplings  sambusa  Hot Pockets  or wontons  Nevertheless  these charred parcels of pastry were magnanimously stuffed with beef  onion  egg  and olives of Spanish origin  I found choosing condiments difficult  so I slathered both the empanadas and sandwich with ajo  extra virgin olive oil infused with garlic and herbs  and Chimmichurri  extra virgin olive oil imbibed with parsely  oregano  garlic  vinegar  and something called  salmuera      And I found I didn t really need either  as tasty as each oil was    Particularly shaking off any condiment was the ragingly demonic bull that was the Matambre sandwich  Armored with a sturdy hide of Ciabatta bread  a scarlet tongue of red pepper elongated from the beast s carnivorous mouth  Grilled onions  caramelized into sweet obedience  were invisible to my eyes but not my teeth and taste nodes  The beef was rare and pink and luscious and dripping in its natural juices  this South American steak hoagie simultaneously expanding my culinary sphere of experience and teaching me that we re all eating the same things  albeit in differing permutations    Of course  I still don t give a fark about what s authentic and what isn t  As long as it s good  it wins  and GPA passes this academic quarter with a        As I finished my meal  I spoke with bespectacled owner Tony Falcon and another employee whom I recognized as an alumnus of Lawrenceville s popular Italian eatery Piccolo Forno  he served me a sandwich to go on my break over a year ago   bragging about the exciting evening with thrash metal legends I had on deck    I looked directly across Penn Avenue towards Altar Bar only to see that not a single metallion was waiting outside  A sinking feeling that the show had been cancelled held my stomach hostage  Quickly  I called Kay and had her check online to see what was afoot  Surely enough  Bobby Ellsworth  Overkill s frontman  was ill with pneumonia and wouldn t be performing that night or on any of the tour s remaining dates    Eh  it was shitty  n bitter out anyway  So to home I headed with a satiated appetite and a desire to snuggle with my lonely girlfriend whom I should appreciate more than I do    Until next time  Blitz     http   www youtube com watch v  WLQvzUux c  P S  I recommended to the personnel that GPA might do well to expand their hours for the Altar Bar concert crowd  Their inexpensive  quick serve  portable fare would likely go over well with the rockers of the  Burgh and therefore prove profitable
Great food  The Parrilla Mixta was great  Please give it a try  The meats were tender and delicioso  The people there were very friendly and attentive  I would return to this place  I recommend it

I m from Argentina  and while the food is certainly not authentic  it is extremely delicious  We go there as often as we can  The Americans friends we ve taken there were very impressed  whereas the Argentinean ones not so much  the meat is too pink  and the food too spicy for Argentinian standards   We love the asado plate  the filet Mignon sandwich  the sauces  the spicy seafood soup  and all of the sides  Their empanadas are not my favorite  they re too dry and the meat is ground too much  I m excited to try their paella  All in all  this is an awesome restaurant with amazing and fresh food

Just ate a lomo sandwich spirited to Philadelphia courtesy of a tried  true  and tested partner  The sauces arrived as well  Let s just say that I am in bliss  my chubby cheeks still evoking my recent flight to the far off heavens

What an amazing restaurant  A few friends   I decided to stop here after walking around in the strip  I ordered the steak burger with avocado   bacon  The staff was so nice   can educate you on the food you re ordering  My friends   I sat outside on their patio   beautiful day outside  The burger I got was amazing  I will rave about it forever  It was juicy  wood fire grilled   I watched the cook cut the avocado that went on my burger  Everything was so fresh    million stars for this place    I only wish it was bigger

I went here for my birthday and had the Bodega experience hosted by Alberto  Omg doesn t even cut the amazing reaction we had to the amount of food  the service  and the taste  So much delicious bread and meat  and don t even get me started on the bread pudding     LIFE CHANGING  If you like a fun family style atmosphere with smokey meat and delightful sides  then this is the place for you

Get the Parilloda Mixta   heaven on earth and you get to try a wide variety of meats   This place is BYO which I love   Hands down the best steak in Pittsburgh   I have yet to find higher quality elsewhere and the service is great every time   Be prepared to order at he counter   Chalkboard kind of deal and then they bring the food to you at your seat   Incredible experience   Wow
Great food  Very casual with a friendly staff  The roasted vegetables were amazing  I will definitely be back

Oh Gaucho  how I love thee   I ve been to Gaucho a few times now  but most recently to celebrate my dad s birthday following all of the renovations   For the building space they acquired  the amount of seating inside is surprisingly sparse   But who cares how close to other people you are when everyone is shoving their mouths full of wonderful  beautiful  perfectly cooked beef   We went with my parents  friends and ended up ordering TWO carne platters and essentially every side on the menu  as well as some grilled shrimp   It s hard to pick a favorite out of everything  but I think that of the beef cuts  the ribeye was the winner  and the sides  the spicy corn pulled ahead as the most unique   That said  there wasn t a single bite that wasn t spectacular   They recently applied for a liquor license  which is at once exciting and disappointing   I do love the fact that they are BYO without a corkage fee  but can imagine that they will come up with some uniquely Argentine cocktails to accompany the fare   I wonder where  exactly  the bar will be going

Fabulous  Loved the iced yerba mate tea  sirloin  potatoes and empanadas  The sauce Station was wow  Left with some alfajores to go  Great service and amazing food  Wish I lived in Pittsburgh  If I ever visit I ll definitely be coming back

This is probably my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  Wood fired grill and delicious meats  What else could you ask for  Oh  maybe the most tasty sauces you ve ever tried  Yep they have those  Or maybe you aren t a carnivore and you are looking for something more herbivore ish  Well they have a full veggie menu    What about desserts   You say   Each time I ve been there they have been featuring a cleverly named dessert that was absolutely scrumptious   My go to is the Rosemary braised beef sandwich  I was overwhelmed with emotion the first time I had it  it s unbelievable  Everything there is  I wish I could give it a higher rating  Go there  Please go now  What are you waiting for

Long wait line  too much talk At the registry that affect the wait line  Food was okay and the utincils were not clean  waitress was too rude when I showed her grease on the plates  forks and knives  she acted as giving me a lesson on how to clean them by wiping it with napkins

Amazing place   As Mr Trump would say GREAT   HUGE    THE BEST     We had the Asado platter and the Mixta plate  The meat was cooked perfectly with a great fire BBQ taste   The sauces were delicious and very light   a great compliment to the perfectly cooked meats   Come hungry as the plates were HUGE

Definitely one of the better restaurants I ve tried in Pittsburgh  My ribeye was deliciously flavorful and cooked to the correct temperature  It was melt in your mouth delicious  The chimis were awesome  Can t wait to come back and try more of their other offerings

I had to check this place called Gaucho out and I did read a ton of reviews on here  I also had a friend who kept telling me to try it  So  you all did a great job     Let me give some kudos to the staff  They could see it was my  maiden voyage  in the shop and they were helpful and informative   I went with the Carne Steak sandwich with NY strip in it  They add fried onions  red bell pepper and a special steak sauce  It was delish  I added a side of potatoes and loaded up on some sauces    I can t wait to go back and try another dish

Oh man  I finally got around to trying this place  It s been on my list for years  Through many boyfriends and bad dates  I ve been  meaning to try that Gaucho place    Well finally    I did  Awesome sauce  awesome sauces   We got the meat selection  we got the meat sweats  we died of happiness  It smelled so good  the whole drive home I envisioned myself lunging forward and tearing into the brown paper bag to get to the meat like an animal   When it touched my lips  I knew love  I knew this was what my mouth had been longing for all those years    Bad kissers  Bad sex  Bad food  Bad alcohol  Bad cigarettes   Forgot them all  I tasted this meat and I will never again be the woman I once was

Delicious  I ordered the braised Rosemary beef sandwich  The meat was flavored perfectly with lots of Rosemary  I was lucky and there wasn t a line  But I ve heard there are long lines  It s worth it   Also it is byob  I can t wait to go back and try other items on the menu  They make there own sauces too

Bottom line  if you visit Pittsburgh you have got to stop at this place   This might be one of the best restaurants I ve been to in years  Waited in line for    minutes outside and an additional    minutes inside  the food was slow to come out  All of this usually would result in two to three stars  But the food was amazing and well worth the wait  I had the pork it was out of this world I ordered the small portion and it was more than enough I left full  The flank steak was also very good  as were the beef and pork empanadas  They also give you side of toast with your meal which is great dipped in their sauces

I was walking from the hotel out to Primanti Brothers in the Strip District when I noticed this little restaurant   Hey  it s new to me   I thought   Let s try it   I d never been to an Argentinian place before but fortunately  the menu lists all the ingredients for each entree  I had Bife de Chorizo  one of the steak platters  I thought it was pretty good and decently seasoned  I also enjoyed the special condiments from the condiments bar

This is the cutest place ever     I went to the Chef s table with my friends and had a seven course meal  reservation only   It was an amazing experience  I can t wait to try the lunch and the Argentinian grill     What can I say the food was made with love  This is why I love small businesses

This place is absolutely AMAZING    The first time that I tried this place we came here for my birthday on a Saturday night around    The line was so long by then  I definitely didn t want to wait but my family insisted in waiting  We waited for about TWO hours before we ordered   paid and sat at a table  You also grab your own plates and utensils  We had ordered the   different types of meat  a couple of empanadas and rice  The meal was not cheap but definitely worth it  I really enjoyed the sauces which you can grab yourself and have as much as you want  After this experience   I came back a couple of times and tried the paella which was delicious  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone  It s a must try

The best part for me is the BYOB policy and its nice location near the David McCullough bridge  The variety of food is great with vegetarian and pescetarian options to choose among  I had a huge fish sandwich which was yummy  The only thing I wish there was more sauce on the sandwich or to go with it  The service is different from other places   you don t get seated until you order

A great spot with delicious wares  imperfect tables and utterly lovely staff  It s BYOB  so pick up wine before you come  if you re so inclined  Even on a Tuesday there was a bit of a wait standing in line  but it was excellent

Very good meats  With such a high rating  we had to try this place  It wasn t very busy  but we did show up half an hour before they closed  The person taking our order did a great job of answering all of our questions  The menu was on a chalk board and there were some things that didn t have an explanation of what they were what was in them  They were out of bread  so there was no bread for sandwiches or to accompany the plates   I ordered the flank steak plate  The meat was seared well to lock in the juices  It was very juicy and tender with a wonderful crispy outside  It could have been fine on its own  but I couldn t pass up the flavors in the sauces they have available as condiments  They made fantastic accents to the meat  Since they didn t have bread to accompany the meal  I got a bowl of saffron rice  I thought it was pretty bland  I traded a piece of flank steak for a piece of NY Strip on my colleague s plate  They NY Strip was just as good if not slightly better
Food was awesome  Seating was very limited  and the ordering process wasn t the most efficient

My favorite sandwich place in pittsburgh  I like both the fish and chicken sandwiches  Fresh   One time I asked for chicken empanadas  but the guy at the counter said he is currently making beef  so I was disappointed  but then in about    minutes he said he popped in a chicken empanada also for me    I was pleased    he is very nice  The meat is perfectly grilled on a wood fired grill

Gaucho has amazing food   a friendly staff  They don t take reservations so sometimes you have to wait in a long line outside of the building  but the food is worth it  Delicious food  plenty of options   anyone could find something that they would enjoy

There s plenty of photos of the Paella   The Paella served this past Saturday is much different from the photos here in on Yelp   No longer has clams  mussels   No longer has chorizo   The Paella we were served has rice  mushroom  peas  onions  tomato  lemon  shrimp   The Paella at Gaucho is a one and done for us     stars for the Paella   Bump up for the rest
I ve been about   times  good sandwich and meats  they can get a little too charred  i don t see why its such a high rating   its not a full service restaurant

This is definitely one of my favorites in Pittsburgh  Get there before  pm to avoid the long lines  The atmosphere is very chilled and the staff friendly  I love that most dishes come with a salad and toasts  Can t go wrong with anything beef

Argentinian meats are soooo good    Great atmosphere and decor  BYOB  great service and cleanliness for the shear volume of people that get food here  It has quickly climbed the ranks of Pittsburgh and established itself as one of the top restaurants in the city  Best part its affordable  they are not fluffing you witch extra cost or lack of food    I have always gotten the sandwiches and the empenadas  My favorite sandwiches     Braised Beef     Carne    Pollo    Fish       Empenadas are all really good     Dont forget to taste the sauces and use the favorite on your food   Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the Burgh  I always bring people here

We went to Gaucho last winter     before the expansion because I remember it being so  oh  so cold  The small waiting dining area was probably about a   X   room  The     stools were against the wall and window  They also had a patio area that was open only in the summer  Anyway  I went back today and they ve expanded  The place so huge  So glad    no more standing around and giving someone the death stare as they are enjoying their deliciousness  My friend and I got the Chuleta Cochina  pork chops   Caldo del Mar  seafood soup   Brussels Sprouts and bread pudding  The pork chops can feed   people    it didn t come with a side so order one  I ordered the brussels sprouts  they were halved and then grilled      maybe   anyway  it was really good  The Caldo del Mar was good  there s a little bit of a broth on the bottom with   pieces of bread and then Mussels Clams and squid sat on top  We had bread pudding    it was good   can t say it s the best I ve ever had but it s solid    We were there at  pm right before the rush at  pm so I would definitely recommend getting there earlier  Parking wasn t bad at the time we got in and there are plenty available on the street    I m definitely a fan

Gaucho is a very interesting place with a cool concept  A big line awaits you when you walk in and it is not the people who are waiting to be seated but they are also placing their orders  You can order your meal and beverages at the check in counter and pay for it too  The waitress will get you and find a seat  Then someone will bring in your food and serve it at your table    Now I liked most of my experience but when you are looking for any service at your table  you would barely get any  Probably because I was there between   and    I don t know  The food was very good  I ordered small plate of camarones  shrimp   veggie empanadas and chicken sandwich  Their sauces are a must try   If not for their poor service at the table and the wait at the front  it is a   Star experience
Everyone was incredibly nice and the food was amazing  The carne sandwich was fantastic  especially with the different chimichurris  I highly recommend it if you re looking for a casual dinner

Wonderful experience  Loved the atmosphere  the service  and of course  the food  We ordered one each of the chicken  beef  and veggie empanadas  a Pollo Sammie  a Bondila  sp   Sammie  and a Rosemary Beef Sammie  We also tried the Provoletta small plate and sampled all four sauces  Everything was delicious  Like  really  really good  Suggestion   try to go between lunch and dinner to avoid the wait  We went at   and didn t have to wait at all  The only disappointing aspect of Gaucho Parilla is that there is not a location in my hometown of Charleston  SC

Ridiculously delicious steak sandwich   Flank steak with chimichurri is the way to go   Only downside is the big line and somewhat limited seating   But you can call ahead for takeout and skip the line

We really enjoyed our meal here  The brisket sandwich and the coleslaw were amazing  The lamb chops were also good but not as standout as the sandwich  I found the potatoes to be somewhat dry  This is a fun  casual  BYOB venue with outdoor seating  with a fireplace  and good food
This place rocks the Steakburger  The beef tastes like the delicious beef of my youth  This reminds us of the steakhouses of B A  Argentina   You must order the Papas al Homo

We went to Pittsburgh to visit our daughter and her husband  They took us to Gaucho s for lunch  Although meat is their specialty  I was more in the mood for a salad  I had a roasted veggie salad which was excellent  If you re having the salad for a meal  make sure you get a large  There wasn t much seating so go when it won t be crowded or get your meal to go  Everyone else got pork  beef or shrimp  My hubby got a pork sandwich  I had a bite and it was really good too  This place is really popular and is expanding soon  The ppl who owned the place and who worked there seemed like they were very happy to be there  That always makes for a good dining experience

Cant say enough about this gem in the strip  If you want a great sandwich that is done correctly go to Gaucho Parrilla Argentina  Everything is done over the smoky fire pit they use in the kitchen  The owner a young gentlemen who works the customers in the front of the house is extremely knowledgeable and is a complete pleasure to talk to  I came into this amazing place on sat morning before they opened and hung out and talk to employees for a second and got a good feeling about the place  I took the advice of one of the cooks and got the Flank Sandwich with roasted peppers on a chibata  roll and was AMAZING  The thin stacked meat was cooked perfectly and just feel apart when biting into it  The meat was smoky but not overly smoky and could sill taste the Beef  The sauce they put on it was out of this world  Over All I give it   thumbs up  I cant wait to go back  Matter of fact may be going back today

Unbelievably good  I had the flank steak and roasted vegetables  The steak was thinly sliced  pink in the center and a great  salty  smokey bark and delicious sauces  The veggies were charred beautifully and drizzled with balsamic vinegar  Caramelized onions  asparagus  tomatoes and zucchini  We went at      on a Tuesday and there was no wait  Staff was super friendly and helpful  We ate out on a nice patio lined with plants and firewood  I m from out of town but I will definitely make a point of returning

We went last night   Tuesday at      we were told that the line is always long so expect to wait   Much to our surprise when we walked in and there were only   people ahead   For first timers the menu board is very confusing so if it is your first time look at the menu on line   We had a very friendly couple ahead who helped us out   The menu is broken into small and larger portion which helps   Sandwiches  steaks  chicken  seafood  veggies  starch  I chose the steak sandwich   You pick your choice of steak   I had filet  Mine was perfect   Another party member had the burger and he said that the burger was awesome  and another a steak and salad on plate  no bun     I would have given it a   but the steak had to go back because it was a medium and came back well   Otherwise    It was great   It s BYOB
Delicious   One of our favorite places to eat   It definitely deserves the high ratings it receives

Don t come here in a hurry  because it is not uncommon for there to be a line around the block waiting to order at this counter service restaurant   It is worth the wait   The steak and homemade sauces  try them all   are the must try items  but salad to shrimp to bread to side vegetables   everything else I ve tried here has been great as well  I just wish they served wine   You are allowed to bring your own alcoholic beverages if you wish to though

At Burgh  this is quite a great establishment  as both the meat and the decor are good  However  the long waiting line is partially due to the popularity  which I understand  but also due to an inefficient order system  If they can seat people  it will be much quicker    anyway  none of my business  Beef is above average though not outstanding  but lamb is recommended
Great food and service  Menu written on the wall looks busy and can be a bit confusing at first  Great variety of sauces  Will definitely return and would recommend

No seating  Honestly I didn t even eat here because the staff was rude  Since their front door doesn t automatically close they asked us to close it politely  then muttered loud enough for me to hear  this isn t a barn   I will not be returning if this is how their staff treats its customers
This is my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh   The food is good and flavorful and the staff is friendly   We take all our friends and family here when they come to visit

If you line up and start to think the wait outside is not going to be worth it  let me tell you  it definitely is   Cooked to order just the way you want it  great food even greater  Sauces    You will understand why you have to wait  Great service  great staff  just all around great place to dine
Amazing a bit of a wait but so totally worth it  Done forget to bring your own alcohol

Carnivore paradise   Surprised that this place doesn t open more locations or other tried to copy the formula    line up  order and pay for your food at the counter  grab your little placard  fetch your utensils and sauces   and wait for a big plate of meat to be dropped off at your table   The place is BYOB as well   Outside of the sauces  they are good   I don t really know what makes this place Argentinian    it could have just as easily be an American grill   And I hear the lineups get pretty insane  but when we came when there was basically no line   I got the Parrillada Mixta  NY strip  pulled chicken and chorizo  for     for a sampling   On the menu  it says it s enough for      but I m a glutton   No complaints  just a good plate of meat and all the various sauces kept it interesting as I went to work   The service is EXCELLENT despite the order at the counter approach   The servers kept coming back to top off our water and checking in   There is a lot of hype attached to this place    but I think it s good in the fact that it simply doesn t fuck anything up and does it in a very self serve casual style   You re probably not going to get the  best  anything here   and you should expect it for the pricepoint   But this is definitely a place I would frequent if I lived in Pittsburgh
First time there  Will be back as the chorizo small plate was delicious  the Caramones were on point and the sauces I used on everything   There is a wait but definitely worth it PLUS it is a BYOB

The food is excellent as other reviewers have mentioned  but the experience isn t worth it for me  I ve tried them twice and I wasn t satisfied with either visit  but my first experience was truly unique   We went right before close on our first visit  so we weren t surprised that we had to wait in line  But I was surprised when they gave me a sign to hold and asked me to turn away any further customers in return for a free bread pudding  We had a few kids in our group and I didn t want to be argumentative  so I agreed to do it   Most people left after an awkward interaction  but there was a group of douchebags who were too privileged for the rules to apply to them  I m not gonna argue with douchebags for bread pudding  so I let the restaurant deal with them  Unfortunately  the restaurant let them stay  and we had to spend the rest of our time in line hearing them use profanity around our kids  It got even more awkward when more people showed up  and the restaurant let them stay too  I recommend just buying the bread pudding and saving yourself the hassle   I went back today for a takeout order  and luckily was not tasked with anything other than waiting  The wait wasn t unreasonably long  but I could see what looked like my food sitting under the heat lamps as the employees in the kitchen appeared confused  moving items from one bag to another  looking at the receipts  then switching bags again  Finally  one employee who looked like he was doing everything came over and repackaged my order  which was indeed the food that had been sitting under the heat lamps   On a positive note  the employees we spoke to were very nice  Also  that one employee was very good

I come to Pittsburgh annually for the Replay FX tournament at the convention center  I look forward to the tournament all year  but honestly  I look forward to walking over to Gaucho s every single lunch almost as much  The sandwiches are incredible  with bafflingly high quality meats  terrific sauces and great veggies  Friendly service too   Expect a line  but it s totally worth the wait  Honestly  one of my favorite restaurants on the entire planet
I m going to save the details this place is downright amazing  Probably my favorite place  Such a great value  Must try

Holly mother of Cool    I can say that this was one of the best steaks      Top    I have had   If you in Pittsburgh  head to the strip and eat some great food    OK that was the good     The bad    Well seating IS limited   And service is   Well not much once your seated   It is a laid back Seattle grunge vibe  Its a trendy   s something place  But it is well worth the time   Cost    It s cheep especially for what and how well the food is

What a wonderful find  This has fast become one of our favorite spots in the Strip  The food is amazing  especially the braised beef sandwich and grilled veggies  Long lines to get in but always worth it  So happy you guys expanded the space

Best sandwich in the city  I know we pittsburghers typically go after something with fries and slaw on it  but this is one sandwich that doesn t leave me reaching for fillers  Everything you need is in the delicious meats  Not a meat eater   Why   Try the veggie plate  Seasoned to perfection and happily drowned in an amazing sauce  Can t say enough good things about Gaucho

As Michael L  noted  it is quite uncommon for a restaurant with     reviews to have a   star rating  after my recent visit I understand why Gaucho Parilla is in this rarefied air  There s not much I can add that hasn t already been said by other reviewers  so I ll just say that their steak sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I ve had in my long and illustrious sandwich eating career  How such a small  ordinary kitchen produces such extraordinary food is beyond me  Just writing this review is making me hungry  so I ll end it now before I get drool all over my nice work shirt

What can be said that hasn t been said already   Great staff  great owner  and excellent food   Try to time your visit outside of the peak hours if you don t want to be in the crowds   Can t wait for the weather to warm up so I can sit outside    I walk all the way from downtown to the strip for lunch even in the winter for the sandwiches and now I have the office hooked   Bring a bottle wine or a six pack and enjoy
I can t add anything other reviewers haven t already covered   These folks know how to make an amazing sandwich  and it doesn t cost a million dollars   Hopefully you aren t a vegetarian

Food is great  Waiting too much for my order  Almost    minutes to order and another    minutes to receive it  I really do not recommend this place if you hungry    Because the I was alone the waitress asked me to move to a smaller table  that s fine  I got all my stuff and went upstairs and oops the other table was taken by other people  She was polite and apologized  I think they need more personals to fasten things
Great food and nice ambiance  Customer service is amazing

Everyone I talked to said this was the the best place for a carnivore in Pittsburgh  If anything  they undersold  Went there before the expansion  so had to stand in line outside in the rain  but was worth it  The staff came out and handed out umbrellas  Who does that  I m glad the line was so long  because it took me awhile to narrow down the choices  Will definitely go back
Loved this restaurant  Casual atmosphere with high end food  So unique  Great experience
Oh yes  Real grilled meat   Skirt Steak is my favorite   Delicious   Pricy thou
Food has ALWAYS been on point  I just wish the space was bigger  So much love for the meats but the crazy lines      are a bit of a deterrent

That chalkboard I tell ya   Ha jk     The meats      AMAZING   Seriously  if you haven t been here yet   You re missing out    I was a block away and the savory aroma was sending signals to my brain directing my path    Come eat meat    Hahaha  If you don t know what to get I suggest trying the Asado Plate  It comes with   different cuts of meat  It s kind of pricey but worth every penny  Split it with a friend   There are   different kinds of sauces  My personal favorite is the Chimichurri  a green sauce used for grilled meat  It s fantastic   And don t leave without getting some Alfajores  It s dulce de leche sandwiched between two cookies  It s like the the French macaron of Argentina

Gaucho is an amazing Argentina restaurant  If you want good steak this is where you should go  They also have amazing empanadas  They re different everyday and I ve yet to have one that isn t amazing  Try them with all of gaucho s different sauces

If you re a meat lover and you happen to be in Pittsburgh even for one day you have to try this place  Everything is grilled to perfection on a wood fired grille  Staff are friendly and nice  Prices are very reasonable  I ll give   out of   stars for sure
Anything you order at Gaucho is delicious  I have tried different things here and was never disappointing  Seriously  everything is great  I cant even pick one dish over another

This place was awesome  It has a bohemian feel and great customer service  I got the mixta plate which has pork chicken and beef  The sides are extra  Really great presentation and everything tastes so good

Came here because of the Yelp hype   and yeah  they lived up to it   Got garlic chorizo  chicken  and carne  filet option  sandwiches  and they were sublime   Rich  bold flavors that complemented each other and accented the meat well    Its a small place at the end of the strip  without much seating   I would recommend calling ahead and ordering for carryout

If you haven t been here  you need to make this restaurant a priority  Just walk in and get the smells and you ll know what I mean  I don t even know what else to add  I don t even want to get too wordy with a flowery description  Gaucho doesn t need it  They re just amazing  Why are you still reading this   GO NOW
Had the Rosemary beef and the shredded pork sandwich  They were both so good  The bread is fresh and crispy  The meat was juicy and so tender

This place is great with bonus points for being kid friendly  Order first  pay  and then sit down  Tried the empanadas  some meat  roasted roots  and a piece of bread with cheese on top  All of it was great and flavorful  I especially liked the self serve sauce options  with the garlic and onion ones being my favorite

I ve been here three times   each time lured back by glowing Yelp reviews and the line snaking around the block   Each time I couldn t figure out what I was missing   Was it the food   The ambiance   The service   Twice I even brought friends   Maybe they could shine a light on what I was missing   But they weren t impressed either   The menu is on a vast  confusing chalkboard that carelessly  and unhelpfully  mingles Spanish and English   The first time I ate here I was looking for the ribeye platter   I couldn t find it on the board  lost  amid the sandwiches and appetizers  so I ordered a sandwich     You order at the counter   Since no one seems able to decipher the menu  each customer peppers the cashier with a hundred questions  This makes the ordering process very  very slow and is probably responsible for the line around the block     The first time I asked for iced tea  All they had was bottled  so I passed   I thought maybe I d get another drink  but I couldn t see them on the menu  so I didn t know what my choices were   Water it was   I never did find out if they have anything other than water and bottled ice tea   Once you order your food  they bring it to your table by calling out your name  One time I saw three  Bobs  jump up at the same time to claim their order   Seating is plentiful   most people are still waiting to order   A condiment bar provides four different Argentinian sauces  a chimichurri sauce  a pimento sauce  an onion sauce  and a garlic sauce   The onion is the best  And you better like at least one  because you re going to need it for the dry  tasteless meats   The first time it was the ribeye sandwich   The bread was burnt and hard as an English biscuit  The ribeye was not tender  not flavorful  and was easily overwhelmed by the pound and a half of roasted peppers laid on top of the sandwich     The second time I tried the ribeye platter   I ordered medium   The meat came sliced  without a trace of pink   I call that  well done   The meat was much the same as the first time   tough  dry and flavorless  It compares to a sirloin from Outback   No wonder folk rave about the sauces  you need them to make the meat palatable     The third time the meat was just as bad as the others   Granted  at this price point I wouldn t expect Prime beef   But if you re going to use Choice or Select  you should probably spend some time tenderizing it   If skirt steak can be made tender  so can a ribeye   Shoeleather sucks

One of the truly authentic great restaurants in Pittsburgh  The food is delicious and the staff is courteous and engaging   The desserts are delicious too   Is it any wonder why this place is packed and so popular

I ve been wanting to try Gaucho for a long time   I ve heard so many good things  and it completely exceeded my expectations   The menu is extensive  there were many options to choose from   I went with the Parrillada Mixta so I could sample as much as possible  it includes NY strip  chorizo  and chicken with sauces and toast   Due to a minor mix up we also ended up with the Camerones  shrimp    Everything was delicious   The food was amazing  I m kind of mad at myself for waiting so long to try it out    We arrived around  pm on a Friday and had a small wait to order food  and ended up sitting at the counter to eat because there were no open tables   There were only two of us so this worked out well   The service was great   We didn t have to wait long for the food after we ordered and the servers were attentive but not intrusive   The line was growing out the door by the time we left  so I would recommend arriving as early as possible   Otherwise  you can expect a long wait  especially with larger groups    All in all it was a great experience  I can t wait to go back and try more of the menu

Drive by this place twice a day and before going in I would always make fun of the people standing in line  After stopping in in the late afternoon I will undoubtedly be one of those people that I used to make fun of  Everything about the meal that we had was phenomenal  Great atmosphere to match  Definitely returning as much as possible

One of my fave places in PGH  I always recommend this whenever friends or coworkers ask about casual but quality food places to check out  The steaks here are REALLY GOOD  Make sure you get all the sauces they have  and take some home too        full of lots of flavor  Gaucho gets packed superrrrr quickly   so either come here with a very small group  or by yourself  lol  or come at weird times  unless you re okay with waiting in line for almost an hour  I ve seen lines wrap around this place in the dead of winter so   you know its good  There s a decent amount of seating in the back  it s an order and sit down place   but they will bring our your food for you and help clean up   but be sure to have a back up plan in case it s crazy in there  Empanadas are alright  but what I come here for  is the steak   sauces and the roasted veggies  Go go go
Amazing      the CARNE anything is the best  I d rather eat their steak over     downtown restaurant steaks any day of the week

You order at the counter and pay first  but the restaurant is nicer than that sounds  This place a cool vibe and good service   but the food is why this place has a line out the door    The empanadas are not the traditional ones I m used to   I ve been to Argentina several times  but they are good  We liked the pork one the best  The rosemary and garlic red skin potatoes were awesome   Much more flavor than normal boring potatoes  The steak was  really good  and the bread was crispy and spot on  The sauces were tasty and plentiful too    I highly recommend this restaurant when in Pittsburgh

There s a good justifiable reason this place is Yelp rated  I have more than enjoyed every single thing I have gotten here    My review is a bit late but here goes   When you walk in it may be overwhelming at first to understand but there is always an employee there to explain  You stand in line  while looking at a huge chalkboard menu and then order at the front register area  This is also where you ll get your wine uncorked if you re participating in the BYOB  which is FREE        Seating is all self service  and during lunch and weekends it gets pretty busy    So far I ve gotten the below  Grilled vegetables some of the most amazing veggies ever  Rosemary braised beef sandwich  probably a   star sandwich but still absolutely excellent  Corn on the cob  always good  Flank steak and ribeye  both half portions and plenty for one person with the salad and bread   ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE  I got them cooked medium and they were perfect every time    Definitely check this place out and in the summer they have outside patio seating as well

Gaucho Parilla Argentina is a hidden gem in the Strip District  We grabbed lunch here before visiting the Heinz History Center and loved our meal  This is a foodie place at VERY reasonable prices  We had the    empanadas  beef  chicken and veggies  and they were delicious  They were traditional Argentinian empanadas with very flavorful filling and nice crust  Our favorite were the beef which had a little bit of spice  For dessert we tried the chocolate chip almond cookie  and it was an elevated gourmet cookie    Great service  delicious food  and VERY reasonable prices
