Delicious  Neat little place   service with a twist  The menu is so big and on a huge chalkboard   plan ahead so you re not overwhelmed  We had the braised Rosemary roast beef sandwich and the fish of the day  The sandwich was amaze balls  The sauces  red pepper and onion  were great too  We will be back very soon to try more items  No issue with the line or seating

The food is      worth the wait   Great atmosphere and food  Obviously it would be nice if the space was a bit bigger  so the line is shorter  but I also think it adds to the uniqueness and small business feel  I ordered the carne asada and it was absolutely wonderful  Very tender  Love the fact that it s BYOB too  Would highly recommend
Food is good and I appreciate that they don t have a cork fee The food is pretty heavy and the sauces are oily so I always have a kinda upset stomach the day after

My parents got steaks  I got the El Guacho salad  I like salads but this salad was really bad  it was just lettuce and oil and barely anything else  I didn t really want to eat it but it kind of seemed like a move it along place so I didn t want to take it back  My parents steaks were really good although they where on teeny tiny plates  I know everything else there is probably better than the salad I got but I m not really dying to go back

Reviews do this place justice  I ha e gone there     timesand I still have only ordered one thing off the menu  The carne  Basically the best tasting sandwhich I have ever had  Guys that work there are very nice  they explain the food the sauces etc    Everyone I have ever gone with has loved it  If you haven t gone you should  Check the schedule because it s not open all the time
Just love it I have been   years ago and come back last night Food is phenomenal The best steak place in the city

The wait was long  but it was soooooo worth it    I got the Lamb Shank with roasted vegetables and grits  This dish was phenomenal   The lamb was cooked perfectly falling off the bone  The vegetables were soft and yummy  and the grits were just perfect  They were perfectly seasoned and didn t have too much butter    Overall  it was honestly one of the best I ve ever had    I also got the spicy chorizo small plate  which came with toast and caramelized grilled onions and red peppers  It was so flavorful and had enough spice  Just get a good bite of bread with the chorizo and red peppers and you re good to go    I absolutely loved all of the chimichuri sauces  All   are flavorful and compliments the foods we got  I really liked the green one and the red one    If I need to come back to Pittsburgh again  I will definitely be coming back to try some of their other menu items

Went here for dinner   A little skeptical due to the line   It took a while to get in  But the menu looked good   Once we got in it was quick   The lamb was amazing   The staff was great   The flank steak was very good   The staff was very knowledge   Awesome

This place deserves all of the hype   I have been here three times and I am still enchanted   Both their pork and their chicken are unbelievable   They even make the toast noteworthy   Be prepared to stand in line  as you won t order until they have a table ready for you   You can expect at least a    minute wait if you line up outside   They are BYOB  and sometimes they even hand out glasses and openers before you get to your table   Yum

Where has this place been all my life  This was my first visit  If you like good steak  come here   If you like good food  come here  Their menu is written on this huge chalkboard on the wall when you walk in   My eyes gravitated towards their   steak cuts  flank  sirloin  skirt  ribeye  NY strip   so I can t comment on the other menu choices  yet         So once me and my dinner date got to the register  we ended up getting the Asado platter       which contains all   cuts of heaven   I mean steak  They say that s roughly   oz of steak   It also comes with three pieces of toast and chimichurri already on top     Service was so fast   And I was so fortunate to have come when there was no line  we got there around     ish on a Tuesday   We were seated very promptly  and served our food in a reasonable time too  I forgot to say that the ambiance isn t so quiet  so it s hard to have a good conversation in my opinion   The only thing I wish is that it had salad on the side like the individualized steak platters have   I needed some greens after downing more than   oz of steak   oh and UGHHH the sauces  Sososo yummy  just get all   and try them for yourselves   I wanted to cry after eating my first piece  Ahhh    just thinking about it now I want to go back   On the platter  they usually seem to organize the cuts in a certain order of sirloin  NY  skirt  ribeye  and flank   In my opinion  the most expensive cut  the skirt  was my least favorite  My most favorite has to be the sirloin or flank  as they were the most tender   Gaucho lives up to the hype   Stop reading my review and just go eat there already
If you need to celebrate with a meat parade  they have the best prepared meats   Get all of the meats and share with a big group

Definitely amazing  A little on the greasy size  but you have to expect that with meals largely made of meat  The grilled vegetales and entrag a were INCREDIBLE  Seriously  best skirt steak I ve ever had  The owner is really cool and does the rounds of the  tiny  restaurant  They re expanding into the space next door eventually  Also  it s BYOB so don t forget to bring your booze

Five stars  you decide  I just paid     for a side salad a sandwich and a small bottle of water  Keep in mind      There is  no tableside service  you go to the counter and order  get your own silverware  your own napkins  your own hot sauce      When you re done you get to clean up after yourself       The menu board is confusing  A majority of it is written in Spanish  Anytime you need to move around to order  get your food or utensils  you have to navigate  your way around customers who are huddled in front of the board with confused looks on their faces  I guess they don t speak Spanish either  And why should they  this is America   I caught them on opening night after their  big  remodel  Somehow it was easier to put up with these things when the place was just a little hole in the wall  At least it had character then  Now it s just un personal and way overpriced  While they may come up with some thought provoking combinations of ingredients  the food is just not that great  Cut the prices by     and I would give this place four stars  As it is  I ll give them a two

This is definitely one of the top restaurants in Pittsburgh   Expect at least a       minute wait if you re going during prime hours   I would recommend any of the sandwiches or the steak platters   I got the paradilla mixta  which includes steak  chicken  and sausage   I didn t really care for the chicken and sausage  the steak was the main piece   If I had to order again  I d definitely go for a steak platter   I also got an empanada and it was really good   They have   different sauces to try from and my group agreed that the red one was the best

If I could eat here everyday I would  I studies abroad in Argentina and this place is as close you can get to argentine food without actually being there  Their empanadas are the best  It s great that s it s byob and you can take your favorite argentine wine to pair with the food  My only complaint is their is always a line so be prepared to wait a bit to order  You can open your wine and enjoy while you are waiting though
Just super  We were visiting Pittsburgh for the weekend and tried this place the first night  The steak was so amazing we went back the next day for lunch  All   cuts are well worth the money

Our absolute favorite place to eat in Pittsburgh  Always worth the long wait in line  Some of the best chimichurri you ll ever have  do yourself a favor and get some extra toast just to dip in the sauces  I recommend the Asado Platter  good to split between   people when you order lots of sides  The empanadas are also great  but they do sometimes run out before the end of the night  so try to get there before then          highly recommend  Great food at a reasonable price considering the quality   quantity  Be sure to bring your own wine or beer

A solid     star  I got here at   am on Saturday just when it opened to avoid the wait  I made the right decision because when I got out of here at      am  there were people waiting out the door  Anyways  I ordered the Carne sammich with sirloin meat medium rare  which also contained the chimmi sauce  caramelized onion  and roasted peppers  The meat was really tender and juicy  and it was just the right amount of  medium rare   I could really appreciate the wood fired grill taste in the meat  Also  the roasted peppers were definitely a plus because they made the sammich that much more flavorful  The sammich was a   star  Now  the Gaucho Slaw was mediocre at best  It lacked somewhat of a flavor  and it wasn t the best slaw I ve had at a place like this  To conclude  if there s one thing I m jealous of Pittsburgh  it will be the fact that they have Gaucho Parrilla in their town

Got the steak sampler  It was amazing   This place gets crazy busy and it s pretty evident why once you ve had their food   The employees are funny and always cracking jokes to make the wait seem a little less long    They also have some great sauces to put on the steaks

Omg     I am so glad we waited in the line to get into this place   We showed up a little after   o clock on a Saturday and the line was out the door  we briefly considered going somewhere else but sucked it up and waited   You order and pay at the counter then they take you to your seat and a porter brings your food   There are not a lot of vegetarian mains on the menu  just a veggie sandwich  but tons of veggie sides   So i did what any insane person would do and ordered all the veggie sides and a side of toast   They were all amazing   Potatoes are always great  carrots with honey and goat cheese   amazing  mushrooms   fantastic   Will definitely go back and gladly wait in line again

Absolutely love Gaucho  Got the steak sandwich with a side of the empanadas  I d been wanting to try their empanadas for awhile but towards the end of the week they sometimes run out  But not this time  Unfortunately I found the empanadas a bit on the salty side  so I m not sure I d get them again  However  the steak sandwich was fabulous  The bread was wonderfully crunchy and the meat was done perfectly  I m already looking forward to my next visit

Anyone who ever comes to Pittsburgh MUST eat here  It s absolutely amazing  I always get the some sort of steak and it s always made just right and with lots of flavor  I ve also tried the Caldo Del Mar which was great as well but a smaller portion  And the shrimp was good but not sure it worth the price for only a few pieces  The lamb was also made really well and tasted amazing  For dessert we usually got whatever the special was which turns out well every time  Oh and best for last  the chicken wing appetizer was incredible  I don t think I ve had better grilled wings before  You have to get them

My biggest question is why they bought such a small space for this restaurant     This place is packed with people and super popular and for good reason    We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and the rain held off long enough for us to get our sandwiches and sit outside to eat   Thank goodness   They only have about   seats inside and a small area outside the restaurant to eat   The menu is up on the wall  and I wish we had tried some of the small appetizers  bc they looked awesome   The grilled corn on the cob looked amazing and I was having big time food envy   But  we only ordered sandwiches  which were more than enough for lunch   This place is known for their meats  so I am here to let the veggie heads know they can also enjoy a sandwich here as well   The veggie sandwich is huge  with lots of great slices of different grilled veggies  They also have all the salsas out on the counter so you can try them all    Which I did    My husband got one of the steak sandwiches and was silent for about   minutes while he inhaled it     which means it was awesome    My advice is to call ahead with your order and pick it up to go   That is what we will be doing the next time we go  which will be sooner than later   It is great  but the seating is a pain

First thing s first  Gaucho has some of the best food in Pittsburgh  It s ridiculously delicious  which makes it really hard to write a poor review   Let s talk about their line system  They don t let you make reservations or write your name on a list  You have to stand in a line waiting  not to order  but for a table  I get it  It s their thing  their gimmick  it makes them seem exclusive and peaks people s curiosity  A few months ago I waited in that line for about an hour  and the quality of their food was worth the wait    HOWEVER  when it is a     degree August day  the line borders on inhumane  They have no Disney World esque signs to give you an indication of how long the line will be  which keeps people waiting because they think it can t  possibly  be that long  We stood in the baking sun for an hour and a half before even getting into the building  then waited for an extra half hour inside the restaurant  I watched people in line get serious sunburns as we waited  I watched a woman with a handicap struggle to literally stand up as she waited  which really made the whole thing feel borderline ableist  A worker came out with a tray of about ten waters  so at least ten people out of god knows how many were able to hydrate  They have signs that say that you can t hold people s places in line  so there are really no good options  The whole thing was a nightmare this time  and seemed like a lawsuit waiting to happen  I don t care how good their food is  no food is worth that   Also  I am the most easy going restaurant patron in the world  and would NEVER dream of complaining online when my order gets messed up  But when you wait in the baking sun for an hour and a half and they forget to put in your dessert order  then get it wrong when it finally comes out a half hour later while you watch the staff goof around  it really feels like an extra kick in the shins  I loved Gaucho but I can t imagine ever coming back  or ever suggesting it to anyone  until they figure out a more humane  kind  and handicap friendly ordering system

We are from Arizona  and can see why this place is so popular  It has a hip atmosphere  the people are very friendly  and the food was excellent  We enjoyed the sides of rice and corn  to go with our fish chicken and steak  We would come back if we lived in the Pittsburgh area

Although the wait was about an hour or so  we really enjoyed our lunch at Gaucho  The lamp chops were fantastic  and the sauces were delicious  The chicken was a bit dry  but the fish and other meats  as well as the salad  were very flavorful  The silverware  plates  and sauces are all self serve  and another customer accidentally spilled a large cup of sauce all over my white shoes     Thankfully  a waiter very graciously tried to clean it off with a washcloth and some solution  So kind  Loved the staff  Would definitely come back to try some other dishes
We had the empanadas and carne sandwich  The sauces are incredible  Killer atmosphere   very clean

Absolutely love this place   I ve been going for a year or so now  and every time the food is fantastic   The steak sandwiches are their main gig  but I highly recommend the braised beef sandwich as well   The sides are delicious and the outdoor seating is perfect   Great job  guys
This place is awesome   And they have surprisingly good fish sandwiches for your enjoyment over Lent

Heard about this place from other yelpers and a couple of colleagues  So  I finally decided to give it a try in the new year  We went on a weekday around   PM and were seated immediately  We had to place the order before we were seated  I think they expanded the place since it can definitely accommodate more than   people now  This is my first time trying Argentinian cuisine and I greatly appreciate the help their staff provided while we were ordering  They were patient and answered all my questions and infact made some good suggestions too   So we ordered shrimp cooked on cast iron and vegetable empanadas  The shrimp is coated with lemon butter sauce and it is tasty as is and the taste enhanced further when we ate it with the garlic sauce  It is cooked and seasoned perfectly  I could not try their shrimp over rice since it is for a large group but I am glad they had this shrimp on their menu which is a decent replacement for shrimp over rice   The vegetable empandas are herb flavored and have a unique taste  The filling was seasoned perfectly and the dough is cooked well  these tasted great with the roasted pepper sauce   They also have pomegranate orange drink that goes well with the two items that we ordered   Overall  it is a great place  Though it is expensive for the quantity  I will go back again for the flavors

After reading all the amazing reviews  I had to try it  The line was out the door  Everyone seemed to be talking about how good the food is while waiting  Total about    minutes wait  The staff were all so pleasant  I wouldn t have guessed they were busy if I couldn t see it for myself  The space is small  but we had no trouble finding a table  There s an outdoor space as well  The windows make the atmosphere so light and airy    We ordered the vegetable plate to split  Yum  Chicken and beef Empanadas were alright    i preferred the beef  The real star was the pork sandwich house special  Lucky for hubby  he ordered it  It was tender and favorful  I really liked it  I had the Carne flank cooked medium rare  Both sandwiches had so much meat  The sauces and spices added flavor  not super spicy like I thought  See pictures for more info

I thought this was a sit down restaurant and so asked   other couples to meet us there  Luckily we got there early enough to secure an outside table for     The staff there were SUPER helpful and friendly   We had   hardcore vegetarians in the group and we had plenty for us  The carnivores could not talk enough about how amazing the meat was  Super affordable   LOVE THIS PLACE   The portions are great  Its BYOB   which we loved   We ordered the porkchops steak  shrimp  and everything was amazing

Simply delicious  These dudes would make Gordon Ramsay proud and Pittsburgh should feel the same  Although I m an experimental vegetarian  and felt quite tempted by the amazing smell of grilled meat  I have been completely       satisfied on both occasions

My husband and I  in town just for a day and taking our college student son out to dinner  attempted here on a Wednesday only to find the wait too long   My son had an early start the next morning   The next day my husband and I headed there for lunch intrigued now to see what all the fuss was about   There was still a bit of a line but the staff was very conscientious to make each customer as comfortable as quickly as possible    We re glad we had the opportunity to try the delicious food and the flavors lingered with us on our journey home

Gaucho Parrilla Argentina would make an excellent ambassador for Pittsburgh s food scene to any transplants or tourists arriving in the city   It s simultaneously  a  one of the best sandwich makers in the city that stands out from the crowd and  b  a restaurant that fits right in with the growing and diverse offerings of an increasingly delicious Strip District   With many cuts of steak available in sandwich or platter form  I m a fan of the sandwiches myself   none of the options are bad choices   You could make random selections from this menu and still be just as happy as if you put hours into crafting your order   It s all great stuff  and I have no advice to visitors other than  get a steak sandwich and anything else that looks good to you    You won t be disappointed   The primary drawback is space  it can be hard to find a place to eat once your food is ready  especially if the weather closes the outdoor seating area   Still  it s worth the wait in line and the hassle of seating  though it s still a far cry from being  good for groups

Dis place has some downright good tastin victuals  it does  I was almost hoping I wouldn t be impressed with Gaucho  But I must say  believe the hype  Ok so it s  th in the      Yelp Top      That means that it is the  th best rated restaurant in the U S  That is impressive  So here I am writing the    th and some   star review  Pthth  eye roll   Pointless  But I m a fan  I want it to stay up there on the list    So I was wondering  what could possibly be so outstanding about Gaucho  the meaning of gaucho is  a cowboy of the South American pampas   which is an extensive treeless plain in South America    South America is where Argentina is and Argentina is where good food cooking gauchos live          It couldn t be That amazing  The simple answer to that question is  everything  Everything about it is good    FOOD  Famous for steak sandwiches  Rosemary braised beef sandwiches  what I got  or just meat in general  not only beef  I also got a side of humita which is a corn pudding  The sandwich was huge with lots of bread and lots of flavor  It was slightly dry but that is fixed with the addition of one of the four wonderful chimmis  The chimmis are a complete winner here    THE PLACE   I was expecting a little hole in the wall joint but that s not what it is anymore since they did a massive redo  It s got a great atmosphere now  It s a super cool place with lots of wood design  Stacks of fire wood along the wall  wood floor  wood tables  and they bring your food out in wooden dishes  Your food is prepared fairly quickly and the service is great and the people are pleasant    Yes  every aspect of this place is nearly perfect  Everyone from foodies to farmers  hoodlums to hipsters  guess not much different there  will be impressed  There s no way you Couldn t like it  I now can understand why it s got such rave reviews

This restaurant deserves all the success and lines out its door  One walks in and is instantly greeted by a giant chalkboard of food items listed divided into  to meats  salads  sandwiches  and sides  I decisively decided on their steak sandwich with filet and then a  oz meat plate of flank  and it comes with a small side salad  toast  and tiny portion of grilled veggies   Depending on the cuts of meat prices vary  Strip steak is the cheapest to filet being the priciest  Ordered both meats to be cooked medium rare    While ordering you can see all the cute young chefs working hard grilling those meats in a modern clean kitchen  Sauce is unlimited and this place is byob even though they also sell beer and other soft drinks  They have wine glasses and beer glasses on the shelf along with plates and cutlery    it s self seating but someone still brings the food to you and will clean up after you    Oh man  the steak sandwich is good  They didnt skimp on the filet either  I knocked one star down because my flank steak was more of medium done than medium rare  Still very flavorful and not chewy  Affordable steaks here

I found this very interesting  I ve never had Argentinian food before  I ordered something that resembled a calzone  it had steak and corn and it was one of the best things I ve ever eaten   I would eat here again and look forward to trying some of their other dishes

What an experience   The food  the atmosphere  the courteous staff   you can t beat this restaurant   The pulled pork and corn pudding were outstanding  I highly recommend trying this restaurant  You will not be disappointed

This place was so incredibly good  I ve never eaten such delicious food  Went with a big group and they were able to accommodate us  It does get very packed anytime after    My only regret is that I did not order all the empanadas

This place is dynamite  We got the meat platter that offered an assortment of the steaks they have  Some were better than others but they were all great  Also  the sauces were phenomenal  The only thing I do not like is that you order at the front  get your own sauces  etc  It is kind of a fast casual vibe but it is a little higher priced so I did not like that we had to serve ourself for some stuff  But we will be back
Amazing    Some of the best food I ve had in awhile and a great deal  Definitely returning here

The best example of open wood fired grilling   You stand in line  Which I find hard to do with the exception of this place  order from a chalk board   Believe me  it is the one place worth standing in line  for unless your in the military waiting to get into the chow hall   BYOB  take a few friends  have a glass while waiting   It s worth the wait   I d suggest the fillet   It comes out sliced and layered perfectly

I took an older gentleman for lunch at the Gaucho Parrilla Argentina  The remodeling that was done to the restaurant allowed for comfortable seating and the service was great  I felt the sandwich s we ordered were over priced for what you got     yes they are big sandwich s but are mostly a bread bun with not a lot of meat  not satisfying for big meat eater s   I ordered a braised beef which was very tasty and my friend ordered a roasted pork sandwich which he felt was over cooked  dry   A server recommended next time to get a  disassembeled  sandwich on a plate which she said would have more meat on it since the meat is not stacked between the bun

The food was okay  It was very seasoned  kind of reminded me of Indian food  But I was really pissed that oil kept leaking from my sandwich all over my dress  Be careful people  You ve been warned  so blame yourself if you get oil all over your outfit  The prices are highish too  I liked that you could try different sauces  Wouldn t recommend

Ahhhh so worth waiting in the line  Great atmosphere and super friendly staff  I got an order of the lamb and went up to order seconds  Portions were smaller than I expected but so delicious I did not mind having to get up and get more

The food is excellent  the owner is a bit strange  You have to pay for your food in advance so if you don t like it  they make you pay for a new dish  I m not a huge fan of the trend and make sure you BYOB  They do not have any alcohol options

The renovated and recently reopened Gaucho is bright  airy and spacious  yet retains the warm and welcoming feel of its former  more intimate  dwelling  I ve been talking this joint up to my family for months  and my dad and I took advantage of a Saturday morning tour of the Strip to pop into Gaucho at     hoping to avoid the scores of shoppers who ll undoubtedly invade the place later in the day    Gaucho lived up to my bragging  impressing even my culinarily spoiled pops  I enjoyed the super juicy flank steak sandwich  smothered in roasted red peppers and caramelized onions and soaked in Gaucho s signature Chimichurri  The steak was flavorful and tender and  while undeniably messy  combined with the veggies and bread to create a masterpiece on a bun  We split the spicy chorizo plate which was the perfect way to sample another one of Gaucho s selections  The chorizo was complexly flavorful with a mild heat and an intriguing mixture of spices  My dad raved about the lamb  tender and cooked to rare perfection  We washed down all the meats with Mexican Coke and exited onto a busy Penn Avenue stuffed  content and with plans for our next visit
Delicious  One of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh  hands down  Basically everything that you can order here is delicious  so just take your pick  Really nice staff too

Dang well deserving of the five stars  Sat outside  BYO B  awesome staff who was enthusiastic  and some of the best meat I ve ever had in my life          would take a detour into Pitt again just for the steak
I am from out of state and wanted to try this place  It said it closes at    I attempted to go   times    got there at      wasn t able to eat  The next day got there at    still couldn t    Like wow

The food is great  but the super trendy and hip environment is frustrating for someone like me  You walk in to a chalk board with a menu and random people asking if your ready then you feel rushed to read the chalk board menu wall  After all that you order and sit at a table where others can sit at and then yell your name   great food but the ambience is not for me

Food is easily   stars  steak  sandwiches  tasty sides   there s not much more to say on this front  However  I have tried to go to GPA many more times than I have successfully eaten there   and I ve only ever attempted takeout  Even with the expansion  seating is a scarce commodity  but more frustrating is the takeout policy  On several occasions they have completely failed to answer their phone for stretches of time  rendering us unable to place a takeout order  on others  we have gotten through only to be told they wouldn t do takeout orders at that time due to long lines at the restaurant  I d much rather be told  it ll be    minutes because of long lines  rather then  no food for you

Lots of talk about this place  My brother and his wife have attempted it a few times but the line was always too long  Another friend said it s one of his favorite places but you have to go early or on a week night    After browsing the strip for an hour or two  we made our way here around     on a Saturday  The line had about    people waiting outside so we went for it  I mean  a line means one of two things  slow  poor service and being unable to serve your diners in a reasonable manner  or the food is THAT good that it s worth the wait and that s why so many people are willing to wait  Judging by the reviews  I was assuming the second    It took us about    minutes to get to the ordering part finally  I got what my friend recommended  carne sandwich with sirloin  I split it with my husband and my friend got the pollo sandwich for herself  After ordering  we got sat right away  Our food came out in under    minutes  There were     empty tables in the dining area we were in during the entire time we were seated and eating  so this is where I begin to beg the question  why the wait  It took     minutes to order and we literally got seated right after  As did the group in front of us and the group after us  Food comes out quick  You eat quick and go  It s in between fast food style dining and normal dining so again  why is there this extreme wait  Yeah  the place is small  But it s a quick turnover  You get up and can refill your own water and grab your own sauces  extra plates  napkins etc so service time isn t the answer either  It just baffled us    Back to the food  it was pretty good  The steak was seasoned well and cooked to medium rare like we asked  I will say  I understood upon first bite why they have the deconstructed sandwich option  My friend s chicken sandwich was no hassle  but every bite I took into mine pulled the entire slab of steak right off the sandwich  And the onions and peppers  So I basically ate mine deconstructed style  though it was unintentional  I d recommend ordering any carne sandwich that way for future reference    I d say the sauces were the game changer and kept this from being an overall   experience  Pretty unique and all clearly freshly made  There was a sweet onion one  a roasted red pepper one  a garlic butter one  think Papa John s garlic butter dip on crack   and one just called  yummy  which cracked us up  but was indeed yummy  Reminded me of an Italian dressing  as it was thinner than the others  Having those flavor options to dip and spread made a difference    I wanted to be wowed by this place and have it be a definite   stars  While we all agreed it was good  that s it  Just good  Not good and worth the long wait  Not good and unique atmosphere or something quirky to set the place apart because it s much like any hipster  exposed beam decor place popping up in any city  Not good and I m already planning my next visit  Just good with some pretty cool sauces  Lots of people were getting takeout orders while we waited in the long line  perhaps that s the secret

Have you tried this place yet  If not what are you waiting for  I eat out often and maybe a bit to often if you ask some of my friends  But when I suggest we visit Gaucho everyone jumps to the opportunity    If you like meat stop by and give this place a try you WILL NOT be disappointed

I finally got a chance to try Gaucho Parrilla Argentina  I d heard the buzz and I really wanted to check it out  I am pleased to say that all the reports I d heard are correct   This  Is  Good  Food   For what it s worth  I went on Tuesday night   I d tried to go before  but the lines can be VERY long on certain evenings  especially weekends   So long  in fact  that it is possible the last person in line will be holding a sign stating something to the effect that once s he orders no more orders will be taken   So go on an off night  or early   If you go on the weekend plan to wait in line   It s BYOB  so bring good beer or red wine   For my first excursion two of us ate  and we were able to share a few of the apps and entrees  I can now vouch for the fact that the chicken empanadas are tasty morsels baked into a delicious pastry shell  I can also vouch that the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich is quite tasty  although the one I tried was ever so slightly too dry  That was easily fixed by dipping it into any one of the tasty house made sauces you can get at Gaucho   However  the winner was the Bondiola sandwich  Perfectly roasted and juicy pork  with spicy mustard and caramelized onion on ciabatta  This sandwich was absolutely a  WOW   My fellow partner and I both declared the Bondiola to be the best sandwich we d tasted in quite some time   We will be going back  and while I love to try new things each time I visit a restaurant I m going to be hard pressed not to order the Bondiola again   For dessert they also served a lemon pound cake  It was the perfect ending to an excellent meal although I can t vouch for whether this is a standard item or whether it was special that night  I therefore have to suggest that if it is available  get it   Overall the restaurant is comfortable  the menu is fantastic  albeit daunting in actual size as well as content   and the food was excellent  Gaucho Parrilla Argentina does it right

If you were to relate restaurants to the human body  Gaucho would be the heart and soul   It s kinda built out of the way  but you know you re there by the smell of firewood   The place itself is small  but boy is the food and service great   They brought the food straight to us  which is very nice considering I have a broken wrist at the moment   We got two steak sandwiches  which was a mistake  Even though it is SUPER delicious  we couldn t finish it all  We also both got Cokes  which the cashier informed us was made in Mexico  so it was made with pure cane sugar and no HFCS  Man was it good   We even felt the need to take a small cup of chimmichurri with us  Probably the best steak sandwich I have EVER eaten  If you need a place to eat  come to Gaucho Parrilla Argentina

Just stumbled across Gaucho when down in the strip  Tried the Veggie Con Pan and was a huge fan of the wood grilled taste   Lots of flavor and several vegetarian options   Nice to have a new lunch option in the strip a short walk from the office

Gaucho s food is absolutely amazing   I d strongly recommend one of the combinations of multiple kinds of meats   I love them all   As far as vegetables  I d recommend the grilled corn on the cob   The only real downside to the place is the lack of indoor seating   If the weather is nice  you have to try this place

Quite possibly the best food experience I ve ever had   for taste and value  I took two of my out of town friends here  both of which wanted to move to Pittsburgh after eating here  The quality of ingredients is absolutely remarkable especially for the price point  I don t think you can find better steak at Pittsburgh s most expensive steak houses  Pro tip   at no extra cost you can upgrade the salad side on a steak plate to the garlic roasted potatoes  I also suggest if you like your steak medium rare to get it medium  they tend to undercook  I would choose gaucho over any   star restaurant in this city or others

Delicious little find   The sandwiches are generously sized and tasty  I came upon the place around  pm on a Saturday and there was only one other couple in the restaurant   My fianc  barely made it to his seat before they delivered the sandwiches to our counter   Both the steak and hamburger were well made and had great combinations of flavors   The guy at the register was quite the friendly chatty box  a welcome departure from the typical NY treatment
Do not miss this place if you are in PGH  Probably one of the best sandwiches I ve ever had  Do not miss our on the Rosemary braised beef  You will not be disappointed

This review is long overdue   I came to this place earlier on this year while I was in Pittsburgh working   This food is unreal   I came with a couple friends and we shared the meat sampler plate  which comes with all the different types of meat they sell  we also got a veggie sampler plate and two sides of potatoes   Everything was amazing   Especially their homemade sauces   The flavors are incredible   I want to come back to Pittsburgh just so I can eat at this place again   Seriously  Go eat there now

This restaurant deserves all the success and lines out its door  One walks in and is instantly greeted by a giant chalkboard of food items listed divided into  to meats  salads  sandwiches  and sides  I decisively decided on their steak sandwich with filet and then a  oz meat plate of flank  and it comes with a small side salad  toast  and tiny portion of grilled veggies   Depending on the cuts of meat prices vary  Strip steak is the cheapest to filet being the priciest  Ordered both meats to be cooked medium rare    While ordering you can see all the cute young chefs working hard grilling those meats in a modern clean kitchen  Sauce is unlimited and this place is byob even though they also sell beer and other soft drinks  They have wine glasses and beer glasses on the shelf along with plates and cutlery    it s self seating but someone still brings the food to you and will clean up after you    Oh man  the steak sandwich is good  They didnt skimp on the filet either  I knocked one star down because my flank steak was more of medium done than medium rare  Still very flavorful and not chewy  Affordable steaks here

I came here on a work trip to Pittsburgh  The ordering process is a tad overwhelming  the menu is written on a chalkboard behind the cashier register and you have to make a choice QUICK  I recommend looking over he menu before you arrive   I ordered a flank steak which comes with a tossed salad  toast and chimichurri  I also ordered the Papas Dulce as a side  The only con to the menu is they don t serve alcohol  They have four dipping sauces which are all equally delicious  so good I was dipping with my fork before my meal came out      TIP  Grab extra napkins  you will need them
Best food ever    Do not forget to order grilled corn and potatoes on the side
It was my first time at an Argentine place  I must say the steak was very good   Seating arrangements can be a little problematic  but overall this place is great

I have been following this restaurant for a while  I can remember when it had about    reviews at a solid five stars  And now it s over     and its   star rating hasn t budged    Finally got a chance to visit today  I had the pollo sandwich and grilled corn  It was incredibly good  Reviews are hands down accurate  You must go  That is all

Steak   Amazing  Sauces   Robust  Sandwich   Delicious   Empanadas   Heavenly  Atmosphere   Charming  Service   Pay order at counter  Is it the finest food out there  Maybe not  but everything combined makes this one of the best restaurant experiences anywhere

I ve heard great things about Gaucho and finally got to try it a couple of weeks ago  I got lucky and there wasn t a line when I went  so I didn t have to deal with the wait a lot of people complain about  My friend and I each got a sandwich and split them  so I got to try the carne and the bondiola  pork shoulder   The bread the sandwiches come with is incredible  It s a little crunchy on the outside  so it doesn t get soggy from the delicious juices from the meat  Both meats were cooked perfectly  melt in your mouth  They also offer you free  additional sauces that you can serve yourself  I tried all four  my favorite was the chimmi  This place is worth any amount of wait

SO delicious   SO good   The meat is beyond tender   The space is a bit cramped  but the hospitality warm and food is delicious   There is a rumor they are expanding soon   That will make this an ideal place for a lunch BYOB happy hour  or quick dinner

This place is great  I work nearby  They are extremely friendly on the phone as well as in person  The food is prepares in a timely manner  The food us absolutely delicious  I recommend the steak burger  I get carry out here in the reg  It s great to eat outside during the summer as well

Was good but absolutely not worth the wait    stood on line for two hours and another    minutes to actually get our food  I heard so many great reviews but I personally did not find it to be all that good

Amazing food  Definitely a must visit restaurant in Pittsburgh  It s in a location where parking can be difficult sometimes but it s worth a few circles around the block to find a parking spot  On a normal day you can find the line out the door   BYOB which we didn t mind   I had a a simple chicken sandwich and couldn t believe how flavorful it was  I also tried the chicken wings  Cooked to perfection   I went with a party of   and we all tried something different  Everyone raved about their food   My favorite part was trying all the different sauces they have   No wonder this place is always packed  I can t wait to go back

I have been here twice  First time I went inside to sit  the second I ordered take out  I will warn those who are looking to sit down inside and eat  from  pm on there is usually a wait and a line that wraps outside the door  I would recommend getting there early or for lunch    The second time I ordered take out  This by passed the wait and you can walk right in and pick up your order  Food took    minutes  and the containers keep the food decently warm    The pork chop  was cooked well nothing to rant or rave about  empanadas have a firm texture which felt like they had been overcooked a little  the vegetable filling was nothing crazy  but the pork filling was really good  The shrimp and corn we re excellent  I will definitely be back but will be ordering take out to skip the wait

I eat here fairly often   Always excellent   Its tough to consistently get meats cooked properly to temperature    Gaucho never misses the mark   All of the sauces  especially the chimichurri and the smoked red pepper sauce  are excellent   Service is good    not Michelin   star dining  but prompt and quick   No complaints   Want a good piece of meat  grilled right  with some excellent grilled veggies   This is the place

One of the true gems of Pittsburgh  If you haven t noticed  this town is becoming a food town and the best part about that  is all the hidden gems resting around the city  This place is not even remotely close to being hidden  but rather  stands out the moment you walk by  The smells are intoxicating and the food is      quality  The service is always prompt   no matter how busy   and I don t need to say how good it is   all you have to do is walk by at noon on a Thursday to see the line out the door

Sooooooo delicious whether you like meat or veggies  I ve been in Pittsburgh a couple of times for business  and I try to make a stop here since I found out about this place thru yelp reviews last year   Amazing sandwich combinations and quality meats  The last time I was there I got the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich  and it was absolutely delicious  Managed to finish the hefty sandwich because how tasty it was  Side veggies drizzled in balsamic vinegar was really good too  Definitely stop by this place if you re in town  Staff is super friendly too  I really didn t think Pittsburgh was such a culinary city

I m really unsure why there is such a hype about this place  I talked to my Spanish professors and friends about it and no one seemed impressed either  But yelp says otherwise  I came here for my friends birthday and thought I would give it a try despite the things I have heard  But it ended up being disappointing for me   The customer service is amazing  However  the food is not quite as good as I wanted it to be  I tried the yams and they tried to put some spices that just made it taste like flowers  The bread was dry  the fish I got was dry  The flavors were greasy and off  It was very heavy  They give a lot of food  but I didn t even want to finish it   They give you sandwiches in wrappers but then they give you plates anyways  So you just unwrap your sandwich and but it on your plate  What s the point of wasting that paper   Its definitely not worth the amount I paid  I got empanadas too  The meat was good but I ve had better empanadas other places for much less the price    Overall it was disappointing but the experience got two stars because of the great service

Why   stars  Because I was so sadly disappointed                       On a      scale  my anticipatory hype for visiting this place was a     I love red meat  I love Argentinian food  The menu was basically if I were able to custom design my favorite    things in the world  How could this go wrong     Ugh  The meat was oh so burnt  I went with the Carne Sandwich  and to be totally honest  it was barely edible  Even my peppers were burnt to a crisp  I should have gone back and asked them to re make it  but I was in a hurry to get to the Pirates game   So why   stars  and not   or    Because I try to be fair and not kill a business based on one experience that seems to clearly not be the norm    If I m ever in Pittsburgh again  this will be my first stop  I have faith that I had a bizzaro world experience

I wish Guacho wasn t so popular  so that it was easier to get into and enjoy they re amazing food  The flow of the restaurant is the only reason it s not getting   stars  you order at a counter that s right by the front  clogging up the entrance and almost always causing a line out the door   But I will always wait in the line because it really speaks for the delicious food  great ambiance and super friendly staff  Extremely authentic  Argentinian food means tons of grilled meats  veggies and some of the best empanadas in town  The fact that it s BYOB just tops of the reasons why you should definitely make your way over the Gaucho
Best steak sandwich I ve ever had and really good chimichurri      for a sandwich but worth it
The flank steak is the best  The chicken was also good  The empanadas and cauliflower I would not order again  Cute spot  Counter service  One of the better places we tried in Pittsburgh

I actually hated this place  Although the spices were authentic to Spanish culture  the menu was extremely confusing and overwhelming  I ended up ordering something extremely bland because everything said it was  spicy   Also  I don t understand why I have to order paella for a family of   and pay     dollars for it

This was one of the most perfect meals I ve ever eaten   The menu is simple enough but well thought out    The prices are exceptionally reasonable   Were this a full service restaurant you d pay at least twice the amount for the same food  The meats were flavorful  juicy and cooked perfectly   The charred toast was the perfect accompaniment   We also got the cheese and fruit board which was stellar    I honestly can t remember a more perfect meal

Fantastic   My flank steak was so tender and tasty  and I loved tasting the various sauces with it  Mashed sweet potatoes complemented it well  Nice atmosphere  not stuffy with a casual yet trendy vibe  Can t wait to go back
Everything is so delicious  Highly recommend then corn on the cob and rosemary braised beef
forget about  Best eats in Pittsburgh  Bar none  Come early though  especially for lunch  This place is crowded from open until close

Omg looking at the pictures I took so I can post on Yelp and I m drooling salivating at      pm   this sandwich was well worth my walk in the rain  I got lucky because there wasn t a line  came on a weekday around  pm   I got the steak sandwich with onions on ciabatta  Bread was toasty and chewy  Steak was medium cooked goodness  Sauce was running through my fingers and hands  What more can one want from a sandwich  I should ve ordered two although one is quite fulfilling  Yum   I need to be back

Have been here twice now  I d give it       This is compared to places in Chicago  Memphis and Austin  TX  First time  we took out  Was okay The past time  we ate in  Went New Year s Eve  It was delicious  We had the Gondola and Parrilla Mixta  The line wasn t too bad at     pm  The other night it was out the door  By the time we left  it was out the door again  The difference between take out and dining in  the food was hot and delicious compared to take home being cold  The dipping sauces were great too    Large dining area in the back  Helpful staff    Will definitely go back and eat more and try other selections    this is definitely one of the better restaurants in Pittsburgh

Food was delicious  Atmosphere was fun  We only had to wait in line for about ten minutes  but we got there early  around      p m   and it seemed to get a LOT more crowded soon after we arrived  I would highly recommend the experience  but maybe go early or be prepared to stand in line for a while

Wonderful sandwiches and a cool vibe   We ve been fortunate to get here at off peak times so the lines aren t horrendous  Love the green salsa  Thought the paella was okay  it really didn t hold up to the hype or the price  definitely better meats

What to get  deconstructed steak sandwich  grilled vegetables Service      Atmosphere  trendy  casual Wait     mins  Tuesday  PM for    Parking  street  The Experience   August       One of the best meals I ve had to date  It was worth the visit from out of town  I d visit Pittsburgh again for this place   Located in the Strip District     this street is filled with ethnically diverse shops and restaurants   There s a lot of one way streets in the area  so you may have to loop around like me to find a spot  I m a chicken when it comes to city parking  so I parked hella far from the restaurant  but it was street parking  Walking to the restaurant  Penn Ave is reminiscent of a smaller Chinatown  but a lot more than cultures  The place is at the very end of the street   If you think coming with a tiny group  aka party of    will get you seated faster  you re wrong  The line weaves in and then out of the entrance along the sidewalk  I m no stranger to long waits  but just a heads up if you want to come with people  If it weren t so popular and busy  I d come here with the girls for a girls  night out with an accompaniment of wine  It certainly looked like the thing to do when I was eating there and all the groups were merrily dining and drinking wine around me   I chose the deconstructed steak sandwich and a plate of grilled vegetables for some variety  The meat was PHENOMENAL  I need to learn better vocabulary for food descriptions  but the steak was perfectly marinated and flavorful  I could have just eaten steak for my entire meal  The crisp toast and marinated and grilled vegetables were a fantastic complement to the beef  Only way to improve this meal was to have a glass of red wine to go with it   I still drool over my pictures of the dinner I ate there and I wish other cities were blessed with this kind of luxury as well  I d say this is one of the key places to visit while in Pittsburgh  Nothing short of amazing
Wood fired authentic food  A gem in the Strip district
This place is amazing  The food is out of this world   I dream about it on a weekly basis

Interesting place serving great steaks  Argentinian style with multiple meet type such a sirloin  ribeye  flank steak  skirt  New York strip  You actually get in the line to order and then they bring the food to you  We got the combination platter of all the steaks which came with three pieces of yummy chargrilled chili bread  I wish this place had wine and beer instead of BYOB since we were out of town but we were lucky in that the patrons ahead of us were all too kind and gave us a half growler of beer  We also tried the passion cookie which was pretty good  Customer service was very good  Argentinian steak a little bit different in that they re thinner steaks fired on a chart grill and service sauces  I prefer reverse year and a big steak to get that perfect medium rare and enjoy it with just salt and pepper  however  the flavor of the sauces and seasonings were really yummy here and there are some days where I crave this type of steak

We have been wanting to try Gaucho for a while after all the great reviews and I got to sample some of their food at a previous Yelp event it was yummy   I was not sure what to expect and called to make reservations haha I hope they laughed at me  This place is so small and just a few counter tops to sit at  I recommend getting take out or going on a nice day when you can sit outside   With Growler in hand   it is BYOB  we waited in line and decided to take our food home as it was packed inside  def  a good sign    There seems to always be a line but the food is worth the wait  My only complaint is that we went around       be warned they close at   pm  and they were out of bread so no sandwiches  I mean come on how can you be out of bread   I was super disappointed but was one of the lucky few in line that got my sandwich on the toasted bread they did have left  When we got home the food did not disappoint and the rosemary braised beef sandwich was fantastic  Had enough to make   extra sandwiches with the leftovers  The horseradish sauce and caramelized onion are the perfect combo with the meat  I also got the grilled veggies and corn on the cob   I highly recommend the corn on the cob and will order   next time  My date got the flank steak which was cooked to perfection   The flavors of this meat cannot be beat  I can t wait to go back as I heard they are moving to a bigger location at the end of the month   Update   We went for lunch since they have expanded to part of the space next store   We waited in line of over an hour but were prepared for this   The staff could not have been friendly from taking our order to checking on us numerous times  I ordered the same braised beef sandwich this time they had the bread to serve it on and it was the best sandwich I have had   The new space has lots more seating

Gaucho Parrilla did not disappoint  I had high hopes after reading all the five star reviews and it met them  I had the carne sandwich with rare fillet  It was so flavorful  The smoked taste of the meat combined with the sweetness of the caramelized onion and the roasted red pepper was a perfect blend  The chewy bread adds a nice texture too  I added a side of horseradish for a nice kick  The owner was working and was so friendly to everyone  Overall this was a great experience and I can not wait to return  Give this place a try and you too will see that it deserves the hype

Omg  This food is amazing  The portions are large so you can share with your family and friends  You must order the mixed veggies  They have a great assortment of house made sauces  The staff is also very kind and accommodating

Awesome place for tasty MEATs  Grilled with real hardwood onsite   When you see the smoke coming out of the stack you get what you smell   Very small and intimate only a handful of seats but worth the trouble   Tastes were heavenly with caramelized onions and fresh crusty breads   The gentleman at the counter works the room like a carnival barker but takes great care of the orders   Great prices and fairly good selection of meaty delights

Came here on a weekday night and the line wasn t as bad as I had anticipated based on other reviews    Items I recommend    Beef empanadas  beef wins over chorizo in my opinion  I would almost always choose chorizo over beef in any circumstances  but the balance of flavor was better in the beef empanada   El Gaucho salad with steak added  I highly enjoyed each bite of this salad that contained radish  asparagus  bunch of leafy greens  carrot strips  and avocado  tossed in a light dressing  One bite of medium rare  or whatever other shape or form you like your meat  steak followed by a massive bite of vegetables made me feel much proud of myself for eating veggies because I actually really would never pay money to buy myself a salad  But this one was worth it     Sauces  try all the sauces and put it on everything whether it s empanada  steak  your fork  or whatever  Find out which sauce speaks to you the most and discuss it with your company for meaningful conversations    If I come here another time  and everything tastes consistently amazing  I will upgrade my rating to a five star   Oh  and BYOB

After yelping and checking out trip advisor  this seemed like a must go to when in town  Sure enough  with a group of people  we decided to check it out  Needless to say  we were not disappointed  There was a wait for about   ish mins but it was worth it  We all got sandwiches and they were all really good  Crane sandwich had excellent reviews so I figured why  not  It really lived up to its reviews  We also got a set of empanadas on the side and  mouth watering  definitely a must

It was about six degrees today  so when we got to Gaucho and saw the line of people waiting outside I knew it had to be wonderful  My boyfriend and I shared the parrilla mixta  a side of papas  and some empanadas  It was the best meal I ve ever eaten  and the sauces are absolutely amazing

Opening tip  try mid afternoon   We arrived around      on a Friday afternoon  I loved the experience of walking into the space  hardwood floors  brick walls  wrought iron chandeliers  high ceilings  chalk board menu and well merchandised sauces  There s so much from which to choose that we decided on three menu items  but be prepared to order your drinks first  I had the small flank steak  which was around      He had the small ribeye which was      I think  We also ordered the small camarones for      They ask for your name and then you find a seat  Before you grab your seat  grab silverware  We didn t have a problem finding a place and opted to sit upstairs  which was open and had a variety of tables  some that could accommodate       maybe more   so you can easily dine with groups  At each table you will find a napkin dispenser and a fresh flower  Note  you WILL NOT find steak sauce  salt or pepper so don t be that person     Our steaks were ordered  and arrived  medium and served with ciabatta bread and salata with an amazing balsamic dressing  The ciabatta was hard so I let it soak up some of the chimichurri sauce  The steaks were perfectly prepared and sliced  The presentation on the wooden platters was clean and inviting  We shared a bite of our steaks and we preferred our own  I loved the camarones doused with lemon    Highly recommend Gaucho to anyone

The ordering system is a little much at first  I recommend going with someone who has been there so they can help you along   The staff behind the counter was friendly and offered to answer any questions I had  There is an older fella  owner maybe   who seemed a tad overbearing in terms of making sure customers were doing what they need to and going where the need to  I appreciated his direction  but he came off a little high strung   I ordered the smoked pork belly special  It was tasty  excellent texture  nice mix of crunch and soft  gelatinous fatty goodness  Nice flavor  subtle smokiness and pretty salty  The potato side was forgettable  but the cabbage side was awesome  Great sweet savory mix  with little crunchy pork bits throughout  Yum

There is no way to overestimate how good this place is  The steak sandwiches are juicy and delicious  We ve tried the filet mignon  ribeye and skirt steak sandwiches and it really just comes down to what cut you prefer    We tried the provoletta and it should not be missed  grilled and melty sharp provolone is placed atop grilled ciabatta bread  it s as delicious as it sounds    The house made sauces are amazing  this trip we bought a container to bring home with us    The place is small so either eat off hours  plan on waiting for a table outside or get it to go    Eat here now

The food is worth EVERY MINUTE of waiting in the line that frequently wraps around the building  I ve been to Gaucho for both lunch and dinner  both were equally out of this world    The lunch portions are just right  I had the ribeye served mediun and it was excellent  I love the appeal of the wooden plates  I tried the Argentino salad for dinner  which is essentially Argentina meets Yinzer  as it is a salad with steak  avocado and papas  I plan on visiting again with a group to experience the paella  PS  great double date idea  and to take advantage of their BYOB policy

Delish  Everything was great  The veggies were Cooked to perfection with lovely seasoning  Loved the Brussel sprouts  the chic   Steak  toast and rice   The wait was way to long almost   hr  The service is so very friendly  You wait on line to place your order and then wait to be seated and the staff brings your food  BYOB

The food was good  but waiting in line for over an hour to be seated really ruined my experience  A little on the pricy side too  lunch for two was roughly      I had a steak sandwich  a side and she had the flank steak  Would I try them again  Yes  but definitely not during lunch hours on the weekend    If you get a sandwich  you should know it basically arrives on an entire loaf of bread  Plenty for two people

Favorite Pittsburgh lunch spot  I ve never had a bad experience  Staff is friendly  meat is top quality and perfectly cooked  the sauces are to die for  and it s byob  Red meat and red wine is winning combo in my book  The prices are also very reasonable when you consider the quality  It s def worth standing in line

I don t know if I visited on an off day or what  but I was very much let down by the food here after reading all the fantastic reviews  The staff and overall experience were great  but the food just didn t cut it for me   I visited with a group of four friends and I ordered the pollo sandwich and the vegetable and chicken empanadas  The sandwich was huge  but the flavors weren t very sophisticated and I didn t  really think they worked that great together  Plus the bread plus all the meat made for a pretty dry sandwich  The empanadas were similarly monotonous in flavor  regardless of filling  and the dough outside was oddly hard  My friends found their meals good but not fantastic   Based on all the great reviews  I was so ready to fall in love with this place    maybe I will give it another chance sometime

Superb  Everything I tried was excellent  Will return again and again  The shrimp was excellent  the meats cooked to perfection and everything had so much flavor  Fresh ingredients does that to food  Can t wait to return and bring a few friends

Basing my opinion on a one meal experience  this place is overrated  I ordered the sirloin medium rare  small       This was the only good part of the meal  A piece of burnt  tough bread was served with the meal  The salad that came with the meal was fair    I ve passed this place several times when they were busy and chose      PM on a weekday to try it  The menu is varied but if all the bread is burnt and tough I doubt if a return trip will happen

Fantastic sandwiches and salads  line wasn t too long but we waited awhile be prepared to wait outside if the line is long  Order and pay then are seated and they bring you your food  Unique menu great variety of sauces and flavors  My sandwich was fabulous and we loved the empanadas as well   Great variety  casual   trendy decor great place to eat if your shopping in the strip

Wow  Absolutely delicious food at great prices  The carne sandwich was awesome     filet mignon  chimi sauce  onions  and peppers stuffed into a ciabatta  Service is very fast and friendly  They have good looking veggie options here  too  If you re in Pittsburg  you should come here

Whoever thought it d be okay to have a copious amount of meat for breakfast is just sick in the head  and I m all for it  On a summer weekend road trip to Pittsburgh  said no one ever     friends and I went on a food excursion through the city of steel  Gaucho was a big surprise to me having grew up in Los Angeles and not expecting such an eclectic array of eateries in a place like this  We lined up right before they opened and got in after around    minutes  just the perfect amount of time to build up an appetite  We got the sampler and a side of okra  just to appease my flexitarian appetite   Yum yum and yum  The meat has just the right amount of charcoal and steam  with its juice oozing out right before your eyes  You can feel the warmth of the slab of steak before taking a bite  what a treat  Do note that this was an incredibly sodium tastic meal  I d say they could use less salt for their dry marination  And don t forget the salsa  try em all

The food is delicious here  Super tender  moist meat with a slice of grilled bread  What could be better  Definitely get the Brussels sprouts  I don t know what they do to them  but they are soo good  The problem is the service  You wait outside in a long line only to be rushed as you eat  We even got asked by the server when we were going to leave because there were all lot of people waiting outside   but I was one of those people too  I wouldn t go back
Hands down best bit of ribeye i have ever had      Get the humitas too if you like a little spice   everything here is cooked to perfection
Seriously one of the best sandwiches I ever ate  and if you getting lunch make sure you there before    or you will be staying in    minutes line

After     reviews at the time of this writing  and with     stars  I don t think that I have too much to add on the awesomeness of this place that hasn t been said numerous times before   I will say that they have recently enlarged the seating area   but I went around      pm on Weds  and it was still pretty packed   People love this place  and for good reason   Authentic  hearty  unpretentious  great grilled charred flavor  BYOB at no charge  fast service   that alone puts it in the top restaurants in Pittsburgh    I went on a hot summer day  and I will say that while it was air conditioned on the inside  I was quite warm   The ac is lined on one side of the upstairs room  and is not so easily felt on the other side   It is also a bit loud   but then I suppose that is to be expected when there are sooo many people wanting in that place   These were very minor inconveniences given that the food was so good   I would like to add that the overall costs for this place are very reasonable for the quality of food that you are getting    Value is even better since there is no alcohol served here  and there is no corkage fee to bring your own alcoholic beverage   In addition  there is no real wait staff  only a few servers and a busboy   I think for this reason many people may not leave a tip   but there is a tip jar at the front by the cashier   Normally  I am not a fan of most tip jars  as many places seem to have one for no reason at all   but assuming that the busboys and servers get a portion of it  I happily left one   All of the staff here were friendly and helpful  and I hope that others reading this will realize that and leave a few bucks for the hard working staff here

Tbh don t really have words for this place  The food is ridiculous  Insane   I got the carne sandwich and my boyfriend got the lamb chops   both done perfectly with just the right amount of pink  The sauces help to make the meal  try all     you really can t go wrong   Service was also extremely friendly  attentive and always ready to answer your questions and help you in any way possible  The only downside  and the reason it didn t get   stars  was the wait  I spent a total of   hours there  most of them which was waiting for the cold  but that isn t really their fault  and it s obvious that the food is just so good that everyone is willing to wait  I cannot wait to go back but preferably not on a Saturday night this time so I don t have to wait     years

First time in for a quick lunch before a flight  I ordered the braised rosemary beef sandwich  the fried provolone to share  and my Lunch date ordered the lamb  The food was giant and just as tasty  The beef was squeezed between two buttery slices of bread and topped with a creamy horsey sauce  with caramelized shallots

Food is     stars  totally amazing   The front desk  however  should not encourage patrons to sit on the patio  Flies  fleas  little black bugs all over the place  which completely downgraded the experience from a    to about a     There is no reason they can t assess the bug situation on the patio and close it down when it s infested with flying bugs that are all over the food   We ate and got out of there as quickly as possible  Sit inside

You want to know what I really appreciate about this meat centric restaurant   The sauces      I have been to other churrascaria style or meat oriented restaurants here and in other parts of the US   I m not going to mention names   One local one starts with G  and to ingest a plate full of potential heart attack substances without additional flavoring is ridiculous   I know that some of you purists are going to say that the quality of the meat should speak for itself  but I don t agree  Just like I like my coffee with a flavored creamer  I want my meat with a lil sumthin  sumthin on the side   Much like a an adulterer   but I digress     This place has not one  not two  not three  but FOUR different sauces that you mix and match and slather dip gently brush bathe your freshly grilled meats in   I love that   I have been hearing about this restaurant for a while  but it kind of dropped off of my radar for more than a minute    So many restaurants  so little money  but now that I m back to my weekly habit of visiting the Strip District  I decided to stop in   I noticed that the menu wasn t expansive  but I still had a problem deciding what I wanted to eat   Del Mar  Of the Sea  or De La Tierra  Gaucho s interpretation   Not of the Sea    Hmmm  meat platter  seafood platter  sammich  what to do     After much time and deliberation  I decided to go with the Rosemary Braised Beef sandwich  Maiz  Grilled Corn on the Cobb  and two steak empanadas   I also scarfed up samples of each of the sauces     Call me Vampire Killer because I love garlic and that Ajo  garlic  sauce is drinkable in my opinion   The chimichurri sauce and the cebolla  onion  sauce were also excellent   The Rosemary Braised Beef was smoky  flavorful  tender and well balanced with the addition of caramelized onions and horseradish sauce   Yeah  I know another sauce   but it was good    All corn should be grilled and seasoned the way Gaucho does it   The only downer that I had was the steak empanada   I bought two  one for myself and one for my daughter Muff and they were a little dry and overwhelmed by the taste of olives   I love olives  but the olive taste wasn t balanced out by other flavors  so it was just bien   okay    After I raved about the restaurant to my sister  I had to take her there this past Saturday   Not only did I reorder the same sandwich and grilled corn  I tasted some of my sister s Gaucho Papas  Seasoned Roasted Potatoes  Ay  Papi were they good     Service at Gaucho s was extremely friendly and welcoming  with the staff more than willing to explain everything about their menu in detail   The place is minutely small and you have to go outside to change your mind    The size of the place and empanadas is my only reason for a   rating   All in all though  a very wonderful experience and you can t go wrong with the food there   Besos  kisses  to the chefs and owners

This is truly a great restaurant  The steaks were perfectly cooked  Very tender  We got the small plate ribeye  The grilled shrimp was out of this world delicious  The roasted red potatoes were so tender you could smash them with a fork  The wait staff was extremely attentive and friendly  I was also very impressed with the manager as she was helping clear tables and sweeping the floor  Great example for her staff  Will definitely go here again  A word of advice  for dinner try to get there before   or you will be in line forever
Amazing food  Don t let the long lines stop you  Loved the tender well seasoned steaks and salads  Can t wait to go back

walked out after twenty minutes waiting with ONE party out of at least ten other parties inside visibly having ordered  someone came around to offer  skipping the line  and get the     head prix fixe menu   are you kidding me   who in their right mind goes anywhere offering a prix fixe menu that makes you wait in the damn street   nothing  NOTHING is good enough to justify that line  that wait  and a terse sign at the door whining about how  we know it s cold out  that s why coats were invented   get a bigger venue   sizing down for  exclusivity  just makes you look like a dick

I don t feel the need to say anything more than what has already been said time and time again about this place   The best steak sandwich I have ever had   Period   Ribeye steak sandwich  don t mess around  put chimichurri on it   The end
The restaurant has a nice atmosphere  laid back  Staff is friendly  The food is good

This is a place where food definitely trumps service   They have a takeout option  but no one seems to answer the phone  so you d have to come in a wait in line anyway   With the length of the line for this place on any day  you can see this business can t really handle the volume of customers it serves or even a possibly growing customer base
Food amazing  ambiance amazing and did I mention the food is amazing   The staff is friendly and quick  It s a byob so that is a huge plus

Great spot  The smoke from the wood fired grill grabs anyone s attention who is walking by  The staff is all very friendly   The food is amazing   so much flavor packed in generous portions  You can taste that only top quality ingredients are used   I try to go here at least once a month for lunch and it never disappoints  The line sometimes can get big but that s to be expected when you have such good food
Sandwich and salads so good that they re addictive    The line usually out the door but so worth the wait

Great atmosphere  very clean  staff very friendly    I had the Cordero  medium rare  Two double lamb chops came out a perfect medium rare  There was a nice char on the outside  unfortunately this carried over to the frenched rib bones  Two were burnt off when it came out  the other two fell apart on the plate  Not appetizing  The meat was under seasoned    The accompanying small casa salad was tasty  especially liked the grilled grape tomatoes  Dressed perfectly  a little understated  as I prefer    Grilled corn was under seasoned as well  and there isn t any salt and pepper to be found  Could have used a bit of char on it  They could have used some of that tin foil it was wrapped in to protect the lamb rib bones      Gaucho papas were delicious  Wouldn t change a thing  They were grilled perfectly  I loved the seasoning  and the oil was decadent  Nice sized portion for three bucks  Plenty to share    They have a small selection of self serve sauces  well balanced and diverse  I thought they were very flexible and all complimented every menu item in a different fashion  Very oily  but great with the meats    I will definitely go back  Baby Girl brought me a chicken sandwich home about a month ago  and I crushed it  Shredded chicken and ajo sauce on that grilled ciabatta  I was so full I couldn t eat the rest of the day  Killed it
I ve been here several times and each time  the food is delicious  Having to wait in line for so long is the only downfall and why we don t go here more often

My wife and I came here with no knowledge of the establishment beforehand  but on the basis of a recommendation  We both enjoy Argentinian food generally and a good steak especially  we were going somewhere closeby  so why not  What I have to say about this restaurant  very simply  is  IT S NOW OFFICIALLY MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT  Read about the great food in all the other reviews  We second them all  Steaks tasty  tender  and succulent  nice portions  wonderful bread and other accompaniments  A great aspect  when there was a problem with one of our steaks  they took it back and produced a new one in a matter of MINUTES and it was absolutely perfect  If you like this kind of fare  you will love this restaurant  Can t wait to go back  Tip  no liquor licence  yet    but bring your own red wine and enjoy  Very accommodating

I tell everyone that this is literally the best restaurant in all of Pittsburgh  If the great reviews here don t tell you that  then the line out the door on a weeknight might  This is not your standard restaurant in that the menu is gigantic and written on the wall when you first come in  You order your food and have a seat  it s BYOB   and they bring your delicious food out to you as you wait  Thankfully over the past year they have significantly expanded the dining room  there really wasn t one before  and have great outdoor seating  The food itself is excellent  The steaks are always cooked to the right temperature and the sides are outstanding  Our favorites are the potato wedges and the corn on the cob  The sides change frequently based on seasonal ingredients  We have tried many different items here and everything we have ever had has been excellent  with the exception of the empanadas which were just OK and a side of roasted peppers  which were just a bit too oily   But the meat is always on point My husband loves to get the strip and the ribeye and I ve had both of those  shrimp  and paella and it was awesome  Two enthusiastic thumbs up

Amazing  This place is worth the wait and certainly lived up to the hype  Everything is so flavorful  The ribeye plate was excellent  Also recommend the potatoes with garlic and rosemary  Tried it for lunch and can t wait to come back for dinner sometime  The small ribeye plate and side of potatoes was the perfect sized lunch for two to share
