This place is ranked    on America s top     in      by Yelp itself   For good reasons  When we arrived on a Friday around      PM there was still a line out the door    I can only imagine how busy it is during prime lunch and dinner hours   The atmosphere is pretty hip and casual  and the restaurant looks newly renovated    We were in a rush so we opted for sandwiches  ribeye and rosemary braised beef   These are now my favorite sandwiches without any exaggeration  Since they make their meat to order expect to wait around    minutes for takeout  but it is certainly worth it   They do their sandwiches extremely well   from the bun through the meat   everything is perfectly thought out   Probably now my favorite food place in Pittsburgh

if I can  I will eat Gaucho everyday  EVERY DAY  the steak burger is out of the world  for    bucks  i m the happiest person on this planet  after the renovation  they have introduced some new dishes  I have tried Parrilloda Mixta and the potato salad  they are both really yummy  it s definitely one of the best restaurants in pittsburgh

This is not your typical sit down restaurant  When you get there you wait in line and then place your order  After your order is placed the staff then sit you at a table  We went on a Thursday night  The line was not that long  but we still waited about    minutes to place our order  The restaurant is BYOB so if you want something to drink make sure you bring a bottle of wine or beer  My husband and I ordered the  large flank steak  the small lamb chops and a side of mushrooms to share   The flank steak was mediocre  I prefer my husbands over theirs  The flank steak could have been more flavorful   The side salad and the mushrooms were good but there was nothing outstanding about the sides   The side salad and mushrooms tasted like any other restaurant   My husband liked the lamb chops  But said they were average tasting   The portion size is small  My husband could have easily ate all of the food himself  I was hoping for a really different tasting  flavorful meal but everything we had was average tasting  With that said I would be willing to go back and maybe try one of the sandwiches on the menu   I think we just maybe did not order the right thing  But the atmosphere is fun and hip and the BYOB would be a good addition if you had to wait in a really long line    stars

Gaucho   Who doesn t love to say Gaucho   And what meat eaters wouldn t love this tiny little spot in the Strip   We arrived early on a Saturday morning   And Chef Anthony Falcon was already performing for the crowd   Yes  this man is a performer  describing the menu  giving tips on what to order and truly thrilling the crowd   So  here is a bit of the condensed version of the story of this grill spot   A gaucho is an Argentina cowboy   These gauchos would grill beef over a wood fire  giving the meat an incredible flavor   Chef Anthony s great grandfather was a gaucho in Argentina   Be sure to search the restaurant wall for a photo of him dressed in gaucho garb   Well  on to the story   Chef Anthony s uncle visited Pittsburgh from Argentina and said  you have got to put a restaurant in the Strip   And so  here we are today     It s interesting to enter and see stacks of natural hardwood everywhere   All cooking it done by fire   No oven   No stove   And definitely no microwave   It s almost prehistoric   Wood  fire  meat   The day we visited  Chef Anthony was not cooking  he was entertaining and waiting on the crowd   Not being super hungry  we opted to order simple items   I got a cob of corn and steak empanadas   OMG   Can t say enough about the awesome flavors here   BJ got a chorizo sandwich with peppers  onion   pimenton   So good   Also  I added the pimenton to my empanadas   Spectacular     Clearly  we need to return with an appetite   And try more of the menu   Can t wait for that

our best meal during our stay in pittsburgh   the carne sandwich was fantastic   the sauces were exquisite   you may as well make a few orders of tostados  toast  simply to enjoy the sauces   the empanadas were really good  and my wife enjoyed her heirloom tomato salad   her only regret   not getting steak on it   logistics are a bit tricky   it s fast casual in the sense that you wait in line  usually a long time   order  and pay   but then the staff seats you  and you re welcome to stay as long as you want   nobody rushes you  even though there is a long line   there are obvious ways that the restaurant could increase their bottom line  more tables closer together  working more quickly  etc   but it s quite charming as is   highly recommended   and  yes  i ll wait in line next time  too

The staff are super upbeat  fun and very welcoming    Everything that we ordered was very delicious   It really made waiting in line worth it   I ve been to a lot of restaurants  I m from Chicago  but never to one that made a      positive impression in all points   I only wish they had one in Chicago or northern Illinois

The concept of this small corner restaurant is so peculiar to me  You order in advance from a huge selection  that serves to any palate and diet  and then  proceed to be seated and wait for a staff member come into the room  call out your name  and deliver your meal    Even though the place can get crowded  the atmosphere is tranquil  modern  and enjoyable   The food was extremely good  I had the Arracera  hanger steak  served with La Casa salad  house salad  and substituted the ciabatta bread it offers for a side of avocado  at no expense   The meat was cooked to perfection  with a rich flavorful grilled taste  The house salsas  sauces  are a must have item to try when you go visit this adorable restaurant    The staff is friendly  the interior is clean  and the food is amazing  I don t think there is more I could right to not want to make you go eat here    Definitely will come back during my next visit to Pittsburgh
Gaucho never disappoints  The steak is obviously fantastic but a hidden gem on the menu is the grilled camerones  Perfection every time

The best meals in the strip district  Their meats were so well seasoned and cooked to perfection  You even get to pick from four different sauces  I enjoyed all of them   There s always a long line so I would suggest going on an off time to not have to wait outside  We had a few people looking at our meals and asked us what we order  Here s what to get   Argentina small salad      and add steak      for the best of it all   I got a beef empanadas      added too and it was delicious   Sixteen dollars for an amazing meal    I would say I m confused on the set up of ordering first at the counter and then they seat you  You don t see staff often for refills so I wasn t sure if this was a wait staff or just workers dropping off our food
The food was on point  Big fan of the Brussel sprouts  empanadas   yams  Great addition to the strip district
Absolutely love   Very friendly staff and great food
Really good for the meat eater  I loved the salsas especially   I ll definitely be back

I was blown away by the entire early dinner experience Husband and I had here last night   Always nice when expectations and hype are met   Allow me to add to Gaucho Parrilla Argentina s accolades     We ordered the Asado Plate  which is a grilled heap of all   of Gaucho s available cuts of beef   Our decision to order this dish was a fantastic one   Sure  I ve experienced each of these meats before  but it was really cool to have all the grilled meats labeled side by side and compare them visually as well as by taste   A nice surprise was that the portion was bigger than I expected   I anticipated I d love the filet  which I did  and was surprised by how delicious the skirt was  a nice amount of fat and very tender   The other cuts  NY  flank  and ribeye  were all nicely executed and good  but the filet and skirt stood out to me   Also ordered the large portion of Vegetales  which is essentially a beautiful plate of mixed grilled veggies   I thought some of the vegetables tasted kind of plain  but then something dawned on me   Read on   Gaucho s condiments are what really take this place to the next level   The   complimentary condiments  chimmi churri  pimenton  ajo  and cebolla  can be dished up fresh from jars in the ordering area  or you can purchase  oz  for      The condiments are killer and really give the already yummy food some oomph  and I liked that none of the condiments are spicy   Pimenton was my favorite  followed closely by cebolla   The ajo was a little salty for me but still delicious  and the chimmi churri  though flavorful and tangy like chimmi churri usually is  was surprisingly thin   This place rocks   I love everything about it   Every aspect of our dinner  quality of food  portion size  d cor  price point  was right on and beyond reproach   Service was extremely friendly  efficient  and knowledgeable   Hell  even the weather was perfect for eating outside on the little patio facing Penn Avenue   A very  very easy   stars

You don t need to read any of these reviews   This is the most popular spot in the city  and Yelp s    in the country     Just make sure you try the sauces   The garlic  ajo   one made my meal completely   This place doesn t need me to tell you to go there  but if you need a review still  a messy one follows   The    and I have tried to come here a couple times in the last year   The first time  after work last winter  called the place  they said they were almost closing         so don t bother  Fine   Tried to go a few weeks ago while in the Strip on a Saturday  HA   Unless you are patient and are extremely weather prepared  don t bother   Lines out the door  we waited for about fifteen minutes and decided waiting in line outside in January is not for us   But alas  I had a half day of work due to an appointment in Bloomfield   It was   PM  snowing like crazy  maybe four degrees out  and you re damn right I got on that    bus and slid down to the Strip District   The inside is tiiiiiny  Mostly kitchen  a middle table  six stools along the sides of the wall   I was immediately greeted by Anthony  I think  who was so unbelievably awesome   Another cook there  younger kid  was drinking all the wine in this BYOB establishment so I knew I liked this place already   I wanted to take dinner home as the    was stuck in meetings all afternoon and couldn t join me  so I needed things that traveled well   I knew I wanted chicken  pollo     which is  poh jo  ish  not  po yo   this ain t a Mexican joint   and was directed to the sandwich which he suggested I get  deconstructed    toast instead of bread  everything piled together  oh my sweet jeebus  you don t even know   It had mushrooms on it which I do not do   but I ate them  Me  Picky Queen of the East  I also got the potatoes  papas   which were roasted to almost a blackened state in the best sense   Don t forget the sauces for these   I had a lot of help packing everything into my huge brown bag   Everything separate and packaged so nicely  They are too sweet here  I can t stress that enough   I asked for the most popular items for      He received a rosemary beef sandwich and corn   After he put that thing together and drenched it in the horseradish sauce  it was gone   I have no idea what happened   I thought he was going to drink the chimichurri  I m not a beef eater  but it honestly smelled good enough to potentially turn me against my moral judgments   The food is some of the best South American y business I have ever had   It might even be worth the line outside in January or  at the very least  another half day of work
I could eat at this place every day and bathe in the Chimichurri sauce   Nuff said
Excellent food and service  I got Pescado and it was great  We had to wait for   hour standing before we got seats
Terrific meal     Great location and atmosphere   But food is outstanding

This is my repeat visit to this meat haven  granted it s been years since my first visit  I think I ve gathered enough information to develop a conclusion  I am not nearly the carnivore I think I am    Seeing how Gaucho is quite possibly top three restaurant in terms of Yelp popularity in Pittsburgh  I think it should be held to a higher standard  So here comes the truth   Good  The energy is undeniable and the wait staff is pleasant  beyond helpful    This space is vast despite its deceiving outer appearance   the smaller items on menu are exceptional  Take the whole  smaller  term with a grain of salt though  I m not sure these guys know small      The not so good  although the meat is plentiful  this isn t exactly Texas low n slow style  Tenderness matters  especially when it s this much packed in a sandwich    Personally I feel where they excel is the sides and appetizers  Items like the empanadas or the roasted cauliflower are great  The cauliflower honestly is out of this world good    Gaucho remains a formidable lunch option  with great value for your dollar  Just don t expect to have additional stomach space for dinner
Ordered the steak burger with Caramelized onions and mushrooms  Sandwich was huge  Could feed    Anthony is awesome  friendly and upbeat staff
Totally insane  an amazing experience  I think the rest of the reviews on here confirm the meal that I enjoyed

Hmm  after having read so many reviews I probably had very high expectations   I am not saying the food wasn t good but probably not as much as I read about it  Or it could probably be that I didn t order their signature Rosemary steak   I ordered Pollo  chicken  sandwich and it was very average   The red sauce was good but one of the sauce was terrible   I really loved the cookie and infact bought a few more to go as well  Will try their steak next time to be fair    But for whatever I ate today I will give only
Top five sandwiches I ve had anywhere in the world  Chicken or beef  Doesn t matter everything is awesome

The food here is phenomenal  Be prepared for a bit of a wait and close quarters   they expanded recently but there still isn t a ton of seating  and when we went  there was a line out the door  However  the staff is incredibly friendly  and my Bondiola  roasted pork shoulder  sandwich was well worth the wait  Also  it s a BYOB  which is great  We will definitely be back

This go around  I was a bit hungrier so I ordered the steak burger       medium well with candied bacon and Spanish blue cheese as my freebie toppings  additional toppings are    cents ea    The burger was served neatly between two thick slices of bread  not sure of the type   In addition to the burger  I also ordered a side of their brussel sprouts and rice  A plentiful amount of sprouts are served with candied bacon  They re quite tasty  but I m not sure I d give them the award for best sprouts in the city  The rice was quite bland and flavorless  The majority of the rice was soft  but some pieces were crunchy and ultimately got stuck in my teeth   unsure if that s the way the rice is meant to be served  Brought my own wine and wasn t charged a corkage fee  unsure if they even charge one     Sat in the back of the restaurant  What should be a     experience became a       due to a number of fruit flies swarming around the table  Originally sat in the back right corner  but moved a bit closer to the center of the room in an effort to avoid them   unfortunately  this didn t help as they just followed my trail  By the time we finished up  we had caught two flies in a wine glass  I mentioned something to one of the employees who seemed shocked and noted that she had been at the restaurant since   A and hadn t seen any  strange    Anyway  she said she d mention something to one of the managers    The place started to get busy closer to      and I could tell we were subtly being pushed out the door when two employees started cleaning everything off the table  We got the hint and left

This place was amazing  I ordered the steak sandwich and selected the skirt steak  There are many cuts of beef to choose from for this sandwich including flank  skirt  NY strip and filet mignon  I asked the cashier for his recommendation and he suggested the skirt steak so that s what I went with  The sandwich was amazing and the steak very flavorful  I would recommend this place to anyone  My boyfriend got the sandwich with flank steak  It was good but the skirt is the way to go  The added fat in that cut of meat elevates the taste  This is a MUST try in Pittsburgh

Never have been disappointed here  You can smell it a block away and that only makes you want it more    Everything from the steak to chicken to fish is all incredible    Staff is beyond friendly and down to earth  They get they re a small place and they make people feel appreciated and welcomed even with a line out the door    Can t wait for their expansion   Ps  secret patio seating on the side and its BYOB  Just hard to find a seat
No matter what you choose off the menu  you ll most likely eat the best sandwich you ve ever had in your life
I had the steak burger and it was very good  Nice size lunch portion  Little pricey  but worth it  Nice people working there  Go and enjoy

To be completely honest I thought there was no way Gaucho would live up to my expectations  I have yet to hear a bad thing about the place and maybe I m a pessimist    but I didn t believe anything could be that perfect   I drove nearly   hours non stop from North East Pennsylvania    landed in the Strip District and immediately walked up the street to Gaucho Parrilla  I ordered the steak burger with onions and peppers  It was large  it was mouthwatering good  and although I was completely full and satisfied  I had to debate with myself on why I shouldn t order a second one to scarf down   Gaucho is perfection  I can t imagine why anyone would go anywhere else  From the friendly staff  to the most delicious steak I ve ever tasted  to the interior and layout  Everything is perfect  The   star rating isn t a fluke    it s that good

Tasty spot with a variety of great looking options   The sauces were all excellent  and the mixed grill platter was good   sausage  chicken and steak all flavorful and well cooked  although mine came out a little on the cold side  which was kind of a disappointment   Empanadas were pretty good as well  although they did not blow me away   Overall  I would like to try some other items on the menu  and I enjoyed the things I did have  although my major complaint would be that it is a tad overpriced   Not terribly expensive mind you  but just a bid overpriced for what you get   Would I return   Yes

Came across an old picture of the amazing food from this place  so I figured I d write up a quick  and long overdue  review   We ordered the Cerdo  Pork  and Camarones  Shrimp  extra special plates as well as side orders of Pork Empanadas and Gaucho Papas  The Cerdo plate was comprised of pork tenderloin  caramelized onion  spicy mustard  small salad  and toast   The pork tenderloin tasted amazing atop the toast with the onions and spicy mustard sauce mixed in  I m more of a carnivore  so I left the salad for my girlfriend  The Camarones were also really good   simple and clean   The potatoes were nothing special on their own  but fortunately there were   really yummy sauces to dip into  Chimmi  Ajo  Pimenton  and Cebolla  We were both obsessed with the Ajo  which I think means garlic   The Empanadas were probably the least remarkable thing we ate  although they weren t bad by any stretch   Another really cool feature of this place is the BYOB policy  It was our first time here  so we were woefully unprepared  but we saw plenty of patrons taking advantage

Let me start by saying that I am Argentine   I recently moved to Pittsburgh and I was VERY hesitant to eat here   I was pleasantly surprised   The Chorizo is not authentic Argentine Chorizo  but the Chimichuri  and the steak sandwich was phenomenal   The service was great and the menu was quite impressive considering the size of the restaurant   I will be back for sure

The food is phenomenal here  Ate outside because we had an oddly warm February day this year  The line is a bit annoying  however the food is worth it  Every employee I encountered was wonderful and I look forward to going back sometime soon    Suggestions  Write your order out in your notes before you get the register so you don t forget anything  Steak filet con pan was an awesome experience and the Brussels are next level  Don t forget the empanadas

WHAT IS LIFE    This was so good    I ve had wood grilled meat when I was younger  and this place knocked me off my feet  All meats are amazing here  Loved my chanchito in a sandwich  We also got the New York steak which was perfectly medium rare and mouth watering  So good  I can t say much about the veggies because we pretty much just ate lots of meat  Mmmhhh meeaaat    Only down side to this place is that it s very small  I would suggest getting things to go  but if you want a homey experience  dine in  Just don t go with more than   people  I think they have   chairs total  P The owners are amazingly kind though  so they don t mind people squeezing in    Final tip  go before  pm    They close at  pm and I swear everyone and their mom goes between    pm  it s so funny  Not sure why this is the case  but we beat the crowd because we re pros  Be a pro  you ll get your food faster

The food here   wow  If you don t like this something is wrong with your taste buds  the food is excellent and I mean everything on the menu  we had a party of   and we ate a lot of food but it was all amazing  I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food

There s not much I can say that hasn t been said  but I ve been a Gaucho fan for a long time  A couple years ago I was walking through the Strip and smelled something delicious  I followed my nose and found Gaucho  I like to think I discovered it before it got big   I ve been at least   times since then and have told all of my friends  co workers  family  and out of town guests    The corn on the cob is simple and tasty  I usually get a steak sandwich and load it up with some of their fresh made sauces  chimichurri is great   The papas  shrimp  and salads are all good too    As Gaucho has gotten more popular  the lines have been out of control  even after they expanded  The last   times I ve tried to go to Gaucho  I ve turned around and gone elsewhere due to the line  I hope they can figure out a way to expedite food a bit faster while maintaining quality   for their sake and ours

Well  I suppose I m going to be the voice of dissent here  but I was Not Impressed with this place  Being of partial Latin American descent  Guatemalan  but Mom spent part of her childhood in Buenos Aires   I am no stranger to grilled meats in this style  to chimichurri  to elotes  this is the food of the summers of my childhood  However  that food my father would so lovingly slave over the grill preparing for us differed from what I experienced at Gaucho in two ways  it was cooked properly  and even more importantly  IT WAS SEASONED  My daughter and I hit up Gaucho on a Thursday afternoon for lunch  I had heard great things  and it smelled wonderful  so we were super excited  On a recommendation from a friend  we ordered the Matambre  flank steak   Gaucho Papas  roasted potatoes   and the Gaucho Salad  With a drink and tip this came to about      NOT a cheap lunch  but you pay for good food  right  The wait for the food was long  but we thought it d be worth it  and their patio is really very pleasant  Oh  and we loaded up on condiments  including chimichurri  an herb garlic vinaigrette that is essential to any Latin steak meal  and some cebolla  a similar combo but with caramelized onions instead of herbs   So  the food finally came and upon the first glance I noticed that the flank steak was cut VERY sloppily  with connective tissue visible throughout  Secondly  the inside of the cuts were so rare that they were practically blue and still mooing  Listen  I yell at people who order even MEDIUM done steak  This was beyond rare  So rare and connective y that most of it was hard to chew  And to add insult to injury  it lacked any seasoning  Nothing  So  I tried the chimi and the cebolla  Equally bland  I mean  like  no damned seasoning at all  I never reach for a salt shaker  but boy  I was looking for one to attempt to make these expensive strips of tough tartare edible  It was shocking how tasteless everything was  but I especially was floored about the chimichurri  Chimi should be a veritable palate explosion of fresh parsley  garlic  vinegar and citrus  This was not    that  Absolutely awful  The potatoes were seasoned  and hot  We liked those  The salad was not a    salad  Unseasoned  with just a few drops of balsamic vinegar  and some very brown and sad avocado slices  Also bad  Perhaps we didn t order the right things  perhaps it was an off day  but as a Latina  I am absolutely astonished at the widespread love this place gets  Pittsburgh seems to never get Latin American food right  with an exception for the tacos at Las Palmas   and it is a damned shame that a place as mediocre  or even poor  as Gaucho has people jumping for joy  If only you folks knew how good this food really can be  I wish I could have you all over for the real deal
great food  the steak platter is awesome

I hate to be a Debbie Downer with this review  but I believe in being honest and not feeding into the hype because it s trending  I don t really understand the    rating for this place    I ll begin by saying the food is actually pretty good  It is certainly not the best we have ever had  but it was decent if you are a meat lover  They offer a variety of options located on the chalk board at the entrance of the restaurant  No menus   At least we were never offered any  Don t worry  you will have PLENTY of time to look at it as you will likely stand in line for a LONG time waiting to place your order at the counter   More on that to come   We  the party of    ordered the following   Mixed Grill which consisted of a presentable offering of chorizo sausage  chicken and sirloin  No sides  The sausage was the best  the chicken was very juicy and tender  the steak was just ok  but a bit chewy   Ribeye grill which included a small salad on the plate which was tasty  The ribeye was pretty good too    Since there are no real sides offered with either meal  we selected the corn pudding to share  It was also prepared well  but I thought could have used a bit more seasoning   We ordered water with lemon   Overall  the food was tasty  but the next segment of this review is what left a bad taste in my mouth    Wah   Wah    enter Debbie Downer   Here is where I take issue with this place  There is a complete lack of structure for their patrons to place orders and be seated  We spent more time in line waiting to get in the place than actually consuming our meal  It is set up like waiting at an extremely busy high priced fast food joint with better quality food  Hey  if you are into these trendy BYOB places and don t mind spending more time in line while you watch empty tables calling your name while you stand in line forever  go for it   Seriously  when we were finally seated  we watched several tables that were never occupied whilie dozens of folks continued to stand in line to order and wrap around the sidewalk outside  In my opinion  the message here is that the CUSTOMER s time is clearly the last thing on their mind  I will certainly keep that in my mind if and when we would ever consider going here again  Sadly  I doubt we will   I enjoy good food  but not at the expense of my time waiting in a long line and inflated prices  Just my   cents  or in this case     for dinner and no drinks  only water  I would give the food an    but the long and nonsensical system to be seated gets a    Sadly  I would give this place a final overall rating   just because of how frustrating the ordering process is set up  However  to end on a positive note  the servers were all friendly and laid back  But as I stated  I doubt we would go back   Wah   Wah
Lives up to all the hype  Best sandwich I have ever had in my entire life  Just go there
If you like meat  you must try Gaucho   Wonderful flavors
Superb   Just not much to say  except be prepared to wait in line  for a bit   But seriously worth it

I work just a few doors down from this place   whenever it s open it s ALWAYS packed  I believe I ve even seen the line go out the door upon a few occasions   So yea   the place is VERY good   The menu pretty much has anything you can think of from chicken  beef  pork    fresh fish prepared in a multitude of ways      they even will do special request orders if you don t see exactly what you want on their menu   WHAT          Some downers  LLLOOOOONNNNGGGG line to order   to get your food  Very tightly spaced place inside   a lil more open in their tiny patio but not by much    so be ready to get your food to go   go   Some helpful pointers  CALL in advance to place your order  especially if to go    you get I think a     off   so that s really nice  HOWEVER  because they are SO busy   don t expect them to answer right away    you may have to leave a message to get a call back or keep trying til you get thru    so yea   did I mention they re busy       In all in all   it s worth it    the food is excellent   I enjoy it immensely

This is the kind of food that makes you happy  It is that good  I had the Carne Sandwich with ribeye steak  caramelize onions and grill pepper with chimichurri sauce and let me tell you that it was amazing  I ordered by phone because usually the line in this place are very long   Now I know why  The smell in this place makes you hungry  The employees are very friendly  I can t wait to go back and try other stuff in the menu  Excellent food

I m a big fan of the pescado  that s fish  sandwich  Make sure to drench it liberally with whichever salsa you prefer from the salsa bar  and you won t be disappointed  Note that it can get pretty busy here around lunchtime  especially on nice summer days   so consider coming on the early side if you don t want to wait in line forever   I only have one minor complaint with the establishment    parts of the bread sometimes come out pretty burnt  and burnt food is a suspected carcinogen   But  you have to balance that with the deliciousness  so I figure it s worth it once in a while

Delicious  Totally loved the potatoes  we got there as soon as it opened so no wait  We got empanadas and they were super flavorful  especially with all of the great sauces they offer  We each got sandwiches  one carne filet medium rare and one braised beef  and they were both great  That bread is to die for    Staff was incredibly nice and helpful  Overall wonderful lunch
ALWAYS delicious   I had a friend in from out of town this weekend and took him here   he is still talking about it days later   Some of the best food in the city   by far

Hi  the food is excellent here  but service is horrible  We ordered to go and the cashier said it is courteous to tip on to go orders  Since I m ballin  I dropped a      Then  when I ate the to go order in their outdoor patio  which smelled like trash  they had the audacity to say that I was not welcomed since it was a to go order  There was plenty of open seating

I HATE waiting for anything  Here  I stood out in line in the blistering sun  Then waited more at my table  And WOW was it worth it  The steak is spectacular  Everything is so well executed  Highly recommended
Amazing place with really polite and cheerful staff   Great vegetarian options  Vegetable sandwich and empanadas are highly recommended   PS  though the line might be huge  its worth the wait

I ve always heard about people talking about gaucho  but never actually tried it until my third year in college  Each time I came I knew exactly what to expect  and gaucho never fails to deliver  The only downside is that the wait can be pretty long during primary dinner hours       pm and after   so if you go around      or earlier the wait time can be significantly reduced    The main thing that I typically order is the Carne De Vaca  which is a meat platter consisting of a cut of meat of your choice  sirloin  flank  etc    a side of salad  and bread  A few times  I have gotten two cuts of meat to split with my friend  one order of a large and another order of the small  This allows us to get a portion of meat in between a large and a small  and two cuts to try    I have also gotten the Carne  which is a sandwich based on a meat of your choice  This has really good peppers that complement the meat well  but to me I personally prefer the platters because they are more filing and have more meat overall   The last time I went  I shared the Asado plate with one other person  which gives you all five cuts of meat     oz total   It was a lot of meat and more pricey  but also very tasty and filling  In my opinion  though some cuts were more tender than others  I didn t think the difference was big enough for me to change my typical order of one of the cheaper meats in the platter   Overall a great experience and a must try for all those who visit or live in Pittsburgh

Simply outstanding food  I m now going to out myself as one of those avid Yelp users who has relied on Yelp     times  literally   all throughout the country  and recommends the app to everyone     and yet I ve never written a review  Today  I was inspired to do so by a phenomenal meal at Gaucho Parrilla Argentina   I can t remember previously seeing a full   star review on Yelp with     reviews  This restaurant deserves that status  My son and I had two steak sandwiches  one ribeye  one NY Strip  and both were absolutely delicious    perfect bread  excellent steak  killer sauces  and a just right balance of onion  pepper  and seasoning  Really  hard to make a sandwich much better  Sides were also absolutely top notch   shrimp  corn  and papas  Each were legitimately world class  If it sounds like I m exaggerating  I m not  My wife is a classically trained French chef and we re fortunate enough to have really high quality food pretty much every day  We ve eaten at terrific restaurants all over the country  and beyond    This place merits a five star review    I ll also say that from a service perspective  every person we interacted with there was kind  knowledgeable  and willing to talk about the history behind the place   They went above and beyond    A few caveats  just to manage expectations  First  BYOB  No corkage fee  but no alcohol there  Also  the place is charming but teeny    it probably seats less than eight people on counters and stools  If anything  this is more of a takeout place  definitely not white table cloth  Effectively  we re talking     on food  albeit with a limited menu  but a    on decor  Finally  be aware that Gaucho Parrilla Argentina closes at   PM and is closed on Sunday and Monday    So  if you understand the limitations of the place beforehand  make sure you come  You ll walk out saying that it was some of the best food you ve ever eaten  While I m from Pittsburgh originally  I live in Boston and in town for the Steeler game  I ll certainly be back at Gaucho the next time I m in the Burgh  A classic Yelp gem

Oh I looooove Gaucho   I remember when they were half the size  prior to the remodel  I didn t even mind the wait for a table  When I go  I love the Carne   It s my favorite   Parking is a bit of a challenge  but it is really worth it

One of my favorite spots in the city   The whole experience is handled with enthusiasm and confidence   And why not   When you re putting out marinated love you should be proud   Now if they only delivered

Who said you can t get a little bit Argentina in Pittsburgh  If madonna stopped in to this spot she be singing oh Argentina all over again  All I can say is no matter what you eat here you are going to be blown away the steak sandwiches melting your mouth as do just about everything else I ve tried  went on the strip get you a strip a steak at the Argentine

Not much to say that hasn t already been said here   Outstanding food  great service  fun atmosphere   Prices are a little steep but the amount of flavor packed in each meal is well worth it   Awesome little joint

Came for a late lunch and only a small line  They have a huge menu with so many choices  but settled on a medium rare ribeye sandwich  well prepared  but a little chewy   Also ordered empanadas  chicken  pork  and veggie  and they were all excellent  The different sauces were also very good  but my favorites were the red pepper and sweet onion  Would come back to try something different when in Pittsburgh

This place is absolutely amazing and worth it s    national yelp spot  Came on a Saturday so there was a bit of a wait  surprisingly only about    minutes total though which is unexpected   They have their menu up on a chalkboard when you come in and a few people pop in and out from behind the bar in order to make sure that you understand or can assist you with the menu  Be prepared to eat bread covered in delicious meat  The steak is absolutely phenomenal  I opted for the con carne sandwich on ciabatta with the arrechera  flank steak  meat  which isn t even the lomo filet  and I was amazed  It s also covered in Chimi and caramelized onions  which I adore  I had a side of a chicken empanada  which wasn t my favorite  but for those who wants a tad of spiciness in their selection  a good option to have    KB has destined for a bread binge  Each portion of Tostados are   large supple pieces of toast grilled in olive oil just waiting for that great opportunity to be dunked in one of gaucho s   ridiculously well crafted dipping sauces  We overzealously ordered   orders of Tostados  That s a lot of bread and a lot of dipping sauce  But SO worth it  In general  this WHOLE PLACE is SO worth it   The only downside to this place is that my picutre of my meal did not get more likes on Instagram  but i think that may be outside gaucho s control  Loving it  Gaucho  you make Pittsburgh proud
I go here with my gf and when the food comes  we literally do not speak to each other until the food is all gone
Excellent AUTHENTIC cuisine    Their homemade sauces are amazing

This is the best steak sandwich I have ever had  We go here almost every Saturday  Their sauces are quire exquisite as well    There is very limited seating inside  and a bit of a wait  but it s so worth it

The Gaucho is one of those special spots where taste and value are synchronized  The mixed grill with smoky sausage  chicken  and steak was oh so good and cooked to perfection         Even with my own delicious good in front of me  I couldn t help creep on our neighbors fatty    dollar sandwiches  It could easily find myself eating his multiple times a week after a good workout and not have my wallet empty  What more could you ask for

Solid place  a must if you re in the Strip   Got quick service on a Saturday night   uber friendly staff  good atmosphere  They were out of bread  like  all bread   the pork  fish  and steak empanadas  Instead  the server suggested ordering the papas and getting the sandwich filling over the potatoes  I asked if we could do that for the sandwich price  but he said no  Seems goofy  bread is clearly an important part of a sandwich  a starchy substitute should be gratis  fellas  Still  the dish was fine for the extra few bucks  and the papas were delicious  The rosemary beef was very tasty  but oh MAN was it salty  I m a big savory fan  but the beef was overseasoned  Veggie empanadas were not the soft  flaky pastry others have described  but were tough and barely warm  Nothing we were served was hot  which I wasn t a fan of    Got the last package of lemon alfajores  which were BANGIN   SO GOOD     Definitely going to come back earlier in the week and give this place another go  I ll be happy to change this review with a great next visit
Now physically expanded  Same quality  now more seating  This place continues to do it correctly

Was surprised by the extremely high rating in Yelp for this spot  but I love steak and went in hoping for the best  This place didn t disappoint  Food was incredible and so delish   For my first time  they recommended the steak sandwich which I got with a rib eye cut  you can choose the cut of steak for your sandwich   which was cool in and of itself   Steak sandwich was topped with sweet caramelized onions and roasted peppers which were packed with flavor  The location was really cool and trendy with Snoop Dogg and Easy E playing in the background  Staff was genuinely friendly and helpful  Definitely will be back

Outdoor seating has been reopened  Best time to come is late afternoon though because who doesn t want to enjoy the outdoors on the  Burgh  Really appreciate the table aide service  even though we are outdoors  And as always the food was delicious
Love this place  Unique but amazing food with a cool atmosphere  Just be aware they don t take reservations and the line on weekends can take hours  Great price for what you get

Wow  this place was amazing  The line was really long  if you ve ever driven past it usually is  but the food comes out very quick  The food was so delicious  We got the Picado that had meats  cheeses  fruits  and almonds  I got the Cerdo and my aunt got the Ribeye  they were both amazing  The carmelized onions  onyinz  were phenomenal  the toast was great  the salad was good  I can t think of one bad thing to say  The service was great as well  SOOOOOOOO worth the wait

My friends brought me here to try Argentinian food  I was EXTREMELY disappointed because I ordered steak medium cooked and it had little to no seasoning  I don t recommend ordering steak from this place  Order something else like their sandwiches  Also  there s no seasoning on the table so you eat what they serve you  You pay ahead as well even if you don t like your food  So they rob you if you aren t satisfied with your order  I don t agree with this business model whatsoever especially since you are required to tip ahead of time even without being served first  Who does that

Soooo good  Lots of flavor   I would definitely recommend the empanadas  Try with all the dipping sauces  The corn on the cob was grilled and excellent compliment to the fish sandwich I had  I love this place

Amazing  I could smell the place   blocks away  I m assume that this is what heaven will smell like   The line way a bit long but the anticipation of the food made it tolerable  An emploee explained the different sandwiches to me and even convinced me to get the carmelized onions  i had informed her that i don t like onions   I ordered   sandwiches to go  steak burger w arrugula   provolone cheese  pork w  carmelized onions   spicey mustard   rosemary braised beef w  carmelized onions   The steak burger   pork were incredible   The pork sandwich was maybe the best sandwich I ve ever had   Can t wait to try the rosemary beef later

Nothing can go wrong with wood fired grilling   Gaucho is the best  and the only one  place where you can try the perfect Argentine style grills in Pittsburgh  They grills almost everything  red meat  chicken  shrimps  veggies  you can tell  how their magical ingredient  the wood smoke can make greater   My favorites are wood smoked shrimps and veggie plate   They also have nice paella  available in big portion only   sea food soup  recommend    and pierogies   The meat quality  cut  part of meat  varies a lot depend on the portion size and or the day

There s always a line  but they deserve it  I stopped eating beef when I moved to Pittsburgh from the Midwest  Tried my husband s filet sandwich on our first visit  and it s now on my regular rotation of places to go and things to eat while working in the Strip District  Very tasty  high quality food  Grilled veggies are also fabulous  Try to get there when they open for lunch to beat the line

I pray to God that the owner sees this review  because I had briefly spoken with him once before and he seemed like a very genuine guy who cares about his business  So  here we go   I must preface this review by stating the following  I enjoy the food from this place moreso than any restaurant in Pittsburgh  It really is delicious  Unfortunately this is the absolute worst managed restaurant I have ever been to or seen  If not for the unbelievable food I would never come here  The line during the busy hours in unbearable  I can understand and even apprecuate a place that has a line because the product dictates higher demand  That is not the entire cause of the problem here  Yes  thenfood is fantastic and yes that makes them busy  but these people have no interest whatsoever in helping alleviate the problem  There is only ever   register open with   person taking orders  ONE  Meanwhile there is a second register sitting right there that no one uses while   guy stands there and does nothing but offer u a glass of water while you lose your mind  another older guy sits on his ass at the end of the counter doing nothing  and guy number   who im assuming is the worlds worst restaurant manager concerns himself only with the shape of the que that has formed and whether or not the door is closed  OPEN THE SECOND REGISTER YOU WORTHLESS FOOL  I cannot get over how much i love the food here  but by the time i get to order I am so completely disgusted and frustrated after having watched these clowns do nothing for    minutes that I wish I could bring myself to stop eating here simply out of spite  I have never been so overcome by anger and frustration at any restaurant before and it happens EVERY SINGLE TIME i come here  Anthony  please  Hire a good manager  I know a few great people with plenty of experience  Lose the clowns and get some help  Your cooking deserves better from your staff

Despite being a non beef eater  Gaucho has been on my radar for ages  and I finally made it in tonight   Ironically  I wasn t planning to come here  I was actually planning to go to a Mexican place in Lawrenceville   However  a bike path closure forced me to detour onto Smallman St   and I soon found myself in the heart of the Strip District at the corner of   st   A quick glance at my nearby bookmarked restaurants at     pm indicated that most of them were closed  but that Gaucho was open for another half hour   I realized this was my golden opportunity to try it  so after riding down a sketchy alleyway and parking my bike  in I walked   If this wasn t serendipity  I don t know what is   As I suspected  it wasn t busy  given how close it was to closing time   Upon being greeted by a guy by the register  I mentioned that this was my first time visiting  and he explained that there isn t table service  but that I could order off the chalkboard menu   I mentioned that I knew they were known for their steak sandwich  but that I didn t eat beef  and he explained how the turkey and chicken sandwiches differed   Based on his description  I decided to try the chicken  pollo  sandwich with some grilled corn on the cob  maiz    He mentioned that they were out of caramelized onions  but that he could put something else on instead  such as asparagus   I love asparagus  so I told him that sounded like a great idea   My order took about    min  to come up    As I was waiting  I overheard the guy who d waited on me speak to some customers seated at the counter   He told them how he started working there and became the manager  and how some of the menu offerings were developed   He also mentioned that he liked everything on the menu   It was clear that he has a great sense of pride in the business   When my order came up  I took it outdoors to the small patio adjoining the restaurant to eat  after getting some water  utensils  and all of the sauces   After taking the obligatory photos  I tucked in   It was delicious   The meat on the sandwich was so tender  it melted in my mouth  and the asparagus and mushrooms were perfectly grilled   The bread was fresh  chewy  and substantial   Although the sandwich came with some ajo  garlic  sauce on it  I added some more  as well as some of the red pepper sauce and the cebolla  onion  sauce   The corn made for a great accompaniment to the sandwich  esp  with all of the sauces drizzled on it   The employees were even kind enough to give me two ears instead of the normal one  either because they were small or due to it being near the end of serving hours   Aside from making occasional small noises  mmm  etc    I m pretty sure I didn t come up for air when eating   Given that they were deep in conversation for most of the time I was eating  I don t know if the couple seated on the patio noticed me  but if they did  they probably nicknamed me something like  Hungry  due to my rabid and shifty eyed devouring of the food   Indeed  that food was so good  I m glad I came alone so I didn t have to be embarrassed about my ravenousness or making a mess with the sauces   You know the food s great when you don t want any distractions
Amazing food  cute space  and efficient even when they are super busy and have a long line  This place is an absolute must in Pittsburgh
Food was spot on delicious  There s a reason the line is out for door for this joint
The food was outstanding  Steak was cooked perfectly  Absolutely worth the wait in line
Fantastic food and good service   The best steaks we ve had in the  Burgh

Gaucho is pretty good  Having gone a handful of times  I can t say it s line out the door good  but it s definitely worth checking out   I ve almost always ordered the Parrilloda Mixta in order to try a bunch of meats  but every time I kind of regret my decision  mainly because of the how tough the NY Strip is to get through  The chicken is good  but doesn t have too much flavor  so you ll be using their sauces to get through it  their sauces are excellent    If you re going with the red meat  I d definitely recommend the flank or lomo  They always seem to come out cooked to perfection  They season their meats with salt  traditional Argentine technique   so expect a sodium overload on flavor  and if you don t like salty  you probably won t like a lot of their food   The sides are hit or miss for me  The empanadas are okay  but they ve been pretty dry whenever I ve tried them  My favorite side is the Guacho Papas  I could eat these all day  Perfectly roasted potatoes  The humita is also phenomenal  I d definitely recommend the papas and humita if you re on the fence when ordering  I ve never had either of those let me down   Ultimately  where Gaucho succeeds is their great  personable staff  fast service  and mostly better than average food  Also their newer  expanded space is beautiful  Gaucho s struggles rest with inconsistent meat preparation  especially the oft overcooked  tough strip   being too salty for the salt averse customer  long lines on the weekends  and price  don t expect to leave Gaucho will a cheap bill   If you can get there in off hours  right after work  for example   the wait will be short and you can be in and out quickly  but I wouldn t put Gaucho in the must eat category that s necessary to justify standing in a line that wraps around the building  It s good  but it s never been THAT good  Enjoy

This place is absolutely amazing   I travelled to Pittsburgh for    months for work  eating out twice a day for the entire time   This is absolutely my favorite restaurant of all that I tried during that time     Suggestion  The meat is really amazing  so I would suggest that you separate it from the bread in the sandwich   The bread is great by itself as well

You ve already heard that the sandwiches are great  so I ll focus on the other aspects     There was obviously thought put into the decor and the design of the space   There s lots of great decorative accents and fixtures throughout   It s a small space  but super cute   The patio area also looked very cozy   Customer service was also great    Personally  I was really confused by the chalkboard menu   I had no idea what any of the categories were   I had to ask the cashier   Which ones are your sandwiches     and  What s all the other stuff    She was super friendly and was more than happy to explain their menu to me   When my sandwich was ready  the manager    brought me my sandwich and was also very friendly and even took the time to explain their sauces to me   Seriously  I was very impressed by the customer service    Not because they made any huge gestures  but it was the very genuine  unhurried  and unpretentious attitude and treatment that I received    We all know what it s like to walk into the new hot spot hipster hangout and get the typical unimpressed and unfriendly customer service      Now on to the sandwiches    I ve had their infamous steak carne sandwich before and it was delicious   Even as leftovers   So  this time I tried the Rosemary beef sandwich   Also very good  but could have done with a little more horsey sauce in my opinion   There s a big chunk of meat  so luckily I had taken the suggestions of the staff at Gaucho and gotten a little bit of the ojo sauce to add to my sandwich     All the other items looked so yummy  I can t wait to come with more people to try all the sides and options   If you haven t already given Gaucho Parrilla a try  make sure to stop by the next time you re at the strip   It s also on the end of the strip  so that makes it an easy stop for lunch if you work dowtown

The line does tend to wrap around the block  we saw it earlier in the evening   Tip  go later and go when it is raining  We experienced no wait under these circumstances  After our order  we waited very little time for our food to arrive at our table  The place is casual and you immediately feel comfortable  We got the fungos  Cremona mushrooms  shallots  sherry vinegar  rosemary   cammarones  grilled rosemary  garlic shrimp w  lemon   pescado   fish of the day   and asado platter  all   cuts of wood fired steak  This was the best meal of my Pittsburgh trip and I will be craving it a lifetime  No other shrimp will ever compare  The meat  oh the meat    All five cuts were perfectly medium rare  One tasted better than the other so I kept going back and forth  Loved the mushrooms  The fish was good but everything else overshadowed it  I ate until I was in pain  Service was friendly  We brought a bottle of wine to accompany our meal  The overprice for the quality resulted in a high value meal   I can t wait to return here

This place is the bomb  Food is cooked to perfection and the flavor is phenomenal  Line is always way too long but they do a good job of keeping it moving  Food is fresh and delicious  Staff is really friendly too

What can I add to the other reviews  What a great restaurant  Everyone I talked to loved their meals  I had the Cerdo  pork  plate with a Papas Dulce side  The small plate was more than enough for me and had wonderful tastes  Don t miss this Argentine treat
Delicious rosemary beef sandwich   Grits are amazing too   Most savory sweet potatoes I have ever eaten  Perfectly spiced  You must try this place

So another positive review of this place   YES  The steak is so good  Seasoned perfectly and cooked just right  I got the steak sandwich with NY strip steak  It was a lot of food and was delicious  My wife got the flank steak on a plate and about ate the plate that came with it    The yellow rice unfortunately left something to be desired  It was bland and relatively flavorless but the steak more than made up for it    There are other meats on the list as well but I don t know if I will ever try them because of how good the steak is    Mmmmmmmm

Might be one of the best places to eat downtown period  Love the chimichurri s and bread  The meat is ok too  I need to try the chorizos next they looked awesome  I would say half of the employees were really nice
Amazing food at decent prices but they need to change their ordering seating procedure

Amazing  I can t believe how good the food is at Gaucho  I ve only eaten here once but will definitely be back many more times  The veggie sandwich is one of the best veggie sandwiches I ve ever had  The concept was pretty basic but they managed to make it taste SO good  Also the grilled corn on the cob  perfect  At first I was a little skeptical  when the food came out the corn looked really bland  But oh my goodness did it taste so good  Just the right amount of butter and grill flavor  The only dish I feel that was a little bit lacking was the Provoletta appetizer  It was just a piece of toasted bread with melted cheese on top and a side of arugula with a tiny bit of dressing  I feel the dish could have been a little more creative  I liked the grilled cheese concept but the bread was really hard and thick and the cheese could stand to be a little more gooey  And the arugula needed more dressing and maybe some diced grilled peppers or little pieces of fresh mozzarella  anything to add more flavor  Not worth ordering the Provoletta  try another appetizer instead   Highly recommend Gaucho  Can t wait to go back

There s no rave I can make that hasn t been made here already  BUT  the accolades bear repeating  Get to Gaucho and get yourself the best beef in the  Burgh  Bar none  Holy cow  pun not originally intended  but okay  I ll roll with it   this place is amazing   In the mood for a steak sandwich  Well  what kind  Your choice of flank steak  skirt steak  ribeye  strip or filet  Or how about chicken  Or shrimp  Chorizo your thing  Or possibly the fish of the day  All piled high on a HUGE ciabatta style bread with your choice of toppings  and sauces  Chimichurri  pimienton  garlic   I can t remember what the other one is  Want some grilled veggies on that  There are too many to list   just ask for what you want  chances are they ll have it   Going light and want a salad instead  I had the Gaucho salad with the skirt steak  grilled tomatoes  carrot  avocado  asparagus and roasted corn all piled high on fresh  beautiful greens  Or maybe you d prefer the Argentino with roasted potatoes and portobellos   Get ready for sides of corn on the cob roasted in the husk over the wood fired grill  Oh  All the meats and proteins are grilled over wood that you ll see stacked in the back and in the front under some of the counters  That s part of the secret of the flavor   Desserts  too  are pretty darn special   Not much seating  but there are a few stool and counters inside and a few tables outside  Get there while the weather is beautiful   come to think of it  it might still be worth it sitting in    degree weather in your parka just to savor the flavor of smoky summer ish goodness

Love this restaurant  The grilled meats  veggies  salsas  tostados are very good   The indoor decors are festive and colorful   Get the Parillada Mixta  a sampler plate of meats  The meat empanadas are best   The salsas are great  especially the Ajillo one   There is always a long line to be seated  so be patient  or come in at non peak hours

Awesome ribeye steak sandwich  awesome corn  the staff is very friendly  the food speaks for itself with the flavor of the wood in everything  The only thing I didn t care for was the soggy bun  it didn t really matter that much once I bit into the delicious sandwich  that had ribeye steak  caramelized onions and roasted red peppers with chimmichuri sauce  One recommendation would be to cut the meat against then grain  then when your biting into the sandwich you don t pull whole chunks of ribeye out and have to pick up with your fingers  With that being said  yummy and I will be back

Read a lot about the wait and it was out the door when we got here  Get here about an hour before close as they stop the line near that point  Also BYOB  All that said the food is worth the wait  The steak was cooked just right and had a great spice

Went for a late lunch  so it wasn t too packed  You walk in and order at the counter  and the staff was incredibly helpful and patient  There are a variety of sauces you can get  which were all excellent  especially the chimichurri  We ordered a sandwich as well as an actual steak  Both were delicious  as we re the sides  and the sandwich came on bread that was toasted and perfect for absorbing all the juices  Definitely a must go for anyone in Pittsburgh

I ve been meaning to come to this place years ago when they first opened but never had the opportunity to do so   either because something came up or the long was awfully long  However the opportunity presented it self as I had to visit Heinz History Center for a morning event  Since it was only few minutes walk from the center  it was the perfect excuse and time to finally pay Gaucho a visit   Although there wasn t any line outside  the inside line was a different story  The order line was pretty cramped and right around to a point where any additional people would have to wait outside  As I was standing on the line   the long list of menu on the chalk board was somewhat overwhelming but you can always ask to the people before or after you for recommendation  And pretty much everyone will recommend something different  I looked up on Yelp and since I was craving beef   I went with the Rosemary Roasted Beef  I also ordered a  Dog Bone     Yes you heard me correct   A Dog Bone for my new puppy     The folks behind the counter are super friendly and helpful  Once you order  someone will guide you to a seat and your food will be at the table in no time  If you are with someone   I would recommend both ordering something different since the sandwiches are pretty big that you can actually split among the two  However  I cleaned out the entire sandwich by myself  The roast beef juicy  well seasoned and just cooked to perfection  Caramelized onion and horsey sauce made it just perfect without overpowering the roast beef  If you want more variety of flavors there are   specialty sauces that you can add   The atmosphere here is very casual  industrial like or may be I should say farmhouse like  specially with all the stacked woods  and lively  Everything is reasonably priced especially for the portion you get  Like me don t let the long lines discourage you  It s definitely worth a visit

I didn t review this place  I came here a year ago  and I m STILL thinking about it  In fact  I was just browsing photos when I realized I didn t review it   I live in Cleveland  but I am literally planning a trip to Pittsburgh just to eat at Gaucho    I had the chicken  and it was the most amazing meal I ve ever had  Well okay I don t know  but it sure was close  The best part is the   different sauces that you can have pretty much unlimited amounts of with your meal  I kept going back and getting more  I was even eating them with a fork     Get here early or be prepared to wait a long time  The line was out the door at lunch time and we got the last table in the place  It s just that good

I don t know if there s a better place in Pittsburgh to eat red meat  This place is wonderful  The inside is small and isn t truly  sit down   though there are a few places to sit stand   the patio next door does provide seating and is a great place to eat some meat  Added bonus  it s BYOB  and the staff is always a pleasure   The steak samplers are the way to go with sides of potatoes  corn on the cob  mushrooms  and or vegetables  The lazy susan with their sauces is amazing and they are all delicious  We ve had less luck with the sandwiches  which are still good  but I thought the rosemary braised beef had too much meat   was too soggy and needed a crunchy ingredient  such as pickled onions or arugula  I also though the empanadas were a little ho hum   My biggest wish is that they d extend their weekend hours later

After hearing all of the hype about Gaucho Parrilla  I decided to finally check it out after months of wanting to go  There was a group of six of us that decided to go on a Wednesday evening at  pm  The line was out the door and down the street when we got there  and it was pretty cold out   We waited in line for a total of about an hour before we ended up ordering our food and getting a table  The staff was very nice and when we got through the door  they offered to get open our wine for us and get us wine glasses while we waited  Gaucho is BYOB with no corkage fee  which is a huge plus  The six of us brought a total of four bottles of wine to split between us   I ordered  the large Provoletta as an appetizer  My fianc  and I decided to split our meals  so I ordered the large Cordero  lamb  and the large Bire de Chorizo  NY strip  for us  Both were cooked perfectly  I loved all of the flavors  Make sure to try all of the sauces that they have  They compliment the meal perfectly  I have no complaints at all about Gaucho  and I would highly recommend visiting  even if it includes having to wait outside in the cold in line  Gaucho definitely lived up to all the hype and I will be returning in the future

The new standard in what a restaurant should be  The steak will blow you away  Everything I have tried there has been great  This is the one place that never fails to meat  that s a pun  or exceed my expectations  This is hands down my favorite restaurant in all of Pittsburgh  If you try it once I m sure it will be your new favorite as well
always the long line in this place but it worth the wait Ribeye is awalys my favorite
Delicious  Had rib eye plate  we tried all the sauces each one had awesome flavors  Also had an order of veggies and potatoes  All I can say is everything was incredible  So happy we stopped there

I am staying at the Omni William Penn for work and was looking for something different than room service    I was not disappointed  The sauces are so flavorful and the right amount of spicy  I had two pork empanadas and kicked myself for not getting more  The flank steak was cooked to medium perfection and so flavorful  I ve been to Pittsburgh many times and this is by far my favorite restaurant  I will definitely be back to try more menu items  Oh  and the service was excellent
I crave Gaucho on the regular  And those sauces  whoa  Anthony and his staff are great

Meat had good flavoring  Loved the variety of sauces available  Vegetable empanadas are the best  I also had chicken empanadas  but feel in love with the veggie  Sevice was excellent  Only gave it a   due to gnats near our table and sauces

The Strip District  Pittsburgh s home to most ethnic foods and fresh seafood  recently got a new neighbor   a restaurant serving up wood fire grilled fare from Argentina  I am not familiar with Argentinian food  so I was eager to try it out when I heard about the place  The space is next to the   th street bridge Near Altar Bar   so the cold weather had prevented me from making the hike up  until there was a nice warm break and I was finally able to walk up   The space itself is minimal  imagine a pizza shop       of the building is dedicated to the kitchen  the remaining     is left to standing room  There are about   countertops to eat at  but no stools  On the wall there is a menu  written in chalk  separated into about   sections  Small Plates  Hambre  Hungry   Salads  and Con Pan Sandwiches   There are   types of condiments in jars in the middle of the restaurant which are there for your tasting pleasure  Chimichurri Herbs  oil  lemon   Ajo garlic   Cebolla onion   and Pimenton Roasted pepper   Gaucho also offers various ways to receive     off on different days  Wednesday  show your facial hair doesn t have to be real  ladies    Friday  show your fashion flare    So far I ve had tastes of quite a bit of the menu   The Vegetales sandwich     I think   two steak sandwiches Flank and ribeye      lets you choose from any beef they offer   Shrimp          hambre menu    Empanadas Beef  onion  and hard boiled egg         Chorizo      small plate menu   and a pollo sandwich      The empanadas were hands down the best that I ve ever tasted Which should be taken with a grain of salt   the steak is incredibly flavorful and juicy  the shrimp were very large  with a sprig of rosemary stuffed into the back of each one and a lemon that was charred on the grill as well  The chorizo was full of peppery flavor and just a little bit spicy  and the veggie sandwich was piled high with peppers  zuchinni  and asparagus my friend ordered without portabello     You can also order two slices of oiled  grilled bread for     The bread here  a fresh ciabatta  is stunningly delicious  soft throughout and a crust that  while chewy  won t resist you as you bite into your sandwich  I highly recommend ordering the bread so you can try out all of the condiments  I m a sucker for caramelized onions  so the cebolla is my favorite  but the ajo is a close second  with the others also being incredible    I ve only gone around     pm  and there is usually a short line  but I m not sure how this place handles around dinner time  or during the lunch rush  I asked about catering and the chef said that one day they ll be able to  He also said that he dreams of doing a whole cow roast one day   a goal that I can wholeheartedly stand behind   Gaucho is a welcome addition  and I am sure I will find myself a regular here  If you work in the strip or downtown  block of some time and make the walk  If you don t  then drive down on the weekend or for dinner  Their website sums it up nicely   Eat Gaucho
The wait is usually pretty long  but food is literally amazing
Food was okay  Steak was close to warm instead of hot and the char was just a tad bitter  Had better authentic Argentinian food in other cites

Small  and I mean really small restaurant at the end of the strip district  Specialty is Argentinean style meats  If you are a meat lover  this place is a must  although they do have some vegetarian options  Try the sauces  they compliment the meats   Love the place  only negative is that they close rather early       p m

This place rocks  Great atmosphere  cool layout that adds to the vibe  great service  and down right well cooked food   I just stopped in Pittsburgh for the day and was pointed in the right direction with this place   Had a large order of med  Rare Flank covered in Chimichurri  side salad  Toast  and a side order of shrooms  Definitely will be back the next time I m in Pittsburgh
Hear a lot about it and finally decided to try  Awesome food  service was great  Fast  helpful  and very willing to accommodate change up their options  Would love to go back

I honestly can say  this is the most phenomenal food I have tried in PA   hands down  The employees were excited about their product  the other customers were exuberant about the place  and we had an incredible experience  The corn  rice  pollo sandwich and steak sandwich     all were incredible  We WILL be back

I have been here a few times now   I love the expansion on the side  Now you can order and eat  before it was a tiny place and you had to get it to go most times  The food always seems fresh and different than the usual burger sandwich places

The meat choices perfect  busy place  very good flavour s but what threw me off a little bit was the char the meat the pulled pork was absolutely perfect and the chicken wings were Really good i could do with a tad spicier but if I were to go again these would be the dishes I d order

Can t miss place   In the spring and summer I miss the Brussels Sprouts  but this weekend the Humita made up for that   Be sure to order this side dish    Goes well with the pork    You ve been made aware of the long line   don t be bothered with that   Stick it out

We had the rosemary steak sandwich with meat and cheese tray   The meal was excellent as usually   We brought a bottle of wine  they uncorked as we ordered   They have wine glasses there for your use   Order extra grilled toast their dipping sauces are terrific

This little hole in the wall in the Strip is serving up some yummy grilled food  The first time we tried to go here they were out of chicken  and I don t usually eat beef  so we went elsewhere  I thought about docking them a star for this  as actually having the food that s being offered on the menu is a big part of running a successful restaurant  but  after having eaten here  I think the place is   star worthy    There is no table service here  and really no tables other than the ones on the patio outside  There are a few barstools inside  but the comfort level is low  as you have people milling about  either standing in line or waiting for their to go orders  and the space underneath the stools where your legs and feet would normally go is taken up by stacked wood  As a side note I ll say that it s too bad there s no place in the Strip  such as a small park or some other public area  where people can go and congregate   it would be a nice addition to the neighborhood  and there are a couple of take out places that could benefit  The outside tables were all taken when we arrived  so we ate at the counter on the barstools  We ordered the chicken from the  hambre  side of the menu  and sides of the grilled veggies and gaucho potatoes  This was a good amount of food for the two of us  The chicken comes  picked  and served with their onion sauce  a delicious concoction of caramelized onions that have been pureed and seasoned  The veggies were grilled perfectly  and the potatoes were delicious  We helped ourselves to the sauces they offer   a roaster red pepper sauce  a garlicky ajo and their version of chimichurri  that Argentinian staple  All were very good  They really know how to cook here  and the food is delicious  I hope they become successful enough to afford a move to roomier digs at some point in the future  In the meantime  I ll still go and hope for an empty barstool

What makes this place unique is their originality  Rosemary and beef   Who would have thought those flavors jive   Be prepared to wait a bit   It s worth it    All Sandwichs come on a freshly baked  Artisan made roll   Shazam    Must check out when your in the strip district

Hands down  my favorite place in Pittsburgh  You can t get better food quality for this price  And the restaurant allows BYOB  You seriously can t go wrong  There is always a line that wraps around the building itself  so I recommend that you go on non popular dining times to really enjoy  I recommend filet sandwich and use all of the toppings that are offered to dip the bread and meat in at the table  The mussels are to die for as well

This place is amazing  I had to drag my boyfriend here but he was thanking me afterwards  Skip the filet mignon cut and get the steak sandwich with ribeye cut  Ribeye just tastes better than filet mignon on bread  It comes with roasted red peppers and caramelized onion on ciabatta bread  Dip it in the fantastic chimmi churri for a good time

This place is so good   Having spent   months in Argentina  I  do love a good parrilla  w  bomb chimichurri   and this is legit  And BYOB  However  the timing is key  since there are no reservations and the line can be insane   When they do the basement chef s tasting menu  you can reserve in advance  and skip the line  worth it

We wanted a  cheap  preview of this restaurant  so we chose the steak sandwiches  I had ribeye  hubby had flank  Word to the wise  get the deconstructed option right off the bat  else you will just do it yourself  We tore the delicious bread into hunks and paired it with the perfect bite of fire roasted peppers and caramelized onions and steak  trying each sauce  My hubby like the green best  but I couldn t get enough of the red  The dessert of the day was to die for  It was worth the wait in line  May I also add that the ability and encouragement to get your own water and sauces is perfect  I hate asking waiters for a ton of stuff  Great atmosphere
Just get the steak burger and all your troubles will disappear  Awesome outdoor seating as well  I will definitely be coming back

So  Good  Other than the staff getting really perturbed with you if you aren t standing in the correct spot  due to long lines out the door   it s incredible  Note  get there early   Go with a group  Get everything  Share  You ll be really full halfway through but press on    You re welcome
I loved Gaucho Parilla  The rosemary beef was really good and with a little sauce  it was amazing  Easily the best food I ve had since moving to Pittsburgh in   months

THE Question to ask yourself at this place is  does the good food make up for the Mean Nazi like seating system that requires customers to wait outside in    degree temps   and don t block the effing  entrance  versus being seated in any of the abundant empty tables    The old man acting bossy boss was downright rude from the moment I walked in   How bout kindly saying  hey  do you mind sitting at a bar stool till your food is ready   I m seating people who have gotten food already in these tables     my spouse was in line ordering instead he was aggressive and rude  Stupid system and mean customer service   Rudeness can easily outweigh good food   Answer   not worth it

Get the flank steak  and add chimichurri  That is my advice  You can t go wrong here  Everything is amazing  They have   sauces that you can help yourself too  but the chimichurri is easily the best  All of their entrees are fantastic but I can t stray away from their steak  The potatoes are a perfect side dish  I ve never been disappointed here

Read about this place on Yelp and since I was in town for a few days  I knew I had to try it  We ordered the shrimp  carne hanger steak sandwich  grilled veggies  potatoes  grilled corn  and   bottled waters  Our total was almost       That s a little high for what I m accustomed to paying for basically a carry out joint  but hey  you only live once    While we waited  I stocked up on the sauces because I wanted to make sure I had the opportunity to sample each one  The chimi sauce is awesome  btw  We got our food and we were off to the hotel room to enjoy it  I started eating the potatoes in the car because    They smelled delightful     I m pregnant  And     Who gon  check me  boo     You could tell the potatoes were batch cooked because some were piping hot  while others were just luke warm  It s a good thing my parents were in Michigan because the flavor of those hot potatoes would ve made me slap my mama  Seriously though  the fresh potatoes were very  very good    The corn was awesome  My hubby thoroughly enjoyed his shrimp and veggies  The flavor of my hanger steak sandwich was off the charts  but it not as tender as one would hope  The toughness of the steak caused me to deduct a star  Overall  this is a solid place with great food and awesome flavors  Definitely a must try

If you love steak  you will love this place  Everything we ordered was fantastic  I suggest ordering smaller portions of the steak so that you can try more cuts and really figure out what you like  BYOB is a fantastic perk  My boyfriend and I did not have to wait for more than   minutes to get a table on a Thursday night  which was great
This place is awesome   Try the steak sandwich   You wont regret it   Great place for a quick lunch   The food is awesome and the service is quick and friendly
