Mmmmm tasty    I ordered the small flank which was accompanied by a rich salad of dark greens  radishes and carrots  and a large slice of toast  The steak was cooked to perfection  I did not participate in any of the sauces unfortunately  My fresh garlic allergy did not allow me  The only reason I knocked off a star was because I ordered my meal without garlic anywhere due the allergy and my steak came out with the chimi sauce on it  which does in fact contain fresh garlic  So  I had to send it back  which I really loathe doing  The staff was great about getting me a new steak quickly  however  the rest of my party had already consumed a good portion of their meal because we had to get back to the office

Maybe I need to go here a few more times and try more things  Ultimately  I liked my steak sandwich  but I think my expectations were too high  We arrived early on a weekday and there was no line  I really didn t have time to read or understand the menu as we didn t wait in any line  The menu to me was confusing with too many options  I got the steak sandwich with hangar steak  The bread was very good  It was so messy though  I think I went through about    napkins  I don t recommend this for a first date or a lunch during the work day  We also had the cauliflower which was ok also  I have had much better  If I lived in the area  I would give it another shot  Maybe I just didn t have the right thing

As a non real meat eater  I didn t think there would be anything for me here  But  I eat fish  and they have fish  and it is AMAZING  The shrimp was really really good and the BF enjoyed some pork and steak    And the owner is pretty cool

frozen chicken and dried up old salad  no thanks  I gave this place two     tries  and every time I have left disappointed  As many have said  once they expanded they dropped significantly in food quality and have now turned this once great place into an eat n park  The original place was about quality food and good service  now it s about making money and trying to cater to the masses  Will not go back

This place is so small you probably can miss it if you re walking down the street   What you won t miss is the smell   The odor of wood burning and meat can be experienced well down the street   You know how smell and taste senses are tied together   Yes  that     The place is really tight inside   There s only bar stool seating along the perimeter of the dining area and a table in the middle with sauces   The set up can be a bit uncomfortable in a sense that everybody is facing a wall or outside and there are people waiting for their orders and or seats to open up   I was in line and my wife took the only   seats that were available for myself and her as I was in line waiting to order   Another couple was ahead of me ordering their food and I wasn t sure if they were eating in or taking out   Another person waiting around was waiting for his take out   Well after that couple ahead of us had finished ordering they had nowhere to go just standing in the middle of the floor as all the stools were taken and some other customers that were done eating seemed to just be sitting around and talking and not really making room for new customers looking to have a seat and eat their food   I had ordered a chicken sandwich and a steak  rib eye  sandwich   While the flavors of these sandwiches were absolutely amazing the steak we both had a hard time with  we split each sandwich in half and shared each    The steak seemed to be really tough to bite through chew   Don t get me wrong the taste was absolutely amazing but the meat seemed rather tough to bite and chew for rib eye   The portions are very generous   The amount of meat on these sandwiches are NOT skimped at all     Along with the sandwiches I had ordered a corn and the roasted potatoes  papas    The potatoes were amazing but I really had to wait a while for them to cool off as they were really hot   I guess the tip for future is steak is good but not in a sandwich because it s juicy and the bread gets a little mushy and the meat is too hard to bite   A plate that we can cut with a knife and fork would probably be better   I m not sure of the rib eye as the meat was generous and thick cut  the meat seemed less tender than I as expecting for rib eye steak     If it wasn t for the toughness of the steak sandwich I could easily grant   stars for Gaucho   I would love to try the pork loin next time   For the   sandwiches  potatoes  corn and one Limonata the bill came out to just under    bucks   Not a bad deal for the quality they pump out of this hot spot

So good  I have been trying to come here for ages  and I am so glad I finally made it  I had the vegetales con pan  a vegetable sandwich  and it was so good  I also had the grilled corn on the cob  which was also amazing    The line was long  but it was worth it  The vibe of the restaurant is also very cool  The man who took our order was extremely friendly  Once you order your food  you take a seat anywhere and a waiter will walk around calling the name you gave for the order until they find you  It s a cool experience  There s definitely a long wait for the food  but it s totally worth the wait

As soon as you drive in front of Gaucho Parrilla your stomach starts growling because the Argentinian grill smell that comes from this place is just awesome    I shared the asado plate with my wife on my first  and only visit so far  to Pittsburgh and I thought it was just delicious  Being on a low carb diet  it is hard finding good stake dishes without all the other very tempting sides but this one needs no sides   The only temptation was the buttery bread that came with the dish that my wife and son were raving about    All five cuts of beef served were great quality tasting meat  very tender  very juicy  and perfectly cooked  I like my steak medium medium rare     On a plate with NY strip  filet  sirloin  and flank  I thought the skirt stake was the winner  I would love to try their chorizo  I can t wait to return    The restaurant is very informal without waiters  you order at the counter and they bring the food to you  so seating space could be an issue  But it wasn t for us    All I have to say is that  given I am on a high protein low carb diet  I would be going to this place every single day if they opened this restaurant in the DC metro area  But  for now  I will be content with the fact that I can only eat here when I visit Pittsburgh so this is a required stop for us when we return

DON T CRY FOR ME ARGENTINAaAaAaAaA    I finally tried this Argentine chacusary styled restaurant  There is a line outside so you know something is up   See  the way it works is you order your food from the chalkboard and pay for it  collect your drinks  sit down and get served one time only  You have to walk around and find your own water and drinks but they still want a tip    I ordered the Carne steak sandwich with roasted peppers and I chose sirloin meat  I ordered the side of rosemary garlic clove potatoes which I ate with my sandwich which boosted the flavor  Everything is slightly charred   It was fun to try different styled food
I had an absolutely incredible salad with shrimp   The only downside was the lack of seating during lunch  but good for them   Fast  reasonably prices  delicious

If I worked closer  I d have my lunch here daily  Filet sandwich hit the spot but the sides are the real deal  We had the roasted red potatoes  mushrooms and corn  Delicious  Plus  all the homemade sauce options are bottomless  Try as many as you want  and get as much as you want  What s better than not having to ask for extra extra extra extra hot sauce

Wow  my favorite place for steak without a doubt  Argentinian style steak so highly seasoned and a great char  Small location and usually about a half hour wait  No seating in restaurant but a few high tops for eating  I would definitely recommend eating at the location as on the   occasions that I have gotten takeout my beautiful medium rare has turned to medium well due to carryover in the box    Amazing food and people a must visit

My boyfriend and I were passing through Pittsburgh on the way to the airport and needed lunch  Thanks to yelp  we went to Gaucho and were extremely happy  Between the two of us  we had the hanger steak  rosemary braised beef sandwich  steak empanadas  and maiz  Everything was delicious  we will definitely be going back if we are ever in Pittsburgh again  The place is quaint and cute  the staff very friendly  I highly recommend
My sandwich was awesome   the grilled veggies were phenomenal  I ll definitely be back

Great place for delicious steak in a low key atmosphere  Also had salad and roasted vegetables which I also enjoyed  Aside from generally being a tasty choice  if your dietary persuasion is of the paleo keto variety  this place should be   A on the list
Never disappoints   except the long lines outside    Always an excellent go to with vegetarian options available in addition to delicious perfectly cooked meat options as well

Yum  I m in love  what we had  Ribeye  wings  beef empanadas  wings  potatoes  corn  brown sugar pineapple bread pudding   Amazing  Worth waiting in line  BYOB if you want alcohol  The line moves really fast   the service was good  Excellent first experience  I ll be back

Oh my gosh  this is just outrageous  literally one of  the best things I have ever tasted   The sauces are on another level and the meat is to die for   I ordered my steak burger medium but it came out medium well  who cares it still tasted like heaven on earth   Huge caramelized onions  melt in your mouth cheese  delicious meet and some of the best sauce I have ever had   I m upset that I have been waiting so long to try Gaucho out   The line is always crazy so I chose to call ahead for take out  This could be one of  if not the best places in Pittsburgh  Try all the sauces and do not hesitate to order large portions  you will absolutely crush your meal    I am so excited to go back and try different things   Please go to Gaucho it is worth the wait  the prices are fair and the food is unmatched

Yuuu up  This spot is the  ish    This was one of our last meals in the great state of Pennsylvania and we couldn t have ended on a higher note   The staff is outstandingly rad  the food is truly executed to perfection and the atmosphere is so casual cool that you ll think you re on a picnic   We had    New York strip   bone in chicken  breast and thigh    I know what Chef Boyfriend likes    house made chorizo    grilled veggies   and ALL the sauces    My only regret is that we hadn t brought a baller bottle of Argentinean Malbec to wash down all this smoky  meaty goodness  The shop is BYOB and you definitely should   They ll be closed for a bit while they expand the restaurant  yay    but as soon as they reopen  so yourself a solid and get yer butt down there

Everything we got was delicious  The line wasn t too long  We only waiting    minutes or less  The meats were all amazing  The corn on the cob was my favorite part of the meal  Will definitely go again  Would have given   stars  but it was a little pricy  Wonderful food though

Incredible food  a bit pricey too  For such a well reputed place I wanted to give it my all and got the     steak sampler which included every beef cut they serve  Each one was made to perfection medium rare  The seasonings of cilantro  onions and garlic was excellent  I don t recall the name of their one vinegar less sauce but that was to die for  The ribeye me was my favorite and if I go back I will get a sandwich of that now that I had the pleasure of trying all through the sampler  Despite the popularity and long line it moved surprisingly quickly  The place draws both locals and  Tourists alike  A must when visiting Pittsburgh
Had steak sandwich  a little too fatty for me   Kind of expensive  Small place  but fun   Rest of meal was good to go    Will definitely go back

The food was very good thus the   stars   But waiting in line is a deterrant to a repeat visit  Also having to BYOB is inconvenient   We also felt rushed as it s hard to enjoy your meal seeing other patron s eyes on you waiting for you to move so they can sit and eat   We went around   in the afternoon  so the line wasn t horrible  but we felt rushed to order when we finally got to the counter   We got the Paella to share with our party of    as it was huge along with potatoes and the roots as sides   In some ways this dining style reminds me of Chipotle  just at a higher level   Food was tasty  just wish the place would expand into a bigger space

My mouth is still watering from the incredible meal I had here  We ordered the filet mignon sandwich  cauliflower  green beans and pork sandwich  Not to mention the   different types of sauces they had and boy do I love sauces  The chimichurri was super tasty as was the onion one as well  It s BYOB with NO cork fee  Can t beat that  I would highly recommend this place  The food was phenomenal and fresh  and the atmosphere was welcoming  It can get a little loud in there but it just adds to the excitement and conversation  The line was out the door but it was beyond worth the wait  You order first at the counter then get seated and given wine glasses and they call out your name for your order  I ll be back for sure  It s not everywhere you can get non dry meat and flavorful too  Yes please

Expertly executed beef with deep maillard crust  fresh beef flavor  exquisite sauces  and big soft garlicky bread  Executed in the Argentinian  Gaucho  tradition    Expect to wait in line for this meal  It s well worth it  I ordered the Carne Sandwich with the Ribeye option  The Ribeye was perfectly tender  cooked exactly to my medium rare preference  The crust was salty  deeply savoury  and slightly reminiscent of green aromatics  This is some of the best beef I ve ever had  It is unquestionably worth the price just for this beef    The sandwich comes on a buttery type of foccacia slathered in garlic sauce  The bread is soft and chewy  It s quite excellent  However  I found it to hide the flavors of the ribeye too much  So I pulled apart the sandwich and ate it in pieces    The sandwich is topped with carmelized onions and red peppers which balanced the sandwich s flavor profile with sweet and acidic notes    I tried the Ajo and chimi sauces  I found the chimi sauce to be a bit too  green  for the ribeye  I much preferred to dip into the Ajo  Garlic     Gaucho is clearly an iconic part of the contemporary moderately priced Pittsburgh food landscape  The attention to detail and respect for natural flavors is executed at a world class level  If you come to Pittsburgh and like food  skip all the carby sandwiches and come first to Gaucho

I regret not trying this place sooner  Just the smell when you first walk in is intoxicating  Just as a warning there is not much seating area so I would recommend going for take out or go during an off time     I ordered the hanger steak which came with a salad and toast and some sort of saut ed onions  This dish was very  very flavorful and looked as amazing as it tasted  I usually take a picture of every dis I order  however  I was too hungry and the smell was just too good for me to waste any time taking a picture  It is basically medium rare though so if you are not into that then maybe try something else or ask for it to be cooked more  It was certainly an adventure for me because I am more of a medium person and like seeing pink not red  My friend ordered the Carne sandwich with rib eye and man it was bigger than I thought it would be  It  Was  Incredible  I would for sure recommend this dish to try first  There are also   sauces to choose from on a table and since I am a big fan of sauce and it was my first time I decided to try them all as a dip to the sandwich and toast that came with the hanger steak  They all add even more depth and tastiness to the food  Either way the flavors are there    Lastly  The service was great and comforting  I don t know if it was the manager or the owner of the place that asked how the flavors were and made sure we were happy with our dishes  but it was a great surprise to see someone care so much for the outcome of everyone s food  Basically just go and go now

I really really enjoy this place  I think the food is just simply wonderful  My husband and I typically get the same feast every time we go  we ll start with the provoletta and picada  and we ll both typically get the rosemary braised beef sammy  OMG to all of the above  especially the provoletta and the sandwiches  Great place

The quality of the food at Gaucho is outstanding  I tried the NY strip  pork  cauliflower  potatoes  and empanadas  all of which were delicious  We waited in line outside for a hour on a Saturday night and it was worth every minute  After we finally reached the counter and ordered we were quickly seated and our food arrived about ten minutes later   Gaucho is BYOB and we brought a bottle of wine which they opened and poured for us   An excellent overall dining experience made exceptional by the amazing quality of the food

Food was good  but since you order at a counter  you don t have a server  but someone will bring your food  Don t go expecting to sit  relax  dine  and talk with friends  They will start clearing around you  It s all about turning the tables

Fun atmosphere and good food  The empanadas were excellent  I ordered the Cerdo  pulled pork   It had excellent flavor  but was a bit salty  The roasted cauliflower and red potato sides were OK  but I d skip them in the future so I had more room for the main course  The peanut butter and chocolate bread pudding was also great  The staff was friendly and efficient  There was a line out the door when we got there  but we moved through pretty quickly and were given a table as soon as we ordered  Definitely a fun place and worth the visit
Amazing food and super friendly staff  definitely worth the wait  I love the empanada and the small meatball plate  Also the sauces there are amazing  definitely try them all

Just as good  Definitely crowded on a Saturday afternoon  I got in at       and had to wait in line to order but when I left the line was out the door and around the corner    I need to remember to get my steak medium  I usually get medium well but I was served well done    This time around I tried the wings which were very good  the potatoes which were overly seasoned probably wouldn t get again  and the grilled corn which was so good    There sauces are amazing and found out that you can purchase them to take home  I m going to use that on everything

This is my first time experience here  I read so many good reviews so I just tried it today  We had chorizo  hot   empadanas  chicken and veggie   Cerdo  paletilla De cordero   Among them  only chorizo and the empadanas with chicken filling were good  Cerdo was super salty  I couldn t finish it  the onions so greasy and almost burnt  The lamb shack  paletilla  was bad  like tasteless and not so well cooked
Most consistent food in Pittsburgh   Always an amazing experience   Must stop if you are in the burgh   The gaucho salad and the mushrooms were a favorite

Had a wonderful experience at this restaurant for a private event  My friend was getting married and held the welcome reception or all her guests here  The basement has a trendy and cool vibe to it  with private alcoves cit wining comfy velour couches behind the main dining area  The meat was fantastically cooked and the sauces to die for  I would definitely come back here for the full dinning experience

I ve never been compelled to leave a review for a restaurant  Especially a restaurant that has had so many favorable reviews  I came to Pittsburgh for a business trip and stumbled upon the Yelp reviews of best restaurants while looking for a place to dine  The reviews were so good that I thought I would be disappointed in the actual food  I lowered my expectations a tad bit simply so I wouldn t be disappointed  This restaurant blew away and surpassed all my expectations   This place does simple and clean food  exceptionally well  And there is no better standard than that   Also  I inadvertently  made sex noises while I ate the ribeye  This shit is real good  REAL GOOD FOOD

I ve been here for lunch three times in      during the week and on the weekend  The food is always amazingly awesome  but the line to order takes a lifetime and seriously detracts from the overall experience

I have tried the Bondiola  the Pollo  and the Carne sandwichs  I had the Carne with flank steak and arugula and it was amazing and perfect in every way  this one was bar far my favorite  My boyfriends favorite was the Pollo  which he ordered with goat cheese  I would have enjoyed the Bondiola more  except I found it way too salty  The complimentary sauces make the sandwiches even more amazing than they already are

Like the other       reviews on this place  I couldn t say less about this Gaucho Parilla  I went on a Monday around      pm  planning on going on a self guided food tour of The Strip  This was my first stop  I found myself waiting on line for about    minutes  which I had been giving warning  but about    minutes of that time was spent in DEEP THOUGHT over what delicacy I would eat  I went with the NY Strip steak sandwich and at the friendly  hip cashier s suggestion  the rosemary potatoes as a side rather than the pork empanadas  I ate happily alone at counter  feeling not at all alone and more so openly welcome by the wait staff  All I have to say to end this review is that my food tour ended at this first stop  This was one of the best meals of my life

I have wanted to try this place for a loooooong time  I work on the North Shore and every day going to and from work I smell the deliciousness of meat being smoked when I pass Gaucho going over the bridge in the Strip District  But finally the day has come    My husband and I actually went here before a Yelp event  that Gaucho was actually providing small bites at   go figure   I got the rosemary braised beef and potato and bacon soup  The sandwich was so big  I  actually just ate the meat because I didn t want to fill up on bread  It was soooo good  I could probably eat a steady diet of just that morning noon and night for a full week  There was a horseradish sauce on it that really paired well with the rosemary flavor  The soup was also incredible and super flavorful  I probably could have done without it because the beef was so filling  but I m glad I got it just to taste it  My husband had some sort of pork sandwich with pickled onions  He couldn t stop raving about it so it was also a win   One thing I also want to comment on is how extremely friendly the staff is  You can tell how much they love their business and care about their customers  If you aren t sure about a menu item  be sure to ask for a full description  Someone will be happy to tell you about it no matter how busy they are    The space is more of a food counter than a restaurant  so if it s busy you might want to consider getting your food to go  but I see they are looking to expand soon so that s very exciting    I totally understand why this is yelp s n mero uno in Pittsburgh  If you haven t gone here yet  you do not know what you re missing

This place is currently closed for renovations  The men outside were very friendly and told me that the restaurant will be reopened very soon  I plan to return here and update my review since I am very much looking forward to dining here

This is my  go to  restaurant when I m anywhere within an hour s drive of Gauchos  It s a reason for me to look forward to business travel to the area    As a former Pittsburgh resident  it s just yet another reason for me to miss the city  If you don t go because it s terrific go for those of us who can t go as often as we would like  You won t be disappointed

Top notch place  Space  food  staff  and atmosphere are all excellent    I went to Argentina a few years ago  and have been starving to get my hands on more  Seeing that Gaucho had opened excited me  and it exceeded the lofty expectations I had  Upon entering  it was very obvious that Anthony was excited about what he was cooking and wanted to share it with us  The menu is vast  with salads  sandwiches  small plates  and entrees to fit any time of day or budget  I had the papas  potatoes   flank steak  and empanadas  All were cooked to perfection  and the ingredients were fresh    It s a great place for lunch  and they have tables you are able to stand at in the restaurant  They are working on outdoor seating for when the weather improves  and it s going to be quite exciting   All the food is cooked over wood fire on the parilla  thus making all the flavors immense and very complex  The owner and staff are very knowledgeable and have really built a great place in Pittsburgh

The food is close to authentic Argentine and very tasty but it is very clear the management has a ridiculous view of themselves   I have been there four times since they reopened and the disorganized approach towards serving customers is laughable   The skinny blond guy in the baseball cap walks around swigging Yuengling while lecturing customers why they should wait and why it is  cool  they have run out of all the popular items  Twice i have witnessed him explaining to customers how wrong they are while holding up a long line  all while holding a beer in his hand    Meanwhile it is total chaos with one young lady trying to take orders with a long line while two order stations go unmanned because managers are sitting with customers drinking beer or laughing it up in the back of the house  which avtually disrupts the cooks   I hope these aren t owners but maybe just relatives      so they can fire these guys and hire people that know the front of the house   If not  I am confident they will lose the buzz of new restaraunt popularity and be out of business in a year because of the hideous customer experience

I was lucky and there was no line when I arrive  The menu is a bit confusing  but the staff was patient and eager to help  The food was delicious and hearty  I loved that it was BYOB as well  Great spot for any night of the week

I d heard about Gaucho through the grapevine for a while now  After eating there twice now  once in March and another just last week  I can honestly say I m going to go back as often as possible as long as they ll have me  There s a reason the line is out the door every time I arrive  and it s well worth the wait  This is my first and only Yelp review because I can t think of any other establishment worthy of such praise

So maybe you re wondering   What s all the fuss and why is there always a line around the block     Do you like an exceptional meal that sticks out in your memory long after the last bite  So do all of those people in line  I promise  it s worth it  so get your spot in said line while you finish reading this review   Gaucho is really first and foremost about the meat  I go for vegetarian options quite often  but I can t do that here  You only need to inhale the smoky  savory aroma that cloaks this establishment like an enchanted fog to get the idea  I ve tried several sandwiches over the years  including the Chory Pan and the Pollo  but the Rosemary Braised Beef is legend  and I keep going back to it  It s a perfect combination of flavors  notably  the marriage of rosemary and horseradish sauce  On my last visit  I finally tried their empanadas and Humita  corn pudding   Delightful  although I still stand by the sandwiches   Pro Tip  ha     Go at an off time  I ve gone either right at   AM or between   and    and the wait is incredibly shorter  Just have an early or late lunch  let me reiterate  it is SO worth it

Went to Gaucho on a beautiful day and was able to enjoy my meal in the outside sitting area  My friend and I had gone for dinner on the earlier side to avoid long lines and wait time  Despite being early  we did have to wait in line to put in order    I ordered the vegetale sandwich  which has grilled asparagus  grilled onions  roasted red peppers  roasted potatoes  as well as mushrooms served on a ciabatta bun  Along with the sandwich  I got a veggie empanada which was nice and fluffy on the outside and the filling on the inside  was spiced just right  Both of these options paired wonderfully with Gaucho s   homemade sauce  These sauces really took the flavor to the next level  For dessert  I got the alfajores  I expected them to be hard on the outside  soft on the inside  but the cookie was delicate and melted in your mouth  It was exquisite     Gaucho is a great option to get some quality food is Pittsburgh  It is definitely on the pricer side  but you won t leave unsatisfied
It s a no brainier       five star reviews  This is the way food is suppose to taste  Do yourself a favor and go there   now  Why are you still reading this     go

Yelp  Rarely lets me down on a search for good eats in a new place and tonight I am so grateful to them   This is some of the most amazing food I have ever eaten in my life   The staff was friendly the food was   star dining in a casual fun atmosphere   Don t let the fact that you order at the counter just means you have several people who check on you to make sure you are happy   I do believe I have experienced the most delicious flank steak of my life   And I think it s so cool that they have a BYOB policy no need to pay     for  oz of wine   This place is a total win if you don t come and eat here while your in Pittsburg well then your just plain stupid
Where to start   the empanadas  the braised beef sandwich  flank steak  or the grilled shrimp  It s all amazing  When in the strip if the lines it too long this is the place  Gaucho has this down pat

Gaucho is well worth the hype  I visited after a friend spent an entire day telling me how great this place was  I was fully prepared to be disappointed  Our first attempt at getting into Gaucho s was on a Friday night  and we were already a little late to the party  The line can be fairly long  and the restaurant isn t a big place  so the wait can get a little lengthy and daunting  We had places to be that night  so we decided to come back the next day for lunch  We made sure to get there early and got a reasonable spot in line    Drinks are the first things ordered and you get them while waiting in line shortly before you order food and pay  There are   options for seating  indoors and in a small outdoors area immediately outside  We opted for the outdoors spot since it was a nice day  and it was great  My friend and I ordered the carne sandwich  with filet  medium rare   a ribeye plate  empanadas  and grilled corn  We were hungry    Carne sandwich       The meat was amazingly cooked  tender and flavorful  The ciabatta bread adds significantly to the sandwich  I m pretty sure it would not be as good with any other type of bread  The chimichurri sauce complemented the meat nicely  and the array of sauces that are available inside all tasted great on top of the sandwich    Ribeye plate       The meat again was top notch  The toast was nicely done  not too dry and not too rough to eat  Plenty of flavor to add to the plate  The salad was a typical salad but was an appropriate amount to combine with the remainder of the dish   Empanadas       We ordered the beef and chicken empanadas  The empanadas are reasonably priced and very nicely done  The shell is toasted to a nice crisp that is also easy to bite through  The empanadas were packed  and were certainly a good portion  All of the contents tasted great    Corn       Corn was lightly grilled and appropriately buttered  Great flavor  but not anything out of this world    Even though we were outdoors and somewhat secluded  waiters made sure to find their way to our table to refill drinks and make sure everything was tasting good  Service was excellent  The only issue with this restaurant is the possibility of a long wait  however that seems to be a growing problem at all great restaurants  If you come a little early  the wait shouldn t be too bad  The parking options around here are reasonable and we found parking     blocks away    Definitely recommend coming here   I would have come back the next day however they are sadly closed on Sunday

Too many amazing restaurants in Pittsburgh to wait in line for     minutes  My beers were cold when I got there  I swear  Sad because I was a loyal fan and customer   The ordering process is not working  Fix it

Steak is perfectly cooked medium rare over a wood fired grill  and thrown on a thick  garlicky  buttered  grilled ciabatta bun with red peppers  onions  and your choice of an Argentinian sauce  The Ribeye is my favorite when they got rid of the skirt  Love the flank  strip  and filet too  Easily in my top   sandwiches ever  If you haven t gone yet  well shame on you
The food is fantastic especailly if you are a meat lover the servings are large and filling the place really has an awesome look and feel  and the service is beyond great   Thumbs up

Gaucho Parrilla Argentina is one of the absolute best restaurants I ve ever had the pleasure of eating at  This is our go to place and is well worth waiting in line to get in  The food quality is always superb and the service is always friendly and fun  They do a great job of keeping the food consistent every time and keeping the quality very high even though they are always swamped    The rosemary braised beef is one of my favorites and always has a delicious wood fired taste with great caramelized onions  a delicious horseradish sauce and homemade bun  I like to put their AJO sauce on it for an extra bite    The provoletta dish of melted provolone cheese on top of house made bread with an assortment of olives and arugula is also a delicious side to any meal and their wood roasted corn is to die for   When I first moved back home to Pittsburgh after an extended stay in Florida the first place we went on the way home from the airport was Gaucho

I was here with a group of six very picky eaters  one might be the pickiest eater I have ever meet  After the meal was all done everyone had great comments about there meals  No one had a single complaint  As far as my meal I had the ribeye cooked medium rare with the chorizo and empanadas as an appetizer  The steak was perfectly cooked and had great flavor especially with the house sauces provided chimichurri sauce was my favorite but the ajo sauce and pimento sauce where also good  caution  pimento is a hot sauce not terribly hot but if you don t like any heat beware

Amazing  First day in Pittsburg  came here with the family for lunch and got the chicken sandwich  Also tried the steak sandwich  We had a side of roasted potatoes and a generous helping of all their sauces  Everything was fresh and delicious  It was our first time in Gaucho and the staff was attentive and really nice  They talked with us and explained the menu really well  Worth every penny  If I lived in Pittsburgh I would definitely come back

If the line is out the door and half way around the block    WAIT   It will be worth it  I got the flank steak sandwich and it was one of the best sandwiches I ve ever eaten  The steak and chimichurri sauce is the perfect combination  The sandwiches are all on focaccia bread which is delicious  but I highly recommend getting it  de con   without bread  as it s actually hard to eat as a sandwich  I pulled mine apart and ate the meat and grilled vegetables with chimichurri  then dipped the bread in the sauces separately as a side  They have   great sauces for you to try with your meal  They re set out so you can take as much or little as you d like of them   Tip   Call your order in for take out so you can skip the line
The sandwiches are so  so good   This is a place everyone has to check out  I prefer the chorizo or Rosemary braised beef

Best restaurant in Pittsburgh  Green sauce on the steaks was some of the best steak sauce I ve ever had  Garlic bread and brussel sprouts were also A  Get yourself a nice bottle of red and enjoy a meal and wine at half the price of some of the nicest Steakhouses in Pittsburgh  Casual  fun

Pretty amazing   JUST GET YOUR ASS THERE   Their Rosemary braised beef sandwich was pretty bangin  like all the reviewers said   Man  it s the perfect bread    The way all the juices squeeze right into the bouncy sandwich  omggggg     The gentleman forgot to ask me the temperatures of my meat and I totally forgot to tell him   I soooo didn t want my meat medium or well done   It s okay though  the flavor was incredible regardless   Next time     We ate so fast  I thought my stomach was gonna explode   All you hear inside is silence   It is THAT good  ya ll   Love their vegetable dish drizzled with balsamic redux   I literally saw my veggies being rubbed with olive oil and going on the grill  I loved that   Roasted plum tomato was a perfect touch   Their salad greens were incredibly fresh and well seasoned  something I really appreciate   Radish and carrots were shaved to order  not pre shaved and stored in water  thank you for that   Really   Oh  and the caramelized onion is definitely the hidden gem   Last time I had those was like      yrs ago  ugh  love them   And the   special sauces    Forget about it  man  Jesus Christ   If you ve never been there  I feel sorry for you      MOVE UR ASS SOLDIER

Truly an amazing restaurant  Went because of Yelp reviews and I was not disappointed  Wings and lamb were phenomenal  Food on the menu all showed an adherence to quality  Staff can come off a bit rude at first but the service is fantastic  Looks like they also serve corn on the Cobb but it s not on the menus so ask for it  Can t wait to go back

Get take out to skip the wait   It s still good when you bring it home but make sure you get the sauces   If you like fire and meat  then this place is for you   All dishes  except sandwiches  are cut for you and are very good to share   The meat is typically cooked medium rare without having to be asked  and the place is BYOB

It took me awhile to get here because I thought it would not be vegan friendly   BUT I finally made it and the veggie sandwich is amazingly good  I also got a small salad which was perfectly fresh and delicious  though unnecessary because the sandwich was huge  I really love all the sauces they have available  too  The service really takes Gaucho Parilla over the top   so so so genuinely enthusiastic and friendly  The space is rustically cozy and the sandwiches are a bit messy  all part of the fun  Yep  this place is fun

Awesome stuff   The sauces though    um  so great  but they get really nasty when    people have made their way through them   I got sick the next day  possibly from the heavy grease of this meal   Was so tasty though

The only thing I m disappointed with is my not knowing of Gaucho s existence sooner   My friend and I both had the carne sandwich  mine filet  his skirt   and they were simply melt in your mouth fantastic   The sauces were also incredibly fresh and tasty  so good in fact that we purchased a container to go   Great food  friendly staff  unique environment  what more could you ask for   A carnivore foodie s heaven

My wife and I made an unexpected overnight stay in Pittsburgh on our way home from Niagara Falls recently  After checking into our hotel  we hit up Yelp to find a great place to eat in the Steel City  I used the search filters and found Gaucho Parrilla by searching  highest rating   As soon as I started looking at the pictures  it dawned on me that I had stalked their page within the past year because I had seen their restaurant named on the Yelp top     list       We immediately made plans to head straight to Gaucho  After driving around the block a few times  I wasn t too sure if we would be able to find a parking spot for the massive SUV rental  but we were finally able to get a good spot on the street just down a bit   We loaded up the parking meter and started making our way towards Gaucho    as we got closer and closer  I could smell the meats cooking in all of their meaty glory  I wasn t particularly hungry that day  but the smells emanating from the place took care of that in no time  Upon entering  everyone was super friendly and very helpful when it came to introducing us to their menu and pointing out a couple of options that would be great for first time Gaucho ers  We tried the meat platter  Beef  Chicken  and Sausage  as well as the pulled pork with caramelized onions  My personal favorite   I have to say  I would be hard pressed to remember a meal that I enjoyed more than the one we had that night    the flavors at Gaucho are on another level of amazingness  If you are anywhere near Pittsburgh  go out of your way to try Gaucho  you will not be disappointed
Amazing food    The sandwiches are HUGE  The meat is always tender and the sweet potatoes are to die for  It can get expensive but it is worth it

This restaurant has the best steak in Pittsburgh   No kidding   It is prepared over a genuine wood grill  not gas  not even charcoal  but wood  then cut in thin strips for serving   Seasoning is simple salt and pepper but when combined with the wood flavor  it is phenomenal   The various chimichurri sauces are good  but unnecessary   In addition to the beef  Gaucho Parrilla offers excellent grilled vegetables  toast and sandwiches   The only seating is in the outdoor garden   There is no indoor seating  only counters to stand at   Come  enjoy the smells and defiantly the beef
Great food  Love the grilled veggies   Assorted sauces are great and I recommend you try them all  can t go wrong   Service is fast and friendly  Hope they expand soon for more seating

Seriously  More than a     reviews  and an average   star rating on Yelp  It s certainly rare to find a restaurant with   stars after this number of reviews   I had to try it to believe it   Food            Simply incredible   The first time I visited Gaucho  I went with the most frequently mentioned Yelp item   the carne  steak  sandwich   This sandwich is HUGE   Generous portions of a cut of your choice   I go for the ribeye  which is a great choice for flavor   Other components of the sandwich include roasted red bell peppers  onions  chimmi churri sauce   The bread just absorbs all the juices from the meat and roasted peppers  not letting any flavor go to waste   If a sandwich is not your thing  there s certainly a variety of other proteins for your choosing  both from the land and sea   I was surprised and impressed with how absolutely delicious Gaucho s camarones  shrimp  were   I m always weary of ordering seafood if I m not near the coast line  with the concern for freshness   But goddamn  these shrimps were hella succulent   Sooo succulent   Other worthy proteins include the chorizo  chicken  and flank steak   If you re in the mood for some vegetables  Gaucho s grilled corn  and their mix of asparagus  portabello  onions  peppers  zuchinni  are also great choices   If you still need more flavor  there are   sauces to help enhance the experience       chimmi churri  fresh herbs  garlic  extra virgin olive oil  vinegars      pimenton  charred pepper  garlic  fresh herbs  extra virgin olive oil      ajo  roasted garlic  fresh herbs   extra virgin olive oil      cebolla  carmelized onion  rosemary  thyme  vinegars   extra virgin olive oil   Service           Family owned business are always great   The two brothers running this joint never fail in making you feel welcome  and are full of energy and enthusiasm for the food they prepare   Ambiance            The place is small and cozy  and unfortunately there are only a handful of stools for people to sit on  as they enjoy the greatness of Gaucho   Overall Opinion   Incredible food   Awesome service   What more could you possibly want   Well  my only annoyance with this place are their business hours and the very limited number of seats for people to chill out and enjoy their food   I heard they are about to expand  so this will solve the latter issue   Their business hours were a major influence on why it took me more than half a year after moving to Pittsburgh to finally visit this place   It would be great if they opened until at least   or   pm   It would also be great if they opened on Sundays   Nevertheless  their business is thriving  and certainly not short on customers   Like I said in the beginning of this review  Gaucho had an average of   stars after     reviews   I now understand why   It is TRUTH   Now make your pilgrimage to this fine establishment in the Strip District

To say this place lives up to the hype is an understatement  My co worker and I decided to take a break from the ordinary and venture down to the strip to see what all the fuss about Gaucho really is    We both ordered the Steak Burger and let me say it was one of the best things i ve ever eaten  I tried all of the   homemade sauces on the   pieces I cut the huge sandwich into   In my opinion this is truly the best way to eat everything here  The attention to detail in the preparation and presentation shows and shines through their product   With the expansion of the restaurant occurring now I cannot wait to try it again  The much needed expansion will allow even more people to enjoy the amazing food Gaucho has to offer
Chicken was not cooked all the way  and the food was mediocre at best    would not recommend

I ve waited in a line outside for an hour and half to eat at this place before and I d do it again   maybe even if it was raining       Surprised I haven t written a review about this place yet    I ve gone to gaucho a handful of times now and I ve NEVER been disappointed  Not only is the food incredible the staff is amazing and I always try and leave them a glass or two of wine    everyone loves BYOB      There are a ton of options  Sandwiches  meat platters  salads  small bites and you honestly CANNOT go wrong  For first timers  I recommend the parrillada mixta  a platter of various meats gaucho has  with a bunch of whatever sides you want  It s a great way to get a feel for what this place is capable of   Yesterday my boyfriend and I went and got the asada platter  incredible    the mussels  also incredible   and the camarones  make sure you squeeze the lemon on top    did I say incredible      There are only   things I m not a fan of      The chicken  I m super picky about the way chicken prepared and unfortunately  on several occasions I ve found it a little dry here  Sucks because chicken is great      At night I wish they would dim the lighting to create a more intimate cozy atmosphere   HOWEVER  don t get it twisted ladies and gentlemen  This place still deserves  stars for its deliciousness  friendly staff  and consistency

So  so  so good  And now that they ve expanded  you can actually sit in the restaurant  yay   The patio looks awesome  but on our last visit we chose to sit inside  We had our   month old with us  and the owner and wait staff were very welcoming  She loved the ribeye and braised beef  as did we  I see that this is the highest rated restaurant in Pittsburgh on Yelp  and deservedly so  It s fantastic

I was saving my    th Yelp review for somewhere special  and Gaucho deserves my triple digit cherry   You smell Gaucho before you see it  freshly prepared tender meats and chimichurri sauce massage your nose from a block away     Gaucho means cowboy in spanish  and you will eat a cow worth of the juiciest steak you ve ever had in your life   Everything on the menu is delicious and perfectly walks the line between traditional and inventive   Very reasonable prices  friendly accommodating staff  a fun  unique style  and generous portions  My steakburger was roughly the size of my head  and yes  I still managed to eat the whole thing    The only thing they could do better is get bigger and expand for more seating  but since they do discounted take out  I d be glad to take it home and be a Coucho Gaucho in the comfort of my living room

Gaucho did not disappoint  Outstanding meal  I ordered the   oz ribeye with a side of potatoes  and corn  The corn was to die for  The roasted potatoes were selfish too  Seating is a bit tight in this place but I guess that speaks to the popularity

I was in heaven as soon as I walked in and looked at that board  My only regret is that I had never been here before   A friend and I walked in a little past  pm on a Tuesday  and it wasn t over crowded  but we had to wait for a group to leave to get a seat  No problem  though    We ordered the meat plate to share including chorizo  chicken  and steak  This was easily the best chicken I have ever had  All of the meat was delicious  tender  and bursting with flavor  Seriously  melt in your mouth good   Watching the people working cut the giant hunks of meat is also entertaining  I love a place that sources their food responsibly  i e  hormone antibiotic free  presumably local  as possible  and they delivered  The quality of this food cannot be surpassed considering time and price    As a paleo eater  this is going to be a mainstay this Summer  I can t wait to enjoy the outdoor space
It s so worth the wait in line  Delicious     Also   Please open another spot with parking as it s so hard to find a place to park near your Strip location
it s about time i review my favorite spot in the burgh    gaucho never disappoints  amazing food every single time  even when I order blindly  The staff is super friendly and approachable  easy

I have been to Gaucho many  many times and each time I m reminded that it is hands down the best place to eat in Pittsburgh   if you want the meat sweats   In fact  many years ago  I d eat lunch here weekly before they had a ventilation system and even then           I always go with at least a party of   and go all in with the meat platter and a bunch of sides and bread  family style  The BYOB option is incredible  The process to order and sit is very streamlined and I appreciate the ease    Make sure to try all of the sauces  each one is delicious     bringbackcampfireyams
Great authentic food  A must do when you re in Pittsburg  Party of   and everything was delicious

I have always seen a line outside but I didn t even know what the restaurant was  My boyfriend and I were going to try the sushi place next door tonight but when we got there all we could smell was the food coming from Gaucho  My mouth literally was watering  The line was decent so we decided to give it a go  SO FREAKING GOOD    The shrimp was honestly the best I have ever had  it was grilled to perfection  My boyfriend got the Parrillada Mixta steak  chicken  chorizo   The steak and chorizo were amazing  the chicken wasn t anything spectacular  compared to the rest that is   We also got a side of red skin potatoes and mushrooms   DELISH   It was a perfect date night  We will for sure be going back with friends

Unbelievably good   One of the best foods I ever put in my mouth   I had camarones  choriza     lb ribeye  veggies  and extra grilled bread  which comes with all four sauces for dipping   It was so fresh  flavorful   Everything was herby  smoky  salty  sweet  and sour in the right proportions   The steak was high quality and cooked perfectly   THe atmosphere is so much better than you would expect   The cashier was so helpful and the chef owner chatted me up and was entertaining and delightful   I recommend everybody gives them business asap   I will definitely be back

The only bad thing about this place is the LINE   No reservation  first come first serve  The wait is about  hr at  pm  and more by  pm and later   Avoid game day  Steeler   Pirates   Pens    It s going to be so packed  it s crazy    Been here so many times  Sandwich on my first visit  Paella and Asado platter when I had a big party  and steak plate for   or     If you have a big party and want to try everything  Paella and Asado platter is the way to go  Asado platter covers all the steaks they have  But Asado platter does not have salad  which individual steak plate do     In terms of salads  go with the ones with roasted items   I do like that hot greens more than their mixed salad  You can add grilled items for a few dollars too  I normally get a grilled portobello for an extra dollar or two   BYOB

Friendly  they know how to handle a lot of people at once  dinner rush   That is not to say it is fast  Take it easy and enjoy the time  The food came out terrific  We had bouilliabaisse  camarones  and a mushroom side  Great atmosphere  It is BYOB  btw
Absolutely amazing and true to the ratings and reviews  Best steak sandwich I ve had   A must try

A friend and I stop down for a Saturday lunch the wait was a little long    min  the line was out the door however  the food was excellent  I will definitely go again  the sandwich was on thick sour dough bread and they were very generous with the meat portions  Fantastic Argentinian food

This place is   star  Everything was delicious  I came at lunch and got here early enough I only had to wait in line behind   ppl  I ordered a chicken sandwich  mashed sweet potatoes side  and a provoletta  Love the mini salsa bar   will definitely return   I do recommend reading the menu on their website ahead of time as it can be confusing   hard to see depending on lighting etc
Wow  Easily the best ribeye steak sandwich I ve had  The chimmi sauce is incredible and should be put on everything

I m not sure what all the fuss is about  Maybe it s cause I m from LA and we have AMAZING food  but this place doesn t live up to the hype of its reviews  The meat itself was cooked and seasoned well  but the sandwich had no flavor  And I ve never had a sadder empanada in my life  Dry and no flavor  Empanadas are supposed to make you happy and dying for more  we were fighting over who HAD to eat the last one

Food  amazing  waiting in line to get into this place   not so amazing  Came on a Friday night with   other friends  and the line was clear outside and wrapped around the building  I ve heard some great things about the food  so I decided to stick it out and wait  After about an hour and    minutes  we were ready to order   I like the concept of this place  you wait in line and order and the food is brought out to your table  They also have a BYOB policy  which makes it really nice to just bring a bottle of wine to share   Once the food arrived  I was amazed  The chicken empanada was perfectly flavorful  The chicken sandwich was absolutely huge and had the best fluffy bread  My favorite part of the entire meal though was the roasted pepper red sauce  I would put this sauce on anything and everything

I still remember this place when it was a hole in the wall walk in shop with deliciousness that you can smell from down the street   The shop has expanded  but it s still hands down as good as it gets when you get a steak sandwich topped with their house made chimi s  my favorite flank topped with garlic    My wife and I have tried most of their items on the menu and all of their entrees are great including the steak salads  chicken and fish  Their sides can be hit or miss at times  but a lot of times that s because they experiment with new offerings   One thing to watch out for is their lines  It s always out the door  but definitely worth the wait  The service is always extremely friendly and it s BYOB

Great choice of meats and great flavors    Paella needs more flavor but it was good  Wait times are pretty long but it s a really popular place  Even going for really late lunch times     pm   it was somehow still busy    Ambiance is great  Definitely a must go place if you re visiting Pittsburgh

So the line for a Thursday was crazy  so they started offering  limited  spots in Bodega  downstairs  where they happened to be hosting a   course fixed menu  It was my husbands birthday  and we had heard so many great things about the food  we decided to give it a try   Bodega offers a slightly elevated atmosphere with the same flavors of Gaucho   it did not disappoint    The first course was a cross between chorizo and salami  Serrano ham  ch vre  manchego  kalamata and caselveltrano olives   It was served with grilled bread and chimmichurri   Then was an heirloom tomato salad with a delicious pork beef meatball   Then the entree  grilled steak  corn on the cob  shrimp  more grilled bread and a variety of vegetables   The Rosemary onions with the steak was out of this world   They brought out our pineapple cobbler  so ridiculous   with a candle for my husbands birthday   a very nice touch  We will definitely be making reservations for downstairs in the future

Easily one of  if not my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  You pretty much can t go wrong with anything here  I ve had the steak  ribeye and flank   shrimp  chicken  and roasted pulled pork  my favorite  and they have all been fantastic  This may sound weird to say about a steakhouse  but the salads and grilled veggies are actually my favorite dishes and some of the best that I ve had period  The beet salad and their caramelized onions in particular are great  as you can really taste the wood fired smoke on the onions which pairs well with their sweetness  Trust me you want to get these on your sandwich  salad  meat  pretty much any dish  The staff there are also always really friendly and attentive  and are more than willing to help you out when ordering from the big board menu  Yes the line can be long at times  but it is definitely worth the wait
AMAZING FOOD    Sauces were fresh and yummy  Would go every week if I ever moved to Pittsburgh

We had a delicious meal here   It took awhile for the dishes to arrive but they were worth the wait   Definitely  go with the filet  the corn pudding  vegetables and the grilled corn   The only disappointment were the clams  which were in a great sauce but many of them weren t opened when they hit the table  which means we had to send them back  They took them back  with a smile  Definitely  try it out   It s a cool vibe and a great meal

The food is absolutely   Star  Long line typically  and tight difficult seating take the overall experience down a notch  There are not too many non chain authentic South American cuisine places to eat in Pittsburgh  this by far is one of the best  BYOB makes it an ideal place for a date night with friends to enjoy a bottle of cab

This is the best steak sandwich I ve ever had   When it came out of the kitchen  my eyes teared up a little because it looked and smelled like the sandwich handcrafted in the heavens by the Angels     I had the flank steak sandwich with the wood fire roasted veggies   Uggggh the chimichurri sauce is so good   I m starting to feel emotional again   The house made cibolla  onion  sauce was pretty outrageously good too   I can t wait until they expand so I can sit down with my friends there for dinner

Like this place needs it s    rd review   Lines are out the door already  right   Well I m glad I was in line and I d get in line again  as the place is really good and a unique experience   People super nice   Food is interesting and high quality     Note this is BYOB   i m fine with water but I kinda which I d rolled in with a bottle of Rioja  that would have been the bomb

Whoever thought it d be okay to have a copious amount of meat for breakfast is just sick in the head  and I m all for it  On a summer weekend road trip to Pittsburgh  said no one ever     friends and I went on a food excursion through the city of steel  Gaucho was a big surprise to me having grew up in Los Angeles and not expecting such an eclectic array of eateries in a place like this  We lined up right before they opened and got in after around    minutes  just the perfect amount of time to build up an appetite  We got the sampler and a side of okra  just to appease my flexitarian appetite   Yum yum and yum  The meat has just the right amount of charcoal and steam  with its juice oozing out right before your eyes  You can feel the warmth of the slab of steak before taking a bite  what a treat  Do note that this was an incredibly sodium tastic meal  I d say they could use less salt for their dry marination  And don t forget the salsa  try em all

Stopped by after picking up kid from Pitt  Came on a weekday  Grab your condiments  cutlery and stuff prior to selecting your food  I loved my lamb chops  This is an Argentinian restaurant   so it came out braying  Lol  Great food will stop again

We made a special trip to the Strip District to try out this Argentine steak place and it was worth it   You order your food at the counter  which saves money and time   We came for lunch and the line was short with plenty of seating   Recommend checking out the menu before you go as it can be a bit intimidating with people waiting in line behind you   Not knowing what to order  we started with the Picada  sampler of cured meats  cheeses  fruit  bread  and Empanadas   The sandwiches were huge  but looked like too much bread for us   We then ordered the Parillada Mixta  which was   lb of grilled meats  steak  chicken  and chorizo  absolutely delicious   Meat was moist and perfectly seasoned   Will definitely return and will stick with the meats
Absolutely delicious  The line is always worth the wait  If you like meat  this is your place  The empanadas are always tasty  Definitely add this restaurant to your list

stars  I d give it   if I could  I had the pork and tried it with all of the amazing sauces available  The pork was cooked perfectly with tremendous flavor  The texture was something that could be imitated  but not mirrored  I will be back to this restaurant as soon as possible
The food was amazing  The menu is a little confusing if you have never been there  But so worth the wait
Food is honestly amazing  Unbelievable flavor  This should be a must stop for anyone in town

With a seasonally changing menu  I would highly recommend the cuisine at Gaucho  Known for steak on an open wood fire grill  this restaurant features in house made everything from sauces to desserts  Non traditional restaurant style but cool  fun and worth the wait    Fav  Rosemary Braised Beef  Vacio  El Gaucho Salad   Tip  Byob no cork fee  tipping is for the entire staff and don t be afraid to add fresh toppers to your plates

Hands down the best restaurant in Pittsburgh  Everything is absolutely delicious  The combination of high quality ingredients and wood fire flavor makes every dish on the menu incredible   If it s your first time at Gaucho  I would recommend trying the carne sandwich with filet  you can have any cut of steak on the sandwich for the same price   I find myself craving this every time I come  But don t be afraid to branch out and try the chicken  pork  fish  and sausage dishes  I have not had one bad dish in the many times I ve visited  Even the simplest dishes  like the toast  taste so much better than anything I ve had before  Gaucho makes seemingly simple dishes outstanding   The atmosphere is casual and laid back  and you will enjoy it much more if you have an easy going attitude  The lines can be long  and you may have to wait a bit for seating  But the staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating  Take advantage of the BYOB policy and enjoy a drink while you wait in line  I promise it is worth it

I came here with my mom on a Tuesday night  around     pm  When we arrived  the smell outside was amazing and there was a line around the corner  so we knew this place must be good   The wait was pretty long   probably about         minutes  which is pretty popping  for a Tuesday   When you get inside  you order your food and drinks at the counter  get a seat  and they bring your food to you    We ordered the small flank steak plate  a steak sandwich  and an order of the carrots  All of the food was         tasty  well prepared  plated beautifully  and well worth the wait  You get a lot of food for your money  it was     for all that     Overall  I would definitely recommend this place as an affordable but exciting dinner spot
Wonderful choices  cooked perfectly    Large menu but they manage it well and there are no bad choices  The lines have been mentioned    Go right at   if you want an early dinner  rain also helps

Really one of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh  Definitely a must try and go to place   Can bet a bit pricey depending on what you order and seating is really difficult    They need to find a better system on how they seat their customers   The review is based purely on the food     the service maybe a    The people that work there seemed stressed and unpatient
Wow  Where do I start  Great food and seasoned well  Great service  Permanti Bros is great  but gaucho is top notch  Highly recommend while in strip district

The food here is amazing  hands down  I remember when this place was a matchbox and now that the repairs and expansions are done it s a marvelous sit in spot  Great food and great quality for the price especially the sandwiches in particular  The carne sandwich comes with your choice of type of beef and it s delicious and tender and well cooked with tons of flavor  The ciabatta bread soaks in so much wonderful juices and is just tasty  My younger sis got the burger and it was a beast in size    Ordering is kind of chaotic and the menu is super expansive now  Expect a line out the door on Friday dinner time But once you get use to it it s not only convenient but run by such sweet and understanding people  They know how to make your service interesting  All their recommendations hit the spot  Also enjoy the numerous sauce station  They are greatttttt
Worth the wait in line   Incredible meats and great energized staff  Cannot wait until its warm to eat outside

stars   Flat out incredible   I drove out of my way about    minutes to find a good place for lunch in Pittsburg and yelp hooked me up big time with this place     Very small place that smells like heaven should smell like   beautiful food fired beef   The ribeye platter was awesome and they season everything so perfectly   Nothing here is lacking flavor   The only reason why I knocked it down to     was the cooking temp of the ribeye   I don t think they cook temp to order  I didn t ask  however  and everything seems to be cooked to med well   If it was cooked to med rare I probably would have asked to sleep on the roof indefinitely    The grilled corn was probably the best corn I ve ever had and the potatoes were phenomenal   big seasoning there too   My wife ordered the turkey sandwich and it really was special too   Everything here is just very high quality and well prepared     Let me say   the best thing possibly about this place are the   sauces they have sitting out that you can put on anything   They are just dynamite   We tried all the sauces on just about everything   It really put the meal over the top      If you are looking for lunch in the area and you go elsewhere you are cheating yourself

Best steak sandwich anywhere   The pork sandwich is even better   Food  service and atmosphere are all about as good as you can get    Pricing is pretty good too   There is nothing on the menu that I ve tried that hasn t been fabulous   Finally tried the burger here and it is so good you will want to go to every burger place you have ever been to and demand an apology    I used to think burgatory was the benchmark but Gauchos has elevated the burger game to new heights   It s almost unfair to the rest

Thoroughly unimpressed by this place  possibly due to all of the hype  I for the life of me cannot understand the process for ordering  You wait in line forever  but feel rushed to order because you can only ask questions once you get to the front of the line  And you don t want to be that customer that takes   minutes inquiring about the expansive menu  Everyone will hate you for it  To make things worse  they only have ONE cashier  This establishment should accommodate the vastly growing crowd  But it appears that they want customers to feel like they re dining at an exclusive place  they could make changes but they seem to think they don t need to  There is another guy at the front counter that strictly grabs drinks and uncorks wine bottles  He could be of much more use elsewhere  such as also taking orders  I don t like that you have to tip up front  Personally  I always tip      but when you re forced to grab all of your own eating utensils and seat yourself  I m not sure what service I was tipping for  The cashier also stated that  maybe someone will seat you if you stand at the bottom of the stairs but I don t really know what s going on right now   And when I went upstairs to find a seat the waitress was very rude in accommodating seating for us   We ordered the wings and they did not disappoint  They were flavorful and needed no extra sauces  I got the ribeye platter with a side of corn on the cob and vegetables  I requested medium well steak and basically got medium instead  The guy at the counter stated that the ribeye tasted better as medium or medium rare  so I think they chose to cook my steak as they saw fit  The corn had no seasoning whatsoever  Not worth getting  The vegetables were cooked nicely on the grill  but then they were paired with a sweet sauce that did not complement the dish well  My boyfriend also had the ribeye platter with a side of corn mash and potatoes  A few of his pieces were so burnt that you couldn t even eat them  The potatoes had no seasoning and the mash was just okay    Overall it seemed that other than having the grill flavor  there were no extra seasonings on most of the food  The wings were excellent and that s the only positive I could think from the experience  I agree with others when they say that you want to get your money s worth  I want to feel like I m paying     for a meal and not at a fast food joint  Also  advertise on the website that you have a BYOB policy so that out of towners are aware  The service in general left a bitter taste in my mouth

The servers told us that they wouldn t take our order until our entire group had arrived  Since the plan was for part of the group not to eat  this made no sense  A different person in the group went up and ordered and we  snuck through their defenses  We got the sandwiches and sat in the back room   we pulled a few chairs together so we could all sit together  The owner   manager came over and took the chairs from our table to put them at an empty table next to us   We took the chairs back and he took them from our table again   We took some chairs from a different table  and for some reason  this seemed ok in his pea brain and he stopped taking the chairs  After this  the food was pretty mundane  I had a steak sandwich that was sliced so thick  it was like eating a steak between two slices of bread  No one at the table was impressed witht he food  and the rude treatment topped it off  No way will we ever go back there   There are lots of other sandwich shops  that are actually happy to take your money

Fantastic food coming from a Texan  The Qui Qui Chicken and shrimp was delicious  The customer service is on point  Everything about this place makes me want to fly back to the lame Steelers nation just to eat at this place

I have heard  read and witnessed raving reviews about Gaucho but every time I drove past the line was way too long for me to wait  Not because I didn t think it was worth it  but mostly becasue when I go eat I am usually already starving to death    Tuesday   pm I ventured to the strip to gather some fresh fruits and veggies and for the first time ever there was no line  I parked nearby and thought to myself  no line  probably closed   Nope  They were open and ready to feed my soul    I walked in  glanced at the enormous menu and asked the kid behind the counter what he recommended  I settled on the carne ribeye steak sandwich  My order was up within a few minutes  The sandwich came wrapped in paper like a butcher would do  I was directed to the sauces    in total  I scooped a small scoop of each in the container and went to the table    The sandwich was excellent  All the sauces were to die for and the steak was just so succulent and cooked to perfection  The only negative thing I can think of was that I was still a bit hungry after the sandwich  I didn t realize it came alone with no sides     I assumed for     It would have come with fries  chips or even a pickle    I will surely go back to gaucho but I will also be sure to order more food so I don t leave hungry next time
If you are a true meat lover  look no further in Pittsburgh  Make sure to arrive       minutes prior to closing time so as to make sure you will be able to be seated

great food  people  and atmosphere  If you truly want to enjoy every bit of it i would suggest only going during the week  On the weekend it is just way too busy and if it s your first time it may be a bit confusing and you may not get the full experience

There is a reason why Gaucho is the top Yelp rated restaurant in PGH  the steak and really everything on the menu is fantastic   Even if you re carb adverse  enjoy one of their sandwiches with chimichurri and enjoy   Oh  and the line that s absolutely going to be out the door is totally worth the wait

A group of   of us decided to try this for lunch today  The owner was enthusiastic and gave us a great run down of the menu and what everything was  I had the pollo sandwich with pulled chicken  mushrooms  potatoes  and onions on a focaccia type bread  The bread was delcious and the sandwich alone was enough to fill me up  Most of the other people in our group also got sandwiches and also said they were great along with the grilled corn  Someone got a salad and added shrimp to it  She said the shrimp and dressing were delicious  My only complaint observation about this place is that there is very limited seating  There is almost no seating inside  so while it was great to eat on their patio during August  I m not sure how much business they will do in the winter months  I think the food is great and the employees and service was exceptional  I just hope they can find a way to keep it running without seating in the winter

Certainly lives up to its reputation  Let me answer some questions  there is a wait as you probably already know    BUT the line honestly goes fast  A tip I used was also you could check the general time on google for the time you plan to go  The place is BYOB  dont miss out on that opportunity   If its your first time  I suggest getting the platter with all the different meats so you can decide on your favorite  The chorizo and asado platter are so juicy and flavorful  When we went they kept raving about the toast   but it was not good at all so I do not recommend that  YOU MUST also try all the sauces regardless  Probably note the best place for large groups because of the table setting  Highly recommend this place and I will be back
Amazing  Worth the wait in line  Everyone is friendly and helpful  I ve loved everything I have had from Gaucho
amazing  delicious food  new favorite place to eat and definitely a must if you re in Pittsburgh

Maybe the best restaurant in Pittsburgh  I really can t get enough  No one in the city is doing what they do and I ve never ordered something that wasn t fantastic  Don t get turned off by the wait  it s worth it and moves faster than you d think  make sure to try their empanadas

As good as advertised  They close at  pm and i was there around   and they still had a line to the door  I ordered the mixed plate and two empanads   definitely a pound of meat  the steak was cooked perfectly and very juicy  chicken the same   The sausage was very tender and had a nice spice to it as well   Must go in Pitt

Come here if you want an overpriced super tough and chewy steak  Not sure if they were just serving crap because they knew a big conference was in town or its the Pittsburgh standard but very unimpressed  I d steer clear regardless   We ordered two ribeyes per the Nirvana loving head bobbing staff   One was medium and other medium rare  It was a battle of sawing through meat fibers and spitting out gristle into the plentiful supply of napkins  No one ever came to ask how are orders were or seemed to care  The sauces condiments on the other hand were quite good and needed to choke down their meat  I think I ve had better steak at outback and I hate that place  Pass pass pass don t go here ever if you like good steak

I couldn t possibly recommend this place more    In the heart of the Strip District  it s the perfect way to end a day perusing through Pittsburgh s favorite Food District  And it s an ending that will certainly not disappointment    It s an  order at the counter  establishment  which can sometimes lead to a bit of a line backup that leads you outside of the restaurant doors  but for the most part the line moves quicker than you would expect    Whether you are sharing a dish  steak platter or paella   or hand picking some of your personal favorites  you are sure to find something that you will decide you can no longer live without     I m a big fan of the pollo con pan  cauliflower side  and the empanadas    Push the flavor boundaries a bit and experiment with one  or all  of their house side sauces   The Ajo is my favorite

I had been to Gaucho a few times before they remodeled   The food was always excellent  but there was barely any room to sit   Last night  Saturday  was my first time back at Gaucho since the remodel   The good news is that the food is still amazing and the prices are still the same   Bad news is that the staff did not grow enough along with the renovation  so the service was ridiculously slow and the line to even get in the restaurant was extremely long   My boyfriend and I waited about an hour to even get in the door  about    minutes in line inside the restaurant  and about    minutes after we ordered before we actually got our food   Let me re emphasize that the food was absolutely delicious  but I do not recommend going there on a weekend evening

It does not get any better for me than a piece of flavorful meat  I had the Carne with Hanger and Flank  My taste buds aren t that sophisticated so I can t tell you what the taste differences are though one was a little more chewy than the other  However that aside my mouth was singing with each bite of the sandwich  I also had to try all of the sauces available  My favorite was the Chimi which had a nice kick  The staff were incredibly friendly and I sat outside in the sun  Credit cards and oh hey diet rootbeer is available too
